review_content: One of my first times in a Courtyard, so some of this may be standard to the chain but I'm impressed.  First night here and a few things really stand out: FAST internet, great food at the lobby bistro, and very friendly staff.Internet: 10 ms ping, 35 Mbps down / 17 Mbps up - that's insane and its free!Food: Interesting and tasty choices at the lobby bar/restaurant/bistro thing.  I had a Chicken Cibatta and it was tasty.  It came with a choice of two sides and cost less than $10.  This was better than Subway by far and a good step up from Jimmy John's too.Staff: They've gone out of their way to make me happy and feel cared for.The room is good too; spacious, plenty of outlets, big TV, and a refridgerator.BTW: The renovation spoken of in other reviews is clearly complete.  The lobby and my 1st floor room are very freshly remodeled.I enjoy staying at Courtyard Marriott hotels. Friendly staff, knowledgeable and can carry a conversation. I had a couple problems with the room though... found a small piece of glass on the floor (which I had stepped on... thankfully didnt get cut by it), dark hairs on the floor.. arent my hairs because I have blonde hair, and I used a face cloth to wash my face with and there was some make up on it. I left it on the floor so the cleaners could take it and when I went to shower the next time, that same face cloth had been folded nicely and put back on the rack... so makes me wonder how clean the other towels were...?Would I stay at this particular hotel? Not sure to be honest.I liked this place.  My room was bigger than average and clean.  The front desk folks were friendly and helpful.  The location was convenient (from a certain POV - you can't walk anywhere, really, but well-positioned for driving to different areas).They were doing some remodeling when I was there and adding a little restaurant and Starbucks in the lobby, which is a nice perk.  Though I often stay in hotels that don't have a restaurant, bar or coffee shop, it's always nice when they do.I'd stay here again.My family has had a great experience at this hotel.  Not being from Michigan it was difficult to pick a hotel.  Because my brother was going to be working nearby we wanted reasonable accommodations for a reasonable price.  We were wow'd with the customer service we received.  Whether it was being greeted by Regina with barbeque chicken wings or having a friendly ear to listen to the days events, I am impressed with the extra mile in customer service.  Going forward, the excellent service provided by each of Regina, Jasmine, Darlene, Elizabeth, Isiah, Martel have made this the only hotel I will stay at in Dearborn.  This is obviously the result of excellent management.  Equally noteworthy, is the fantastic food and spirits.  Comfortable beds and spacious rooms makes this a worthwhile stay.The courtyard is currently doing rennovation in the lobby "to better my future experiences here," which leads me to wonder how often travelers stop off at the same place more than once? Because of the remodeling, there has not been continental/complimentary breakfast as was advertised.That being said, it's a decent hotel. It feels new and clean, the water runs nice and hot, the staff is friendly, the mini-fridge is a nice convenience, the location is nice for seeking out the many Middle Eastern businesses & restaurants--but nothing to write home about. I don't often stay in hotels, so I'm not sure if wi-fi is typically available in other hotels--it isn't available here. They do offer free high-speed internet, however, so bring your laptops if you want to connect to the internet. Slightly un-related to the Courtyard--I had a difficult time getting a strong 3G connection (through AT&T) and had many dropped calls--not sure if it's our room's location in the hotel or just the area in general.Checked in. Hotel staff was friendly and effecient. Quickly got to room, which was clean. Only complaint was the thin walls, as I heard neighbors TV until after 1 am.nice hotel, very clean and cozy with the fireplace going, but the thinest walls out of any hotel I have been to! I literally woke up thinking people were in my room

Musty smelling, clearly remodeled old hotel. The front lobby was nice but the rest of the property was clearly outdated and I wouldn't be surprised if it had been a Super 8 or Econo Lodge in a past life. The rooms were actually decent - very nice bathrooms and comfy beds but the overall damp feeling that others have mentioned is definitely true. We were going to an event in downtown Detroit so this hotel was a bit out of the way for us and I found that there was really nothing besides a Tim Horton's anywhere in the vicinity. There was easy highway access however.Didn't use the outdoor pool but it looked dirty and looked as though it could be accessed off the parking lot by anyone, regardless if they were hotel guests or not. Breakfast is now complimentary, and was better than expected. The bagels and bread items seemed stale, but the hot breakfast food was good and they had a lot of grab and go options (fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, milk in cartons) as well.Probably would not stay here again because of the location, lack of nice amenities, etc. but it was fine for one night.DO NOT STAY HERE!! RUDEST SERVICE EVER FROM THE DESK TO THE WAITSTAFF AT BREAKFAST HORRIBLE. 10:05 breakfast is over at 10 waitstaff watches my girlfriend trying to get orange juice we finally ask is there anything Erin with machine she replies no i turned it off. The man at front desk acted like he couldn't be bothered to help anyone . And they allow people to party at poolAll hours of night drinking and harassing people STAY AWAY!!!My dad was in the hospital for a 2 day stay that turned into a 4 day stay. The hotel was close to his place and not to far from Beaumont, but it was at best a 3 star hotel. It was clean, but it was damp - smelling and feeling - and there were stain spots on the carpet. But I could deal with it because it was clean, there were no bugs and we got plenty of clean towels every day to take showers - just couldn't get rid of that musty feeling, my son called it the "Detroit funk". The staff was really great and helpful, they let us re book each night as we needed... the place is just old and needs a remodel, but if you need a place to stay in that area, I am guessing this is your best bet. I did think for $97 a night that it would be a bit nicer. I paid 149 and stayed in a great hotel the next trip. Totally worth it for me..lolStayed overnight on the weekend for a hotel promotion.  Pretty bare-bones.  Free parking and WiFi.  Room and LCD TV was decent sized.  No microwave and mini-refrigerator.   There was an adjoining restaurant and bar.  Morning buffet was $9.95.  It was a good stay and would definitely stay again if I had to do business in the nearby area.  Wouldn't go out of my way to stay though.Stayed one night on business. Room on first floor which is fine but carpet felt wet or damp. Smelled musty, cracked the window but closed later on after dark - no careen and first floor!Room was clean but sparse, double beds??Breakfast was adequate and staff was courteous. Not a lot of choices for dining in the area. Not the best HI Express I've stayed in but ok for a night.We stay here whenever we remodel our house, and also the few times there have been power failures.  It's always been clean and comfortable, no problems ever!Rooms are fresh and clean. The staff is very friendly, especially John, the maintenance man. He made us feel so very welcomed and was one of the friendliest guys we have ever met... If there was a nice restaurant and gorgeous view, I'd give it four stars. We're lucky to have this place so close to our home. We are houseless right now due to plumbing issues. Holiday Inn Express gives us exactly what we need... a clean, comfortable place to sleep and a clean bathroom and shower. Not a single complaint from us. Rooms have large flat screen tv's, a couple of chairs and a desk. a small bench seat. Really nice. Free WI FI too. I've liked every Holiday Inn Express I've ever stayed at, like the one in Bad Axe and one in a Chicago suburb. All of them are great. I recommend this hotel for travelers and guests.For what we paid ($120/night) for a jacuzzi room, I don't think it was worth it. I've paid that at resorts in Orlando, 5 min from Disney. To pay this for Michigan, with nothing around, I feel is ridiculous. Not to mention, they charged my credit card a month in advance, and then charged it another $100 the night we checked in. They said this was just a deposit that would be returned to us. However, we checked out on Dec 28, and the $100 wasn't put back into our account until jan 2. The hotel was pretty empty, and seemed to mostly cater to business travelers. The staff was nice, and bored. I have to say that this was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in though, hence 2 stars.Nice place to stay. Clean room and friendly staff.This is not the greatest Holiday Inn I've been to.  It's an older one, so you'll get a small, older TV (most new Holiday Inns have large flat screens), and a heating/cooling unit that does not have an adjustable thermostat, just fan and heat level settings.  They did give me a complimentary upgrade because of my platinum Priority Club status, but it was a room with a jacuzzi in it!  Why a business traveler would need a jacuzzi for a one-night stay is beyond me.  Pulling into the parking lot, I noticed that it wasn't plowed very well.  It was impossible to see the yellow lines, and I had to drag my luggage through gray slush.Breakfast was the usual Holiday Inn Express fare, but they didn't have any gravy to go with the biscuits.  This really irked me, as I often get biscuits and gravy in the morning.  I opted for a plain biscuit instead, but they didn't have any butter laying out, so I had to put straight jelly on it.  Curses!They also didn't automatically check me out and slip my receipt under the door, something most other Holiday Inns are able to accomplish.  A few positives to this location: it's not in a bad neighborhood (a real plus for the Detroit area), they have decent irons, they deliver USA Today to your room in the morning, and the staff is friendly. As a frequent business traveler with Holiday Inn, I believe this location to be below average.

This place is awesome! Great price, safe area, and excellent hospitality. Also everything was clean just the way I expect.The worst place I've ever stayed in. First off for one night without jacuzzi is 140$ gtfo that's insane. And then the heat in the room was unbearable it was like 90 degrees the whole time I mean geezee o Pete it was hot  and then getting woke up at 430 am to ratchets screaming outside my door was not cool. People slamming doors it was a mess and I will never stay here again!!! Also whoever cleaned the room left the old coffee In the coffee machine. Ugh only know what's lurking around these rooms. Smh never again!!I love this place. I've stayed here regularly for 7 years and couldn't be more satisfied. A top notch staff and a super professional manager, Janet. The rates are reasonable and I can get to Detroit and the airport very quickly.For the money, this place was great. It was hidden away a bit from the main street, behind a mini strip mall. Room was clean, free WiFi, Cable tv. I don't care for coffee makers in the room, really, does that stuff ever taste good. Room was cleaner than places I have stayed at and paid a lot more money for. We got a quiet night's rest and that was all we needed after all, we were not in the area for the hotel.Cheapest room and it shows. My stay here was less than pleasant. As soon as you you walk into the room you are hit with a wave of heat. This is caused by a heater that you can not control. There is one above the door and window and another one just outside the bathroom. Cleanliness was a word that never even entered my mind during my stay. Not only did my dog find a condem under the bed but the bath tub was filthy. Throughout my entire time my room was never cleaned. The location was very close to downtown which was nice but the grass was littered with trash and food. The shower was completely extremes it was either way to hot or way to cold. The vending machines were nearly empty and the one row the did have food didn't work. Overall my stay was unpleasant, the quality of service and cleanliness were below average, and the amenities were nonexistent. I will never return to a Red Roof InnWas the worst service I got.   They have employees that yell at you.  Then on top of that. They called the police to escort us out they said we wouldn't want to leave.  They only came and knocked on the door once saying room service and when they knocked they didn't even ask us to leave.  They are the worst ever.  We went to Dearborn Michigan to have fun but that was the worst experience place I ever been too.  I do not recommend it.  They even got our room wrong they gave us false information about the room as well.   Please if you want a good experience and good service.  I do not recommend  this place at all. Save your money.For the price, very nice. I stayed at a holiday inn express the night before. The only major difference was the breakfast. Red roof gives you a bottle of water, a muffin, and an apple. Free coffee @ the lobby.Not the best Red Roof but certainly not the worst. This one is on the border of Dearborn and Inkster (hence the bulletproof glass in the reception area) but the staff are fairly nice and the room was clean. Remember, it's Red Roof, not the Marriot. Breakfast is a lunch bag with an apple, a bag of water and a blueberry muffin. Wifi signal is strong and best of all, it's a non smoking hotel. There's a Big Boy across the street and Leon's (a diner family kind of place) is also nearby.Stayed one night. Standard room is very small. Standard rooms don't have iron and iron board. Had to go to front desk to borrow it. Location was alright. It was very cheap so it was ok just to sleep. Cant expect more from a Red roof.I visited the Red Roof Inn during there 1 cent promotional event and I was extremely disappointed. There marketing department did a great job on the website pictures of the rooms. I was excited: a nice room and a really cheap price. However when I arrived my lip dropped and I couldn't help but frown. Could they have at least taken the nasty, used shower cap off the bathroom door? Did I really have to pad the toilet seat with tissue because it was visibly not clean as it should have been? Could they have at least replaced the tattered blankets in the room? (They were clean, but looked like it was time to buy new ones.) I mean if the place had been remodeled it should still have the new car smell (you know what I mean). The parking lot was small and loaded with truckers who I guess were taking a night break. I never thought I'd be nervous about sleeping in Dearborn, but man did it feel like I was in one of those cheap motels that people go to in horror movies. I slept with my clothes on while laying on top of the blankets. smh I just didn't feel right in that room. I had grabbed my key early in the day but didn't go to the room until late (my fault for thinking it would be a clean room). And I didn't wanna complain because the room was only one cent. Had I paid regular rates, I would have had a major fit!The staff at the front desk was actually nice. I filled out a survey about my stay and received an email from property manager. I explained to her that the room was not to standard in cleanliness. I have not been back since. I WOULD NOT recommend going here unless you are desperate and are doing a short stay. I've been to better.Note: I had out of town relatives stay at this same red roof inn this past month and they were not pleased either (Had they told me where they were staying I would have sent them somewhere else)Spend the extra couple of bucks and stay at another hotel. You will thank me later.This Red Roof worked out great for a mini vacation to the Motor City. We requested a room on the golf course side and it was extremely quiet. We were in town to visit the Henry Ford and the location was perfect. Considering the price you could not ask for more.        The room was clean and the staff was friendly. We asked for extra towels and an iron and they were provided immediately.        Not sure how old the remodel was but be aware our floor was some type of linoleum, so pack slippers or extra socks. The double beds were a bit tight but not too hard. I did not realize till day 2 that the pillows were different, so I slept on a too hard pillow one night.         I am also not a fan of the sack breakfast. I heard they used to give a voucher for local restaurants. That would be best. Skip the sack drive to Leon's or Bob EvansI'm not sure what the other reviewers experienced but I found this red roof very nice.The room smelt new and seemed like it was recently renovated. Everything was really clean and the linen was excellent. The Dearborn area seems pretty great compared to some places around Detroit as well. My girlfriend and I felt safe here anyway.There is a small bar fridge, microwave, safe and a 40inch TV with a bunch of channels. There is also a desk, air conditioning and stuff for ironing clothes and hanging them.Overall this was a great example of a Red Roof Inn and I would have no problem recommending it to people especially for $54 per night.Even though the rooms were remodeled this place is still a dump.  There is bullet proof glass and it is right across the street from Inkster.I called for towels and got them 3 hours later.Would have given two stars but I wanted a copy of my receipt mailed to me and they said I had to talk to a manager.   I called back when the "Manager" was supposed to be in and they said call back tomorrow.  They couldn't send me my paperwork unless I came in in person and signed for it.  They wouldn't tell me WHY I had to sign after I asked.DUMPY HOTEL. TERRIBLE SERVICE.PRO: Fairly close to downtown Dearborn bars.  Not walking distance, but pretty cheap and close.***Update - Kevin helped me out and mailed the thing I needed.

Pleased with the room. My house flooded and I needed a last minute escape close by and I chose this hotel at 7pm on a Saturday night. Rooms clean, modern and spacious. Staff professional and helpful.  Bed was very comfortable and we liked the balcony although it was freezing outside,  it was a plus.Everything here was good. Great decor in the room, extra towels (in hotels you know sometimes they are hard to come by), there were extra blankets in the closet. They had a small fridge included, made it nice to keep all the drinks we had to keep cold. They even had a make up remover pad to use, it surprised me, it was nice. One of the only downside, the housekeeping staff was loud the first morning we woke up. They were loud talking to each other early in the morning, thought it was crazy because you are at a hotel and people are sleeping, or trying to sleep all around you. Also, I wish breakfast was included because for $89 a night, it should've be still.This hotel is pretty decent. From the outside it may appear as a motel-layout, but it's actually not. Turns out it's somewhat of a massive hexagon (I don't know what the hell the shape is, to be honest. All I know is it's a damn maze once you enter it, g'luck!) The interior if the building seems to be freshly remodeled with a very modernistic decor. There is a small cafe and cozy lounge area.  The hotel staff is very professional: efficient, helpful & accommodating. I had initially requested a 2-queen bed rm, but it wasn't available as I had arrived very early. At my request the staff swiftly changed my rm to a king rm and allowed me to check in at about 9am (vs the typical 3pm chk-in). Also later that evening when I requested add'l linens they had them to me in less than 10 minutes. My only gripe was finding the elevator. As I stated, the building is quite large. It seemed that I was walking miles and miles, days and days following an arrow to an elevator that didn't seem to exist! Of course Eventually I found it but I recommend hitting the stairs or checking in and then driving around to an entrance proximal to your rm.The rm was fairly clean. I found a random pine cone in my rm and my brother found a couple of beer caps in his, but other than that it was decent. Each rm seems to have a small patio facing the courtyard area. The courtyard area is quite nice as well.The location is somewhat awkward because it is located off the service drive and you'd have to drive to get to any restaurants/entertainment, but serves it's purpose.I would definitely recommend and stay here again. Pricing is very reasonable for the quality.4.5 stars considering the great price. Stayed here for 3 nights. I paid $59/night via priceline where the hotel's name isn't listed, just their star rating, price, neighborhood (normally it's $90+). Very friendly receptionist (young woman with glasses). The room was spacious with a renovated look. Plenty of lights. Coffee maker and mini fridge included with Paul Mitchell shampoo/conditioner. AC/heating unit was a bit loud. Otherwise I had an excellent stay with the location being a convenient 15mins from downtown Royal Oak.Also, 24hr fitness room and an indoor pool.Just stayed at the Courtyard in Southfield, MI for the second time, on business.  The staff is so friendly and efficient.  Food from the Bistro is actually pretty good!  Lots of coffee options in the morning. There's a full-service restaurant in the Marriott next door.  There aren't any other places to eat within walking distance, so you probably want to  have a car.  Be sure to ask for a room that overlooks the interior courtyard.  You'll have a balcony and view of landscaped area.  It'll be quiet, too.  I plan to stay at the Courtyard every time I have business in the Southfield area.What to like: you get most of the amenities of your standard Courtyard. It is conveniently located close to the highway, however rooms on the back side of the hotel are very quiet. I heard no rush hour traffic. They have the Bistro with bar items so you could get by eating a few meals here if you didn't venture out. What to dislike: Hot tub is out of service... Over 2 years according to staff. As a business traveler, I enjoy a dip in the hot tub at the end of a long day of travel. The elevators are dirty. What is it with hotels that don't daily vacuum the elevator? I know they vacuum at this hotel, as they were vacuuming the hallway outside my room at 8:30 PM. Would it be so hard to give the elevator a little TLC? Although the hotel lobby has had the upgrade, the room and hallways have the look of an older hotel. I will stay here again as the detractors were not major, but I would love to see the hot-tub working and the elevators vacuumed.Also, I didn't notice any nearby restaurants (walking distance) but in using Yelp I found an ample number of great places to eat within a 5 mile radius.Great price for a Saturday night. $89 plus tax. Was looking for a room after a concert at Joe Louis tonight.. 1 king bed and balcony, fridge and very comfy. Customer service was great compared to Marriott in Detroit. I would come back here again.Stayed here for a family function the weekend of 6/11-6/14. The facilities are up to date. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. The amenities provided were plentiful. The most important feature were the employees. All were professional, helpful and friendly. I would recommend this facility when staying in the greater Detroit, MI area.Very nicely appointed very comfortable rooms. White linens on a super comfortable bed, nice LG flat screen, well placed computer desk with plenty of plug ins. There was also a very spacious bathroom with Paul Mitchell products. Friendly helpful staff. Just two downsides it was a little far from local restaurants, and with the condition of the road in front I wasn't inclined to put my car through any more punishment. (I blame that on Michigan winters...) And the breakfast was not complimentary, but they do have a full service Bistro restaurant that has plenty of options. Overall comfortable friendly stay.Was not happy with this hotel. Although I should know what to expect at the Courtyard, there were a couple things that really stuck out. Upon check in I was notified that room service was available until 11pm. I called at noon 4 times and no one ever answered. I then called the front desk and they still transferred me to the same line which was clearly not being answered. Bed was clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were very outdated. They did not even supply a soap to wash your hands with. Would not stay again.Good hotel about to get even better. Getting the full courtyard remodel in September with new rooms, new lobby and new dining area.Marriotts are a favorite of mine so thought to try this one due to it's location. Easy to get in and out, great desk service checking in. Room looked and smelled fresh and good size. Only issue was a flossing toothpick left in the corner of the room that house keeping missed. Shower may have been a touch dated. Bed felt great and slept well, asked for a late checkout of 1:30 because of a meeting granted easily. Breakfast looked OK but all I had time for was some fresh fruit as I was on the road. At around  12 I received a call asking if I was staying or checking out and then housekeeping knocked on my door, It seems they did not record my late checkout but granted it again at that time.I'd go there again as it looked they were updating as well.I was very satisfied each time I stayed here.  My reservations were made in advance and the staff was prepared upon my arrival.The pricing of this establishment is surprisingly affordable for all it has to offer.  On top of that everything is modern and up to date.  The pictures below of the rooms don't do them justice.They have an indoor pool with a lovely view of the outside.  This does make the room a lot cooler, but they have a hot-tub to keep you toasty.  It was nice to use the small gym because there weren't many people in there.  The equipment was clean.I'm a life-long fan and will recommend The Courtyard Marriott to everyone.Friendly staff, close to main office. The down side is the building is old and there was a lot of construction going on (the main road - not there problem).The rooms are nice and quiet, the beds and pillows were nice and they even had a great pool.The thing I hate is loud guests who don't think of others. That is hardly a problem with the hotel, but get someone to walk the halls and settle things down. Another thing I hate is when I hear staff complain about their work! Especially when they are loud And ghetto about it!No wi-fi. Only wired internet. Otherwise not bad. Quiet and comfortable.

3 stars! Why?First off, the location is great and the view is amazing. Depending on which side your room is located you get a view of the water and then can also see Detroit from your window. Secondly, the service isn't the best. For the price that you pay and the name that it carries, you would expect some better service. One time my A/C was not working properly and the water was leaking from it onto the carpet. Well, they didn't come to see the issue right away and took a couple calls for them to come. On top of that, they didn't even offer to change the room. Really? We had to move our luggage away from the A/C because of the wet carpet that kept getting closer to the bed. Good location with a good view. Hilton? Surprised it carries that name.I have a couple seminars to conduct this morning in Windsor so drove down last night.The room is big.  There is a desk so it's good if you are here for business.  The bed was comfy and I had a great sleep.The view from my window when I checked in about 6pm last night was gorgeous ... the sun was setting on Detroit (I'm on the 16th floor).  It was a lovely sunrise this morning.WIFI is free (in this day and age, I hate it when hotels charge for it). Parking is odd. You can park your car yourself in the back for $10. Or you can have it valet parked for $21 (they take it away to the same spot you would have parked it but charge you $11 more). Or if you are lucky enough, you can leave it in front of the hotel and it's only $15 but you have to pay cash. Huh?! It's a about six blocks from the casino.This is an old hotel and should not be under the Hilton brand. I complained to management but they don't care as they rely on casino business. The drapes have never been vacuumed and everything seems old and worn. For what they charge you can do better. Nice view of Detroit and the bar downstairs has decent food but both times i was there it seemed a ghost town. WiFi is wired which is so 90's so i couldn't use my ipad or iPhone and that was not a nice evening!Not business traveler friendly at all.Really uncertain how to review this place.  I think it does pretty well under the circumstances but maybe there is just not enough business in Windsor to justify good maintenance and upkeep of facilities.Service was excellent -- front desk people were really friendly and efficient.  Too bad they couldn't fix any of my problems.Internet was down for full THREE DAYS of my stay. Really?  How is that possible? Are we in Iqaluit? The staff did send us over to the Radisson next door to sit in their (rather dire) lobby for WIFI.Room had a million dollar view of the Detroit River.  Huge bank of windows, very comfortable bed.  Good coffee service. Alas, only one phone worked and it was never a sure thing that the toilet was going to flush.So my rating is an average of some things being 4 stars and some things being two (or worse).  Bonus points for a great jogging walking path across the street.  Runs by the river and has wonderful sculptures along the way.Came back again this week and they delivered an exercise ball after I complained on Friday and via email over the weekend.  Too bad it was the smallest one I have ever seen (unusable).  Don't understand why you can't get anything to eat after 10PM.  Whirlpool wasn't hot enough and shutoff after 5 minutes.  They gave me free "giant breakfast". I am a Hilton Diamond and get the free continental.  They add eggs, bacon, sausage and potatoes for $7 more.  Not worth it.  They needed omelets or pancakes.There have been better days for this Hilton. Decor looks quite outdated; a reno was done, but maybe twenty years ago.Spent three nights here for a work function.I was on the 13th floor facing Detroit. Beautiful view! Looking out made me feel so guilty about saying crap about Motown.The room is cluttered with furniture that it was a tad hard to walk around when I also had my luggage with me. On the other hand, there IS free Internet in the room. Water pressure in the washroom was terrible ... thankfully I had bottles of water so I was able to brush my teeth. After mentioning this little problem, front desk quickly sent up someone.In spite of the ugly, I found staff to be super friendly and courteous. Windsor is ... nice ... albeit small for a city girl like myself.The Hilton room was reserved for me by work so I didn't have any choice in the matter.It's a-ok.Definitely not the poster 'child' for the Hilton brand.Went here for lunch with a business associate.  We went to both lunch and have a business meeting, the restaurant was not busy (Wednesday) and quiet. Perfect.  We were invited to choose any table, but when we did the waitress (working alone) said that we had to move closer to other diners (two other tables) - I guess she didn't want too much exercise!  The food was OK - but very weird service - as if she didn't listen.  I asked for blackened salmon (as on the menu).  Instead she decided to bring me salmon with a lemon sauce!  My associate ordered a club sandwich on white bread.  She decided to bring him a club sandwich on toasted wheat bread!!  Normally I would send it back but we were in discussions - but the whole service thing was F'ed up.  Not a thing came without something being wrong. Deaf?  On something?  WeirdThe view is amazing. Everything else is mediocre. It's not a complete dump but it's on its way. I've been staying here for 15 years and it just gets older and older. A major renovation could really help this place. Not just some paint on the walls in the rooms but new elevators, refresh the bar and address the parking situation. There is real competition out on Huron Church now and they all have free parking as does the casino. Figure out how to get competitive with that because this is now one of the oldest "nice" hotels in the area but is still $20-40/night above the others once parking is factored in.

Yes, I am giving a Comfort Inn a 5-star rating.And it is well deserved.I couldn't have been happier during my 2-night stay for the Martian marathon. The room was spacious, with all the amenities I needed (including a microwave that I couldn't use to make pop corn "according to local security laws"....mmmk Wayne County...) and extra clean. There was a pool. Free continental breakfast (and GOOD coffee, no joke). Free wifi internet. And the location was super convenient for the race.BUTWhat really brings it to the top is service. The united-colors-of-Benetton (gotta love Dearborn's diversity!) staff was always smiling, welcoming and accommodating at any time of day or night. Ok, I didn't *really* check the state of things at 3 am but you get my drift. The best part?They offered a shuttle to and from the race, starting at 6 am in the morning. Yup, people got up extra early to take us dummies to our run. They even provided a little stool to get in and out of the van easily (which is really thoughtful when you think of the state of our poor legs after 26.2 miles). I was quite blown away.Oh, and five pillows on the bed?I am sold.This is an ok hotel. A bit worn but the king room with one sofabed was adequate for our needs.bad: room carpet dirty in spotstub and surround a worn lobby main entrance "stuck" open therefore cold lobby and breakfast areagood:helpful and responsive staffbreakfast was adequatepool was very warm and cleanWe stayed for two nights recently. Our room was clean and comfortable, and the free breakfast had a lot of variety. However....  There is a free shuttle, but I would not recommend taking it. We took it to Henry Ford Museum. The driver who took us was not friendly, and seemed to be annoyed that he needed to take us and another couple. When he dropped us off, he simply said to call the hotel when we were ready to come back, which we did. Long story short, we ended up waiting for 90 minutes for the shuttle. We were given the excuse that the driver, who was not the one who had dropped is off earlier, had waited for us at a different entrance and we weren't there. Maybe if we had been told that we would be picked up somewhere different than we were dropped off this wouldn't have happened? Frustrating. Also, although there are signs stating that it's a 100% smoke free hotel, the second floor smelled very strongly of fresh cigarette smoke on our secondafternoon here. They also charged our credit card for the stay despite our indicating that we would be paying cash at check out.Room was nice however, while sitting in the lobby waiting for the rest of my party to arrive, I accidentally nodded off. My mistake because I was tired after riding 1500 miles in two days on a motorcycle. The lady rudely told me to not fall asleep as it is disturbing the customers, of which there were none in the lobby. In the morning while eating breakfast, I say and listened to the manager and employees yell across the areas to communicate with each other. This was very disruptive. I do not recommend this hotelWe were pleased upon arrival but after that things went downhill. We had asked for information on transportation and were given blank looks and shrugs. We partook of the free breakfast and were sorely disappointed with the coffee. We were told that they have no control over the coffee machine. Then after a day of sightseeing, we came back to find that the keys didn't work and the room was not made up and it was nearly 6:00 pm! We had to ask for more coffee and clean towels. I would have to say this would not rank as a very good hotel experience.These people care. At first I was all upset w the difficulty of choicehotels gimcky discount program but local mger Brad made it right. Plus when their printer was down he let me print boarding pass in his office. Super close to greenfield village and very quiet. Is ready for remodeling but service more than makes up. A 10++We stayed for a hockey tournament.  Room had 1 King bed.  Clean and well appointed room with contemporary decorations and new case furnishings.  Housekeeping polite and attentive to needs and very efficient.  Complimentary hot breakfast with lots to choose from.  I loved the coffee.  Hotel was very busy but staff handled demand well during breakfast hours.  Close to Ford Headquarters and Greenfield Village and Henry Ford Museum.  Plenty of restaurants close by as well as a large shopping mall.  I would stay again.  The only thing I didn't like about room design was the entrance of the room incorporated the sink/vanity area of the bathroom, but toilet and shower at least had privacy of closed door.  My kids had a ball in the swimming pool.  Fitness room had good weight and cardio equipment and was not busy on the weekend.The hotel changed to a Comfort Inn. All of the rooms are non-smoking, but our room 301 must have been a smoking floor prior to the n/s rules, and 301 still smells of smoke. To the extent that I called the front desk to advise, so they don't hit me with a $250 charge for smoking in the room. We cracked the window open to get some fresh air, but it only opens a few inches.We couldn't keep the windows open for too long because there's a set of train tracks behind the hotel. That was a little noisy when a train would go by. Closing the windows helped a lot, except for the train whistle.The parking lot entrance doors need a key card to enter the hotel. But the door lock is broken on the door nearest our side of the building. Just a pull on the handle gets you inside the hotel.  They said it'll be fixed in a few days. I was surprised to see so many people checking in with cases of liquor and beer. The hotel was pretty quiet until about 3am. Things got quiet about an hour later. The flat panel TV was either 60 Hz, or they're not paying for HD service. The picture can be fuzzy. The hotel is clean, and they have the typical breakfast: waffle iron, eggs, sausage, cereals, pastries, etc.We had a great 2 night stay at the hotel.  Everyone at the front desk was friendly and very helpful.  We arrived early (11:00)and they let us in early ..that was great to have a few mins to rest before we headed off the Greenfield Village.  Their package deal to the Henry Ford saved us some $$ and the fee shuttle back and forth was well worth it.  The room was updated and very neat and clean.  Was impressed with the hotel overall.  Breakfast had a lot of hot and cold options.This was a very nice, clean hotel. And what more can one ask for really when your on the road? Clean rooms, decent breakfast and very friendly staff. A minor concern with the A/C was quickly taken care of and we felt comfortable staying there. Very close to Greenfield Village and the Ford Museum. Quite a few decent restaurants nearby. They have a museum ticket package available if you stay with them which saves you a few bucks.WOULD STAY AGAIN. First i would like to say with great service and a convenient shuttle it only makes it so easy to get cozy here.Thanks for a great stay great service and fresh hot cookies at the counter Kevin at the front desk was really helpful

Stayed here the other night because me and a few friends were going to a Redwings game. Great hotel, in a really nice location.It was nice having the bus stop right behind the hotel as we used the special transit to cross the river. The hotel itself is super clean and pretty up to date. My room had an amazing view of the river and Detroit. Comp breakfast in the morning was really good. It has a lot of great attractions around like the Cesar's casino and joe Louis arena.We got a fantastic rate as the hotel is undergoing renovations. The lobby is torn apart...wires hanging from the ceiling (behind the front desk), lobby restaurant closed, etc.The room itself, while the bed has been updated, still needed repairs..the wallpaper seams are visible (seperating), however it was totally eclipsed by the gorgeous view from the room.  Getting to the hotel from the parking garage was a challenge, as the pathway takes you through several doors and is maze-like (I now know how lab mice feel) ...the pathway dumps you in the lobby of the hotel next door (The Riverside Hotel)..we had to go outside and walk over to our hotel.The view of the Detroit River and skyline from the room was spectacular...it is obviously the biggest selling feature of the hotel.Pros:Very comfortable bedsThe female staff member who checked us in was fantasticThe viewNew carpetGreat water pressureFree WI-Fi ( which was decent for a hotel)Clean roomsConsDreadful pillows (perhaps the flattest I've ever encountered)Maze to the hotel from the parking lot (a $12 surcharge)Rooms needs updating (wallpaper)TV reception on some stations was awfulDidn't partake in the included bkfst.Would stay here again.Room was clean, view was AWESOME!Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast bar was ok, but it was free.I would stay here again no problem.I wanted to stay at the Caesars but was not willing to pay double the price as the Waterfront. So my boyfriend and I chose to stay here for the weekend. We booked the room with a partial view so it was an okay view. We got to visit our friend's room with the panoramic view and it was so nice! So I definitely agree with other TripAdvisor members that the view is spectacular.The hotel definitely needs a facelift because it is very old looking. The driveway entrance in front of the hotel is very small and will only allow 1-2 cars to be in it. However, there were cars parked in it so it's annoying to have to reverse out onto the road. Parking is $12 (plus tax) per day which is kind of lame because it's not even the hotel's property. You have to park in a parking garage across the street that is behind the hotel. Luckily they have a convenient back door for you to use.Our room was clean and was fully stocked with towels when we checked in. The bed was very comfortable to sleep in which was nice.The complimentary breakfast is definitely not worth waking up early for. Their sign in the lobby is very misleading. There are no sunny-side up eggs, bacon, or home fries. The breakfast buffet was pretty sad. There was sausage (which were dry and tasted below average), scrambled eggs (not made from real eggs AND had hair in it), yogurt, toast, english muffins, cereal, and waffles. I have to say that the complimentary breakfast at Holiday Inn was WAY better.I'm pretty sure once the hotel is renovated it would be much more appealing for guests. Also, if the hotel served better breakfast everything would be great.This hotel is gorgeous! It would normally be out of my price range, but I had a discount from a rewards booking site so I jumped on the opportunity to stay here. (It was listed as the Riverside Inn, but the old Riverside lobby forwarded all guests to the Waterfront Hotel.)All of the rooms have a view. I'm sure some are better than others, but it's safe to say there is not a bad view in the entire hotel. The view from the breakfast buffet is also amazing, even on a cloudy and rainy day.The rooms and hallways are in great condition. They are slightly worn, but not bad at all. I was shocked to read people criticizing "marks on the walls" in other reviews. If you are looking at the walls instead of the window view and judging wear and tear, then you have bigger problems than the slight wear on your hotel room.We stayed in a King room, and the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was huge. The furniture is all pretty dated with some dings, but it's still a great room with an amazing view.The breakfast is pretty cool, with a do-it-yourself waffle-maker and a small hot food selection. There is plenty of baked goods, bagels and toast, cereal and oatmeal. It was well stocked, even after 9:00am, and someone helped me when I didn't know how to use the waffle iron. The panoramic view is great.Housekeeping was friendly to us in the hallways and asked us if we needed anything every time we passed by in the hall. We also had a mini-fridge delivered to our room for free. Huge plus.Parking is $12 a day across the street, or free at Caesar's with a 5-10min walk. We decided to pay for parking and it was worth it, because we used the in and out privileges a lot. Do NOT take the elevator walkway from the parking garage to the hotel though... it is a long winding walk when you could just cross the outside street to the hotel.I would DEFINITELY stay here again, especially if I could find a good deal online. Great location and friendly staff, I highly recommend.Front desk staff need training on how to professionally deal with their customers.The view was beautiful.. looking at Ren center in Detroit.    Room was nice.   Extra charge 12 dollars to park.   Buffet free, however was picked over by 915 and not restocked...not even coffee.   16th floor.   Carpet in hallway falling apart.... marks on wall...that could be washed off....but housekeeping ignores .... pool room looks nice....Did not use.... lots if young people..  had to call security at 4 am...people in hallway would not quiet down.... security Did come up.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. In general I'm not too picky with hotels. Just want somewhere cheap, cheerful, and clean. We heard from a friend that this place had been renovated recently and was well priced so we thought we'd try it out while in town for a wedding. Huge mistake. Please - for the love of god - nevereverever stay here. We arrived late at night after a delayed flight and checked in. The smoke-free room stank of smoke and when I pulled back the sheets the bedding was crumpled - full of hair and various bits of unidentified debris. Fine - might have been a housekeeping oversight. I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. We tried another room. And then another. Same in every room - unwashed sheets full of all kinds of hair. There was also very questionable activity occurring - screaming matches in the parking lot at 1am and I wouldn't have been surprised if the rooms were being rented out by the hour. A total hotel horror show. We ended up getting a room at the St Regis Hotel downtown and it was the best $109 dollars I've ever spent in my life. I nearly wept when I saw the clean sheets.In fairness the person at the front desk couldn't have been more polite or accommodating. She gave us a full refund for our prepaid room and apologized for our experience.I'd be giving negative stars if it were an option, bad service, rooms weren't very clean, loud outside screaming matches at 1am, room was pretty musty. Overall bad experience will not stay here again or another red roof inn. Management was very rude when I needed to renter my "clean room" to get something I was missing, clearly when it was right at my checkout time, which I think was wrong. Will not return.This is a slightly sketchy Red Roof off of 696 near the border with Hazel Park. While some other Red Roofs have gotten a make over and have posher furniture and decor, this place must have been overlooked. Basically, it's a dump. I stay in Red Roof hotels all the time, but this place is really bad. It smells, the carpet was dirty and the bathroom hadn't been cleaned. When I talked to the manager no one came to clean the room. Really? There's a Ponderosa, a Bob Evans and a Mexican fast food place (Aztec something or other) within a block.I should give this place no stars as my husband and drove from California to here for a Special Event. We had drove into the lot which was being resurfaced so we couldn't park close to our rm. We were also unaware that this place had no elevators so we had to walk up stairs to a second floor to where our rm was as I walk into the rm I smell what smells like stale cigarette smoke well this place was supposedly smoke free rms well I went to desk to complain the lady at the desk was rude and she told me if I don't like it go to another motel. That's nice to say to a couple who is tired, hungry and just wanted a clean smoke free place to sleep. l asked for some Fabreeze as we had to spend one night there as we didn't check out so we would be charged for one night. We had planned on spending 5 days here, but they didn't seem to care about losing a customer. I was  told by a housekeeper that they didn't have Fabreeze, but was given 2 candles and a lighter. Well that didn't really help the smell I was so glad to leave the next morning and don't plan on going back to Michigan again. We found a better motel and they didn't allow smoking in rms and they were cleaner, we stayed the rest of our time at the Comfort Inn in Warren, Michigan. They even had a place for me to wash my clothes in the motel. The Red Roof Inn had no laundry on sight. I am very disappointed in this place and wanted to let others know so they don't go through what we did.Well, it's cheap, I'll say that much.  But honestly, if I'm going to pay 40 to spend the night here, I'd rather spend 80 to stay at a Holiday Inn or something.  Ok, things weren't nice, that's for sure.  The front desk person works in a little cubby behind bullet-proof glass.  My room had carpeting that was torn up, holes in the bedspread, and a black-out only option on the shades, which opened directly on the sidewalk and parking lot.  I.E. either have your shades open and the whole world is looking right in your window, or close the shades and have some pathetic little lamps on and feel like you're in prison.But that's not what really rubbed me the wrong way- my room was dirty.  Really dirty.  Grease and food left on the counter.  The bed was made with a little card saying how fresh and clean it was, but there was hair in it!  Many hairs!  Many different colors and lengths of hair!  Same in the shower.  Yuck!Very much yuck.  Not worth it.

We had our wedding this past Saturday (10/17/15) at the nearby Waterview Loft and used the Marriott as our hotel to get ready in and for guests to stay. Everything was absolutely perfect! There was not a single issue, all the staff were so helpful and kind, the rooms were beautiful, the rose petals and champagne were a welcome surprise, and all our guests were overly impressed! Definitely a top notch hotel with amazing hospitality and and helpful, classy, and organized staff.Is it possible to have negative stars?  If so, then this place would have -4.  Upon check-in, with a large convention in town, there was one clerk at the desk. Finally, one more slowly strolled in. It didn't seem to phase either one that there was a line out the door.   The next day we came back to our room after lunch to find that the room was so filthy we couldn't believe it. The only way we were sure that housekeeping had been in was that the toilet tissue had been folded in the little triangle they do to prove they've been there.Great location, great on-site dining, great room views, very comfortable bed and absolutely amazing staff! First time to Detroit a few weeks ago and completely impressed with this place. I must say that 1 staff person in particular, Nekitta P., was so unbelievably accommodating, friendly and helpful upon check-in and throughout my stay. If she isn't a customer service manager or trainer, she should be. I will definitely stay here again when I'm back in Detroit!I stayed here for one night while a friend was playing a show, although I didn't get to spend much time in the room -- what time I did spend there was super nice. We ordered room service, and the burger was huge and juicy with perfect steak fries. The rooms were decorated comfortably, and the bed was big and poofy (perfect!) The view over into maple leaf land was nice, and looking out over the river was not a bad deal at all! Definitely could recommend this place if you ever find yourself in Detroit. It gets four and not five stars because I was running into the trade show traffic a lot and the parking was a bit of a pain.

I arrived from California with my suitcase to meet friends at the greektown casino. I assumed a giant hotel/casino would have some place to check your things so you could go spend money at their establishment. This almost wound up ruining a Christmas reunion with friends I hadn't seen in a year because they wouldn't check my bag and wouldn't let me in with it. Wound up having to pay for an entire room just to put my backpack down. Terrible customer experience, bad business.Update: I was contacted and they were very apologetic to my circumstances and refunded us the cost of the room. The situation was handled by their customer service staff very professionally and timely. I may even be going back next weekend!Staff could be more attentive. Certainly not my "go to" casino, but it is on the list of casinos I will more than likely visit again. I have been here a number of times, thought it was finally time to post a review. Overall it's not bad, as I said I would visit again. However the staff could be more attentive and mindful of the mess around them.For example: one evening I was there the cleaning guy was flirting the entire night with the beer girl and ignoring the mess that was quickly building up in between the touch screen roulette kiosks.As for my contact with staff members, serves, bar tenders, etc... they were all positive and friendly. Tables in my opinion were fair. I've had nights where I've left here with money and nights where I left with nothing.** This is a GREAT place to come to for hockey games! park here for free, have a drink or play a little before the game. take the people mover to the arena and then come back and maybe gamble a bit more.**We had an excellent experience here! Service was fast and efficient. The hotel and room were very clean! The bed was comfy - the view from the room was beautiful! We ordered dinner and breakfast from room service and the food was excellent!! I have been to the casino many times it this was the first time staying at the hotel. I will definitely be back.IF YOU READ THIS, DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Stayed at the hotel for a few nights, and now I have the multiple bites you see in the pictures, and some I didn't take pics of. Don't think they're bedbugs, but the only time I wore short sleeves was while I slept since it was 10 degrees outside. If they turn out to be bedbugs, you better believe this hotel will hear about it. In addition, the pillows are awful and the towels feel like sandpaper. STAY AWAY, FOR YOUR SAKE.Meh, it was OK but a little pricey for the accommodations. Personally I didn't really dig this place. It's a little rundown and beat up and look likes it's been mugged. The fixtures look nice enough but overall it's just not as nice as it should be. The bed was mostly comfortable but the pillows are TERRIBLE! They're all extremely hard. The bathroom was small, there was no tub and the towels were just kind of stuffed into their shelf. Room service was pretty quick though. Prices for midnight snacks were standard and their quesadillas are pretty good. I'd pass on the chicken strips next time though. It's definitely about the location here rather than dazzling the guests. If you wanna be downtown and stay in the heart of the action this is probably your best bet, but for my money I'd rather stay at Motor City and Uber over when the fun ends.Stayed two nights while attending the auto show. Nice lobby with helpful staff once you get their attention. . Rooms contemporary and nice. Probably not the casino's fault, however, but the walls between rooms seem to be paper thin as the sound one night from a room full or party goers next door was too much to take. You could hear everything through the walls so be careful what you say... or do!!!I guess that's collateral damage from a hotel being attached to a casino. Too many imbibers looking to party hardy. Good breakfast buffet also. At $259/night it was a bit pricey.It's by far the least classy $200 hotel downtown. Be ready for long check in and out lines, poor customer service and loud loud drunk casino patrons. If you're lucky you might even be staying next to some teenagers throwing a hotel party, or maybe even lucky enough to to be by the ice machine and elevator. Either way, your better off staying at MGM or even Motor City, sadly.. Oh and forget about Room Service.Smoky.  Staff does not seem happy to be there.  Typical casino experience, I suppose.Definitely the least attractive casino and hotel in the area, we chose greektown for our anniversary because it was close to a restaurant we wanted to walk to for dinner. Casino does not have a very "classy" feel to it, on the dirtier side. As for the room it was nice looking, however we were so lucky to be placed next to a wild party room that had to of had at least 15 people in it partying until at least 6am.  It literally sounded like they were outside of our window. Yelling, loud music, sexual noises, banging on walls, girl passed out in the hallway. Pretty sure it was just a big orgy going on. We called the desk 3 times to complain, and it was not early, the first time we called was 1am and then we called twice more and finally realized they did not seem to care about us, each time they said theyd "send security to check it out" and each time we heard security laughing in the hallway with them, at one point im pretty sure they even told them we were the ones that called. Very professional. Needless to say the noise never stopped. I was half tempted to go bang on their door at 8am just to wake them up so they'd know what it was like. My husband and i wanted a nice night away from home for our anniversary and definitely did not have that experience in your hotel. Could have been handled a lot different. Will pay the extra $ to stay at mgm or motor city next time.Staff was pleasant and accommodating. We arrived early and received our room with a nice view. The hotel was in a great location. Food places were within walking distance. The food court in the hotel had great options. I like the safety feature of using your room key in the elevators to go to your floor. The business center is nice and safe. It was accessible by room key only. The hotels downfall is that they could have a few extra restaurants, and the casino gaming was terrible. The slots were dated. They could use newer slot machines that pay. The machines were tighter than Batman's tights. Ijs.Nice hotel, nice location! Upon arrival we found that the valet service was fast, friendly and attentive which is what we encountered at check-in as well.  The hotel room itself had some slight signs of wear, but nothing to big to discourage another stay in the future...the bed and the pillows were comfortable, which is one of the more important things when staying away from home (in my opinion).  This will definitely be my "go to" hotel the next time we stay in Detroit!This is my go to casino when I go downtown love the new remodel more TVs more excitement. Love that it's around a lot of local bars. Also the parking garage is always a plus for free parking. The waitress staff is always on point and polite. The dealers are fun to play with and make it a fun experience. I've been to all the casinos and I prefer this one every time.The good:1: Friendly staff.2: Full casino: tables, machines, high roller area.3: Free parking.The needs to be improved:1: Not enough cashiers.2: Self parking hard to find: street signage lacking.3: Self parking too far from casino.4: Inside signage lacking: not clear.5: Poor ventilation: too much smoke lingers.A few weeks ago, I left a negative review for this company and their services on their old business page.  Since then, my opinion of their customer service (which is everything to me) has completely changed.  I had a corporate representative reach out to me via phone and he was able to not only apologize for my negative experience, but offer me a deal that made up for it.  I gladly took the deal after he also assured me that he would be speaking to the front desk associate that was checking me into their hotel.  I work very hard for my money.  When I spend it, I want to receive top quality and service for it.  The backbone of this establishment made sure that that is ultimately what I ended up walking away with. Thank you Greektown Casino-HotelI am from Detroit and was coming to town for a family vacation, I booked with greektown for their experience specificity to show my wife from out of town a good time.  We spent over $300 for a room.  The room did not have a working thermostat that we tried to call the front desk about FIVE TIMES, and they never answered (even when I tried calling from my cell phone and not my $300+ room) at check out I expressed my disappointment to Joseph who seemed ill equipped to deal with any complaint since he didn't even ask how my stay was. After I told him about room 2917 having a broken air conditioner on the 29th floor when it was 85 degrees and humid at night with NO ANSWER at the desk he gave me a cardFor Natalie the supervisor and said to call her, who has not returned my phone call STILL. I would NEVER RECOMMEND greektown casino EVER... An issue like the room temperature I can understand but with no concern/follow up or customer service solution after spending OVER $300 for ONE NIGHT... I find it completely unacceptable. More then anything the fact I spoke so highly of my hometown while fighting the negative winds the media brings was so quickly shut down by my experience here at Greektown Casino Hotel.When I am in Detroit this is where I stay, period. It is the spot. I don't gamble but my friends do. I don't drink anymore but when I did, I did it at the downstairs bar where I have been known to throw down an insane rap over a Karaoke beat before I fall down and have to be excorted to my room, yes the room, a suite with an enormous window veiw of Canada! If Sarah Palin can see Russia from her window then why can't I see Canada from mine? Then there is the humungous jacuzzi bathtub and if your like me you love a good gigantic bubble bath that is 2 feet tall running over and onto the floor with suds and I tip the maids well so it's all good, but for me I am 6'2 and some 240 pounds so I don't fit into some wimpy bathtub, so this tub is enough reason to have me coming back! Then there is room service that is out of this world. It's 3 AM, I am drunk and hungry so I pick up the phone (yes, this is when I used to drink) and I order the steak and lobster that ran me about a buck twenty ($120) I don't care though cause that's just par for the course, so speaking of course, I swear the server had to be a carnival world's strongest muscle man to pick that plate up off of his cart and I think I felt the floor shake a little when he dropped the giant silver platter with silver domed cover on the table! Then he lifted the dome and like a good rock band fogged out stage show steam came bursting out like a 3 fire alarm fire, my eyes bugged out like Large Marge as the steam cleared and I feasted my precious little pupils on the biggest lobster I may have ever seen. Red as a fire engine, this was a gorgeouse fish tank freak of nature that made the oversized baked potato and 20 some odd ounce slab of steak look like Davie next to Goliath! When my buddies got back to the room even drunker than me and several thousand dollars lighter after a night of gambling and swiping Amex Black cards like crazy people they even stopped dead in their tracks as they laid their eyes on the lobster carcus that took me 3 different eating sessions to finish. The next words out of my buddy Jay's mouth were very remarkable for a guy that just tried to pay a sushi chef to return to the fish restaraunt across the street for $10,000 dollars to make us sush, not more than 5 or 6 hours earlier, and I might add that was one stubborn sushi chef, he turned us down! He said, "did you charge that to the room? I hope you know that you are paying for that!" I did and it was worth every penny!We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Everything was clean, we had quick room service(cheap), and no issues. Would stay here again. Staff was nice as well.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Allen Park-Dearborn
review_content: This was a fundamentally sound hotel.  It had its good and not so wonderful moments. On the positive side:1.  Offer free coffee in the lobby 24 hours a day.  On the not so positive, they did not always keep the coffee filled.2.  There are free DVD rentals and a DVD player in the room.  3.  Free continental breakfast.  The food wasn't great but there is a nice selection from bananas, to sausage, to biscuits to eggs.4.  The front desk was very friendly.5.  Free Wifi and refrigerator in the rooms6.  Free USA Today in the mornings.7.  There is a gym and pool but they close at 10 PMOn the not so amazing side,1.  The bed was a bit hard and I did not have a good night sleep during my stay.2.  The location is fine but a little out of the way3.  The breakfast could be a little better.Overall, it is a good family hotel and for some business travelers fine.I had my worst travel experience in this hotel. I found some disgusting bedbugs in my room on the headboard of my bed. The reception desk guy promised to give me a new room for free for the rest of my stay. But  finally when I checked out they laughed and said it's hard to believe they said something like that! That was as painful as seeing bedbugs in my room.I could never meet the manager. The front desk guys told me they would contact him and would get back to me. Of course they never did.The bedbug was not my only problem. The second room I received had an issue as well. The window didn't close. I found it the next day when I got cold. Then they changed my room again. This room had a damaged safety box. But this time I refused to change the room.Let's start with the dingy and low light atmosphere when you walk in. Very depressing! Then the fact that I arrived at 3:15 pm and my room wasn't ready, had to be given another room and wait for the two girls to figure out what to do. Went to the room and it was hot, air conditioner was on high cool. Took out both air filters that were black and had to wash them in the shower. Put them back in and the room cooled off! Turned on the tv and it looked like snow, had hotel maintenance come in, they were going to have someone look at it, no one came in 3 days!!!!!! Every night I had to run the bathroom vent and keep the door closed because of the cigarette smell from another room, I don't smoke!!!! The two girls in the lobby love to be on there phones so get use to it, and they will tell you it's not there job to make coffee or cookies, just to look good!!! I wouldn't recommend this to my worst enemy, I travel all over the world, worst hotel ever!oStayed here over the 4th of July weekend, and I have to say this is by far the worst Holiday Inn Express I have stayed in.The A/C is very inconsistent, making it hard to keep a stable temp throughout the entire room.  I was in the main bed by the window and was freezing all night, while those at the other end of the room near the entrance door were sweating it out.  No fun.Carpet in the room was dingy throughout, which made me very thankful that my baby is just that, and not a toddler who would want to be crawling all over the place.We reserved a suite with a "wet bar", though the sink was not functional when we got there.  The carpet in front of the sink was soaked due to an apparent leak in the drain piping, so staff simply turned off the water supply so that we could not use it rather than fix the issue.  I asked to have it fixed, but staff waited until 4 pm the next day to take care of the issue, which was a very inconvenient time for us.I have a cat, and I have to say that the first floor near the breakfast area/pool smelled like an over-full litter box.  There is no other way to describe it.  Staff stated that there was "an accident" in one of the bathrooms nearby, but I can't imagine what could have made such a stench.  Perhaps Sigfried and Roy stopped by with some tigers?  We'll never know.  Staff tried to remedy the smell with febreeze and similar, but it honestly just smelled like a flowery litter box after that.The coup de grace was the fact that on Saturday morning, the hotel decided to have their entire parking lot sealcoated and restriped.  We left for the day and had to drive our car around cones/under caution tape to exit the parking lot as the contractors closed it off without asking anyone to move their car.  There was no sign/notice in the lobby, and the girl at the counter had no idea why they were sealcoating that day, nor when it would be complete.  When we returned in the afternoon, there was a single parking spot available at the front of the building since the entire back lot was roped off.  Good thing we had a room at the complete opposite end of the hotel...About 2 hours later, we were told by family that we needed to move our car ASAP because the contractors needed to sealcoat where we had parked.  This conversation was punctuated by several calls to our room from the front desk asking us to do the same.  Seriously?The remainder of the evening was spent basking in the sweet scent of fresh tar mixed with the aforementioned litterbox stench on the first floor.I get that it's a Holiday Inn, and not the Ritz, but the facility needs some major fixing up, no question about it.  Staff was accommodating and the breakfast was good, which were certainly the only high points of this visit.  I can't say I'll be staying at a Holiday Inn (at least not this one) again any time soon.This Holiday Inn has location going for it.  It's right off the highway, close to the airport without being right in the flight path and there are easily a dozen restaurants within a mile or two.  I give three starts because I've stayed in better Holiday Inn Expresses.  It was clean.  The staff were friendly enough.  The a/c left something to be desired in my room and it was completely non-functional in the second floor hallway.  Coming up the stairs (right by the side entrance, which was convenient) and turning down the hall, it was like going through a sauna to get to my room.  I was there for three days and it was like that the entire time.The fridge in my room was huge, which was great for leftovers.  The bathroom was stocked up with the usual supplies, which I've grown fond of (this was easily the 20th night I've stayed at a HIE this year).  Everything smells like cinnamon.  Their lotion, shampoo, soap, conditioner - cinnamon.  My TV left a lot to be desired.  In all seriousness, I think it got 15 channels.  ESPN was not one of them, nor was the Gold Channel.  This is a problem for me.The breakfast was average-to-slightly-above-average.  There was plenty of coffee (to augment the single bag I received in my room - come on, guys, you need to leave two minimum).  There was meat and biscuits and surprisingly tasty cheese omelets.  I would have liked more fruit, or at least something besides bananas.It's pretty likely that I'll return to Detroit before the end of the year, and I could see me staying here again.  I may not simply because I'm in the room a lot and I'd like TV and an a/c that really works well.Also, there were kids in the pool/hot tub area at 9:30p.  Put your kids to bed at a decent hour so the adults can enjoy the hot tub, people!  Ha!  What an old man I've become.  Seriously, though, some piece and quiet in the last hour of hot tub operation would have been awesome.  *sigh*Stayed here for one night. Given that I used 10,000 Priority Club points (that are otherwise worth e.g. a $25 iTunes store gift card) for this one night, I was very happy with this place.Only one complaint: which was that there were no recycling bins. (I'd just come over from a crabby hotel in Canada, but which had recycling bins.) I guess it would just be too un-American to recycle.Came down for a wedding, and this option seemed to have the best reviews.  The staff were very friendly, especially the front desk clerk Katie.  We arrived early because we still had to get ready for the wedding even though check in was 3pm.  After giving her the confirmation number I was given when I made the reservation, she said it had been cancelled.  After researching it, she found out it was an obvious mistake, and corrected it giving us a just cleaned room allowing us to check in 3 hours early instead of waiting until 3.  The room was nice and comfortable, everything worked great.  The wired ethernet jack is an added plus.  The breakfast bar was good, and had quite the selection and was constantly being replenished.  Overall, the staff was very good, and I would definitely come back.Looked great from the outside but the interior halls and dining areas were quite dark. We reserved a suite to accommodate my wife and me along with our two teenage grandchildren. Our room was a great distance in the back corner of the hotel. As we got closer to the room, all the hallways had a peculiar smell and were very humid. There were fans in several locations blowing air out through open windows. There were three broken windows in the hallway outside our room. And a busted door and lock on a nearby room looked like some kind of brawl had recently taken place there. Between the smell and humidity, my wife refused to stay there. When we returned to front desk to say we were leaving, the manager offered a different suite. One of their best suites on the first floor at no increase in rate. That room was fine. Still a bit humid. Complete with a whirlpool tub which we did not use. Towels were quite small for a room with a whirlpool tub.Went to get ice. First floor machine at the other end of the building was out of order. Got ice on the second floor. The next day the machines on all three floors were out of order. The lady tending to the breakfast saw me holding the bucket and gave me some ice. Food was okay. The staff was friendly and courteous.Just spent another week here in January 2011 and not much has changed. Clean rooms, great staff and nice place to stay on a business trip.If it were not for the auto show in town, I probably would not have found this gem. I would have given it a 5 but the television is all jacked up. I mean I sometimes get certain channels and some I don't even get anything other than the local channels. No clue why, or what time, or anything, it just happens randomly.The rooms are clean, comfortable and I love the fact that they have a 24 hour gym, which I sadly have not taken full advantage of, but it is available, but it has been packed every time I want to use it.The front desk girl that I got checked in with when I got here was kind of hot too. I am thinking a Middle Eastern girl. Spoke to her multiple times over the last few days, smart, cute, and talks to me, what a keeper!The morning breakfast is edible and does not give me bad gas, the cleaning folks leave my shoes where I left them and also my socks. I don't like people touching my shit, especially if I leave it at a specific location. Just come in, make my bed and leave. That is what they are supposed to do, not clean up my clothes.I would stay here again if downtown is packed. Front Desk Girl makes the trip worth it!I went here for an anniversary. Our room was spotless. We got a suite with a two-person jacuzzi tub  (which was also spotless!) There were no funny smells either. The gym was small but had nice equipment and two large TVs. Breakfast was great and fresh. Staff was nice. The inside of the lobby and really the whole hotel is beautiful. They have a decent 'library' of DVDs and books that you can check out (with your room key) at any time of day. My husband and I loved this hotel, and anytime we want to get away for a weekend, we will go back!

This is a hotel made by Satan. I don't know where to start with this. The building itself is about 6 years overdue for being torn down. It resembles less of a hotel and more of a crack house.  The baths won't drain so be prepared to take a shower in while taking a bath. And the water tastes like rust. I think I might have contracted a rare African sickness while staying here. The customer service isn't awful. That's why it gets 2 stars.They don't really deserve one star I need to get what I am paying for Their TV Screen isn't clear & I hade to call the room service to tell them I can't spend my night without a tv cuz there was only three channels so they can to bring another TV that was worst any way don't really recommend this hotel it smells bad too & old   & expensive.We originally checked into room 317 after booking a Jacuzzi room online for our first wedding anniversary. We wanted to go cheap since we really just wanted a place to have a relaxing bath together and have sex in peace. Being from out of town there isnt much opportunity to have private time in the houses of family that hasn't seen us in years lol.We knew we wouldn't be getting frills but cheap does NOT equal dirty. Room 317 had tiles missing above the bath tub, a missing fire alarm that was just a bundle of wires hanging down, and no safety latch on the door. We didn't look any more after that. The jacuzzi was just barely bigger than a standard tub as well.  There was barely enough room for the bed in the tiny room and the tv was ancient. The front desk clerk really didn't want to switch our rooms but after a bit of pushing about safety he did. As soon as we opened the door to our new room I could see why. This room is better by leaps and bounds. The tub is big enough for 2, the room itself is much larger with a table and chairs, and a flat screen tv. Though not without fault as there is a huge water stain on the ceiling, unfinished walls in the closet, a toilet like those seen in public restrooms, and yellow drips down the walls that can only be years buildup of rat piss dripping down with all the water leaks. There's a smoke alarm in this room but it's missing the battery so it's useless. We booked online for $15 less than rack rate so they stuck us in the shitiest room possible. This place is a disgusting accident waiting to happen run by dirty people who are a bad mark on all of the lovely America's Best that we have stayed at in the past. It will work for what we need (sex) but I won't be surprised if we wake up covered in bed bug bites.Stay away. Unless you like the smell of curry and mold.I also had to post this from my phone because free WiFi means no working WiFi.HORRIBLE!!!! DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!  You have been warned. 1. The elevators are so beaten up. They could easily paint it, but they obviously do not care about appearances.2. The hallway smelled like my dog when he has been outside too long and needs a shower.3. The signs everywhere say non smoking, but as soon as we stepped into the room, we were choked with the smell of cigarette smoke. Also, people were smoking marijuana in the room next to us.4. The main wall had water damage and markings up and down the wall. 5. The mattress felt worn out. I could feel the springs and it had barley any cushion. 6.
