Top 40 music isn't really my thing and I wanted to go somewhere less business-like (as all of my co-workers were obviously in attendance) and ended up over at the bar at the other end of the building. Good move I must say. The bar was totally elegant and gritty at the same time. Weird I know but it was fancy in a gangster kind of way. The bar staff was super-duper chill and really made us feel welcome. Very low-key jazzy type vibe. Loved it!!! And the drinks were top-shelf, not over-priced, and strong. Fan-friggin-tastic!As for the adorable room, I couldn't get enough of it. It was very, very spacious and had the comfiest of beds. The linens were soft and inviting too. When I visited this hotel, I did live over an hour away so it was a nice treat. Now, I live right down the road and though staying at a hotel so close to home might be strange, I have been considering it just for a quick little night away from my 4 legged friends. Every momma (doggie momma's too!!!!) can need a break from time to time. This place was so superior to other hotels that I have stayed at that I might pop in just to have the experience all over again. Can I get a 6 stars please??? What? What?Our family has many fond memories of holiday gatherings and special occasions at the Dearborn Inn. Last week we returned to eat in Edison's to celebrate our dad's 91st birthday, and we were not disappointed. Matter of fact, we were all very impressed with the high quality of food and service! It was a fantastic way to top off a day at the Henry Ford (or Greenfield Village). SO glad they still are maintaining their long-standing tradition of beautiful surroundings, good hospitality, and quality dining!
review_content_40: The Early American room is pricey but has wonderful steaks, salad, dessert, and service.  I reccomend the salmon oscar or filet oscar.  The  newly renovated rooms are beautiful.  This hotel is definitely a classy place to have a drink and take in a little history.Dearborn Inn if you're reading this:Bring back the brunch so us and our many friends can rejoin the Insider's  Club!  We miss Sunday Champagne Brunch : (I felt pretty fancy staying here.  The only thing that surprised me, was they didn't have a shuttle to the wedding we were attending, and the complimentary shuttle ended at 9pm or something ludicrously early like that.  The *other* wedding that was also happening nearby had a shuttle, so it just seemed a little odd.  For the fancy level, I was expecting a little more by way of transportation across the street to the Ford Estate.  I guess I expected just a scoche too much.I live in Boston now but had my wedding in Dearborn a couple of weeks ago. We stayed at the Dearborn Inn and several of our relatives also stayed there. The rooms were great and the staff was beyond wonderful. I cannot say enough about the staff - they seriously went out of their way to make our stay great, including moving around rooms so we could be together (even though they were very full with other unrelated guests), handing out gift bags upon check-in, and adding extra nights when necessary (particulary for the "bridal" suite which was fantastic). My only criticism is that they don't seem to get Fox Sports Detroit in the hotel rooms so the men were slightly disappointed not to catch the Tigers games. However, I didn't care so much and I think they played in the bar. Oh - and speaking of the bar - the renovations were lovely and the bar is now a totally comfy and kinda hip place to hang out.I've stayed in this hotel some years ago, but it is just a very nice almost with a historycal atmosphere to it.I love the brunch served at the Early American Tavern, it is the best brunch in Michigan, nice staff, luxurious dishes, endless options! Not too pricey for what is offered!The Dearborn Inn is a beautiful hotel with lots of charm. I ended up getting this hotel for $55 a night through priceline! The staff seemed really nice even though I didn't have much interaction with them. I told them it was my birthday and they upgraded us to a corner room in the concierge level. The room was really nice, spacious and very clean. Huge king bed was soo comfortable. The flat screen tv was at a bit of an odd angle but it worked. Channel selection was ok. In the concierge level rooms, you get free snacks and drinks during certain times but unfortunately we were there on the weekend and I think it's only on weekdays. My only complaint is their internet is $12.95 a day but other than that, check-in/check-out was smooth and I have no complaints.We blocked off rooms for your wedding. Many guest were from out of town and stayed 2-3 nights. Most of the guest said there rooms were okay. I only hear from a few that had rooms that were too small or dirty. Our room on our wedding night was beyond horrible. We had gotten the suite for 2 nights, Heather was very helpful in setting this up. My husband and the groomsmen would be getting ready at the hotel on the wedding day so I asked for the room to be cleaned sometime after 3:00 p.m. ( our wedding started at 2 p.m.) I also set up for champagne and strawberries to be in the room around 12:30 am ( reception was in Dearborn and ended at midnight)  We arrived at the hotel and there were no strawberries or champagne in the room.  The room was very hot. I understand there is no A/C in the hotel this time of year so we opened the window. I thought I would take a shower but there were no fresh towels and no soap. No one had set foot into the room to clean it. So on my wedding night I had to walk down to the front desk and spend a 1/2 hour asking for champagne, strawberries and towels. I mentioned the room was dirty. They offered to send the cleaning staff up. The last people I wanted to spend my WEDDING NIGHT with would be the Marriot cleaning staff. I got to the room with the towels and shampoo to find black mold in the tub. Really! Champagne arrived randomly at 2:30 am ( way to late and only because I complained). At this point we decided to just pack up and leave. I will NEVER forget having to drag my wedding dress through the  lobby crying while my new husband loaded the luggage in the car.  I will Never forget spending part of my wedding night in the dirty room and I will NEVER forget having to argue with the desk clerk about checking out ON MY WEDDING NIGHT. I am embarrassed that we had 20+ of your rooms booked with out of town and local guests.  I am embarrassed that we chose to have them stay here and they had no other choice not knowing the area. I have heard similar stories from a few of our guests and I am continuing to apologize to them for our choice in hotels.  I was contacted about our issues by Heather ( who I had emailed) and was told cleaning staff did come to the room at 3 but there were people in the room. If our wedding started at 2:00 p.m. and lasted an hour with a reception following who was in our room? Who was given a key? And even if someone was in the room, why didn't staff come late, before 12:30 am? What about the champagne etc? Bottom line is there is NO EXCUSE for the condition of our room. There is NO EXCUSE for how we were treated and for the lack of service. Bottom line OUR WEDDING NIGHT WAS RUINED BECAUSE OF THE DEARBORN INN MARRIOT HOTEL.On a side note it rained on our wedding day. All of our photos were planned for outside. Scrambling for ideas we called the the Dearborn inn thinking they might let us take a few pics (total of 16 ppl) in the lobby. They would not let us. Even with having 20+ rooms booked for several nights ( adding up to about 7-10,000$) They would still not let us take photos for 1/2 hour.Stayed September 2007 with family.  We checked in late at night after a long drive from Chicago and the lady who worked at check in was not friendly and had issue with my friends and family authorization form. I have used this form at least 5 times and have never had a problem. If this woman were good at her job she would have checked us all in since it was about 8:30pm with 4 and 7 year old boys bouncing off the walls from being in the car for hours and just asked me to stop by the front desk after we got settled to discuss. That would have made for good customer service. Instead at 8:30pm at night with 2 active children (none of us had dinner yet) she questions me for a good 15 minutes where I have to call my family member from Chicago to answer questions for her. The manager was there too. I was so disappointed. The actual hotel room was okay. It is an old building so allergy sufferers beware. I will say the building and grounds were beautiful and the breakfast was good but, quite expensive. Overall, I was so disappointed by their lack of service I will never go to this hotel again or recommend it to anyone.Liked -- The groundsDisliked -- the serviceA great place to stay...historic, beautiful. clean.What a beautiful hotel. They have themed "guest houses" in the back of the property that you could stay in that are period homes but I didn't get to see what they looked like on the inside. They looked very cool from the outside, though.The inside of the hotel was very cool. The rooms were a nice size and very upscale. The staff, outstanding. The bar made you feel like you should be sipping a single malt scotch & smoking a cigar. heh.Not sure about this place....most reviews I have read about the Dearborn Inn have said the staff was not very good. My experience has been the opposite- the staff I have encountered here have been wonderful- front desk, wait staff, concierge and housekeeping. The only staff issue I encountered was the morning concierge lady seems to like to talk loud and often, but she is attentive.The room was a good size with a tiny bathroom. No big deal to me, as I travel mostly alone, on biz. The room is basically Marriott stock- comfy bed, desk and large TV. Although the inn feel is still present with some dated furniture, heavy doors and great old pictures, this is still got a Marriott feel.The food has been borderline, at best. I had the Salmon Oscar last night with Bernaise sauce...the sauce overpowered everything on the plate. Chicken Quasidillas for lunch were good, but only 2 on the plate- a little skimpy. The Chicken Pot pie and baked potato I had for dinner tonight was downright awful. The pot pie was a runny soup with no substance and the baked potato was destroyed to the point of being inedible.The building itself is very nice, in a 1930's kind of way. The history is evident and the feel of days gone by is palatable. Marble floors, gorgeous lobby and period furniture enhance the experience. The grounds are nice, especially considering the terrible area the hotel is located. A nice hideaway.Overall, I would absolutely come back. Although I may venture elsewhere to dine. It certainly is a break from the standard Marriott experience.Historic old world class, it was built by Henry Ford.  There are the five guest cottages out back, and they let you walk the grounds.  My particular favorite is the Edgar Allen Poe house which is the honey moon suite.  If you feel like splurging you won't regret Sunday brunch in the Grill; it's a champaign brunch so plan on retiring early.   Golden Eagle Lounge is snazzy, in a  boy's club/smoking room kind of way with huge wing back chairs, couches big screen TV's, and a pool table.  Unfortunately you can not kick back with that cigar because the entire hotel is smoke free- come on it's historic !Great hotel, with a historical feel. Have stayed here two weeks on buisness and will spend four more here. Great staff, clean and comfy rooms, and great food.The Dearborn Inn is that rarest of properties - a chain hotel (Marriott) with real charm and character. Tucked behind a stand of mature trees (with vivid fall foliage) in the midst of the Ford industrial complex, the Inn has the air of a well preserved county mansion from the 30's. Inside, the old-style charm persists with nicely preserved and gently modernised rooms (with opening sash windows), a large and gracious lobby, and a snug, paneled bar. If you are fortunate, you'll stay in a room or suite in one of a set of charming reproductions of historic cottages that ring the lawns and gardens in the rear of the grounds. So drive a few more miles past the other corporate sleep-boxes in the area and take in some of the elegance of years past

hotel_name: Aloft Detroit at the David Whitney
review_content: The location is superb, especially if you're going to a show or a Lions/Tigers game. Lots of restaurants in walking distance, plus the gorgeous Christmas lights up and down Woodward during the holidays. The front desk staff was friendly, happy, helpful (even when we checked in at 11:45 pm!). The room itself was small... Felt almost European. But nicely appointed and clean. The rooms feel much more modern than the lobby would suggest. Big windows overlooking Woodward helped with the slightly small feeling. The 24-hour reFuel convenience store in the lobby was helpful. Free coffee and tea at any time comes in handy when one of you (out of a group of four) gets up four hours before everyone else. I would stay here again with friends, but I definitely would opt for The Book if you're looking for a romantic destination.The David Whitney building itself is incredible. The lobby is stunning and makes a wonderful impression right after a courteous valet took my vehicle. The hostess was kind, though not entirely professional. Our room was modern and sleek, as you would hope and expect in a downtown hotel in the price range. However, there was a rather unappealing stain in the carpet that needed to have been replaced. The carpet is laid in an arrangement where that would have been simple, but they don't seem concerned--I was a little skeeved out. When my wife called the front desk from our room, she was placed on hold and after over 10 minutes of waiting we called back and spoke with someone immediately. We asked for a hypoallergenic pillow and received two additional down pillows. When I explained that down (feathers) were the offending allergen, I was told the hotel doesn't have any cotton pillows whatsoever. Lastly, small gripe, but the bathroom door was really difficult for both my wife and I to open. The rollers may have been off or something to that affect, but annoying nonetheless. Overall, nice hotel with a good view of the city, but average vs. above average is in the details for me and they failed in a few categories.I stayed at the Aloft once when it first opened. The building is beautiful and the first stay was alright, there was some water pressure issue that made an alarm go off for quite some time so that was annoying. I booked the night for new year's eve and got a suite. I guess I assumed the suite would be really nice based on the price but I guess they just jack up the rate on their rooms like 350% and give you subpar service. My friend and I had both had kind of a crazy year so I thought we'd go party at the Fillmore and I'd surprise her with a really nice suite at Aloft. I paid the same price as what a corner suite at the MGM would cost. Have you seen those rooms? They are amazing. This room....it was pathetic. Yeah, I said it. The living area was an uncomfortable couch with some scratchy ass wool pillows and two neon orange uncomfortable retro chairs. The bathroom was tiny, just as tiny as the regular rooms. There wasn't any hot water either. The sleeping area was just a larger version of the regular room. There were barely any towels and only one bottle of water. I'm a gold elite member at both SPG and Marriot (which recently acquired SPG) and I'm a Delta rewards member. I'm not trying to be snooty but seriously, I stay at your hotels a lot. At least pretend like you give a shit. Overall, the most bogus 'suite' I have ever stayed in. The only good things about the stay were the friendly front desk staff and the prompt valet. I would never stay here again.My friends and I spent the night at the Aloft Downtown Detroit for our annual Christmas party. The hotel is in the Historic David Whitney building. Let me tell you,  it is a beautiful piece of architecture.  We valeted our vehicles which is $30 per night. I think that is about the norm for downtown hotels. A bellman, Christopher, helped us bring our bags up on a luggage cart. He was very friendly and hospitable. Later there was some confusion about our tipping as he was overheard stating he was only given $1 tip.. hmmm. We tipped him $8, and guests in our party in an adjacent room said they tipped him a $10 bill so...?? I thought it was kind of gauche that we would've been in a position to over hear that.  Back to the rooms. Nice. Contemporary.  We had a great view of Comerica Park and Ford Field. The rooms have thick walls too and we had been concerned about making too much noise and disturbing others  (there were 10 ladies in 4 rooms, but we all congregated in one suite)The employees were friendly and knowledgeable.  I would definitely go back.We were surprised how great this hotel was!  Pros:  - Location!  Located in the dead center of Downtown Detroit and very close to Ford Field!  - Rooms are very large and very nice! They seem recently renovated. Decor is on the modern side. - Staff:  Very helpful. - The building is historic and is just beautiful.  White and gold interior.  Beautiful. Cons: - Lots of traffic during game day.  Our recommendation is not take your car anywhere on game day.  It took us 20 minutes to go around the loop just to get on the right street. Overall:  Great hotel.  It is on the expensive side but you wont be disappointed.LOVED THIS PLACE. It was beautiful!!! Very modern, very clean, a hip, trendy place to be. We will stay here again as our primary place to stay when in Detroit.Two stars for rooms that weren't fully operational. Five stars for the hotel's response to the issues and for the overall concept of the hotel.  Absolutely breath-taking building and artistic decor, but it wasn't enough to cover up the functionality flaws we experienced.We choose this place for a Valentine's day overnight. We drove in on what will probably go down in the history books as the day h*ll froze over; It was very cold outside. But the valet was friendly and the front desk individual greeted us warmly. Taken by the marble and glass of the atrium, I looked forward to seeing what was in store design-wise for our initial room, 403. I was not disappointed! We had a large seating area and bedroom designed with a minimalistic eye. The bathroom was tiny, given the size of the other two rooms, but was adequate for our overnight stay. The first of several incidents with the hotel happened when we went to take a shower. There was very little hot water and our showers were on the luke-warm side. Figuring it was maybe our preference for scolding hot water, we brushed it off. It's when the door wouldn't lock that we made our first call to the front desk. The deadbolt didn't line up to the door jam. Generally, your hotel door should lock.Quickly, we were transferred to a room on the 7th floor. Good news- the door lock worked in this room. Our 7th-floor room was smaller but had superior, sweeping views of the city with an especially good view of Comerica Park. The decor was just as nice and unique as our first room. We noticed that the room was chilly but since we were leaving for dinner, we didn't think much of it. Hindsight being what it is, we should've thought about it more. Because generally, you want your hotel to have heat. It's when we woke up to ice covered windows and a thermostat at 58 that the hot shower was nice. And yes, this room had actual hot water. If you're keeping track, Room 1: little hot water, broken door, has heat. Room 2: hot water, door works, no heat. We complained about the lack of heat to the front desk and they graciously comped our room. Another guest was arguing with the front desk in her coat and hat, saying she has to wear full outdoor gear in her room. So it wasn't just our room that was dealing with this. I've heard great things about the Aloft Hotel brand so I'm still willing to go to another hotel in this brand. Will I come back to his hotel - Maybe in the summer when we don't need heat.Impeccable service, comfy beds, beautiful building in an up and coming area. New restaurants and stores on Woodward, people mover adjacent to hotel, attached bar (didn't open until 4pm on the Saturday of our stay) and everything one needs to be comfortable, feel safe and have fun. I couldn't figure out the heating/act so I just turned it off so the unit didn't run continuously and the area and hotel became very loud at 2am when the bars closed. It was short lived. Wonderful stay, I will be back!My review is for the WXYZ Bar inside the David Whitney on the first floor.This is a great new bar/lounge with quality people.  The music on the nights I have been there is chill dance electro and everyone is dressed to the tee.  They have couches bordering the inside, which are open to any of the patrons as long as there isn't a reserved party.  It is a small place, so if it is too stuffy for you, you can take your drink in the lobby of the David Whitney.  They have a seasonal drink list, but be prepared to pay the prices. I can't speak on behalf of happy hour prices, but drinks will run you around $8-$10 on a Saturday night.If you're looking for an interesting night of mixing and mingling I would hands down direct you to the WXYZ.There are a few specific individuals that you rarely wouldn't recognize but are part of a "big picture" mind like view atypical to certain people but needs recognized and is the reason for this rare review. Edgar, employed by Starwood aka Aloft Hotel front desk was so kind, genuine and focused on his job, but went over and beyond not interfering with policy or job guideline.  He is our future and I want to publicly say I would hire him in a minute.  He has the values, integrity and authenticity we need in Corporate America now, the future without all the Applicant Tracking, Psychology, Behavioral Testing "so called" to retain employee turnover and recruit the best candidate.  I hope he gets the recognition well deserved as a Gold Member with Starwoods and Marriott.....I'm loyal to people, my family, friends Employer and most of all my Country.Cool modern and chic hotel with just enough amenities to keep me happy. Good quality bathroom soaps, shampoos and nice towels. The beds are comfy and clean. The rooms are cozy with a nice view of Comerica Park. Would come back when I come to Detroit. Staff was very helpful and took care of all needs, fast.I am so glad Aloft came to Detroit.  It's a great hotel chain, the likes of what you would see in Chicago or some other swanky downtown neighborhood.  The building, David Whitney, has been restored beautifully.  Honestly, it caught my breath when I walked in.  Pulling up we were greeted by the valet.  We walked in with the bell hop (who chatted with us about how things had been going at the hotel since its opening a few weeks ago).  He was very nice and even though we had one small bag for our overnight stay he helped with it and made pleasant conversation.  Upon check-in I signed up for the Starwood rewards program.  When asked the reason for our stay I said it was our anniversary and we were upgraded to a suite. Wow...was the room gorgeous!  Very modern, fun colors in the living room.    Walk in shower for 2, great decor, king bed, and great city view.  Got some very cool pics of the people mover right outside our window.The hotel goes up to the 9th floor, and beyond that is residential apartments.  What a fabulous place to live!!  One small con was the fact that the windows aren't soundproofed very well and we could hear the train rolling by.  Luckily we had a late night and it wasn't too long after returning to our room that the people mover stops (it runs until 2:00 am).  So, it wasn't terrible, however if you're a light sleeper or have to be up early in the morning it might cause a problem.  Check out is noon and they gave us late check out so we had the room until 2:00 pm.  That was nice because I just wanted to sit and soak up the atmosphere of the lobby.  They have complimentary coffee and tea as well as other snacks, beverages, etc available for purchase in the 24/7 store in the lobby.  We grabbed a newspaper, some tea and coffee and relaxed before we checked out.Take a look around the city - new stores and restaurants are opening on a regular basis.  This hotel is an obvious choice for Detroit and a very welcome addition.Absolutely a great place to stay in Detroit. The place is new yet old. Meaning, the building is a historic building built about 100 years ago. The architecture is just remarkable particularly the grand lobby. Now it's somewhat new because the building has been converted to a hip hotel after being abandoned for years. Their standard king sized room is beyond standard. Plenty of space to run around. The bathroom is modern and efficient. The ceiling is probably 12 ft high. Free wifi too for spg members.They have a pantry place in the lobby that is stocked with essentials. From frozen packages, Cheerios, cookies, snacks, iced cream and emergency "stuff", this place is just so convenient. Their valet is very attentive too. I was trying to check out in the lobby and they quickly helped me with my luggage and placed it in my car without even me asking them to do so. The xyz is bar is stocked and there's a DJ spinning on weekends.Overall, it's truly a great place to stay. It's now my mainstay hotel each time I'm in Detroit.This hotel is outstanding.  From the moment you arrive, Valet is attentive, courteous and friendly.  As we migrated through the gorgeous lobby (it's worth walking in - even if you're not staying there) and the wonderful Concierge helped us.  I believe her name was Shannon.  She provided not only hotel information, but some general information about the city and the area.  She was pleasant and cheerful and made us eager to stay at this hotel.The rooms are nice - albeit not my ideal layout.  There is a large living room area, smaller bathroom and large bedroom.  I guess the living room is useful for longer stays - but with a 1-2 night visit I would have preferred more bathroom space.  The furniture is modern.  A bit art deco in that 1950s way.  Our view faced East - and we woke with the bright sun. My companion hated this - I LOVED it.My biggest shout out goes to the XYZ bartender Shannon.  She is hands down the bees knees.  This chick can make ANY cocktail and she does it RIGHT.  Delicious martinis, perfect margarita, Moscow Mules - you name it!  She is friendly, attentive and DAMN good at her job.  As a former bartender I have insanely high standards for a cocktail and Shannon gets it right every time.I frequent the Book usually when I stay downtown - but quickly added Aloft to my list.  It's a better venue. location, service and price - you can't lose!I have stayed at the Book Cadillac so have something to compare Aloft to.  They are very similar in feeling, stately old buildings gloriously restored and repurposed as hotels.  The David Whitney is worth a look even if you aren't staying here.  The lobby especially the ceiling is beautiful.  A cheery valet took my car at the door. One can access one's car as many times as needed without additional charge, I did not need it though.  The check in was professional and easy. The room is very large and nicely appointed with Bliss soaps. The towels and linens are typical of SPG and very nice. The bed is great, the bathroom clean. The bar was pleasant for a martini.  Good location.  Overall an excellent choice.  The reason I gave 3 stars, is because competition is stiff and it wasn't a bargain and there was one glaring fault.  The A/C unit is so loud it is unusable.  Now it was late August, but not sweltering night and I was alone, had I been a couple on a hot night without A/C it would have been a disaster.  When I asked about it at  during check out, The front desk attendant lamented that they Knew about it, and that the building was old and the unit was really loud.  Further, that if I had complained in the middle of the night I could have switched rooms..... huh?  I said, that sounds really inconvenient, why would you use that room in summer at all if any other was available to avoid that scenario.  To which she had no answer.  Well that sure didn't  make a strong positive impression. The hotel was definitely not fully booked.  I don't understand that at all.   That was the only fault and I wasn't looking for one. just felt it necessary to point out.  Rest of stay was fine.Nice place to stay slightly at the edge of downtown. Like most of Detroit, the outside is dodgy, but the inside was nice and the ambience is different than a regular big box hotel. Room was comfy.We had a great stay here... The building is absolutely beautiful. The room was very comfortable and well appointed, and the staff particularly friendly and helpful....and that atrium!It seems like the #1 topic talked about in Detroit is... Detroit. It's a resurgent city. People who want to make art ... music... food... can afford to feed their creativity with the money they aren't spending on rent. On one hand it's shocking/depressing seeing near-empty downtown streets on a weekday, but on the other hand there's an energy there... something is happening in Detroit... and as an outsider you can kind of feel it, or at least look out on it, in this hotel.This is a beautiful hotel! The people are friendly, but the bar patrons can be too friendly (loud) at night. Your door leads to the lobby which houses the bar. The room is outright gorgeous! Modern and cool, with plenty of room. We had a single suite. There was a pull out couch, lots of seating, and two TVs. The bed was comfortable. It was centrally located and a five minute walk to Comerica Park. On a separate note, we drive a highly modified van for a wheelchair user and the parking for that was a huge struggle throughout. We were told multiple times it would be no problem and when we arrived were told there was nowhere to park it. At 11pm. After about an hour we got a plan settled only to be told the next day it wouldn't work again. Again, more discussion and problem eventually solved (although we were told this time we might get a ticket.) Ultimately it worked out but not without a lot of struggle. Several of the valet staff tried very hard to help us. A four star rating for the hotel had we not had such issues.My wife and I live in Detroit and we wanted to get away for a night to celebrate our anniversary. This hotel is amazing. The David Whitney building is absolutely gorgeous. Built in 1915 and newly restored in 2014, it is a space like none other in the city. You will spend time hanging out in the lobby because of how breathtaking it is.The room was very spacious with high ceilings and fantastic views of the city. The in room decor is vintage/modern and very cool. The staff are extremely accommodating and friendly, and made our stay extra special.The bar in the lobby pours delicious "and large" cocktails, and has a great selection of local spirits. Aloft is walkable to many great restaurants, bars, Comerica Park and The State & Fox Theaters.I am so excited that a place like this exists in Detroit, and we will be back!Pros:-Friendly and attentive staff.-I was impressed that the beauty of the original building was still very much intact.-Spacious room (Upgraded as a Platinum perk)-Close to local attractions.-Great price, especially in comparison to the nearby Westin.-Very hip/millennial friendly.Cons: -Room was right next to the People Mover tracks, which runs until midnight on weeknights. It was really loud.-It would be nice if they had a light room service menu. I know it's not custom for all Alofts to offer room service (they do have a reFuel section to buy snacks and serve food in their bar). I think for this particular area, someone traveling alone may not feel as comfortable walking to grab dinner at night. Making the XYZ bar menu available for room service would be a simple fix.
review_content_20: Roxanne was the best at the front desk!!! She was amazing friendly and cool. I highly recommend staying here and talking to her!!!Absolutely beautiful place. The service was awesome. Valet was quick and very helpful. WXYZ bartenders Shannon and Jaimi were outstanding. Best service I have had in Detroit. DJ Tom T had the crowd engaged in a great time. Best hotel bar I have even been to. Will definitely be back.My wife and I stayed there and chose to go there due to the proximity to Comerica.  Excellent choice!  I called about 20 minutes prior to our arrival and asked if they had a room available (early arrival).  They said they did.  We used the valet parking and was parked, checked in and brought our stuff to the room in about 10 minutes.  Comerica (and Ford field) are only about a 5 minute walk, perfect for game day!  As far as the room, it's rather spacious, clean and very nice.  I would highly recommend!My husband stayed here in May and enjoyed his stay. The hotel is very nice and comfortable. However, we had a billing issue due to an error by the hotel staff and it took us almost two months to resolve and get our money back.Wonderful staff!  Couldn't recommend them enough.  If you are in Detroit this is a great place to stay!Went to wxyz for a drink while I had some time to kill before an engagement.  Long story short, I blew off the engagement to hang at the bar. It was a blast.  The bartender, Jaimi, is the best.  The drink selection was solid, the atmosphere was great, and the pool table existed.Go.Although the hotel seems well renovated and I am so pleased that the building has maintained its spectacular lobby, I regret to say I experienced several problems when booking four, special guests for two nights each at this hotel. Even though all reservations were clearly made via email, names were entered incorrectly into the system, and upon arrival the guests learned the dates of their stays had been incorrectly entered as well. Those fixes were made at the front desk by patient concierges. Additionally, I paid for all charges via credit card the day after the guests left, only to find out two weeks ago that one of my guests was charged via credit card for her stay as well (her card # was taken for incidentals only). After repeated phone calls and emails, I cannot get anyone to speak with me to rectify this error, which should be easy to correct. At this time I cannot recommend this hotel to friends or colleagues without explaining the series of errors.Stopped in for a drink and to check out the renovations. This bar is small, overpriced and I found the bartender/waitress to be condescending. (I was a bartender for 11 years and always treat servers with respect) One and done. No reason to go back.Beautiful and bustling.  Greeted first by a top hat wearing gentleman , then quickly by the helpful valets.  Loved the use of this historic building. Rooms were hip and clean. Space are designed well, ample room but not alot of wasted space. A helpful check in and out by Eva-thanks!

review_content: We really enjoyed our weekend stay at the Double Tree Hilton.  I used my points from the HHoners program to book a free weekend stay.  Tip- it is well worth joining the hotel rewards program with their branded credit card that gives you free points to use for hotel stays.  I found the hotel to be very clean, all of the employees were friendly and helpful.  The beds were comfortable and the feather pillows a delight.  The onsite restaurant though pricey, made up for it in value because all the food was very good.  Fresh fruit in the morning at the buffet included several melons, blackberries and blueberries and fresh pineapple and all the fruit was ripe and tasty. The bacon was lean, crispy and some of the best I have had.  Its the little extras that make this hotel so nice.  A warm chocolate chip cookie on check in and daily free newspaper and starbucks coffee in the lobby in the am. A very nice pool and exercise room with extended hours ( pool and hot tub open until midnight!)Avoid the pool on weekends though, unsupervised children left by parents otherwise occupied in their rooms made the pool noisy and unsafe for the children who were running about unsupervised by any adult.I came to Detroit for a dental school interview this weekend and stayed here with my mom. I don't normally write Yelp reviews but we had SUCH a wonderful experience that I decided to write one. First of all, the hotel shuttle service is ON POINT. We got rides to/from the airport, the university where I had my interview, and the DIA museum in downtown (they'll take you anywhere within 19mi radius). Joe, our driver, was very helpful and accommodating. Grille39, the restaurant inside the hotel, was also really nice. My mom and I appreciate good food, and we appreciated this place. If you like meat, you MUST try their steak - I had their filet mignon and it was awesome.  My mom enjoyed her seafood tacos. The customer service was all around very satisfactory. Josh, who was our front desk assistant, was incredibly helpful and personable. We really appreciated his excellent service. Last but not least, THEIR BED AND PILLOWS ARE SO COMFORTABLE! My mom and I both slept like babies both nights. I wish I could've kept the pillows!  I would definitely recommend this place to loved ones, and stay here again if the opportunity arises.I waffled b/w an A-ok and Yay but went for YAY for one reason alone-Brianna. I pulled a bone-head move after a co-worker in another city had his work laptop stolen from his hotel room. I put my work laptop under the mattress-didn't fit in safe. Yeah. You know what happened next. I was an hour from home when I had that "KEVIN!" moment from "Home Alone". I had a horrible time finding a person who wouldn't put me on hold for 10 minutes and actually help me find my laptop. I finally found Brianna who handled the problem like an absolute pro. No kidding. My laptop was FedEx'd to me for my presentation in PHL by 7a Tuesday. Life saver. We were there for a hockey tourney. Plus is that there are lots of doors to make access to rooms convenient when carrying in bags etc. My room was clean, spacious and had obviously been updated recently. Cons is that there is obviously an issue with the staff and how to answer the phone. However, Randy the manager assured me that he was nipping that in the bud immediately. Ultimately very grateful for Brianna and her dedication to helping out a desperate customer on a Sunday afternoon.When hearing the word Doubletree, most people would share the same initial reaction and impression that I had when I hear the word: It must be pretty good!Well, there are always exception to the rules. This is probably one of them.Juggling around 3 different Doubletree due to business travel in Detroit so far, this is probably the oldest of the three.  Don't get me wrong, I felt great hospitality upon entering, but the building itself definitely needs some fine-tuning. I definitely come to appreciate the big common area in the lobby, where I can enjoy reading my ipad, or get some work done while being away from the temptation that wreak from my bed in my hotel room. However, putting the elevator that far back to access doesn't seem..convenient for me, personally. Of course, I realize there will be factors that dictate where the elevators will be located in the building...but again, just how I feel.I resided on the 6th floor. I pressed the elevator button to go down every morning to go to work. The button does not seem to be functional. I waited 2-3 minutes before suspecting the malfunction of the button. I quickly thought to myself: Well, guess I am going to have to walk down 5 flights of stairs every morning to go to the car to go to work! Thank god there is another button located at the opposite wall, yay for being lazy!Another big thing that I would prefer to not exist is the fact that I have to use my hotel room key to go in and out of the parking lot. Yes, I understand that this is a rather big security issue, but the inconvenience of doing so really does add up to my annoyance. I am no expert on hotel infrastructure or arrangements. Heck no. But this is just my two cents on the hotel as a whole from a consumer perspective, and believe me when I say the majority of the prospective residents in this hotel will most likely feel the same way I did.This lady is Awesome... I will give Hilton credit for having such an outstanding staff member who takes customer care to that awesome level Thank you Lesley.Also regarding the room loved the mattress, linens and pillows. Excellent place for our family reunion. The food they served at our reunion was top notch.Hotel is always clean and comfortable. Equally outstanding is the staff. Always willing to help eager to please and always with a smile. I have spent a lot of time here on business. Folks are pretty much like family.They even put up a tent outside for smokers. Whether you do or don't what other hotel shows that level of commitment consideration?  First class in experienceHere for a conference.  Though the staff couldn't have been nicer, it didn't make up for the the unclean condition in which I found the room. I wouldn't have picked this hotel if the others hadn't been sold out. The location is just OK, I would have preferred being closer to downtown. The  restaurant is good and based on the convenient location, I would recommend it over room service.  (same restaurant, but it's worth a short trip to the lobby) It was quiet which is important especially on business trip.UPDATE: I was very disappointed in the state of my room when I first checked in, but between the general manager, the front desk, house keeping and the conference staff, the issues were resolved.  So though the first impression was less than favorable, I was impressed by the response.  The location can't be helped, ( in terms of the proximity to downtown) I have to compliment the customer service.  Because of the commitment to address the issue (and in a very pleasant manner- I was not treated like a nuisance, instead  my complaints were greeted with concern and apologies) I upgraded the score.Not a fan of this hotel.  Firstly I stayed there for around 2 weeks.  The walk alone to the rooms is exhausting.  I felt like I was in a casino expect I wasn't walking past slot machines, open bars or food.  Restaurant and bar closed crazy early even though the entertainment space is about the same size as a normal hotel.  I guess it an event space.  Everyday leaving the hotel I would have to walk through a huge crowd of anything from religious seminar check in or model calls.  Even a high school reunion full of old folks in lobby.  Super weird.  Oh and if you think the walk sucks well get used to it because you key won't work about every other day.  Oh but the rooms once you get to them were nice and clean. But the worst part they lost a package of mind and then argued with me and never paid for it even though the tracking has logged that the person with the matching name signed for it at front desk.  They did not handle that well and I felt disrespected.  The restaurants near by close early but the strip club in walking distant could be fun... Pretty skanky one...   Over all.  Stay somewhere else.Check in was quick and easy. The front desk girl greeted us with a smile :) We all received a fresh baked cookie upon check in! Had a horrible time trying to find the elevator! I must not have been paying attention, because I'm sure she pointed me in the direction...lol. The hotel looked like it just went through a major renovation. Everything looked new. The room was nice and clean with nice decor. Didn't get a chance to use the pool. It was very small though and there was probably about 30 kids in it when I walked by...sooo that wasn't happening anyways..lol. They do have adult swim after 10pm and early in the morning. Our family was having a party in one of the banquet rooms. The food was good and the serving staff friendly. The bartender was not very talkative and didn't really smile....strange for being a bartender. All in all it was a nice party. We had breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. They had a pretty good selection at the buffet. Didn't care for the eggs though.This is a nice affordable hotel that's 11.5 miles from COBO center. It's a good choice if you're going to the convention center and don't want to pay an arm and a leg for hotel. Drawback is that you'll have to arrange transportation. The hotel has a huge lobby and makes a great first impression. Go into the rooms and you'll find a TV, round table, single couch, and spacious bathroom. There are outlets on the desk lap which is convenient. I noticed I was missing cups in the restroom, however you can use the ones in the room by the ice bucket. There is no fridge or microwave at the time of this review but while I was here they received a large order of refrigerators for the rooms.  The rooms are decent, however the Double Tree hotels in CA have more amenities. I deducted stars for the service at the hotel & restaurant (attached). Online I requested a room with 1 king bed but received a double instead. I asked to have this changed but had to wait 2 hours for the clerk to find a room. This was clearly a mistake on the hotel's end so having to wait so long for a solution was ridiculous. I went to the Chili's next door to pass the time. There is also a Red Robin down the street but not as nice of a walk. I was here for a business trip so I'm typically not as picky in these situations. This Double Tree is enough to get by for reason of my stay. It's not a hotel when taking a vacation, but hey... Who's vacationing in Detroit lately anyways?The restaurant at the hotel, Grille 39 is a nice little spot. Spacious and good for large parties. I went here each of the 5 days I was at the Double Tree. The food is good (slightly pricy), and the service is slow. I'd hate to also deduct stars for their service at Grille 39 because the bartenders/waitresses (Pam and Bobbie) were really nice. But hey.. It is what it is. Hire more staff! I can see how they have a hard time being a bartender and waitress for the dining area, especially when it gets really busy on days with conventions in town.Clean...and love their warm cookies:):) Got the free breakfast package which was a big mistake, it was terrible, especially if you don't eat pork there wasn't a lot of other options. I did not like the hike it was from the front entrance to the elevator.what a change...I was here in 2012 and I loved it.Couple years later, it appears poorly cared for.The swimming area was disgusting (partly due to the decline of western civilization and the fact people carry themselves like ANIMALS..); dirty towels all over the chairs, floor.  No clean towels available (went to swim an hour before closing).  Hire a security guard (i never saw one), too much ghetto riff raff wandering the halls, taunting women, etc.. Counter staff were very friendly but this place is on the verge of being run down/dirty.  Actual room is pretty nice, city, etc is pretty close.  Hopefully they make some changes, I'd like to return again, maybe in 2 years it will be really great again.... maybe.They're doing a renovation currently so it's all very messy. checking in was a bit of a wait but they def redeemed themselves throughout the week I stayed here. Great customer service from the ladies up front. I'm sure the place is going to look great!I've been here for 4 weeks now and have 4 more to go so I've had more than enough opportunity to evaluate the hotel and staff. They have been wonderful during my stay!  The staff is friendly and very polite. The restaurant has great food.  They have fantastic cookies you can get at the front desk whenever you want!  Plenty of parking and it requires a room key to get into the lot.My flight arrived early, so I headed to the DoubleTree to see if I could check-in early. When I first pulled up to this huge hotel, I was a bit skeptical because it's not a big shiny new hotel.  I didn't expect much more out of Dearborn, so I ignored my hesitation and went inside to be greeted by welcoming staff and a nice waterfall in the lobby area.  The girls at the front desk were extremely polite and accomodating.  They gave me an access code for free wireless internet because I'm a Silver HHonors member :) I also received breakfast coupons! They even came out from behind the desk to personally hand me my room keys and make sure I knew my way around the property. Sweet!They told me to park around the back of the building and enter through door 4.  The doors are numbered and accessible by key only.  I headed to the elevators, which also require you to swipe your key to go to a higher floor.  Though my room isn't the largest, it's more than cozy.  They brought a refrigerator and microwave up for $20 for the week, which I didn't mind because the rates are very good for a DoubleTree.  The bed is SUPER comfy and the furniture is very new.  Though the building isn't the newest, the hospitality and amenities at this hotel make up for it.  Everyone at this hotel is extremely polite and the property is very well maintained.  Great hotel for the price, and they ensure your safety while you're staying in Detroit/Dearborn.  Kudos!My a accommodation were awesome breakfast fantastic.  Wait staff phenomenal.  Remembers me and makes me filling family away from home  Made to order omelette would be icing on the cake.    Housekeeping awesome fulfills my room request and always makes me smile with a great clean room Would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for the bar!!   Bar staff very unfriendly nothing like other staff.   Not attentive and charge me for a drink I did not even like !!    Left full drink walk away disgusted.Not impressed.  We've stayed here before, and it was nice.  It seems a bit rough around the edges now.  The clerk at the front desk seemed extremely put out by my check in through Hotwire....she could not find the reservation, and asked me repeatedly if I was sure  it was that Doubletree!  Finally she found it.  I don't know where, nor do I care.  We were tired and just needed some sleep.  However her attitude was less than welcoming.  She knew there were 2 of us, yet she scoffed at handing us 2 cookies.....hey the cookies were the only perk of the stay!  When we got to the room the bathroom floor, toilet, and tub had long dark hair sticking to each surface....Gross!  Thats why I carry Clorox Spray Bleach with me when I travel!  You laugh, but it's out of necessity!  My boyfriend left the room at approximately 6:30 a.m. to go to work, and at approx. 8 a.m. the door opens and the woman walks in and says  'Housekeeping'.....Seriously?  There was no knock, no prior announcement of housekeeping....she just walked in!  Scared the daylights out of me....I left soon after even though all I wanted to do was rest. I would most definitely NOT recommend staying here.  Save your money, and go someplace cleaner, with better service, and without the staff barging in your room at 8 am unannounced! Plus this place has the nerve to charge for parking!  They're NOT DOWNTOWN so that situation is a bit overkill!The staff was super friendly, they gave us our delicious cookie! The lobby was really cool with a neat bridge and waterfalls....it seems a bit outdated and old....there was some super lame chess tournament going on, so all of the boardrooms were messy and filled with random people, gross garbage and take out food containers left thrown around on the floor, a bit dirty and not as clean as it could be. The room itself is nice and clean, a great size, the bed super comfortable. The gym was nice and big, the pool area definitely a let down, the pool is tiny, but there are two hot tubs! There were dirty towels left strewn about all over the place, and there weren't any clean towels left, so that's a bit disappointing. The pool is open until 12 am though, so that's always a nice perk! Free wifi and free parking too. There were a lot of annoying kids/teenagers/young adults running around, roaming the hallways, they would harass you if you were walking around - I was trying to find a vending machine and had to encounter two separate groups of people in my travels....most of the time people just want to be left alone at 3 am....When I return to Detroit, I would stay somewhere else just to try something different.After a terrible experience with the people at customer service and on the one 800 number line, Josh, the evening supervisor went out of his way to make sure that we were comfortable. We didn't get a discount or anything but he was pretty much at our beck and call if we needed anything and it was very appreciated after the hour and a half of hell I had gone through with the people in customer service. If you ever have a problem ask for Josh! Great guy and great employee!This place used to be something else, some other hotel chain.  Even though the staff vehemently denied this the 47 times I brought it up during my recent stay, they are wrong.  Embassy Suites?  I suspect so...The rooms are adequate.  Not palatial, not closet-like.  Adequate.  Bed, TV, Bathroom, Closet, Iron, Ironing Board, Coffee maker.  Yep, they have all the bases covered.  That last one becomes important, because in a strange new trend, this place doesn't have the endless coffee pot sitting out in the lobby, free for the taking day and night.  No, if you want coffee in the morning, you have to have breakfast!  Or make coffee in your room.  I found myself bribing the wait staff with my Breakfast Vouchers just for a cup of coffee in the morning.The lobby seems really busy, not exactly a relaxing place to hang out.  Since I never hang out in hotel lobbies, though, this wasn't a big deal.  If you are the type that likes to check into the room, go down to the lobby and grab a cup of coffee while you lounge, well bubba, I've got some bad news for ya....If you use a GPS to get here, you might want to keep the driver's side window of your car rolled down so that after you circle the hotel for the 4th time, you can toss your GPS out the window and navigate to the front door old school style.  The address is Southfield Freeway, but I think that is just to fool the cops.  Just get close then use your eyeballs to figure out how to get to the parking lot.So yes, this is a Doubletree Hotel, very much like most of the other Doubletree Hotels I've stayed in over the last decade or so...although the piped in music that is played in the lobby and all over the common areas of the hotel is different....sort of a cross between Light Jazz and the Soundtrack to a Porn Movie.   You know, the type of music that includes some loopy sounding flute runs and wah wah guitar noises.  Listen closely and you can hear the platform shoes the musicians were wearing when they recorded these tracks.  Wouldn't it be cool if this was a Pandora station (Dearborn Doubletree Pornjazz)?If you have business in Dearborn, stay here.  It is close to everything that you need and far enough away from the stuff that you don't.
review_content_20: We had a suite, and the beds were very comfortable, and the room was huge.  A friend used the pull-out bed and said she had no trouble sleeping there.It is not the most modern of hotels, but we had a nice TV.  The one downer was that I couldn't figure out how to turn on the bubbles in our jacuzzi tub.  Was it my problem or was it broken?  No idea.The staff is extremely accommodating at all times.  It was a pleasure to stay here again.This Doubletree was...adequate for a night's stay. Our reservations at the more upscale Marriott got changed, and this place was available and cheaper. Close to the Henry Ford Museum, and right on the Southfield Freeway, it puts you fairly central in Detroit.There's not much to this hotel. The lobby area is plain and minimal. The bar small, and closes at 11pm. I think dinner was not available, or the restaurant was going through renovations, or something when we were there. Breakfast menu looked good, though.Got a room with two double beds and those were not double beds. More like twin beds! The storekeep was sweet, and they had a lot of snacks, vitamin waters, red bulls, and Detroit Baby t-shirts. I would stay here again if we got bumped from the Marriott (again) and needed something quick.Had an event at this hotel. They were very helpful and backed up everything they said they would deliver. Comfy rooms. Reasonable prices.I've stayed in the Dearborn/Detroit area weekly for over a year now and have long-ago chosen the DoubleTree as my go-to hotel.  The spacious gorgeous lobby and vintage automotive/Ford decor in the hallways are way-cool and the beds are reliably comfortable.  If you find the duvet too warm, ask for a non-feather blanket as a less-hot alternative.  Some room-views are better than others so I prefer views to the west.  The bathrooms are really nice with huge countertops to spread-out your stuff, luxurious shower heads, and plush towels.  The computer desks/tables are large, at a lower level for comfort, and have good wireless service.  The chairs are cloth and comfortable, but since I find them slightly low, I throw a pillow on them for a slight boost.  The workout room, pool, and two hot tubs are all excellent and immaculate.  Self-parking is a breeze.  There is lots of it, all patrolled by contract-security 24x7, with numerous entrances.  I recommend driving all the way around to the northwest corner lot where only the most-regulars park and the walk is minimal.  I confess I only eat breakfast in the hotel, and the buffet is fantastic, but with so many great restaurants nearby, I prefer to get out for dinner.  My favorites are Big Fish, Bravo, Andiamo's, and Crave, but there are many others in the Fairlane Mall area or in downtown Dearborn between Andiamo's and Crave.  Exploring them is the best part of travelling for business!    In summary, as a road warrior I can tell you without a doubt, that the best feature of this hotel is the staff.  From the front desk to house keeping to the waitresses/bartenders to the maintenance techs, everyone I have ever encountered at this DoubleTree is pleasant beyond compare and efficient at what they do.  They make this place an exceedingly delightful place to stay.  This is THE hotel for your stay whether it's for a night or a year.  And I haven't even mentioned the fantastic chocolate chip walnut cookie that awaits you every time at check-in.  They are also THE best!I checked into this place on a miserable rainy Detroit afternoon.  This property has a very spacious lobby with a cascading fountain.  The sound of water is very soothing.  It's so big that it's not easy to find your way to the back elevator.  Even when on your floor, you could easily lose your way if you don't watch it.  The one thing I want to talk about is the DT bed.  When I crashed that first night, I was lying in bed, too tired to get to sleep immediately.  It must have been over an hour, but the bed and pillow were so comfortable that I did not even move once.  That is pretty remarkable.My room, reserved just last week, was $149, pretty decent value, but the room is not nearly as comfortable as the one in Ohio.  They have a nice pool and a well-equipped workout room with a water dispenser.  HATE workout places at half-assed "fancy" hotels that force you to drink tap.  Oh how spoiled we North Americans are!!.Ok, to start off, I just want to make clear that this review is from the perspective of an event rather than a traveller.  Although we did certainly stay in the hotel (and enjoy the rooms), it wasn't really our focus.My husband Scott and I got married at this hotel on May 30, 2010.  Our wedding was on a Sunday and it was a brunch wedding with the ceremony at 11am and the reception at 1pm.  We did the ceremony in the lobby and then moved to the banquet halls for the reception.  We had absolutely wonderful help from Nicole Nation and Lauren Rodriguez, the two event managers, and were not bothered with a single problem on the day of the event, so that was absolutely fantastic.  I guess I'll try to break it all down - this may be a long review.We had our rehearsal dinner the night before.  There was another event going on at the time at the hotel, but it wasn't a problem (for either of us, I hope).  We were given a hospitality suite for the duration of the weekend and the lobby was set up for the ceremony when we arrived at 3pm the day before, which was really nice.  When I mentioned the rehearsal dinner, they gave us another banquet room for that as well (no cost) and we had a laid back pizza and salad rehearsal for around 60 people.  The pizza, salad and soda came to about $300 total - at $5 a person, I am not complaining!  They have a nice bar in the hotel, so people could just walk over and buy their own drinks, which they did.  The next day I heard that Lauren and the banquet staff were awesome at helping to set up the reception, and we ended up having a bunch of extra flowers so they pulled a bunch of vases out of their storage and added more beauty to it all.  Of course, I didn't know any of that at the time.  I had the great pleasure of being able to just get ready for the wedding, blissfully unaware of anything downstairs.The ceremony was fine - the only minor glitch of the day is that they were supposed to turn down the waterfall in the lobby (it's *loud*!) and that didn't get down, but once someone ran over and asked them to do it, they did.  (PS, since there were no pictures, I put one up of the waterfall - the lobby really is very nice).  As far as the hotel goes, the reception was good.  Lauren was there the whole time, so when there was a moment of confusion over how long we had the room for, she was able to clear it up right away.  The bar did stay open an hour longer than it was supposed to, but it didn't end up making much of a difference.  While we went and got pictures taken, our guests had access to coffee, juice and tea and also a large variety of fruit, cheese and crackers.  We went with their champagne brunch buffet with mimosas instead of champagne.  I was a little anxious about it because we never tasted *anything* ahead of time, but oh my gosh - it ended being a huge hit.  There was an omelette bar that people loved, and all of the food was really really good.  I had people complimenting me days afterward, so that was really great.  We ended up having about 120 people there, and our total bill was  $6800, including the rehearsal dinner.  For a wedding, that is more than reasonable.  The room rates were nice too - we had a block at $89.95 a night for our guests.  Overall, I'm very happy we chose the Doubletree Dearborn to get married in.  The lobby is beautiful with huge ceilings and skylights and the waterfall, meandering stream and live trees around it.  My guests all had a good time, and the food was wonderful.  Thank you, Doubletree, for helping make our wedding day such a success!!I travel frequently for work and have stayed at this property in the past with no problem. During my last stay in April 2014,  I woke up in the middle of the night covered in itchy welts. I soon discovered that my room was infested with bedbugs. I requested to be switched rooms which the staff was more than willing to do but the damage had already been done. I was incredibly itchy and too scared to get back into bed. Needless to say I had a sleepless night. As goodwill gesture, I was promised 10,000 Hilton points which I have yet to receive. I have contacted their customer service and have heard nothing back. I am highly disappointed and I will never stay at this property again.Dropped by to say hi to a friend for a few hours, have a drink, and put my feet up - the hotel has pretty spacious rooms, and seems nice enough! But we got a knock on our door saying that we were being too loud, and still had our room service to eat. What a dilemma!I have been staying at this hotel during the week for the last 8 months on business and my experience has been great. There is free wifi and breakfast for Hilton loyalty members, and the hotel restaurant is great. There is even a few walkable food places nearby which is very convenient.The lobby has high ceilings and a fountain with a great seating area. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, and there are refrigerators and microwaves available upon request. Overall I thought the hotel was very clean and homey. There are a lot of great things about this hotel but the best feature: the staff. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful, and will go out of there way to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The breakfast staff is incredibly friendly, and the manager Charles is awesome. He takes time to listen to the guests compliments/complaints/suggestions, which really makes the hotel a success. Definitely recommend it!Area is not the greatest but it's a good rate for what you get, but be warned... the hotel  has several flaws:  1) Usually one person working the front desk so it can't take a while... my last trip had faulty room keys... long walk back to front desk with luggage and had to wait for three people before I could get re-keyed.   2) The workout areas has missing weights and all the attachments to the multi-purpose machine have vanished, presumably stolen   3) The elevators are slow and out of service ... it can take a while.   Room is okay... nothing special...If I would've known that this hotel on Yelp had no pictures, I would have definitely taken some during my stay this week. Sadly I was only in town for a few meetings and a 24-hour trip. I've always been a fan of Doubletree Hotels and not just because of that yummy warm cookie you get when you check in. (Whoever thought that up is brilliant!) I find Hilton Hotels to be consistent, clean, good service and reliable...plus nicely decorated etc. This hotel is big- huge lobby- a bit open like an Embassy Suites, but really beautiful. The staff at the front desk was exceptionally friendly, the woman stepped out from behind the counter to come around, give me my room key and point me in the right direction to my room. My room was outrageously clean. I say outrageous because, I travel a lot. And I expect cleanliness but sadly, I find some chains forget to clean. So I find myself Looking around first to see if I feel like I'm in a clean room. You know, you can be in a "poshly decorated room" and it can be dirty and ruin everything. This hotel is spotless. Spotless. The beds are TO DIE FOR. I actually slept in past 6am because of the comfort. The desk has 2 electrical outlets in the lamp plus 2 to the side- so plenty of plug-ins for chargers. Frankly, there could be more, if you think about it. Hotels should do this; we have bluetooths to charge, laptops to plug in, smart-phones to charge and more. Give us PLUGS!! ;-)Room service was prompt and very courteous. They even added 2 after-dinner mints to the experience, nice touch. I will always stay at this hotel in Dearborn. Great location- you can walk to a Chili's restaurant or Wendy's from the parking lot- plus it's quiet and they have a security truck roaming the parking lots all the time. (I noted this when I went for a walk.) Awesome.my reason for giving it a one star:they put dirty towels that we had put on the floor back with the clean towels... we had put them there because they were dirty to begin with... that was highly disappointing...  horrible room service!!! even the hotel was comfortable enough, i was very under-impressed by the service.As some previous reviewers pointed out, the hotel is in a neighborhood that's pretty sketchy. However, to stay at a Doubletree for $129 for room and breakfast buffet for 2 and free parking is a great deal. The hotel is about 15 minutes from downtown on the outskirts of Detroit and spitting distance from Dearborn. Our room was nice and clean, the bed very comfortable, and we had a small sofa as well. When you check in, you get a warm chocolate chip cookie for each guest. Absolute bliss!!! In my opinion, this is probably one of the best deals out there. I got my honors points and airline miles for my stay as well. Doubletree is affiliated with Hilton hotels and you can use points to stay here.When I was pulling into the parking lot I knew it could be a problem. Behind a Chili's and a lame sports bar, sits this hotel. Upon entering the lobby, I was impressed, it is spacious and first impression is the hotel will be nice. After checking in, it is a long walk to the elevators past the conference rooms and my room was about a 4 minute walk from the front desk. The room wasn't bad, but the TV was an old tube TV from the 90's and it made me think how I've come to expect a nice flat screen with a responsive remote. The fan on the air unit was whiny and loud and every time it came on in the night, it woke me up. I had to put my White Noise on my phone to drown out that sound. I will be looking for another hotel next time in that area.Comfortable beds. Decent security. However, my towels had not been changed for I don't know how long. A huge chunk of hair fell out when I removed the washcloth. Gross!! There are numerous floor plans so you have to make sure that you ask for one of the nicer ones. Don't think about dining I the restaurant for dinner. Service is nonexistence and the food is comparable to a low end hospital cafeteria.  The breakfast buffet service is friendly... If you place an order expect to wait a few.  Speediness is not their top priority, but the morning staff is very friendly.  Not a Four Seasons but you get what you pay for I guess.Staff was extremely pleasant and professional, from reception to the bar.  The hotel, however, is pretty dated, and my room was not a winner.There were two filthy hand towels dried on the shower rod that I didn't notice until morning when I went to shower, and it was a 5 minute walk just to get to my room from the front desk/restaurant.The hotel borders a pretty sketchy neighborhood, which is somewhat mitigated by the constantly circling security vehicle and a wall with barbed wire facing the side street, but not a place to go jogging at night.Again, the staff was great, but the hotel was just adequate.While the facility is somewhat dated, we enjoyed our stay there.  The neighborhood (especially to the North) is somewhat disturbing, but fear not, as the security cars and barbed wire keep the parking lot safe.  The cookies on check in at least let us forget about the security while we parked, though.

review_content: Great hotel!!!! Perfect downtown location. The people mover is in the hotel and makes moving around downtown so easy. Mike checked us in faster then when I use the Marriott app. Beautiful room with a fantastic view of the Ren Center and the Detroit River. The room, common areas and lobby were very clean and well kept. The only down side was an over zealous security guard who found it necessary to have my wife bring our room key down to the lobby in her pj's. I left the key in our room since she was there and I went to the lobby to get our pizza. Thankfully the staff at the front desk gave me another key, after I showed them my id and my wife didn't have to come down to satisfy the private security guard's need to be a total pain in the ass. Fantastic hotel, don't let the security guard ruin your time.I stay at a lot of Courtyards and love, love, LOVE their newer properties.  This is not one of those.  Which is to be expected as it is Downtown D-town.  But, it is in serious need of renovation.  The signs in the hotel say that this renovation is imminent, but I see no sign of it having started.  Get on it, peeps!I've stayed at this location twice.  The first time I got an automatic upgrade as a Gold member but the second time they must have been full as I just got a regular room.  The upgraded room was huge with a living area and minifridge - probably over twice the size of a regular room.  But, still very disco in furnishings and a lot of bare space.  Basically same amount of furniture from a normal room (plus a couch) but spread over a much larger area.  Ugly ass blue carpet.  Bed was comfortable though.The second time, same floor but regular room.  Still ugly ass blue carpet and comfortable bed, but even though I had upgraded internet service, I could not get an internet connection at all during my whole stay.  I come for business so this is a big problem for me.  So I decide since I can't work to try to watch a little telly... and I note that they have probably *half* the channels that are offered at my usual RenCen Marriott across the street.  That's freaking cheap, folks.  I just want my HGTV, travel channel, food network...not asking for HBO or anything fancy.  But nope.  TV selection is spartan and mostly sports (blech) and news (depressing).The only reason I'm giving them 3 stars instead of 2 is I think the mattresses here are more comfy than at the RenCen.  But really I don't want to stay here again if I can get a room across the street.The hotel is a great option for staying downtown! We got a room for a bachelorette party in lieu of staying at one of the pricier casinos. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Our room had a nice view as well.The location is really really nice, we were able to walk to & from the greektown area on a Saturday night without any problem. The people mover is right there too, but honestly unless the weather is bad - just walk.Very nice and friendly staff at check in. Disappointing to see the forced wrist bands, but definitely understand the need during Movement. I thought it was a bit extreme to have a policy where you could not get a new wristband at all. What if it's your name on the room? Anyways...Low markings for this hotel due to the exceptionally dirty room at check in. * Grease stains on the headboard from someone's head. Wiped this down.* Dusty couch on the top of backboard up against the wall. I wiped this down with a wet cloth--world of difference.All in all, overpriced for what it is.There are some great things about this hotel. Let me start by saying the room is beautiful and spacious and you'd think you're in a full-service Marriott. The sheets and pillows are excellent. The view of the water was wonderful. The sofa and ottoman very stylish! I was here for four nights on business so this is a good start. But as we head into the spacious bathroom with lots of counter space...the towels are so thin I wouldn't wash my car with them...the toilet seat is WAY smaller than the toilet base, so essentially you're partially sitting on the toilet seat and partially on the rim of the base. Very uncomfortable....and,I found the blow dryer in the closet but it is the kind that one half of it should be screwed into the bathroom wall and then you pull the other half off to blow dry your hair. Instead the whole thing was in the closet!... The Internet worked, but even though I signed up for four days, it asked you every day to re-sign up. And it said it was good for up to six devices but it asked each of my devices to sign up all over again. Very inconvenient...Lastly, the TV was mostly static on all channels. After I complained about all these issues to the front desk, I got thicker towels, which were nice.  Disappointing they didn't care to fix the rest. As a Gold Marriott member, I try to stick with Marriott, but I think they have a lot of improvement to make on this hotel. It's very conveniently located if you have business at the convention center, and the people mover is practically at your door.I've stayed in a lot of  Courtyards for work, and this one is one of the nicest. It's definitely larger and the inside has more amenities. There is a full bar and restaurant in lieu of of the usual mini bistro. Sadly there isn't the usual Starbucks station. The Renaissance Marriott and GM Center are across the street and connected by tunnel for easy (warm) access. That hotel is so integrated into the larger GM complex I prefer the Courtyard. The Courtyard has much less foot traffic, is a bit cheaper, and includes free wifi. It also is as close to Greektown and the Cobo center as the Renaissance.Clean hotel. That's usually my number one criteria when searching for hotels, next to location. This hotel is within a couple blocks of all the action and it has the People Mover which is 75 cents and helps you avoid walking the streets of downtown Detroit, for the most part. However, we had an issue with our air conditioner that was never fully resolved and two guests in our group was sick after eating the risotto dish at the restaurant inside. I think the hotel is overpriced. I think all of the hotels in downtown Detroit are overpriced. There's more casinos, restaurants, more fun and better weather in Vegas and it doesn't cost as much to stay in a hotel as it does in Detroit.Just checked in and I'm loving it already. FIVE STAR SERVICE from the moment I got out of the car. I felt like a big shot visiting my hometown. What a way to come home!I stayed here overall three weeks in late March and most of April. 2014. This is the time of the year it might be hot or cold outside. Room- The rooms were pretty good, comfortable, good views when I had a room overlooking detroit river, fair when I had views of the back alley and street. Environment - Heating and air seems to be an issue during this time of year. If it is warm outside and they have not switched off the heat, you get no cool air. Even it is cold outside and you are hot, hopefully you can open your window.Breakfast - got the breakfast option with my room since I am traveling to cut down on expenses. They have a good breakfast and friendly waitstaff.Dinner - ehhh not so much. I wasn't impressed. Anything with the word Cajun in it seems to be doused with salt.Convenience - absolutely. You go up a few floors and grab the one-way people mover. There is a c-store right outside the hotel but still indoors that will sell you people mover tokens. People mover will take you to Joe Louis arena, Greektown, and I'm sure many other interesting places.My room was 74 degrees all night and it's  summer I found a dirty thong which I brought to the front desk and found a cockroach in the shower Needless to say never againThis is our second stay. Comfortable, clean, consistant and up to date. Valet parking available, skywalk to Ren Cen, People mover in nearby.  Really nice indoor pool, rec center, bar and restaurant in the lobby.  Breakfast and parking packages available with booking rooms. The breakfast is pretty good for the price, but service is lacking.  Best thing about this place - I love the showers.  Can't beat a great shower with unlimited hot water.  Just wish there was an exhaust fan too.  Room can get steamy but the nice AC unit fixed that pretty quick.Overall, a good alternative to the Marriott at the Ren Cen and conveniently located if you're doing business in the RenCen, you can walk across the street to it in a covered tunnel and are never exposed to the elements. Room was pleasant, bed was comfy and got a good night's sleep.Stayed here for the Detroit Marathon in October.  It was convenient to the start/finish line, and they had a special marathon rate.  The parking is additional - $20 per night, but the room was clean and roomy.  We got a king room and it also had a sofa/sitting area.  Free wi-fi.  I'm picky about the bathroom and it was nice - granite and clean grout in the bath/shower (it really bothers me when the grout is not well-kept).
