The towels were on the thin side and I could hear the neighbors - thus, the loss of one star in the rating.  But it did have indoor access to the People Mover, a monorail system that is 75 cents to access places like Greek Town if you don't want to walk it.  The desk personnel were also friendly and helpful.  Would stay again.Honestly, the hotel is nice and the last time I stayed there everything went smoothly. However, this past weekend, there was an incident that makes me think otherwise about a repeat stay. When we went to valet, the valet said just leave the keys in the car and they will take care of it, because they were a bit backed up. Fine, no problem there. Fast forward to the next day when we go to retrieve our car from valet, and they ask for our ticket. We said they never provided us with one. They said we needed to speak to the front desk; enter Ash. Ash was very unhelpful, and borderline rude! He kept asking for the plate number (which sorry we didn't memorize), and was like "oh well". We were like we aren't leaving without our car, so he said go look at the keys and see if you recognize them, which we didn't until we looked at this other area and saw the keys there. We asked what those keys over there are, and Ash said it's for unassigned cars. Well what the hell have we been saying for the past 20 minutes. Ash should take a course on customer service and try and be a problem-solver, not problem maker.Yes, this is "just" a courtyard hotel, but you wouldn't know it by the amenities. The beds were comfortable (though the pillows left something to be desired.) We were especially happy that the hotel had a grocery store in the lobby. Being connected via indoor passages to both the people mover and Ren Cen were also nice touches.One of my favorite things to do at most any hotel is to check out the hot tub. This one didn't disappoint. In fact, the entire fitness center was quite nice with ample equipment, separate mens and women's saunas and both a massive indoor pool and a good sized hot tub. Nice bonus, you get a view of ren cen from just outside of the pool room.We also checked out the breakfast buffet. It's pretty good and has a good selection of breakfast food and a made to order egg/omelet station.The best free perk though has to be the WiFi. Not only is it completely free, but it's also fast. Increasingly a luxury in hotels that I visit.This hotel has terrible customer service. I pulled up to the front door and asked about parking. The valet driver stated there were 2 options, to valet park or just park around the corner and walk the skyway to the hotel. I chose to self-park. BAD IDEA! The ramp was huge and I could not find the skyway. I ended up having to walk outside in the bitter cold using my iphone to find my way back to the hotel. I asked about parking at check-in and the receptionist informed me that if you park in the ramp it is $15 EVERY time you come and go! Valet parking is $23 but you can come and go at no extra cost. I explained that nobody had explained this to me and she directed me back to the ramp to move my car. I had to run back to the ramp in the hopes to make the 15 min cutoff(for $2 charge). I missed it, paid $4 to leave the ramp and on top of it had to pay the FULL $23 for valet parking. The receptionist informed me I would be welcome to walk back over to the ramp and talk to the people at the window about getting my $4 back, but there was nothing she could do to help me. Absolutely ridiculous given I specifically asked about parking and was given bad information! On top of that, it took me over 30 minutes to check in given this whole fiasco. I would have at least expected $4 off the cost of my valet.Overall nice hotel.  Great location. People mover on fifth floor. Nice pool with handicap lift.  They could however do some things to improve it.  The in room coffee was pathetic. Only enough coffee for one cup of regular coffee. Also the restaurant service at dinner was very poor. We had to walk up to the bartender to get our drinks refilled and it took almost 25 minutes to get our nacho appetizer. It was not busy at all. For a cost of 240 dollars which yes did include parking and breakfast but I would think they could include some features such as an upgraded coffee maker and better service in the restaurant.I can see Canada from my hotel room!!!This is my go to hotel in Detroit.  I love this place.  Great location ( for me ) and I've always had great service when I've been here.  The restaurant here is even great as well.  Front desk people have always been friendly and very accommodating.  My only complaint, is the wifi is pretty shady.  It drops out here and there.First off lets start by saying why this Courtyard is a 4 star instead of a 3. There is a a glass enclosed room on the 8th floor overlooking the GM Renaissance Center, riverfront, and Windsor, Ontario. Oh and did I mention there was a heated pool and hot tub in this room? Yes going to that every night after doing tours of the city in 30 degree weather was rather relaxing. Other than that the rooms are standard, service is friendly, mediocre-good breakfast buffet depending on your taste, downstairs restaurant was a tad cold....Another plus is this hotel is connected to the people mover(mono-rail) & GM Rencen leaving you little reason to go outside.This hotel is close to the border and Greek Town plus local to several casinos for entertainment.  Once you leave Jefferson Street however, be prepared for homeless people begging for money, sleeping on the sidewalks and run down graffitti filled buildings.  The hotel itself made you feel safe as there were sky walks to the General Motors building across the street with a pretty large food court, a few shops and a CVS.  You can also access the People Mover from one of the sky walks in the hotel.  The rooms are big and the fitness facility is probably one of the best I have ever seen in a hotel.  The restaurant was also reasonable priced for hotel food.  The maid service needs work.  My shower had hair on the walls and when I came back the next day after my meeting, there were black shoe prints all over the floor and something brown all over the ceiling.
review_content_20: Came here for one night only for my Giants who were playing in Comerica that night.  Location wise, it was very close walking distance to the park and to the nearby water where one can see the MGM Grand across the way.  Across the street in the Marriott Renaissance, they have a Starbucks and a food court with McDonalds and Subway.  Inside the hotel, it was pretty well laid out with the business center located near the convenience store.  I used my card key to get in to print out maps and driving directions.  Of course, I thought I could sneak a Facebook login to check my virtual restaurant...denied!  Seems like they filter out certain websites...Checkout wasn't a problem although I noticed that after the valet brought back our rental car, there were some scratches on the back left bumper?  Since we were in a rush, I never made a big stink about it and left.  The hotel and location is nice but probably will find somewhere else closer to the park to stay.Our nonprofit organization was extremely happy with the formal luncheon for 100 students and professionals that we hosted at the Courtyard Marriott Detroit Downtown. We had a number of guests in attendance who were deaf, and the event Manager Nico made sure that we incurred no additional cost for accommodations such as an extra projector screen (to display text of the speeches being made). We were also awarding an honoree who was in a wheelchair, and Nico went out of his way to secure a ramp to attach to the stage so he could come up to receive the award. Nico and the catering manager Nona both went above and beyond to make our event run smoothly. I would highly recommend this venue and their kind and helpful staff!It's downtown Detroit and an ok place to stay. Staff is enormously friendly and helpful but otherwise it's a no frills standard room that is decent and fairly clean. The property is showing some age from its last renovation. Convenient to the people mover and a inside walk to the Ren Center make this ideal for getting supplies at one of the small shoppes or CVS.Ok, this place wasn't bad.  The rooms were large, but not particularly well laid-out.  When I checked in on 6/6 the ice bucket in my room was still full of the melted ice of the previous occupant.  Otherwise, it was clean and quiet.The little hotel shop for snacks and incidentals was out of a staple - toothpaste - and, I'm guessing had been for a while, as it was on the price list, but all the pegs in the display case were filled with other things.Desk service was efficient if not friendly.  When I checked in, the person at the front desk might have said two words to me total.The FUNNIEST thing (and you HAVE to pay attention to this if you stay here) are the recorded female voices in the elevators.  OMG.  What is with this overtly sexy, sultry voice for announcing floors?  Especially funny is the way she says "floor" . . . you halfway expect a lap dance with the experience.  Hilarious (so much so that I did a voice recording of it and plan to post it on facebook later today).  I actually laughed out loud every time I rode the elevators!A bit pricey for a Courtyard.BTW, this is nothing about the hotel - but about Detroit . . . what the hell is it about taxis there - what horrible transportation hell is this?  Wow.  If you're traveling here, add an extra 30 - 40 minutes to every trip you need a taxi for - because even if you call and request one, and even if they call and say it is right outside - it probably isn't.Pretty nice hotel in the middle of downtown.  Rooms are large and spacious and bed is super comfortable.  And really nice views of the downtown area and riverfront.Very nice hotel. I was a bit bummed when my company book me here rather than the  Renaissance across the street, but this place is pretty nice for a courtyard. I got one of the biggest hotel rooms i've ever stayed in, and I'm a Marriott Platinum elite. So I stay in a lot of Marriott's! Anyway the gym at this place is also the best hotel gym I've been in also which helped since the April weather in Detroit was pretty crappy for a run. The food at the restaurant was ok, if you got other options I'd not eat there. The hotel also connects to the people mover and  a bridge connects to the Renaissance Center. So you can avoid the crappy Detroit weather pretty easy.Though not as "ritz-y" as the Marriott at RenCen the staff more than make up for any nits or chips in the armor. From check in to check out to the Cafe, the staff is friendly and really makes you feel at home. I cannot remember staying in a Marriott that made me feel more welcome. The only nit is that the internet was very sporatic and lost connection ALL the time.Could have just been my room was in a bad location, but enough of an irritant to deduct one star.Highly recommended if not for the fact that you will come away feeling like your patronage was truly appreciated.** If the management is reading, Shout out to Tanya as she was my first point of contact and she gave me a very warm welcome which set the tone for the whole stay.Convenient downtown location.  It's across from GM, the Windsor tunnel, and Riverwalk.  You also get free wired internet.  We got a standard double. The room appeared clean but it was uncomfortably hot.  It was in the 40s outside but our room felt like 85 degrees.  Why not turn on the AC?  Well, we tried.  The theromstat was set at 60 but it definitely did not feel like 60.  We also couldn't adjust the theromostat to go any lower either.  Long story short, we complained to the front desk and only got a measly "sorry."  I have 2 basic requirements for any hotel stay: (1) must be clean; (2) must be comfortable.  The heat just made it unbearable to sleep at night and getting ready in the morning was awful.  Especially when I have to blow-dry my hair.  I felt like I was in a sauna!  After this experience, if I need to stay in downtown Detroit again, I will avoid this hotel.I stayed here for about 6 months every week M-F while working in Detroit.  The staff is excellent from the bellhops to the front desk.  Well, one time I had this one lady at 2am or so who was kind of a bitch.  But other than that, all the others were very nice.Since I was there so long, eventually all the staff knew me and would already have my reservation pulled up for me by the time I was at the front desk.  When I got drinks or food from the store, they would wave me through and either remember which room I was in, or just look it up themselves.  I guess you expect this kind of service anywhere you go, but let's be honest, not every hotel does it well.  Even though the trips were business, I would stay there if I ever go to Detroit for pleasure...I've stayed here every time I've been here--easily  6 times in the last 18 months. Yeah it's a bit pricey but the amenities are great in every way. The in-house restaurant is good, the breakfasts are huge both in price and quantity but also high quality. Rooms are sparkling clean, beds have this memory foam that make these probably the best next to my own bed at home.It's conveniently located across from Windsor Canada if you want to enjoy Canada a bit. It's very near on the riverfront, within easy walking distance. It has complimentary Internet which the more expensive Marriott across the street does not have.The rooms are quiet, the AC doesn't blow on you like so many other hotels seem to. In room fridge is whisper quiet. There's a safe if you need it. Even the desk is set up for Internet and a business function. They have recently provided more comfortable desk chairs to make this even nicer. Right next to the front desk they have a nicely stocked and reasonably priced convenience store with everything from dinners to snacks and drinks etc.Their exercise rooms are neat and clean as well and offer a large assortment of treadmills, bikes, and step and elliptical machines as well as free weights, an aerobics room, pool, and a full gym of free & plated weights and targeted weight machines. They really have thought of pretty much everything.If you can afford $200+ per night, you will not be disappointed here.Great location, great customer service, free wifi.  This is my favorite place to stay in Detroit.Signed up for Yelp to leave this review. Drove in from St. Louis overnight and they let us check in as soon as we arrived at 7am. The room was AWESOME and had a great view. It was a little more expensive than some of the other choices I looked at but totally worth it.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express & Suites Detroit Downtown
review_content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn express while we were in town for a Lions game.  No issues checking in or checking out, Valet service had our vehicle ready within mins of calling for our car,  The hotel staff were friendly, service was good. Our room was clean, beds were comfortable and the hot breakfast was decent.   Based on my experience, I'd stay here again.Holiday Inn Express is located very central on Washington Ave in walking distance to all arenas-/attractions (if you like to walk around in Detroit during evening hours :) ). Just one block far away from the Detroit Mover.Hotel is offering Holiday Inn s standard amenities: well equipped gym, basic swimming pool on 17th floor and complimentary breakfeast with good quality.Reason why I have put three stars only? :  - my room was smelly - rooms have seen better times... refurbishment would be nice - valet parking chaoting and asking for 23$ (twenty-three!!) a night! Not to forget that we are NOT in Manhatten... - money paid compared to the value I got (almost 200$ for a single room-/night, maybe the SAE conference was the reason for such immense rate)Will try the Crowne Plaza-/Westin around the corner next time.All of the staff were very friendly during my 4 day stay.  It is a easy walk to Cabo Center and the Riverfront park.I just had the pleasure of speaking with a lovely woman who was chomping on food and slurping a drink directly into the phone while not helping me cancel my reservation. She also used an acronym (fourteen times) for which she didn't know what the letters stood for. Luckily I will not be staying here.If I was standing in front of that sales lady she would've melted as she looked into my gorgeous blue eyes, that's the sad thing about all of this.+Great locationSafeStandard, decent roomsAmazing view if you're lucky enough to be on the top (17th) floorGREAT free breakfast- we're talking bacon and eggs, people!-$20 for parking... seems steep when you're already paying for a roomValet-only, and the valet people aren't very organized or speedyWAY overpriced, considering it's an average chain hotel in DetroitOverall, nothing too special, but fine if it's in the location you need and you get a good deal.The positives: Location was great. One block from people mover.Hot breakfast with nice variety. Nice lobby/breakfast area. Quiet on high floors. Room was clean. Area felt safe. Nice view from room (15th floor)The negatives:Front desk Staff did not seem too professional or knowledgeable. Lots of noisy people (not the hotels fault)Faucet in tub pointed sideways...soaked the carpet out side bathroom Room smelled strange. As if it once was a smoking room. Didn't have safe to lock up valuablesBed was very low We were in town for the Grand Prix. The hotel served its purpose. Next time though would rather stay somewhere classier. Maybe Marriott at Renaissance Center.I went up here for the game @ Ford Field (Buffalo vs Jets) when the Bills got snowed out at home. The check in process is hectic. With limited space to park in front of the hotel and a valet service that is really understaffed. Check-in was quick and greeted as a Platinum member and upgraded to a suite. The room was huge! could have slept 10. Very clean and comfortable. Walking distance to most places downtown but the people mover is a block away which will take you anywhere downtown. 10 minute walk to Ford Field. Not bad for $140 a night. But I used 10K points.Horrible experience here. We paid $330/night because of the national baptist convention in town, and it was a disaster. Wifi was spotty, key cards didn't work, elevator was broken and the "business center" is just a computer and a printer in a dark corner of the lobby. Worst of all, my room had BED BUGS and I woke up with dozens of bites.Very bad experience. I stayed in room 518 of this hotel on Saturday, August 1st of this year. While the staff are friendly and the location is great, I am sad to report that they have BED BUGS. This hotel was a stop-over on a long drive to the East Coast. I woke up at about 3:30 a.m. to a slightly painful, itchy feeling on my feet. After turning on the light, and inspecting further I found bites on my feet and elbows. I also found a live bed bug up  near the headboard of the bed. My poor confused dog also had several bites on his little head. Once home, I did the research that I should have done prior to booking, only to discover that people have been complaining about bed bugs at this hotel since at least 2010. I also spoke with employees who told me that they have ended up bringing these bugs home with them.This hotel is in need of a seriously big overhaul, the rooms are out of date small and smelled heavily of weed. The showers take about a full 2 minutes to turn on and the noise is unbearable be prepared to wake up at 6 am when the train rolls by every morning.  The hotel staff other than Laquetta are terribly condescending and rude, the rates are outrageous with zero amenities.  This is a badge of embarrassment for the IHG chain.Just returning from our trip to Detroit.. Saw a Red wings game, went to Greek town Casino, had a Lafayette Coney (2 blocks away). Great weekend.. The Staff at here at the Holiday Inn were GREAT, all of them, Valet, Front desk, Housekeeping.. all.It's an Older Holiday Inn, Its Clean though.. just down the street from Detroit's "People Mover",... very fun restaurant/Bar ..  mixture of locals and tourists. I was a bit reserved about traveling and staying in Detroit.. NOT any more.. we walked, people moved etc across the city and had the BEST time. we will be back.Thanks Detroit,,,This place is horrible. I will never ever come back here again. My kids and I checked in at 3pm. We had asked for fresh towels up until 11:30 pm and never got any service. The beds were worn out, the room was freezing cold, and the front desk receptionist was not so pleasant.  The pool area is dull looking. Looks like a jail or an abandoned school swimming pool. I would not recommend this location to anyone!I was at first a little thrown off by the other clientele. Then I remembered it was Hoedown weekend. Holiday Inn forgiven. The front desk staff was very friendly and the room was clean. I was 'in town' for a wedding next door at the Book Cadillac.  The room was $75 cheaper than its neighbor hotel and was fine for our post wedding reception drunken sleep. As a resident of a northern suburb I got a good kick out of the 'what to see and do in Detroit' video. First of all, most of the places to visit were in suburbs. Second of all, almost all of the highlighted restaurants in the video had closed years ago. I would recommend this hotel as a non fancy, slightly worn down alternative in a great location for visiting venues in the city. Take advantage of the free shuttle service in a 3-mile radius before 10pm!I stayed here during Movement and stayed in one of the suites. It was definitely quite large, and the kitchen was nice to have. The refrigerator was leaking a little, though, and dripped onto my pizza box. Nonetheless, the room was clean, and the people who worked here were really nice despite the fact that most of the people staying in the hotel that weekend were not very functional. I, myself, never made it down to breakfast, but it was nice that breakfast was included.There are sticky patches on the carpet, the air conditioner is making strange pulsing noises and not functioning, and the bed creeks every time you move. Unless you need the location, definitely pass.I was going to give this place a better rating but my most recent stay was NOT ok. I'll start with the positive: rooms are fairly new and clean. Nice, new television and a pretty large refrigerator. Good central downtown location. Free wifi and free breakfast every morning, and the breakfast is GOOD! Those biscuits and gravy are awesome! Indoor pool and gym as well.Parking used to be free, but is now $20 a day.My first year I stayed here I had an overall very positive experience. However my most recent stay was terrible. I came during memorial day weekend 2014, a VERY busy weekend for them so they should have been prepared. My friends and I had problems with our plumbing the ENTIRE trip. The pipes would makes this super scary, loud, banging noises anytime you showered and sometimes when you flushed. They water pressure in the shower was terrible and sometimes would not get cold, sometimes it wouldn't get hot! By the third day of our stay they shower TURNED OFF in middle of my boyfriend's shower! And then the toilet completely stopped flushing. So for a day and a half we had no shower and no toilet! We kept having to go downstairs to use the toilet! HOW RIDICULOUS!  If I had known this I would have saved hundreds and dollars and slept in my car all weekend. By our last morning, after a LONG weekend we were trying to sleep in a bit before showering and heading to the airport. We got a call from the front desk at 9:30 informing us that the water would be turned off on OUR ENTIRE FLOOR for TWO HOURS! WHAT?! There was no way we were all getting on a plane without showering! Two of my friends were flying to Berlin for gosh sakes! We PAY for HOTELS so we can have a SHOWER, BED, AND TOILET! Not just for a bed and television!They clearly had known that the plumbing was an issue the whole weekend and did not call at all except the FOURTH DAY. And did not offer ANY type of compensation! Even passing by the plumbers working on it(FINALLY AFTER FOUR DAYS) Said,"This is totally ridiculous I hope all of you get some sort of compensation!"We had to go down to the front desk in person and complain so they opened an empty room for us so we could all go shower and use the toilet for the remainder of our stay(all of 1 1/2 hours). By then it was 10:15, and checkout was 11. Thanks guys, really helpful. We of course stayed past 11am because how were we all supposed to shower and pack in time by then? Thanks for charging us for a room that basically had no plumbing all weekend Holiday Inn. And for the record these plumbing issues were OUR ENTIRE FLOOR. So we weren't the only ones. I won't be coming back.What a room!We decided on this place in relation to Comerica Park for our trip to Detroit.  We were pleasantly surprised!  We were in a suite and it was most definitely the biggest hotel room I've ever stayed in.  I'm no world traveler and don't go too many places, but hey, it pretty nice.  We had a huge bed, a cool kitchen area and practially a whole living room.  The bathroom was a little on the small side, but I ended up getting ready just outside the bathroom anyway.Our room and the hallways were quiet, the front desk and valet very helpful and the bartender in the connected lounge was nice as well.  I would stay here again since it's pretty close for what we needed.  My only gripe - they were always cleaning the floor by the elevator in the lobby and it was always wet.I am jealous of all the people that only paid $49, I wouldn't complain at that price, but I will at $120 a night!  The breakfast was so busy, it was hard to get in.  The people working did their best to keep up.  Our room smelled like Urine.  Once the AC was on full blast, the smell was better. It was obvious that the door of the bathroom had recently been kicked in.  That alone was pretty scary.  It was so loud, even after midnight, people in room next to us were fighting.  Lobby was loud also.  Beds were newer but not very comfortable.The WORST!!!!! The key cards don't work. Old property. Maintenance is terrible and shoddy. Front office staff is most disinterested in fixing things. The restroom makes water sounds all night long and no one fixes it. For Holiday Inn very disappointingMy friends and I stayed here during Movement.  The location was good - a lot of our friends were across the street in the Westin, so it was great to be so close by.   The positives for our visit were the free valet parking, free breakfast (though we only made it to breakfast once), and friendly staff.  Unfortunately the room was a bit shabby and there were constant problems with the key cards. Every single time we tried to get back into our room, we were locked out and had to get our keys re-programmed. They even tried replacing the card reader on our door mid-weekend, and no joy.  It was a significant inconvenience, especially with people coming and going at all hours because of the festival and after parties.
review_content_20: We started out alright, and this was after we had to change rooms because of a leaky, running toilet and a handicapped shower that would have soaked the entire bathroom, if it has hot water. Nice to have a free breakfast, but if you are going to have a big hotel, you need a large eating area. The line on Saturday morning was so long, we decided not to wait in it. The long line could have been due to the fact that many people slept in because we were awoken at 4am by a fire alarm. (I know this is not the hotel's fault for some drunken fool who pulled it, but still sucks getting your scared children down fifteen flights of stairs.) Housekeeping of the hotel is not the best, certainly not the worst I've been in, but a vacuum and a mop go a long way. (Especially under the couch hide-a-bed and the elevator floors. Valet staff needs to stop texting and goofing off with co-workers and answer the phone, so when guests come for their cars, they are waiting.I would have given 5 stars until on the drive back to Saginaw we noticed the valet service stole $ from the middle console that we'd forgotten to take out. We called the hotel who didn't seem in the least intersted that the valets that they hire stole from their customers. We would have stayed there again had it not been for the theft. We wouldn't steal from them, didn't even keep the toiletries from the bathroom, and expect the same from them. Will never step foot in this place again, definitely not concerned for their customers.I go to Detroit a hole mess of times. I think easily 30 times in the last two and a half years. I have pretty much stayed at all fo the downtown hotels at one time or another. It may not have the glitz and the glamor of some of them, but this hotel is just down right perfect for me. It is right next to the Westin and right down the street from my work offices in Detroit. I can honestly say that I love this place, even though it is slightly worn down, not the cleanest place I have ever stayed, but for what it is and the price of the place, it is perfect.I get a decent nights sleep, no noise, the shower works, the beds are comfortable, i get free wifi. Breakfast int he morning is edible and not vomit inducing. Maybe I have set the bar really low, but every time I go there, I am ultra content. I also have not been robbed or killed or raped on my way to and from work, either sober or completely tanked off my ass. It is a block away from the people mover, right down the street from Comerica, it is in the perfect place and you do not need to pay Westin rates.Only complaint and it is not really a complaint that would knock it down a star value. But the lady that wanders around at breakfast, you do not need to come by my table every 7 minutes to ask me how every thing is. It is almost like you are shocked that everything is good, or that the food is not making me want to vomit. It is very unsettling. And to the blonde 23 year old that works the front desk, I know your birthday was just the other week, I am also waiting for you to call me back, i left my cell phone number on the receipt when i checked out. I know you were looking at me. I really appreciate you coming up and helping me fold my laundry that one night too. I'll be back soon, I do not remember your name.. but I will keep my eye out for you.When you book this hotel on Hotwire.com, the price is right ($49/night). Just look for the only hotel in Downtown Detroit and you'll find it.With the exception of staying here for The Hoe Down weekend, I've always had a nice time. DO NOT stay here during Hoe Down weekend. It's just too trashy and icky for comfort. Since this place is cheap, it brings out all the losers and weirdos that come from down river to experience the trashy country music festival. Outside of that weekend, the hotel is great. The price is nice, the rooms are big enough and they all have a desk, dresser, flat screen TV, cable, closet and large bathroom (shower + tub). The bedding is also really nice - feather pillows, feather comforter, soft mattress... very comfortable. There's an on-site fitness center (not too big but never occupied), free continental breakfast every morning and a restaurant on the premises. The staff are friendly enough and the check in process is pretty quick. Valet parking is $18 per day (CHEAP!) and there's in/out privileges all night. Oh, and did I mention free WiFi?The hotel is within walking distance of everything downtown Detroit has to offer. 10 minutes to Comerica, Ford Field, Opera, restaurants; three minutes to Campus Martius, Detroit Riverfront; three minutes driving to the tunnel to Canada.Really wanted to give it 3 stars as most of the staff was great but a few issues over 3 days; room was musty, the toilet seat can't stay up because the tank cover doesn't fit when remodel happened, so guys prepare for a two handed process. No fan or vent in a really small bathroom. Other issues, Had a room attendant actually drink some of our bottled water and leave it next to the TV while forgetting to clean out the coffee pot and not leaving more coffee or cups, the A/C heater unit was full of dust/ dirt that was evident when we tried to use it, switched it off immediately. One the elevators kind of has a mind of its own, stops short of the floor by a few inches, sometimes just stops on the way up then starts going again??? staff actually got off with us and said "oh no not again." The business center is a one pc searching for a wireless signal and a windows op system that was copied from another machine and installed - never actually was able to get one the web.Perfect place to stay after an event downtown! Rooms are nice, beds are comfy and the location is ideal. The staff is super accommodating & friendly. Free, full breakfast in the morning is the perfect way to start the day. My only suggestion would be updating the blow dryers in the bathroom.Shuttle service is very efficient. On the other hand we had to wait more than 30 minutes for the swimming pool to be opened...I've checked in here a few times in recent months and I must say, one thing I noticed is that the clientele is often somewhat louder and a bit rowdier. Not in a menacing way, but just in an inconsiderate way. I am sad to say the staff doesn't call them out. I guess it's just the ambiance in this casual hotel. This place feels somewhat outdated, and while it's rated 2.5-3.0 stars, and has the potential to be such, I would say the upkeep of it is in the 2.0-2.5 star. Rooms are moderately comfortable, but the walls are a little aged, carpets old school and aged, bed was a little old, furniture old, well OK - you get my drift. Looks like they are trying hard to milk their preserved from the 90s interior. Location is good because it is downtown and just walking distance from the famous Michael Symon's Roast restaurant. Also, you are looking at a short drive to any downtown fares and Windsor. Parking was about $20, which is annoying but expected. There is complimentary breakfast with hot items, which is a nice freebie - but it gets kidn of loud and messy from the aforementioned crowd, so that kind of repels me from it anyway. Besides, the extra coin on all the great eats out and about is justified.Overall, a decent hotel, and can be had for a bargain price of around $50-$60 when secured via Hotwire or Priceline. One of me lesser favorable ones downtown, but still a solid level better than your Motel 8 & Best Western tier of hotels. Also, higher floors have a cool view of the nearby skyscrapers of Detroit. Lastly, you want a minimum standard of this place to feel safe and comfortable in Detroit I'd say. They are also very kind to late checkouts at 1PM, which guys like me who party hard on Saturday nights can appreciate on a detox Sunday afternoon.Stayed here the third weekend in October for the Theatre Bizarre Halloween party. This is the second year I have stayed here, last year it was a last minute thing and they got me in cheap. I think the rooms are fine and clean to boot. everything worked, they gave me a wifi code, but i was trying not to communicate with anyone so i didn't bring any devices to try it. Staff was friendly, and a little slow, breakfast in the morning was the usual fare. The only complaint i had was the valet parking checkout on sunday took about thirty minutes. Apparently they have to walk 4 blocks to get your car, so call down at least 15 minutes before you want it. this is close to MGM Detroit, and the old hulk of a train station that I love to visit, plus a lot of other decaying buildings that you should go see.For the money, I think it's a good deal.This hotel is exactly what you would expect for the price, which was awesome. The rooms are clean, but nothing fancy. There's valet so you don't have to worry about parking your car in downtown, but it takes a while to get your car back. The b-fast is cereal and stuff, but who doesn't like that. The shower was very nice, and when the blow dryer in our room was broken the front desk was eager to replace it. It's walking distance from Comerica Park and lots of other things in downtown. Overall, a very good experience.Good Hotel considering price and proximity to downtown. It could use a makeover. Staff is friendly. Valet parking is convenient. Had to take away a star for the long black hair I found lying on my neatly-made bed. As you can see from my profile pic , it didn't fall off my head!First off, our room was crawling with bed bugs. Secondly, after checkout, we received a bill for $226 in unknown damages. After many, many calls to management (which were not taken seriously), we finally discovered that the damages we were forced to pay for included:1. A broken mirror in the room across the hall (where none of our party stayed, nor was the room under our party's name or associated with us at all)2. The number plate outside of our room that went missing while our party was not presentAfter many more phone calls, we got rid of the mirror charge, but they still claimed that we were responsible for the missing number plate. I consulted my lawyer, and he informed me because the plate was located outside of our hotel room in the hallway, which is a public space, we could not be held accountable for it.More calls to management resulted only in blackmail- they told us to stop calling because they had "photographic evidence" and "video footage" of our party committing the crime of stealing the number plate (which wouldn't be possible, as we were either sleeping or away at a convention when the theft took place). During one phone call they even told us that because we were responsible for reporting that the plate had gone missing, and we didn't report it, that they were within their right to charge us for it.Filing a complaint with corporate twice yielded no results. They simply took the hotel's word for it and never investigated into who actually stole the number plate, taking the easy route by stealing our money to pay for it.I stayed here one night recently and had a pleasant experience. This hotel was specifically chosen because it had an indoor pool. I really wish I could give a five star, but there were a few stand out disappointments. At first, I was excited to find that they had valet parking that I paid an additional $20 to have. It was snowing heavily when I visited. However, I was dismayed to find out that my car had been parked in a regular lot overnight and valet drove it up covered in snow. Also, there is no other real option for parking for this establishment besides parking your vehicle in one of the nearby paid lots. The hotel is clean, but dated. Our wifi consistently dropped. The elevators have gang graffiti scratched into the doors. And the pool is quite small. Many times we had to wait up to thirty minutes to get into the pool because room keys don't unlock the pool door. For some reason towels were never stocked in the pool room and we also had to wait long periods of time for the staff to bring them up. We were told not to use room towels for the pool. The blankets on the bed were very thin and not very warm. On the plus side...the staff was friendly and not in a we-have-to-be sort of way. The pool hours pleased us, as most hotels close their pools too early. The buffet breakfast offered lots of choices and was pretty tasty. They had a large area sectioned off for people to sit and eat. So, I wasn't forced to eat my breakfast with strangers. Would I stay here again? Yes, but it would depend on the weather/season and I would remember to bring my own blanket.This is worse than the motel 6. I am a platinum elite member I stay at a lot of different holiday inns this is ranked at the bottom. Ice cold showers all weekend the water did not drain it came up to your ankles fast they did fix that but left my door wide open all day luckily nothing was missing from my room. The made never replaced our wash cloths I went to the front desk and asked for some when we got back late that night we still did not get them. Also the maid never replaced our empty tissue box.Good value. The hotel could use new carpet and fresh paint in the hallways though.The shuttle staff was very accommodating. My driver was super friendly and really funny actually. He had a lot of insights about the city as we drove around.I stayed here on a last minute business trip for a convention at the COBO center. It was really close to the convention hall and in a safe area. The room was really clean, comfortable and had everything you could need. The bathroom was a little on the small side but since it was only me in the room it was fine. They have a small business center, free breakfast, pool, gym and free Wifi. The staff was excellent! The front desk staff was so friendly and accommodating. They really made it welcoming as soon as you walked in. The Valet staff was incredible! (Thank you Ricky...you ROCK!) I would definitely stay here again on my next trip.Very Helpful service. Nice pool. Great breakfast. Close walking distance to everywhere in Downtown Detroit. Great hotel with a Great price!Great location and customer service from the front desk! The room was rather small but clean which is more important. Wi-fi was free but super slow, so I didn't even use it on my phone. The shuttle was great and took us where we needed to go even though our guy backed into another car and told us that "we didn't see or hear anything." We did have an excessively long wait for our car from the valet as we were told several times the car was on its way. Then the last excuse we were told was that it was stuck in the elevator after waiting 40 minutes for our car.Great location, good price, and fine rooms. This place isn't a hotel of swanky light fixtures and old school glitz. It's a modern hotel with a modern "I-bought-this-from-china" feel. It's fine, but not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination. I stayed one night for business and was happy to be able to walk downtown (although I appeared to be alone in this endeavor), and was pleased with the complimentary shuttle service which will pretty much take you anywhere in the city for free. Hot breakfast was all the food I got before leaving town, and was pretty good. Beds were fine and I slept OK despite a strange noise comming from the pipes occasionally... Would do it again for business, although a little extra coin, as the other reviewers have noted, can put you in a VERY different environment.Stayed here on several occasions when on business in Detroit. I gave it 4 stars based on the hotel itself. Rooms are all very clean and modern and the staff is very friendly. There is a decent restaurant attached to the hotel but it is frequently packed as it seems to be the only place open at night in the area. Around the hotel is about what you would expect of downtown Detroit. There is not much of anything. Overall experience would be 3 stars but I'm not going to knock to hotel because of the town there in.

hotel_name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton - Fort Shelby
review_content: When the highlight of your stay is that warm delicious cookie that all doubletrees supply you with, it's not saying much. My stay wasn't bad, and the amenities were quite nice, it just wasn't wonderful. We arrived Friday afternoon, and were told about the $25 dollar valet. Which didn't make much sense to me. Seeing how there is a much cheaper parking lot right next door, that you can park and take out yourself. And I'm not exaggerating, it's two connected to the building, right next to it. The room was nice and had a pull out sofa bed and a super plush bed. When I hit that bed later that night I was out. Sure, I had a lot to drink, but I can usually toss and turn. Here I was snugged away in dreamland. I realized when I was upstairs that one of the remotes were missing. I mentioned it when I came back in, and they told me they'd send someone right up. They never did. It wasn't until I got back that night when I called the front desk and they finally sent someone back up to give us another remote. The hotel looked beautiful. Nice decor. The place looked new. It was able to accommodate lots of people, most of which seemed like they were there for the Tigers game like us. The hotel is less expensive than some of the other hotels, more centered in the downtown area. I enjoyed my time at the downtown doubletree, it makes for a good option. Just make sure you have your remotes.We have stayed at this location twice.  Once for a Tigers game and then for the Kenny Chesney concert last week.  Both times we were extremely pleased with our stay.  The staff are friendly.  The rooms are huge and clean.  The Valet staff are efficient and the best thing is the cookie they give you.  Warm, gooey and delicious.The suites are very roomy. They offer a desk, love seat, TV, refrigerator, Microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom is spacious and comes with a tub, and shower as well as very nice soaps, and shampoos.The bed is firm and comfortable and the bedroom offers an additional TV.They have a great bar, restaurant and Starbucks coffee shop.It's in a nice location and is extremely close to the Joe, COBO Center, the People Mover, Channel 4 and a plethora of restaurants.Still a cool place to stay.  They changed the menu in the bar so I am not that wild about the new menu but not bad.I didn't know what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. Our room was spacious and clean. Starbucks in the lobby was handy. I do wish they had a little shop for amenities. Best perk was the shuttle to take us around town.I've stayed here a handful of times when coming to the Detroit Electronic Music Festival (now called Movement).  We typically stay in a 2 room suite which is the same price as a regular room at other hotels.  The room can comfortably sleep 6 with the pull out couch - which is actually quite comfortable for a pull out.  Having the 2 rooms is awesome in case some people want to sleep while others are still up in the living room.  The staff always friendly, and you get warm cookies when you check in.  Often times early check-in is available, but if not they will hold your bags.The breakfast buffet is really good.  They will give you to go containers if you are in a rush!  The bar side isn't as good though - overpriced and INCREDIBLY slow every time I have eaten there.  Last time the room had a weird smell, but other than that I have had no issues with the rooms.I stayed here during my first (and most recent) stay in Detroit since it offered a central downtown location at a reasonable price (I paid about 120$ per night, before taxes).  The DoubleTree is right by some public transit, including a bus that can potentially take you to/from the airport during certain times of the day, and the Fort Cass PeopleMover station.  There's a few restaurants nearby (but not many) so if you want to eat, you'll likely have to walk, cab, or PeopleMover it.  The hotel provides complimentary WiFi and chocolate chip cookie, and as a Hilton Gold member I was provided breakfast buffet vouchers. I can't attest to the buffet as I used my vouchers on the grab-and-go option at their cafe instead, which was decent.  One of the perks of this particular hotel is that they offer a free on-demand shuttle service within a 2-3 mile radius of the hotel.  I took the shuttle service to the DIA, so it was nice since I didn't have to walk there. The drivers can also pick you up and drop you off to another location if need be.The DoubleTree chain typically has very spacious rooms, and here they are suites style with separate living and sleeping areas, which is nice. I didn't score an upgrade here (not sure why) but I was still content with my room since it was very spacious for me as one person.  The bath amenities are from CrabTree & Evelyn, which smell great.Okay so enough about the good things... One of the things that bothered me was my bath towels seemed a bit dirty since they had old blood stains. Granted I'm sure they've been cleaned and bleached many times, but seeing the stains kind of grossed me out.  I called housekeeping and asked for new towels, which were delivered to me promptly.Overall this hotel provides many great services at a reasonable price in a central/convenient location.  Even with the blood stain mishap, the DoubleTree was an overall above average experience.It's a doubletree so it does the job. The food is decent and the location is accommodating for work and personal purposes. Getting a cookie upon check in is pretty sweet.I loved it and the manager helped me with my issue. I'll definitely stay here againI love the royal treatment here at Double Tree.  Keera Akins was very pleasant and friendly during my stay here.  I was always greeted with a welcome smile.  Will definitely come back again for the next property investment.If I was staying for business or a baseball, football, or hockey game, this would get three stars, at best, for what it is. For leisure, I hate myself every time I have to book this place when the Westin is full and holiday rates go up yet somehow a room is always available here. Got me again Hilton. Keep the cookie and buy some wine bottle openers so I don't have to hear from the 'Care Line' that I need to come downstairs to open a bottle of wine because you only have one opener for the entire hotel. Weak.The suite we got was spacious and extremely clean. We reserved the 2 bedroom suite but Of course the Hilton gave away our room even though we had made reservation 5 days before.  We checked in around 6:30. The front desk guy showed no concerned and his response was "we are busy and first come first serve". Even though we made a reservation? He replied, "yes"!  However I contacted Hilton through social media explained to them what happened and the room was free. The breakfast came with our room. It was typical hotel breakfast: eggs, juice, bacon, French toast, cereal. It was ok. The warm chocolate chip cookies were good.LOCATION:  On Lafayette near 1st street.  There aren't really any restaurants or stores close by.  There's a small gas station across the street and a dive bar around the corner.  There's a nice deli (open for lunch) a couple of blocks away.  The Fort/Cass people mover is about a block away.  There are a lot more food options on Woodward, which is about a 10 minute walk.  It's a little creepy at night when there's no one else around on the way there except maybe a bum.INSIDE THE HOTEL:  -BearClaw coffee shop in the lobby that is opened until 4pm.  Besides beverages, they sell oatmeal, granola bars, prepackaged sandwiches, salads, parfait, bagels, and pastries.  There's also a tiny section of medicine and toiletries, which is nice since the hotel doesn't have a gift shop.  I was hoping they might carry contact lens solution, but they don't.-Round Bar - The food here is pretty good and "happy hour" is excellent.  Happy hour is M-F 5p-7p, $3 draft, $4 house wine, $5 cocktails and appetizers (chicken wings, potato skins, sliders, zucchini sticks, and chicken quesadilla).  There's also a sushi menu, but the stuff I've tried weren't good at all.-Fin and Porter Restaurant - This is where breakfast is served and is right across from the Round Bar.  I tried having dinner here once, but they said they don't do dinner every day, so I never ate here.ROOMS:  Most are suites (separated living room area), but some are regular non-suites rooms.  Some rooms have a fridge and a microwave while others don't.PARKING:  There is no self-parking, only valet for $23/day.  There's a parking right next door that charges $10 for parking.If you have gold status or above at Hilton, then they will give you a breakfast voucher good for breakfast in their restaurant.  I asked for mine to go and they gave me a container to put stuff in.  The staff here are very nice and friendly.  The selection is decent - oatmeal, fruit, bagel, pastries, cereal, yogurt, sausage/bacon, and eggs.My boyfriend and I stayed for Tigers Opening Day weekend, and the hotel itself was very nice, but the service overall was BAD. The good: super quick wi-fi, nicely deocrated room, warm cookies upon arrival, lobby and elevator areas clean, room clean upon arrival. There is a mini fridge you can actually USE! The windows actually OPEN a few inches. The building itself is beautiful. The Round Bar has good beer on tap, but the food is way overpriced for what it is.So for the bad-The in room movie service did not work. We called the front desk but it wasn't able to be fixed. One of the telephones did not work. We also did not have our room cleaned during the stay. Worst -was the valet-it took 40 minutes to get our vehicle. We called the front desk and they said 20 minutes. We waited 30 before the staff realized no one had gone for the vehicle-then they asked me to find my keys. For 27.50 a night to park, this was really disappointing. Especially for Opening Day weekend of Tigers season! Definitley won't be back, nor would I reccommend this hotel to anyone because of the poor service. Housekeeping also banged on the door the day of checkout before 8 AM in the morning. Very poor service, again, for such a nice facility the level of service is a big letdown.Update: I sent a letter to their management explaining our stay. They wrote back about a month later and apologized and offered me a coupon for a free nights stay with free parking. It's now June, I have not seen anything in the mail from them.I liked this location because you are able to book corner suite rooms for the same amount of points as a normal room. During the second weekend in July, I was able to book a room for two nights for 30,000 points/night. Located right next to the Detroit Free Press, not far from where Detroit City FC plays at Cass Technical High School, and extremely close to the tunnel to Canada, the hotel location worked for us. You will need to rent a car though, and valet parking costs $25/night with in and out privileges (Sheraton Times Square NYC was $50/night, no in and out privileges). Hilton Diamond members receive a free, full breakfast and free wifi, which is nice. I really liked the suite which has a separate living room, bathroom, and bedroom. I liked how the bathroom is actually separate from the bedroom, not a part of the bedroom (like Residence Inns or Hyatt Houses). There was ample seating available, and if you have a third person, a third person could sleep on the pullout sofabed. Would I book here again? Probably. Customer service at the front desk was good, and the service at breakfast was decent enough. Sometimes they ran out of things for breakfast, but items will be re-supplied within ten minutes or less. Nothing bad happened during our stay, but nothing absolutely outstanding happened here either. Not bad!Not cheap.  The service was excellent.  We valet parked our car - $28.00.  The room was very nice compared to what we usually can afford.  We splurged this time.Starbucks in the hotel.   The hotel is downtown and close to everything. We opened our window as the room was at 68 degrees when we walked in.   There is a TV in the sitting area and also in the bedroom.   The sofa had that sickly sweet air freshener smell.I stayed here in 1971 when I got my physical for the Marine Corps.  It was quite different this time a round.  Duh.  Can't afford this luxury very often.   It's a definite step up from the usual "Inn".The place was neat. The staff was very nice. I only had one day when room service was not as great as it could've been. The morning buffet in the restaurant was excellent.  The room service staff was very very nice. The room service food was not great.Nice hotel in an up-and-coming part of Detroit. Parking can be a little sketchy unless you valet but you can find street parking (park at your own risk though).  The hotel's bar and restaurant is very good if you're dining in.  Boyfriend and I ordered room service, just appetizers and wine, and it took an hour for our food and wine to arrive. Other than that the hotel is nice and the staff very accommodating. The rooms have been redone and are all suites with a separate sleeping and living room area.Great location and comfortable spacious rooms! However, I was very disappointed with the front desk staff, minus one person, and the restaurant was ridiculously SLOW!We were actually visiting friends at the apartments.  The apartments are very nice inside.  They have a great view and in room laundry.  It comes with valet too which is a favorite of mine since parking downtown is a pain.  They also give you free cookies even if you are not in the hotel part!Everytime I come to downtown Detroit I come to the Double Tree.  Good rooms, service, and the bar is first rate.
review_content_20: Very clean building and nice staff. The check-in line was a little long so we got extra cookies and free valet. Only major snafu was the first set of keys we got were to a room already occupied - surprised us and the person in the room. Once we got that straightened out, it was smooth sailing.Hotels come in many shapes and sizes, sometimes you get a really tiny European sized room, sometimes you get a really spacious hotel room that is clean and tastefully decorated. Double Tree-Fort Shelby was the latter. I booked a Double Queen Suite and it was only $119 (not including taxes and fees)!! We had a bedroom separate from the living room and kitchen, two TVs, Comfy beds, free wifi and tons of space!!! The front desk people were kind and very helpful and it really just set the mood for our stay here. Next time I visit Detroit I am definitely staying hereLocation only would be good. Room was gross, staff nasty & rude, specifically suited male bartender. Karrie wouldn't review room after requested, requested multiple times. Specifically asked to visit room. She was "manager" on duty. Hilton, get some standards!!! So disappointed and would not recommend. Really, you cannot view room???? Just inspect and do your job!! Terrible management. Hair in sink, hair in bed, toilet seat up and dirty, walls at floors dirty as wow. Before booking next time, check for management and department head changes. Really liked hotel before. Poor Hilton :(We were in Detroit to attend a weekend of Tigers baseball . I knew this property was older but had a makeover . Checkin was quick and the staff in the valet area were helpful with directions . Our room was ready and clean the suite concept is a nice feature and allowed me to sleep in . They offer a shuttle to almost anywhere downtown . The round bar has a nice selection of both local and national beers . Service was ok since only one server was on duty . For the price $ 113.00 plus assorted taxes and parking fee of $ 25.00 was not all that bad . If we got a good rate I would consider staying at this property again . Just keep in mind this hotel is a bit removed from the action . However a short ride to Greektown and the Woodward Avenue strip .Large, clean suite room upgrade for being a loyal hhonors member! Room service was great- Mike took our order, brought it up to us, and helped us clear the table for the tray! The food was great, and Mike got us extra salad dressing from the kitchen! We were on the tenth floor. Elevators are clean and fast, and there is a deli/Starbucks in the lobby. Gave each of us TWO cookies-at the front desk and Mike brought us some. Beds comfortable, sofa clean and soft, two free water bottles upon checkin, and extremely soft tap water. Only downsides were a sketchy parking lot, and that the HVAC system takes a long time. Good view of the downtown Detroit skyline, and a good shuttle service.The ladies up front couldn't be nicer or more welcoming. The gym is great too. Room service didn't speak English well and messed up my order completely. The food didn't taste too good either. The breakfast buffet was out of eggs and fruit and never was replenished even after several requests.Unexpected spaciousness. Nicely appointed. Odd things, like you can use the refrigerator or microwave, but both cannot be plugged in to the only available outlet at the same time. The maid knocked at 8:40 am EST, not outrageous, but I am still 3 hours behind on Pacific time. I wave at her and point at my room as I leave for work a short time later. Tonight-- room not serviced-- not a real problem, I just wanted to coffee to be re supplied! Forget the restaurant. Cold potatoes, veggies that tasted like a dirty grill. Only when the manager asked if I had been taken care of, did a waiter surface--25 minutes of waiting. Nice space, potential...poorly managed.My company always gets us a block of rooms at this hotel each year for the auto show. It is definitely one of the more spacious rooms that I have ever stayed in. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I give it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the lack to detail when it comes to cleaning.I booked a hotel room at booking.com for this hotel in February. A week before my arrival back home in Detroit, I called to confirm my reservations. I was told by the none too helpful clerk in this unmistakable dry tone, that they did not have a reservation for me. He seemed unconcerned and was 100% unhelpful. His only response was for me to call booking.com.I called booking.com who informed be that Double Tree Suites had received the reservation 3 months ago but decided to overbook the hotel and ignore my reservation. UNBELIEVABLE!I'm glad that I took the time to confirm my reservation a week before arrival because if I had arrived at the time of my reservation and told this $#!+ I would have been up a creek without a paddle.I love my hometown and only want the best for it and the businesses that serve the City, but this kind of service speaks poorly to how the City is run overall. What better way to say "stay away" than to have hotels that don't honor reservations to visitors. Absurd and ridiculous!So buyers beware of Double Tree Suites in Detroit and booking.com. Additionally, I would like to applaud them for their very unprofessional and uncouth behaviour and award both of them the Knucklehead Award [in my best British accent!]DO NOT STAY HERE!!! I have been here for two weeks now staying for the Detroit Autoshow I am working. Last night one of the girls on my team had a man come into her room when she was sleeping. She had her bedroom door closed and was scared so she didn't come out of her room. When she finally did she found that her purse and jacket had been stolen. She didn't have anyone staying with her and nobody else had a key. You can't get a key from the front desk unless you show a picture ID so IT HAD TO BE A STAFF MEMBER WHO CAME INTO THE ROOM AND STOLE HER ITEMS. The hotel is trying to blame it on her saying she must have dropped her key somewhere. Not the case! She didn't have another key and even if she did they don't have their room numbers on the keys.Word spread pretty fast about what had happened as people who work in the autoshow are a tight knit group. At work today we had another woman come up to us from another brand and tell us she HAS HAD A MAN COME INTO HER ROOM UNANNOUNCED LATE AT NIGHT TWICE!!! This happened once two years ago which the hotel tried to explain away by saying she called for her room to be serviced at 11:30pm (which she didn't and is ridiculous either way) and then she had it happen again on this trip!! Again the hotel is explaining it away by saying he was delivering towels at 9:00 at night. The funny thing is she said he didn't have any towels.Something fishy is going on at this hotel. We won't be staying here another year to find out. If you're unlucky enough to have to stay here make good use of your safe!!!Class all the way! We went here for cocktails and dessert after dinner at nearby Harbor House at the suggestion of a friend. It was the perfect nightcap. So clean you can eat off the floor, front door valet, beautiful architecture, fun, upbeat Motown classics playing, our bartender David was brilliant! He made those drinks with love and was impeccably dressed. The desserts were simple, yet decadent. If you're in the downtown Detroit area do come inside from out the cold and eat, drink and unwind.So I was walking barefoot in my hotel room - HUGE MISTAKE. They had exposed wood from pulled back carpet with staples/nails sticking out and it sliced into my foot which is bleeding as we speak. Mike from the front desk came up after I called and all he said was, "Do you want to change rooms?" No big apologies, nothing. Nevermind that a nail from your hotel went into my foot. I can barely walk right now, let alone pack everything up and haul it to a different room. I asked if they had a rug or mat or anything to place over this as it is an extreme safety hazard. He said maintenance would take care of it and left. I'm still waiting for someone to fix this.Really nice hotel, prices are reasonable too! The bathroom was huge and the entire hotel was very clean.Don't have any expectations and you won't be disappointed. Staff makes promises they won't keep.I stayed here for two weeks for Detroit auto show. I called very far in advance to request a double suite and was promised I'd have one along with a microwave. Neither of these things happened upon check out. One week into my stay I was able to transfer into my double room.The valet is beyond horrible and rude. Give yourself about an hour waiting for your car. I think there are much better hotels in Detroit!Liked the hotel. Had a pretty cool view. If you're from out of town the picture to me was kind of misleading. I thought we were gonna have awesome views of Detroit but the highest floor is 10 the condos next door or whatever must be 20+... Anyway room worked out well for NYE.Nice hotel. Big rooms. Decent customer service. Nice location. Good price. Would stay here again! Never received our cookies though :(I stayed at the double tree down town Detroit for almost 2 weeks for business. I wouldn't reccomend this hotel, as they were not very accomidating to the business patron. Below is what I would consider the pros and cons of this establishment.Pros:Large rooms, the hotel was kept clean and the rooms had nice general ammenidies including a fridge, coffee maker ect.Staff was generally pleasant and waitstaff in the connected restaurant were attentive and very quick to fufill orders.Price of the hotel rooms themselves were resonable.Cons:Price to park a vehicle was around 22.00 a day, in Detroit that's high and fairly unresonable, consitering the cars parked are placed in an abandoned non gated parking lot across the street. Also 22.00$ pays for property taxes for the year down town Detroit.The room during my stay faced a parking structure that apparently makes frequent high pitch beeping sounds everytime a car drives in or out even at 4am.At a lengthy stay of several weeks a incicidental fund associated with a credit card can rack up quite a hefty bill even when you don't use incidentals. The front desk staff was almost hostile to the idea of a cash deposit and totally unwilling to work out an alternative or to accomodate a more resonable deposit, needless to say if you plan to stay several weeks, bring a card with a few thousand dollar credit limit.A shuttle service does exist, which is a nice gesture but is almost always unavailable or out on a run. The one shuttle I did manage to secure left me stranded at mgm casino when I scheduled a return to the hotel. After waiting 45 mins past the pick up time I decided to call them. They told me the driver attempted the pick up awhile ago but went to a secondary entrance. After another 30 mins the shuttle arrived at the scheduled pick up location.On my last day before departing I asked if I could have an additional hour before checking out, since my flight home was delayed an hour as well. The staff explained "they don't do that". The staff also went into detail about the policy and made no effort to be tactful about the situation.Needless to say, they do not meet the needs or accomodation that is required with traveling guests, the staff at any point of request to identify with the needs of a customer came up very short. The staff loved to use the term "its our policy" when it was anything to do with going above and beyond. Travel and business pros alike know traveling can be draining, its places like this that make it that much harder, leave you more tired, and drain you that much quicker.I had never been to Detroit before. I didn't do much research before I got there since the primary purpose of my trip was to see Muse. I made the drive in like three and a half hours and stayed at the Doubletree downtown. There is nothing to brag about as far as the room goes, but it seemed as the hotel was an excellent value. It was within walking distance of the Joe Louis Arena where the concert. Whenever I am planning on going to sporting events or concerts I usually try to get a hotel within walking distance of the venue, so I can save on parking. In this case it worked to my detriment since parking was pretty cheap almost everywhere. Still I liked the security that the valet parking of the hotel offered.My wife and I, along with some friends spent the weekend in Detroit for the Fall Beer Festival. We left this hotel with mixed feelings. From the $15/pp breakfast buffet (we've had better selections AND better food elsewhere for free) at the onsite restaurant to the questionable valet fee where our friends were told to run across the street and get their vehicle, one can't help but wonder was it worth the savings over staying at some of the other nicer choices in town. It's not bad, trust me, I've seen worse, but I can't say we would stay here again.Had great time here, albeit for one night. The front desk was very accommodating to us, and the room was large, and had nice view. Was short walk to Comerica, so location was good, too. Staff was great in brining up extra towels and such. Only negative is I wish they had pool, and were closer to Greektown. Outside of that was a great stay.
review_content_40: Traveled to Detroit for a baseball game and the hotel was a preferred hotel of one my vendors.  It is also either a quick walk (1/2 mile from the Comerica and Ford Field) or a ride on the people mover at the Fort/Cass stop (75 cents each way).  I'd recommend using the people mover since a stop is right around the corner from the hotel.Valet was hectic as a lot of people were checking in but simple enough.  Unsure if there is street parking available as I am not familiar with Detroit's night time parking laws.  The hotel itself has two restaurants and a little cafe that I did eat at or use.  Check in was easy and they gave us plenty of fresh chocolate chip oatmeal raisin cookies.We had a 1 king bed suite with separate seating area.  Had 2 flat screens, a pull out sofa, and free Wi-FI.  View was of a secured parking lot but not where they parked my car.Check out was just as easy (I did mine on the TV) but they did charge me for parking when it was suppose to be included in the parking.For $99 for the night, you couldn't beat the price, quality, service, and location.I travel for my job so I have stayed at my fair share of hotels and I have to say that one of the main reasons I enjoy coming back to Detroit is because of this hotel.  Okay it's not the most modern or glamorous but the service is amazing.  The staff, from the front desk to the hotel restaurant are always pleasant and accommodating.  It doesn't matter if they are working the morning, mid, swing or night shift.  You get warm delicious chocolate chip cookies when you check in and throughout your stay if you ask nicely.  I requested a microwave, fridge and corner room ahead of time and actually got all three.  Amazing!  The rooms are spacious enough.  You have a separate bedroom and a living room space.  Even though it's not located near other restaurants, it doesn't matter cause the hotel's Finn & Porter Round Bar is awesome!!!  The service is friendly and the food is sooo good.  Try the Roasted Chicken or the White Fish.  Even the chicken tenders are good.  You can also get a made to order fresh salad for like $6 for lunch.I definitely recommend this Doubletree if you're headed to convention center cause its a short walk!The hotel is typical for a Doubletree.  Rooms are nice and large. The breakfast you get as a Diamond member is just continental and doesn't include hot items.  Many other Doubletree's will give you a full breakfast, including hot breakfast, so this was a little disappointing.The one thing that was really annoying is they don't have self parking.  Valet is $23 and I had to wait 10+ minutes for my car.  With all the local parking lots in the area, they can definitely make a deal with one of the lots for guests to self park overnight.  It's one thing for a high, upscale hotel to only offer valet, but a hotel like this needs to offer self parking, in my opinion.  I will not be back unless they begin to offer self parking.The hubs and I stay at this hotel EVERY time we head downtown! We've always had great rooms, fantastic service and who doesn't like the warm chocolate chip cookies you are given when you check in?! Very close to a people mover station and is a pretty easy walk to get downtown.Our stay at the Doubletree was not without a few glitches, but the important stuff was outstanding.  The people, from check in to valet to wait staff, were friendly and attentive.  The room was very clean, big, and the bathroom was huge.  I would not hesitate to stay here again, but there could be some improvements.  Housekeeping never showed up to clean our room, which was no big deal, but we had to ask for new towels and then it took several hours for them to show up.  The wifi dropped connections a few times, and one of the TVs had to be fixed.  The food in the Round Bar was good, but it took forever to appear.  The server was attentive, but it took 25 minutes to get a sandwich when the bar was empty.  That evening the appetizers during happy hour also took 30 minutes to show up.  Breakfast is not included, and that would have been appreciated.I stayed here during the Movement music festival, and for the price we paid, I think it's a great value. The location is convenient to Hart Plaza and the ball park.  The hotel has many suites which have living room and bedroom separated, with a sleeper sofa in the living room, so there is plenty of space for a family or group of friends.  There is also a microwave and mini fridge so you can keep some food items in your room.  Everything was very clean when we checked in, and due to our fault (leaving the privacy sign out), our room did not get serviced every day; despite that, housekeeping checked in with us to make sure we had clean towels.  On the night we arrived, there was a problem with the air conditioning in the room.  The first person they sent to fix it did not get it working, but the next person I spoke to fixed the problem quickly and even gave me a number to reach him should we have any more problems. (Fortunately no further issues).  I have to say that even though I stayed there during a festival, when the majority of the guests were there for a festival and seemed to be partying at all hours of the night, when inside my room, there was no noise.  So the sound proving for rooms seems to be very good.Had a two room suite, rooms were nothing fancy. Clean, spacious, but isn't that what's expected? The best part about staying here were the chocolate chip cookies, reminded me of the ones they used to sell in the tins at Jacobson's. Am I showing my age by talking about Jacobson's? LoL Brunch on Sundays with the bottomless mimosas left me stumbling to my room. The biscuits and gravy were phenomenal!This hotel rocks.  My friend and I purchased our rooms on Hotwire:  $87 + tax.  Each of us got a 1 bedroom suite.  Our suites each contained a fluffy King-sized bed with two flat screen TVs.  The cool bathroom had long, soft towels and even the in room coffee service was pretty delicious.Lots of amenities contained in this hotel.  The "Round Bar" is a sports bar off the main lobby that's open until midnight.  There's a coffee shop serving espresso right off the front desk as well.  There's also a pretty rockin' Fitness Center on the 4th floor with all your favorite Precor cardio machines as well as a cable station and free weights & dumbells.  Pretty frickin' decent.$20 bucks per night to park -- that sucks.  But you're NOT gonna want to park in the street in this neighborhood, so suck it up.All-in-all a great value for a modest price.Spacious rooms. Very clean rooms. I'm an annoying about clean hotel rooms, and this one definitely passed the test. Great televisions so my whacked out mother could watch the Casey Anthony trial all day long and I could imagine Casey's attorney, Jose Baez, running his ginormous hands through my hair. Hate all you want on Detroit. I really love it. For realz. I do. This hotel is in a great location if you're going a Tigers game, going ghetto gambling or having dinner in Greektown. The parking situation is kind of weird on the street outside, so make sure to read the signs before parking for the night.The valets/doormen sucked though. They just stood there while my lovely mother struggled with her luggage. Shame on them for not having good manners. Other than that, I had no problems with this hotel. Oh, and for those of you who are super freak dog mommas, this hotel is pet friendly.this place stands alone, every thing from the rooms, to the gift bag you get when you arive.the food is awsome. and the bar is to die forGreat place.  Excellent value.I would like to relay some of my grievances I have with my recent stay at the Doubletree Hilton in Detroit during the days of 28-30 May.  We stayed in a double bed suite for ~$250/night, valet and taxes included.Beginning with our check-in, the hotel did not have our room ready as it was being cleaned.  We understood these things happen during holiday weekends, and we waited at the lobby bar for over an hour after being told it would be ready in 20-30 minutes.  Our luggage and electronic gear had already been unloaded from our vehicle by valet, and I requested that it be stored in a secure location until our room was available.  I returned to the front desk 45 minutes later to find it sitting in the lobby, unsecured and not readily viewable from the front desk.  After checking into our room, we found the windows closed, the air conditioning off and balmy 86F.  We ran the a/c for the next 24 hours, but with tepid results.  Thankfully we paid extra $50 for the corner suite, the extra square footage in a super 10ft wide hallway, a view of an abandoned office building, and no cross breeze.Around 8am every morning, the cleaning staff on our floor began checking rooms.  This procedure involved opening and closing many doors, which I understand completely.  However, the hydraulic units on each door are either not properly installed, or rated for a different door as they slam shut during the last 12-18" of closing.
