It was impossible to sleep during this time period.Other minor problems with our stay included:-only decaf coffee, sweet!-the coffee machine does not have a plug available within reach without moving the table or maker - thankfully it was on wheels, someone is thinking!-late check-out was 30 minutes or 1230pm -230pm checkout was an option if we paid half the cost of the room was an absurd option after waiting an extra hour to get in-valet parking was in an unsecured lot across the street, which I was assured while booking, the parking would be in a secured covered parking areaOn 01 June, I was charged an additional $310.70, and an additional $10 in separate charges to my credit card for unknown reasons.  I contacted Paul, a manager at the Doubletree Hilton in Detroit with my concerns, and was told I would receive a call back from a financial manager.  These additional charges have not been explained.  I called Hilton corporate and the Doubletree in Detroit for over a week every other day, and finally had the charges reversed.  I am reassured the speedy reversal in 2-5 business days.I would like to compliment the doormen, valet, and bellhop, as their service and demeanor was pleasant and extremely helpful during our stay in Detroit. I highly recommend staying at the Westin Book Cadillac two blocks away.  The only reason I stayed at the Doubletree was the double-suite availability.  I'd rather sleep in my car under the Ambassador bridge than stay here again.This brand new hotel in downtown Detroit just opened in December of 2008. I stayed there on the Tiger's opening day and was more than impressed! It is a beautiful hotel! The rooms are set up like suites featuring a separate room for the beds and a sitting room with a pullout couch. Perfect for multiple people crashing in one room. It's a little off the beaten path but it's really not that far of a walk from central downtown and there are People Mover stations easily accessible to get to sporting events, Greektown, etc. The best part? The fresh baked cookies upon arrival. Even at 2 AM after a full day of celebrating, we were treated to warm chocolate chip goodness!! I would definitely stay here again!!!This is a solid hotel with a great rate (when compared to other Hilton/Marriott options) downtown. Also worth noting: great breakfast buffet, free local shuttle and really impressive service from the front desk and restaurant staff - would absolutely recommend staying here.There are a few things that I normally shake my fist at in hotels - most notable are the lack of cream to go with the in-room coffee (no, an envelope of powdered Cremora doesn't count), and the lack of hair conditioner to go with the shampoo.  Here, two little individual real cream creamers were placed next to the coffee (perfect to sip with the welcome cookie).  The bathroom amenities were better than those found at most hotels, and included not only conditioner, but a Neutrogena day moisturizer with sunscreen (Patrick Bateman would be pleased, as was I) and actual facial cleanser in addition to typical bar soap.  The shower was nice, clean, and spacious enough for two, with sliding glass doors.  The room was a two-room set-up with one bedroom as well as a sitting area, with a fold out couch and desk.  Both rooms had flat screen tvs.  Bedding was extremely comfortable and dreamy to sleep on, and I most appreciated the modern decor and lack of "party prints" on any of the upholstery.   The Jacobean flourish carpet pattern in salt fork tan and espresso brown may seem like a laugh a few trend cycles into the future, but for now is suitably au courant in a hotel that is so far doing a good job of keeping itself sparkly in a city where other buildings are rapidly in decline.  This building was recently renovated - My boyfriend, a Detroit native, used to pass before it's renovation, and he thought it was a great turnaround.  The lobby is really beautiful with a marble staircase and stylish furniture.  I did not use the exercise room, but peeked in and it looked nice and well-stocked.  Only saw two people using it over the course of our two day stay.  All staff members were very friendly, and this hotel would be a deal at twice the price.  The only reasons I didn't give five stars: the view (or lack thereof), and the parking situation.  Valet parking is practically mandatory as there is no self park.  The valets were quick and friendly, but it was disappointing to notice as we left that the car had been kept in an unfenced lot right across the street.  Any other hotel where I have used valet has been underground or in a garage.  Our view was of another building, which would not be so bad if it had not been an abandoned (and perhaps soon to be demolished) building, which meant that the view was actually of an inexplicable collection of copy paper reams, old newspapers, an overturned orange cart, and pigeons.  Que sera sera... while the walls of the room featured classic Detroit-representational art (Fox Theatre, etc.), out our window was quintessential modern Detroit.  The best of both worlds.Fresh warm cookies on check in, prompt service, and stylishly comfortable suites  (even the pull-out sofa beds are comfy!) make the stay here memorable. I loved staying here and it's the best deal for hotels in the downtown area -- it cost $30 more for a standard room at the Courtyard Marriott, which is situated a mile away, versus a whole suite here. It's a beautiful hotel with a clean, airy lounge/restaurant downstairs, free Wi-Fi and big, fluffy towels. Had no complaints and would definitely stay here again.Excellent service.  Clean, large room with sitting area in addition to bedroom.  Good thermostat and as a plus the windows actually open, something that you dont always see in hotels anymore.  Close to people mover.  Take it to Greek town if you're looking for bar scene outside of the Anchor Bar just down the street.Amazing cookies. Very nice hotel room with shampoo+ conditioner that fill up everyday! And nice blowdryer too. And beds. Super comfortable beds. Great service and very convenient dt locationAmazing hotel, right in the heart of downtown Detroit. Beautiful rooms, great service, perfect for more than one night! A real treat! Wish we could've stayed longer. Worth every penny and then some.

review_content: One of the best hotels in the area. I stayed here for almost a week and I really loved it. The room: I stayed in a suite and it was clean, large, comfortable, and overall very pleasant to stay in. The bathroom was huge and the sitting area was separated from the bedroom by a pair of doors. The decoration of the room was simple and modern. For me the most important part of a hotel experience is the cleanliness and The Henry really shinned here. There was no dust, and no stains on the couches or sheets.The food: The room service was surprisingly delicious. The grilled cheese sandwich had a generous amount of cheese that was melted well and paired with a tasty tomato dipping sauce. The souffle was also delightful and really satisfied my sweet tooth. The service: everyone was kind and courteous and very willing to help. The rooms were always kept very clean, and the room service always arrived in a very timely fashion. This was some of the best service I've ever received during a hotel stay. The lobby is also pretty cool. They have tons of art on the walls that I believe are actually for sale.I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in or around the Dearborn area.My work team stayed at the Henry for a few weeks for a project in Detroit and was certainly one of the nicer hotels we've stayed at. Beautiful decor and very clean; our rooms were spacious and the service was great. They had a concierge lounge open for platinum members, so my team and I would re-group after the day with cocktails and free appetizers / desserts. The surrounding areas of the hotel weren't the best, but it's not like we were walking around at night. All in all, very comfortable stay and we will definitely be returning again in the future - Best,CharlieI've stayed at this hotel a few times for a nice parents getaway. We really enjoy the restaurant inside the hotel that is mostly the reason we stay. This last trip we enjoyed the spa facilities. The pool is nice along with the spa pool. My only complaint is that it would have been nice if they had lockers for your clothes. The staff at this hotel really go out of their way to make you feel like a VIP. They keep the same employees so you see a lot  of familiar faces when you come and to me that says a lot about the way the hotel is ran. The food in the restaurant is always changing and is absolutely delicious .The chef  really takes great pride in the menu and food quality. This would be a great venue for a wedding or event. We have also enjoyed the Mother's Day brunch this past year which was phenomenal.Super swanky hotel. I mean, really swanky. High ceilings, crown molding, sparkling chandeliers and wall art renders this spot a luxurious feel for an affordable price. Stay here if you come to Detroit. You'll be 20-30 minutes to anywhere.Rooms are comfortable and the linens are fantastic. Fluffy! Makes you want to just plop on the bed and take a nap. Well, we didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on the food here. But it did seem pricey like your typical marked-up-for-the service hotel. I do have to say, though, I really enjoyed the art on the walls. It is so full of color and texture. Just a really nice touch. 2 out of 3 computers weren't working in the business center. Bummer. (my station felt like it was operating on internet speed from 1998). And I only wish there was an outdoor courtyard or dining area. This would have been such a great bonus on our recent trip during the 4th of July. Would have been perfect for watching fireworks. Instead, we had some really great service on July 4th. The bartender opened our bottle of wine when we forgot our bottle opener. And the front desk agent gave us access to the 10th floor exclusive lounge where we watched fireworks late at night - complete with a panoramic view of the Detroit skyline and ambassador bridge.I'm really impressed with the service and the luxurious vibe here. Just get that internet crankin' up and point me to the outdoor patio area, okay?I finally found a place I can call home when I'm visiting Detriot! First, it's close enough to the airport. I love the actual hotel location as there is plenty to do right around it with decent food and shopping options. Second, it's an old Ritz, and a new autograph. It's just has a classy feel with excellent service. The rooms are very comfortable with a decent sized bathroom. The bed was excellent with different options of pillows! They have 24 hour room service which is so nice when you get in late. I love the art... It's everywhere and they give art tours on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The gym is pretty big and has plenty of equipment which is always a plus!There is self park and valet options. The bar and restaurant Tria is a great option! By far the best place I have stayed while working in Detroit!Its a nice hotel , it has this old nice touch to it. I love every single minute i spend there, the room service was fast and amazing. I asked for a bottle opener and I got within a minute, literally. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is the valet service. I parked at the main entrance and waited for someone to get out and take my car, but no one did. I looked around to see if im at the right entrance, i was. I actually parked really close to the sign that says valet parking. After a while i got a little bit sick of waiting so i took it to myself to park my car behind the hotel. The weather was really cold. And I would give the hotel five stars but maybe next time.This was my first visit back here since it changed names, from the Ritz Carlton.  I still love this property!  Rooms are very nice, staff is incredible.  I went to celebrate an anniversary with my husband and we had dinner there as well.  It is a great get away for locals who want to spend a nice evening at a nice hotel.  However, I am sad the surrounding area isn't what it once was.  I am not sure there is much to offer outside of the hotel itself.I'm back and how much I love this hotel. I found long hair on the shower wall, no in the shower, literally on the shower wall. I wouldn't expect this from a hotel where I spend my hard earned at. (Over $200 a night..)Great hotel with impressive art. Very nicely appointed and with many nice touches. A step above the Ritz Carlton level consistent with the Autograph Collection feel. Definitely worth staying in Dearborn rather than downtown Detroit.   Would definitely recommend to friends.Great hotel, staff was incredible, parking was a little bit tough as space is limited for self parking. They do offer valet service, but didn't catch the price.Beautiful art gallery inside with many different types of art. Many are for sale too. Concierge lounge was nice and attendant was very pleasant. Seemed fairly busy most of the times I visited. Loved the snacks available, nice to take back to your room.Located right off the highway, but not many restaurants nearby. They do have a restaurant on site, but didn't try it. Did have room service one night and pizza was good and hot. Close to some of the attractions, but unfortunately I was here for business. I hope to stay here again in the future.The art in the lobby is a major plus! Reasonably close to the airport, free parking, easy to get in and out of...would stay again.What an absolutley beautiful hotel, but beauty isn't only skin deep.The beauty of the hotel is it's decor and rooms. My daughter and some of her wedding party stayed here the night before her big day and their wedding night. The location was close to the church. The room they stayed in was huge with a separate living/meeting with a half bath area and separate bedroom with it's own bathroom. The bedroom area was spaceous and the bathroom huge. Very clean roomsand well stocked with amenities!There are two things that make wedding pictures sing out beauty and quality. The first is the photographer(sorry Henry) and the second is the location/background(Yeah, Henry). The background for photographs are outstanding whether in the room, lobby, hallway, outside or just about anywhere as eveidenced by other reviewers. Instead of a lot more pictures at the church the party decided to go back here for additional pictures. They came out great!Now for the "not skin only deep" part. The staff was outsatnding opening with the concierge. He was quite helpful in manyways. The reception desk staff, outstanding. Everywhere we went the staff all had smiles and a friendly welcome.One more daughter, one more wedding. I think I'll start my wedding affairs here first. Anybody coming in to town whether friends or business I will recommend this hotel. They won't be dissapointed.A little overrated.  Bar is always very loud. Rooms are normal. Breakfast is expensive.Stayed at The Henry last week for the first time in my many trips to Dearborn. This was a quick utility stop when my business trip got extended by a day; I checked out at 5AM after a one night stay. Very friendly front desk staff. Rooms are bigger than usual for a Marriott property. Comfortable beds. Artwork everywhere. The Tria restaurant is very good if pricey.Nicely appointed bathroom with quality products.This property has something of a reputation for not posting your Marriott Rewards points - I've seen reports that you actually have to request posting of points to your account. I hope that's wrong, but 8 days after my stay and my points/stay haven't posted.I prefer the Dearborn Inn - which is one of my favorite hotels and favorite Marriott properties anywhere, but if they're full, as seems to often be the case, this will likely be my go-to Dearborn hotel.+ Very comfortable room, flawless internet, outstanding service, nice restaurant-  Self Parking Lot can be a long cold walk when it's fullIt's now a year later and this hotel has improved on everything I previously mentioned in my last review.  I stayed here for the Detroit auto show this past weekend and it could not have been better. The room had a nice view of the city, it was quiet, had a mini fridge, thick bed comforters, internet download speeds that were super fast for a hotel (7+ Mbps), a heating system working perfectly, and the TRIA restaurant that was wonderful for breakfast.  They offer a nice breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast, various fruits, high quality breads, and a station for preparing you a custom omelette).  Along with the hallways of the hotel, the inside of the restaurant has various artwork throughout and is connected to a waiting room with a classic piano.  A very nice touch.The only downside of the hotel relates to the location of the self parking lot.  It's a bit of a walk from the lot to the front entrance at peak periods, and feels even longer when it's super cold out.  But, there is a valet service which solves that issue if you really don't want to walk.  Other than that, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Detroit / Dearborn area.  Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby, and it being right near the highway, makes it especially convenient.  And I have to say, all the staff at the hotel, from the front desk (hats off to Domingo!) to all the restaurant servers, were just outstanding.  They were always smiling, chatting with you, promptly providing you with what you needed, making you feel right at home.  It's rare to find a hotel which exceeds in so many areas and I certainly look forward to my next stay at this 5 star facility!My husband and I had our wedding reception here (15 years ago) when it was still a Ritz-Carlton, so when we were invited to an event here, we of course agreed!The interior has been completely renovated and is more upscale modern than before, as it is now owned by Marriott. The event was a charity benefit with a "strolling dinner". This just translates to "schlep all over the room to stand in line at different buffets". The food was very good, especially for buffet, but logistically was a nightmare - lines were long, each buffet station had different items, so if you wanted to try everything, you were going to be there a while. There was not a lot of opportunity to visit with your table since everyone was at different stations and coming back and eating at different times - my husband and I stayed together in the lines just so that we would not be sitting at the table eating alone while everyone else was in a line somewhere.When I pulled up to a handsome man in a top hat I knew this was going to be a spectacular experience. I stayed here years ago when it was the Ritz Carlton and was sad to see it was now The Henry. Fortunately, the Henry left a lasting impression during my visit. This is my kind of hotel. It's posh and luxurious. If you loved the Henry when it was the Ritz, you will love this hotel just the same.Loved my bed, it was extremely comfortable. My view, as always, was wonderful. Nice contemporary decor and updated amenities. The workout facility is a joke. I believe there were two, maybe three treadmills and one eliptical machine. The univeral weight system seemed only slightly big enough to accomodate 1 1/2 people. They really need to consider renovating the workout facility. Many travelers take great pride in continuing their workout while away from home. When there are so many hotels to choose from, many travelers, myself included, will often opt for the hotel with the better workout facility. Fortunately, I am a Marriott snob and the Henry Autograph Collection is supreme. So, I opted to work with the minimal workout offerings.The best part about my stay was the magnificent Concierge Lounge located on the 10th floor. Unlike most Marriott Concierge Lounges, the Henry offered what seemed to be the entire floor dedicated for Concierge service. You literally walk off of the elevator directly into the Concierge Lounge. There are always wonderful offerings throughout the day. Absolutely splended. The Renaissance Downtown Marriott should definitely take note. Their Concierge Lounge lacked in so many ways.I will definitely return.Hotel pretends to be more than it is. Overrated art adorns the lobbies (although there are a few paintings by real masters). Staff is attentive. Rooms are adequate but not luxurious. Wifi works as it should. Bed comfortable. Bedrooms not well appointed, but large. Conference rooms well below average. Food is very good but overpriced. Overall some pluses and some negatives. But compared to the hype not so great.Ok so this hotel is amazing. I love the art I love the executive lounge and the rooms are large and have all amenities.The Henry is wonderful. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful; during our stay, we noted that we didn't encounter a single staff-member that didn't smile at us. The artwork is also such a beautiful feature. All the amenities that The Henry offers are just notably all-around great. Our room was on the 8th floor, we weren't too excited to be able to look into the offices directly across the way. That said, it didn't interfere with our overall experience - the hotel was BEAUTIFUL, we loved our room. It was spacious and comfortable. We also really enjoyed their restaurant, Tria. We just had such a wondeful experience, this Marriott location has really earned their name. We cannot wait to return.
review_content_20: This is one of the best business destination hotels I've ever stayed at. I've stayed at The Henry Hotel over a dozen times in the past year and half for business. It's absolutely beautiful from the lobby to the bedrooms; the photos don't do it justice. The staff and service is impeccable. Everyone is friendly, professional and on their game. They don't have high turnover, so I got to know several of the staff through my stays. The food is delicious; definitely not cheap price-wise but not the absolute most expensive either. The chef knows how to create delicious and engaging meals that satisfy. I was forced to stay at another hotel nearby when The Henry was booked and the differences were alarming. It showed me that The Henry is well-priced (food was worse and more expensive at the other hotel), clean (the other hotel was dirty and items in the room were broken), and has amazing staff and customer service (the other hotel staff were rude and there was no customer service present). Do yourself a favor and unwind from the day's work here. You won't be sorry.Beautiful hotel; the friendly staff was very courteous and helpful and my room was very clean, well stocked and comfortable. I especially enjoy the feather pillows! However no breakfast buffet and the only option for miles is the Tria buffet which is grossly overpriced and not worth $23! Also, the pool was closed "for renovations" The worse thing for me was the fan located in the bathrooms; they run continually and there is no way to turn them off. Also, the room doors are so heavily made that they tend to get away from you and slam really loud.This is a really nice, swanky hotel. They overdo it a little with the art (it's seriously everywhere - front desk, lobby, hallways, your room) but they're all nice pieces and I think they're on display for sale anyway.If you have the points.. the 10th floor breakfast is great! Real classy, real silverware, just a couple hot options (eggs, toast) but plenty overall (cold cereal, lots of drinks, pastries, muesli). yelp.com/biz_photos/oA-l...There were just some logistical stuff they messed up on, which was fairly easily fixed. A big group of us were staying here for a friend's wedding and the reception forgot to hand out their wedding gift bag upon our check in. When we reserved, we requested extra towels and we didn't get any. We called the desk for extras and this took forever, almost making us late for the rehearsal dinner (4 of us, 1 shower = timing is crucial!). Also my friend booked using her rewards membership and this was not part of our reservation. She had to get on the phone with them for quite a while to get us access to the free breakfast.We had the rehearsal dinner in the private rooms downstairs. Saladyelp.com/biz_photos/oA-l...was good, mains not so much (the chickenyelp.com/biz_photos/oA-l...- too sweet! And dry. Salmonyelp.com/biz_photos/oA-l...was ok), and the dessertsyelp.com/biz_photos/oA-l...fantastic. We got a huge platter of mini pastries!To be clear, I'm not saying this is a two star hotel. I'm saying that per Yelp's rating descriptions my reaction to them saying they're a 4 star hotel is "Meh. I've experienced better."Let's take a chronological tour through my stay, starting with the horrific parking situation. I expect parking trouble when staying in a city, but not this far out in the suburbs. I ended up parking completely around the back of the building, and for some strange reason ALL the doors from the back are for employees only. You would think they would make at least one of the doors for guests. Instead I hiked around the building from the back in the bone-chilling Michigan weather. Not a good start to my stay.Next comes the lobby and checkin. The lobby and hallways are gorgeous, and the checkin experience was flawless. This part was definitely a 4 star experience. I was really expecting the gorgeous hotel to continue into the room, but was disappointed. There was nothing wrong with the room, it wasn't dated and nothing was broken, but it didn't match the 4 star feel of the rest of the hotel. It was just sort of unimpressive. The room was 3 star all the way. Adequate.When we did have a problem with the room it unearthed the fact that they don't clean very well. When we took a shower the drain wasn't draining, so we pulled it out and a TON of hair came with it. So we threw it on the floor and left it for the cleaning lady. When we came back the room was "cleaned" but the drain with a huge clump of hair was still sitting right in the middle of the bathroom floor. That means housekeeping came in, made the bed, straightened up, then left. There is absolutely no way they could have actually cleaned the floor without seeing the drain.When we told the front desk they sent someone up to fix the drain immediately and comped a night, but I will definitely never stay here again. There is no way I would trust that they actually cleaned.What was really outstanding in this hotel was the restaurant. Oftentimes hotel food, even luxury hotel food, is not very good. This was not the case at all with The Henry's food.We stayed here for a 20th anniversary family event. Lots of my family work for Ford in Dearborn (or "Fords" as we say in Windsor) and now live in the area so we thought a swank hotel stay might be nice.The Henry really met expectations. Room rates were reasonable (we got a $99 a night group rate). Even without the discount the room rate was reasonable. The hotel under the new owners has been dolled up with the amazing Roaring 20s/Great Gatsby theme. The art work is amazing. Your room comes with two vouchers for the breakfast buffet next morning. It's a quality spread, including smoked salmon. The sausage, however, was nothing to write home about.The workout room is well equipped. Nothing I hate more than a hotel with a Sears treadmill and an old stationary bike. The pool/hot tub are a bit small and the hot tub could be hotter but all 'n' all quite nice.Service is exceptional across all facets. The only thing I'm dinging them a star for:1) They turned the ice machines off on the odd floors. Sure, during winter maybe but when it's a hot humid summer and all you want is ICE I want it on my damn floor. I don't want to have to go down a floor to get damn ice. 2) Parking, while complimentary, can be tight when there's a wedding. There is overlfow on weekends in the office complex next door.3) The "freebies" in the bathroom could have been a bit more glitzy. But that's just a minor point.Random stuff:1) Free, passwordless wireless.2) Free earbud phones in the gym3) Walking distance to Fairlane mall and a movie theater. 4) I noticed they had Korean OB beer at the bar. I asked the bartender about this. She said the hotel was owned by Koreans and they kept some on hand for Korean business people. OB was my favorite beer in Korea.We stayed here for a few nights while attending a wedding held on-site. Overall, this is a beautiful hotel and cost shockingly little for the quality ($99 per night wedding rate).We were very pleased with our room. My only complaint is that housekeeping came late in the day and we found ourselves grabbing coffee in the lounge because our room wasn't ready around 2pm. Staff was generally very helpful and pleasant to talk to, and gave us detailed advice on where to run nearby.The wedding itself was gorgeous. There was also another wedding next door, and the comparison was sort of amazing. The two weddings had completely different decors, but were equally lovely. Clearly the staff at the Henry is committed to helping people personalize their event.The public areas near the lobby are decorated--the word that comes to mind is "littered"--with paintings for sale. Personally I don't care for this cluttered look, and I was shocked by some of the prices on the artwork ($36,000 for one painting!). Still, it did provide a lot of visual interest when walking through the corridors.I recommend checking out the Henry for a Dearborn-area stay. It's an elegant change of pace from the typical chain hotels.The conference facility is nice, but if you're gluten-free, beware. I'm not, by I was with a few people who are and they received a smallish side salad for lunch. No chicken or protein of any kind. The chef brought out some grilled chicken about an hour later after people complained. They tried to make it right, but somebody obviously missed a memo somewhere.One of the best hotel experiences of my life and that's really 100% due to Henry's itself. It is not located in one of the wonders of the world, nor does it have great views or any natural beauty like that. The Henry, simply shines with its artsy decor, service, attention to detail, and comfort. The rates are very reasonable as well.Each time we stay The Henry gets better. The staff are the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel. The only place to stay when in Dearborn or going to The Henry Ford.Beautiful hotel, wonderful, accommodating staff -- no matter who you came into contact with. I was greeted warmly by the person in the hotel gift shop, the folks working in the restaurant, the folks at the front desk, the cleaning staff -- every single person had the same positive demeanor!The bed and room were super comfortable, and the food -- I experienced the lunch as part of the conference I was attending as well as a salad for dinner-- was outstanding. The only thing I noticed was that noise from the hallway could be heard pretty clearly in the guest rooms -- certainly not the fault of the hotel if guests are loud in the hallway! But if, for example, they are vacuuming or conversations are taking place in the hallway, you will hear them pretty clearly in your room.That aside, however, I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel, and would stay here again in a heartbeat!Who knew such a fantastic hotel was hidden in the Detroit subarb of Dearborn! I was traveling to the area on business and was when I heard "Detroit" I was expecting to have to fend for myself in a post-apopocalyptic Walking Dead type situation. Imagine my surprise when I pulled into the luxurious lobby the Henry, with the valet in a top hat and tails, Picasso and other legends of art hanging on the walls, and a staff that bent over backwards to meet my (many) needs. Still not big on the city or the area, but, but this fantastic hotel certainly made my visit much more enjoyable and comfortable.This used to be the Ritz Carlton, but is now a Marriott property. The rooms are a good size and clean. Beds are very comfortable and the service is nothing short of a four star hotel. We hosted an event here and the catering staff was very helpful. They did their very best to accomodate our groups needs. The food was just okay for hotel catering food, which is what you can expect from hotels. The gym is small but has the basics that you need. There is not too much around the hotel except a mall. They do have a deal worked out with the town cars at the airport in which they will charge you a flat rate including tip, which was just like $5 more than a taxi. Definitely a place I will return the next time I am in the area.Overall, a very pleasant hotel located close to most everything in the area. The staff was extremely friendly when needed, and invisible when not. They have a clean workout area, and a nice pool for families.A couple of minor things dinged this one for me. When we made it to our room, there was a water bottle still partly under the one bed, so it appeared to not be as cleaned as could possibly be.I also noticed the shower vent/fan located in the shower had a tremendous amount of dust/gunk in it, and really could use cleaning. It just a pet peeve, and the little things are what folks notice. When you walk in and are greeted by gentlemen in top hats, and six figure art pieces for sale, you don't expect these types of little things.Upon our arrival, The Indiana University football team was staying here, so that reinforced its a decent place. Saturday, the Cincinnati Bengals checked in as well. Therefore, with the budgets these teams have, they could have stayed anywhere but chose here.The hotel has a lot of unique artwork located throughout the lobbies and waiting areas. It makes for a really unique touch!It's not five stars, but most likely one of the nicer hotels in the area given the teams who had a presence here over our weekend stay.Great hotel , helpful staff , massive selection of local beer and a very good restaurant , breakfast it also very good, especially from the menuI recently stayed at this hotel while I was in town for a wedding and had a pretty terrific experience here. The hotel is very contemporary with lots of great art on the walls and very modern colors and decor throughout the hotel. It is one of the better hotels in the area, and still very affordable.The amenities at the hotel are great - they have a good restaurant (but get the room service - its faster), a nice fitness center and a nice pool/whirlpool area. The rooms are also modern but come with great touches such as feather pillows and duvets, plush robes to use during your stay and a nice coffee bar in your room. The rooms are all equipped with both wired and wireless wi-fi, above basic cable (HBO) and even video games (if you wanna pay to play). My only gripe about the hotel is the elevator system. You are given a key card that goes to your room, but you also have to use this key card to get to your floor by way of their elevator. This is very inconvenient and I can't tell you how many times during my stay that I had to ride all the way up to, then down, then back to my floor because it didn't always work before the elevator started moving or because I simply couldn't get the card in fast enough seeing that I was on the 2nd floor. Not to mention that if you are with a large party who are staying on multiple floors, it makes it almost impossible to go to that floor because your key card only wants to let you off at the floor you are staying on. I know that they are concerned about security, but when it that much of an inconvenience to your guests to use the elevator it is time for a better system.Hotel room was spacious, and the bathroom had some really nice touches. It was probably my favorite part of my stay due to the marble from floor to vanity making it feel bright and spacious.The bed was nice, but still can't compare to the Heavenly bed at Westins. The lobby was nice, but the workout room was a little small. The artwork was ok, but don't expect a museum.. I spent no more than 10 minutes going through the collection. Parts of the ground floor were still under construction.The Henry, formerly a Ritz Carlton, is alright. The decor is somewhat distracting and disjointed, but it comes very close to actually working. The food I had was alright. The service was alright. All in all, it's a place that's, well, just alright. There's nothing overtly wrong with it, but what strikes me about the Henry is that if you had the right management in place, this venue could be world class. It's situated just right, the basic structure is there, but in its current iteration, it's, well, just alright.Nice hotel and conference rooms. Excellent service from the staff, I would certainly come back for another stay.This hotel is especially nice for an older hotel, with big modern rooms and nice bathrooms. Elevators are pretty quick as well. I didn't hear ANY noise from the hallway or other rooms.The big con is the free wireless internet doesn't seem to work too well- it's slow if it works at all (both on my computer and for others I stayed with). The fitness room is tiny for the size of the hotel, with three ellipticals and three treadmills, so expect a line at 6 AM. There also isn't much convenient parking.So you're in Dearborn, Michigan. Lord only knows why you're in Henry 'Too Much Jew' Ford-land. I am because my sister, brother-in-law, and nephew live here. The fam has stayed at the Dearborn Inn many times and while it was comfortable, affordable, and the employees were nice; it was lacking in charm and amenities. Lo and behold I found a lovely and charming spot to rest my weary head while visiting. Anyone who leaves less then a four star review for this hotel is picky and is probably an irritating person. I stay at hotels all of the time. Constantly. It's part of my job to stay at places that look good on paper then disappoint in real life. This place is legit.Not only is it a quirky, artistic spot but also I've always been greeted kindly by the front desk people and all staff. Without fail I've repeatedly gotten a lovely room with a large desk and extension cord in order to do work, ugh, on. The Internet has never been spotty and I've been able to access it from my room, lobby, and restaurant with no issues whatsoever. By the way, eat at Tria. They've updated their service to include tablet menus. Adorable. You can see photos of the dishes they serve and in very navigatable tabs. You also receive drink recommendations to go along with your entree. I've found it best to stick to wine or beer with my meal because the alcoholic drinks are mixed with a heavy hand. Some people may prefer that, do with that knowledge what you wish.The beds are fluff balls of comfort, the bathrooms always seem to have enough water and adequate pressure to satisfy my shower and bathing needs, and the maids are kind and willing to part with extras to make your stay more comfortable.This is the best hotel to stay in Dearborn, it's a Marriott and prides itself on quality. I always forget to check out the art museum but always am amused by the bits and pieces scattered throughout the entryway (also I'd steal those white leather club chairs at the entrance in a minute if I didn't think the top hatted concierge wouldn't come after me.)Stay here if you are here. Really, it's lovely. Check out the pool and art gallery for me and let me know about it.
review_content_40: "Artsy, Unique, Great Value"Love the design and personality - arts on the wall, grand piano in the ballroom, unique decor, beautiful chandeliers...A boutique feel.There is also a gallery on site that offers guests a tour of the arts - guests also get a piece of art reprint for free.The room is contemporary and very bright.Great service, courteous staff.Very reasonable price.Convenient location, close to Fairlane Town Center Mall and Ford HQs. The area surrounding it is nice and safe.Absolutely love it!This is a retired Ritz Carlton, I would rate it higher, but since they seem to not realize I stayed with them for the first two nights of my five night stay, I have to rate them low.The building has been used, and used well, the L button on the elevators has been so well used that the the L has been worn off!The staff were friendly enough, the room was OK, nothing spectacular (if they knew I was staying there - they might even have made my room up on a daily basis)The lobby bar and eatery was fine, the food was fine.I attended four days of meetings in their meeting spaces, and that was fine.  Location is good, close to the highways, a major shopping mall and FORD World Headquaters.My biggest concern is that they don't seem to know they have guests staying there, glad they did not give the room I was staying in to anyone else.We stayed at this hotel this past Saturday night and I really enjoyed everything about it. The rooms were nice, updated, and clean. My only complaint would have to be that we could not get ahold of room service Sunday morning. We had preordered breakfast delivered to the room and needed togo cups for the coffee. Overall a great establishment for the going rate.So, I pretty much LIVED in this hotl for about 80 nights this year.  As the other reviews note, this is a retired Ritz hotel and is a part of the Autograph collection of Marriott hotels.  PROS: VERY attentive staff, from the doormen (one top hat man in particular) to the front desk ladies who knew me by name and especially the ladies who manned the concierge lounge (free top-shelf booze makes everyone happy). The food and ambiance in the restaurant was very nice.  I recommend the scallops!The room service was good, for a hotel.  I enjoyed the Henry salad with Salmon and they can pretty much bring up anything from the restuarant. Like I said before, the concierge lounge was prestine.  The food is the best free lounge food I have ever tasted.  The ladies were awesome and the drinks were FREE. Bed was comfortable.  Towels were fluffy.  Sheets were soft. Front desk kept my bag for me behind the counter every week and had my key ready when I walked in the door. Valet guys were very attentive.  If it was raining or I couldn't find parking in the back, they'd valet me for free (I think).CONS: The building is a bit older.  Found myself saying multiples times "I don't know how this was every a Ritz."The fitness room could be expanded into another area of the hotel: conference rooms, 2nd floor. The Lions stayed here for part of their training camp.  They took over the hotel! I understand that they had a deal with the hotel.  They blocked off more than half the parking lot for their expesive toy cars and left very little parking for the rest of us.  They sped like maniacs in the parking lot and I almost got run over a few times.  I'm more complaining about the players than the hotel.  Overall, the staff treated me like family and bent over backwards for any little need I had, from workout socks I forgot to a ride to the local sushi restaurant in the dark.  I had a great time here and would recommend this hotel to ANYONE in the Detroit area, no matter how far you are staying away from the hotel.  They even gave me a going away gift of a bottle of my favorite wine during my last week. Thanks for everything, Henry staff!Beautiful Detroit. From room 1023. Stay at a ART Gallery! Terrific!!!As an Event Specialist, working with hotels and venues to create a memorable experience for clients is half the battle. Furthermore, working with vendors means you have to trust them enough to represent your brand as they are an extension of your service for a few days. The Henry Hotel did an incredible job. I worked with Alison C., on everything from planning the menus during our meeting days to the floor plan of our meeting room and beyond. She served as a liason for the AV Tech team, the service and banuqet staff, as well as the front desk adn transportation. All of which were attentive, personable and very professional. The food at their restaurant (try the salmon or any of their specials) is amazing. We asked for alot during our stay and they consistently delivered. The hotel itself is refreshing and feels like a clean, modern but quaint hotel with gorgeous art lining the cheerful walls. This place is truly a gem! Thanks Henry Hotel - for an incredible few days!I've never actually STAYED at the hotel - I've only been here for a required work meeting (a THREE HOUR LONG meeting, that was on a Monday NIGHT until 9-friggen-pm!!)/dinner program. Sooooo.... my review will be about my experience with The Henry in regards to that!The place, first off, is quite pretty. Well, the parts of the building I saw were pretty - the lobby, the hallways to the large meeting room, and the room itself were all quite lovely. I was seriously underwhelmed by the food. The salmon was a bit boring - not a whole lot of flavor - and the not-really-creamy polenta just sat on the plate literally like it had been scooped out of a bucket. It was odd. The dessert - a chocolate mousse topped with fresh berries and a weird 1" thick vanilla-ish wafer/crisp thing (that was SO HARD you couldn't actually friggen eat it) - was equally unimpressive.The parking is also really, really weird. I don't like that you have to park all the way behind the building, or way off to the side (unless you valet, of course).LOVED THIS HOTEL.  Wasn't there long enough but it is a huge improvement over that hideous Hyatt that was there before.I travel a lot and Detroit is always referred to as De-Troilet by the rest of the crew. This hotel saved our opinion of this city. It's basically a Ritz with a different name, owned by the same people. The art is fun to look at as you walk through the hallways. My wife is an interior designer and all about art so if I ever travel with her to the Detroit area we'll be staying here.Well-kept, classic digs. Decent gym and pool, both smallish.Pricey wine at the bar.Free wired Internet / wifi.Beautiful art everywhere. Spacious, but yet isn't a hotel that you'll get lost in. Rooms were immaculate; metropolitan enough without being modern tacky. Food was great at all functions of the Indian wedding. If in the area, I would not consider staying anywhere else.So what happens when a Ritz-Carlton is de-flagged?  Well, in this instance it dropped into Marriott's "Autograph" collection of independently-owned upscale hotels.  While I liked this property back in its Ritz-Carlton days, it was admittedly one of the weak sisters in the R-C family, and was definitely in need of some refreshing and updating.  I was curious to see how The Henry would compare with the old R-C.The most notable change is in the lobby.  The dark wood paneling has been painted over in blue and white, and the walls are filled with lots of colorful paintings, all of which are for sale.  Personally, I liked the classic feel of the dark wood, but the new paint definitely brightens things up. The old bar and restaurant have also been updated and combined into a single, open room.  If you like contemporary spaces, you will like the new look.  If you liked the old bar, you will be disappointed, as it now looks pretty much like everything else built in the last ten years.  I had breakfast a couple mornings, and the food was fine, and the servers were excellent.  The breakfast buffet is a decent value, but could use a bit more variety.  I rarely order room service, but on my first night I ordered pasta with grilled shrimp.  It was delivered quickly, the food was served hot, it was delicious.    Despite being in one of the newly-renovated rooms (534, to be exact), the furniture, walls and doors already show quite a bit of wear and tear, and the room had the unmistakable odor of cigarette smoke.  The whole thing looked to have been hastily done, without much thought or care.  Oddly, while the wood headboard unit was pre-drilled for reading lamps, they were never installed.  And while the lobby was filled with art, not a single print or even a mirror was hung from the walls of the room.  On the upside, the bed was comfortable, and the LG flat-panel TV included HD channels.  And a really big plus:  there is good internet connectivity throughout the hotel available at no charge!The fitness center is pretty much the same as it ever was, which is to say small and dark.  They really need to spend some money and improve this space.  I did not check the pool, but I assume it has not changed, either.  As for location, The Henry is very convenient if you have business at Ford or another local business.  The Fairlane Town Center mall is adjacent to the hotel.  While I used to go here frequently, after this last trip it was clear that the mall is feeling the effects of the long recession.  Also nearby is the Henry Ford Museum, which is a must-see attraction if you have the time.  A car or taxi is pretty much a necessity.  I would advise against walking between the hotel and mall after dark.  Once the workday is over, this area is pretty desolate.Overall, for the price, The Henry is a good choice if you are in Dearborn on business.  Many of the staff from the R-C days remain, which meant prompt, professional, and courteous service throughout my entire stay.I love this hotel when staying in Dearborn. Close to everything Ford. Friendly staff and decent hotel restaurant. Nice rooms and amenities.Excellent staff and very fast room service and request filling. Clean rooms and great TV! Free wifi and pretty safe parking lot. Highly recommended!Wonderful hotel.  Undoubtedly the best hotel experience my family and I have had in a very long time.  From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we felt like we were truly appreciated and accommodated in every way.   My family, with three boys 6 years old and under, can need some special care sometimes.  Bottle needs to be warmed, forgot spoons for ice cream, need quick room service.  This hotel did it all with amazing, friendly staff to make our one night stay not only convenient but truly enjoyable. Food at Tria was on the pricier side, but you get what you pay for... Very good food.  Swimming pool and fitness room- top class. Art work- like a small fine arts gallery.  Feeling like your every need will be met is priceless.... Especially with a young family.   We will be coming back, even if its just another quick trip because this hotel was a true gem that makes their guests want to return.  Not just run like a business as every other hotel out there does.  5+ stars.This is a VERY nice hotel.  if you want to impress family or friends, put them up at this place when they come to town.  I can't use the word beautiful because it's not really elegant or anything.   It's modern and loaded with art everywhere, even has Picasso and Chagall.  We stayed in a King Suite on a Friday and used a travelzoo voucher.  The guy who made the reservation went on about the complimentary all day snacks, night time desserts, and drinks that you get with the Suite.  So imagine our disappointment when we get there hungry and ready to dig into some hotel snacks and the lady at the front desk tells us that  the deal description was incorrect (sent out mass clarification emails)  and there were actually no free snacks on weekends or for the deal whatsoever.   Several Reese cups held us over til we dined at Tria (another review).   So anyway, the room was incredible.  It was huge, clean, 2 big TVs, walk in shower and  bathtub in one bathroom and another 1/2 bathroom.  The art was very cool.     They even have an interesting and informative video  on one of the TV channels about the different artists whose work is featured in the hotel . "Ooh we saw that, and that,  and OMG  he did the ones in the room   LOL.   As someone mentioned, the thermostat seemed to have a mind of its own, but I figured it out and it was nice and toasty from there on out.  Pillows were so soft. This was the second time at a hotel I had to see who made the bedding items-same place.   The view  wasn't good.  I don't know what was out there, a hill and some miniature chimney things,  but who cared because the room was so nice.  We didn't really spend any time in the living room.  OK so no problems with the room.  But, the only real complaint would be about the whirlpool not being hot enough.   Just wasn't hot enough to feel therapeutic.  The pool wasn't warm either.  The sauna wasn't hot enough and the timer was broken  so I just waited  til I broke a lil sweat. Another note was that the hotel did not allow early check in or late check out.  It wasn't even up for discussion or negotiation.  However, I think this is definitely one of the best, if not the best hotel in Michigan.  If I had more money to blow  I would prefer to stay multiple nights.Go for the art, it's stupendous.  An original Picasso!  and a Chagall!right in the lobby.  fabulous art.Nice room, very comfortable, good rate.Disappointed in the restaurant - they didn't bother to tell usthey had souffles....which - of course - have to be ordered beforeyour meal.  They owe me a chocolate souffle!  Breakfast was only so-so.I stayed at the Henry Hotel in Detroit a few weeks ago while attending the North American International Auto Show, the Henry Ford, which is a Marriott, is absolutely beautiful. The lobby resembles an art museum and the room I stayed in was damn pretty! The bed was cozy, which is not typical of hotels, usually. My only complaint would be the internet connecivity problems, had trouble getting my laptop connected my whole stay, which was kind of annoying, but I had my iphone, so all was saved. :) The rooms were cleaned everyday, stocked with good products and water in the fridge. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend you do too! Oh, the bar has super expensive but equally as strong drinks and you can take them back to your room, which I did. :)I spend 75+ nights annually in hotels and most are Marriott properties.  I'm really conflicted about The Henry.  It's definitely better appointed than the Southfield Marriott where I usually stay.  That being said, the mini fridge didn't work, the showerhead leaked and sprayed as much out the side as downward and the parking lot is absurdly small for the number of rooms in the hotel.  Hotel maintenance quickly took care of the first two problems.  The only solution I saw for parking was to wait for a very long time for a spot to open or to pay the valet fee.  I didn't try the restaurant or bar.  The gym was nice but also very small for the size of the hotel - only 3 treadmills and a few other machines.  I'm still planning to stay here for trips in June and July.  The Marriott rewards program owns me and this is the best Marriott option in the Southfield area that I've found.I stayed here for 4 nights while working on a client project here in Dearborn. The Henry is a nice property (ex-Ritz Carlton) that continues to be updated.Staff is friendly & proactive. Most have a very strong service focus. Rooms are mostly quiet (plumbing is very noisy/squeaky). Beds are comfortable. Flatscreen TVs are standard in refurbed rooms.Lunch at the on-site restaurant - Tria - has been a disappointment. Meals take forever to serve and each time for our group there has been a problem (overcooked salmon, wrong sides with an entree, missed sides unserved). Staff apologizes promptly and removes charges for problem areas from the bill - but length of time to serve and ongoing problems make this a risk everytime one sits down.Concierge service for frequent stayers is on the 10th floor - hot breakfast in the AM, hot appetizers in the PM - are very well done.If not for the Tria restaurant issues, this would be a solid 4 star hotel.
review_content_60: Stayed here on a recent arbitration trip.  Excellent hotel.  Very chic and loaded with so much art its like a mini museum at the hotel.  Was told it used to be a Ritz Carleton.  I never previously stayed there so I'm only familiar with it as The Henry.  Not a giant hotel.  Well located.  Reasonable costs for this type of hotel.   High end decorating as its redone from a traditional look to a really modern look.  They have a fitness center but I did not visit it.  Weekend rates were $129 and weekday were about $189.  Internet was everywhere and included.  Very close to all the Henry Ford museums and locales. I found the room very comfortable with those very high quality hotel sheets and towels.  About 15 pillows on one bed.  I had to move them there were so many.  For those how like pillows, its as good as it gets.They have bed bugs! Booked a room 1/5/14 and when I checked in I went up to check out my room. The hotel is beautiful, but when I checked my bed I  found bugs crawling on my sheets. I called the front desk telling them I was going to need another room because my bed has bed bugs, she acted like it was no big deal and said "oh ok, I will get you another room. She didn't apologize about it or seem surprised. I asked her, don't you want to send somebody up here to check it out and she said, "well I guess we could send somebody up there if you want"  I ended up going down to the front desk asking for a refund. They were unapologetic about the whole deal. I asked her at the desk if they were having a problem with bed bugs and she stated "not recently". That was enough for me not to stay there. I was very disappointed with the way they handled the whole situation. I posted this review on their website and it has been removed.Been coming here for dinner over the last month or so. Different from the old Ritz-Carlton but most of the same staff (absolutely great) and same quality of food -- fewer choices. Recommend it hightly.Nice hotel, nice decor, friendly staff, super comfy bed, marble bathroom, good price, highly reccommended.

review_content: The last time I was in Detroit I stayed at a hotel that was not a good choice. While on a morning walk I passed by the Crowne Plaza where I received a friendly greeting even though I was just walking by. I decided that I would stay here next time. So, four months later the time came and I booked my stay.Walking into the lobby I was greeted as I walked to where the line was to check in. Check in was quick and I was on my way to my room. I was greeted yet again before I even got to the elevator. The staff and inviting atmosphere was exactly as I had expected. I had a few questions throughout my stay and every staff member helped me with no hesitation. I really enjoyed my stay here because of the employees, and the view from my room was really nice! The only thing I didn't enjoy was being able to hear "my neighbours" in the adjacent room. I think that was because they talked really loudly, not because the walls were thin. Another set of neighbours kept letting their door slam, and that was annoying. The location of this hotel is great. You are across from the COBO Center, where you can catch the People Mover. You are also across the street from the Riverwalk, which is beautiful. If you like to go for walks (like I do) this hotel is in a great place. Overall I had a pleasant stay and I look forward to staying here again.I recently stayed here while on vacation, the hotel was so nice. Rooms are super comfy and they have wonderful customer service. We had just got back from a game and it had to have been 12:30pm and we were hungry so went to the bar to order food, we'll the gentlemen that attended us was amazing! He had a pack room of people (we all just left the Lions game) and he attended everyone with excellent customer service. He was working alone, and had to say he had 30+ customers trying to get food and drinks. Awesome guy hope they give him a raise for all the hard work he did. I highly recommend staying here. Very nice and you get a view of the lake...can't beat thatWifi did not suck at all, very fast. Everything was nice and clean.Pros: Clean rooms, great views of the city and river, friendly staff.Cons: The WiFi is terrible.  The original iPhone 2G data plan will surf the internet faster than you can at the Crowne.  Ironically, they also have a porn filter on their wifi (you get to click a "I won't go to bad webpages" disclaimer splash page )so you'd think that would stifle bandwidth problems.. but apparently not.The shower is also very small.  The bathroom was so small in fact I had to move the trashcan so I could open the shower door.Overall it's in a good location, easy walking distance to Greek Town and lots of food & drink options around so if you're not needing to work in your room, you'll have a good stay.This is a great Crowne Plaza hotel! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms were great, the staff was great, the amenities great. Restaurant on the top 25 th floor was fantastic. Starbucks in the lobby. When in Detroit this is where I'm going.For the money I paid, I wasn't impressed... The view was the only nice thing about this hotel. Elevators were in and out of service. The restaurant upstairs had very poor service. I will never book there again - not for $300 a nightI only came here as an attendee for a day-conference - so I cannot speak to the quality of the rooms, experience as a hotel guest, etc. However, I enjoyed my experience as a conference attendee.Con: the main conference room was more wide than it was long, so anyone who sat at the far corner of the room may have had issues seeing whoever was speaking on the main stage.Pros: Food was tasty with quality options for various types of eaters. Breakout session rooms were spacious enough. Staff was friendly and helpful, signage (to go to breakout rooms, etc.) was well-placed. Great sound system.Overall, very positive experience. Didn't knock my socks off though, hence 4 stars instead of 5.Went here a couple years ago for my wifes company christmas party.  It was the worst one I have ever been to when it comes to the food.  The room was ok but all the food was just cheap pasta and processed roast beef dry.  Wine was cheap.  Was really quite bad.  I posted a rewiew on their site and somehow it was gone within a few days.  I did not stay the night so cant speak to their rooms.  Dont host a banquet here though.The good:* Clean rooms (at least for 2 of the 3 rooms I saw for a 1-night stay)* The view (see pic)* Customer service (details below)* Free Wi-Fi* Location - near the courthouse (in case that's where you need to be; within walking distance of Greektown).The bad:* The first room they gave me was nice but right next to the elevator. I needed a good night's rest for the meeting I'd flown in for, so I called the front desk when I got back from dinner and asked to change rooms.* Went down to the front desk, picked up the key card, went to the second room, only to see that it had not been cleaned since the previous guest. Called down and was told that they'd clean it right away. Waited about half an hour, started dozing off, called back to cancel the room change, but was reassured by the clerk that she'd be up right away to take me to yet another room.Back to the good:* She came up, waited for me to pack up my things, and took me to another room, which was not as big but still perfectly fine. Was super apologetic about the whole thing and gave me a coupon for free breakfast.Back to the bad:* They apparently didn't adjust my reservation in their system, because just as I was about to go to bed, another guest was able to use her key card to come into the room. Quickly saw that it was already occupied and left. * The next morning, got a bill under the door for another guest, presumably the one from the night before, with charges I didn't make. Took it downstairs and had them correct it.* They wouldn't let me use the breakfast coupon for room service or even to get anything to go from the restaurant. Didn't have time to sit and eat.The ugly:* Me without breakfast.First of all, we were a little apprehensive staying here because the reviews we read were mixed at best. But our experience here was fantastic!!!! The room was super. The view of the riverfront and downtown was spectacular. We had a suite on the 20th floor. Plenty of closet space and HD TVs with refrigerator. The room was very clean.... We took advantage of the exercise room, sauna, hot tub, and pool. All terrific. The exercise bike I used was the latest in design.We picked this hotel to be close to Joe Louis for our Red Wings game. The spot is perfect. We walked thru Cobo right next door and got to the arena in five minutes.I'll be honest and say CP'S are iffy. Some are great remodels, some not so much. I probably would have chosen differently for my first time in Detroit but 30k young Lutherans were in town for a conference and options were limited. Lobby v nice. Speedy polite check-in. Asked for highest possible floor-got 24 out of 25. She worried about city vs. river view but it's Detroit! I can see a river every day (literally).Room is a angled-corner with all full wall windows. View of art deco bldgs astounding! Room is nice, small but needs met. Bath very small with shower only (could be because it's accessible ). Clean B+. Outside noise (right on top of people mover) is minimal. Stylish, surprisingly affordable. Would do again (so far).Very nice and classy hotel. The building itself reminded me of the RecCen. It's unique shaped glass and height made me thing and feel as if I'm in another major city. Indoor pool and outdoor waterfront view was nice! I would come back again!Older hotel, but good location downtown. I think the place need some updates. Not a high end hotel. If you need to get to cobo hall, its right next door. I was here for a meeting. the meeting rooms were good. Just think its needs a make overIt started so well. The staff was professional & notably friendly. This area of Detroit felt moderately safe. The initial astetics of the Crowne felt classy. The hotel bar looked aptly equipped and capable, the kind of place that me and my number one gal could really tie one on. But alas, just like the first time you know a gal (in the biblical sense), it was an entirely disappointing experience.The stairwell smelled like diapers. The elevators cannot handle a max capacity hotel. The never ending wait for the lift forced us into the baby's-pants stairwell.There was a Halls wrapper atop our sheets. After informing the front desk of our find, and suggesting they either remove the wrapper or refill it, they offered us free drinks (just 2, don't get excited). But I think they missed the point. Free drinks are nice, but the free drinks didn't make us overlook the fact that the Halls wrapper was still spread eagle atop our bed several hours later!We ate in bed (we're emotional eaters). The next night the bed was made, but our crumbs from the previous night were still in the sheets!So why am I giving then 2 stars instead of 1? Because they were just so dagnab nice. Even when they didn't follow through, they still said whatever they had to say with the conviction of a door to door Jehovah Witness door knocker.I can not say enough about how friendly and personable the staff was during my 5 day stay at the Crown Plaza. I was greeted every day by name by everyone, my preferences were remembered, and no one missed a beat going above and beyond. I really enjoyed my stay and was a little sad to say goodbye! The location of the hotel is perfect if you're attending anything at the COBO center. It's directly across the street. The rooms are very small and narrow, but get the job done. Housekeeping did a great job cleaning. Service was fast all around. The views are great...I could see Canada! And great lighting.If you have time, visit Adam in the bar and have him make you an Adam Bomb! Great drink! Chanel was a great waitress and Officer Miller (I hope that was his name) was always a friendly face at the hotel. Check them out!Checking is at 15:00 and we arrived at 16:48 to find none of our rooms are ready. Most of the people at the checkin desk were busy with other tasks thus the line at the checkin desk desk was flooding into the sitting area of the lobby.We then were sent to a room which was already occupied which we did not learn till we walked in on a family. Then they finally hours later got us into a dirty room. Not a good experience at all but they refunded our money so they get two stars.Pros:  Great view, great location, and gorgeous rooms.  Me and my friends were able to walk to Wright & Co. and the Grand Trunk.  The swimming pool, the hot tub, and sauna were amazing.  The room was comfy and beautiful.Cons: Wouldn't give me an hour later for checkout on my birthday and was rude about it.  Other than this one employee though, everyone else was very nice.Me and my wife stayed here for one night. The place has a really nice lobby and it's real close to the expressway so it's very convenient to get in and out. I wasn't to impressed with the room, for the price we paid it was actually kind of small. The first time we went to use our keys neither of them worked so we had to go back down 23 floors to get a new set. The real reason I'm giving this hotel a lower rating is it might of been the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed it. The excuse at the front desk was "we were pretty much sold out" I replied there was noise until 5 am and it reminded me of a Spring Break atmosphere.. Fix the noise with security and get a new valet system in place. But I recommend other hotels in the city.The Crown Plaza is fantastic. Great rooms. The staff is unbelievable and go out of their way to help you. The food in the redturants is great and good prices. Hotel is close to the Detroit Princess for summer time dinner cruises and just accross the street from Cobo Hall.  Great views of Canada, Ceasers Palace, the river and the Blue Water Bridge.Everything was perfect...until I attempted getting my car back from valet the next day.I wish I would've snapped a picture of the room with all the valet tickets. They were ALL OVER THE GROUND. You would see a valet guy run in there, pick a random ticket off the ground, and then go look for your car. There was absolutely no rhyme or reason for how they went to get your car. If you wanted it, you would have to stand by the valet office door, and repeatedly ask the attendant to go get your car. I waited just under 2 HOURS!! Absolutely ridiculous. If there was a system in order, I would have no problem with waiting. But the fact of the matter is there wasn't. It was literally a luck of the draw. Other than the valet fiasco, my experience was excellent!! Just get a better system going for valet.No sleeping here! The doors shake and rattle every time someone in my hallway enters or exits their room!!! Plus the carpet looks stained and the decor is outdated. The bathroom is tiny, and there's a hole in my sheet on the bed. I should have stayed at the Westin.
review_content_20: Pros: This hotel is in a great location downtown and serves great breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. Price was reasonable as well for the night. Gym is adequate for a quick workout and lobby is very clean. Valet parking is quick ($25/day). Staff is friendly and they have happy hour in the bar during the week. Cons: Hallways and guest-rooms are FREEZING! And my thermostat did not function well. Either too hot or too cold all night. Bathroom wasn't that clean. My coworker had a blood stain on her tile floor. My bathroom shower had hot/cold backwards. And my room was in a weird location straight at the end of the hallway. Overall, I would stay here again for work.  It's close to the highways and working walking distance of restaurants (but don't go waking at night). There are alleys nearby but stay inside at night and you will be fine.We were here for a Wings game and loved how easy it was to get to the Joe. Staff was wonderful and room spectacular! Every thing above expectations.I recently stayed at this hotel while attending conference events at the nearby Cobo Center. It was convenient, with nice views, and generally friendly staff. BUT IT HAS BEDBUGS.  The night manager's attitude was somewhat cavalier and it seems that bedbugs have been an ongoing problem that they're not addressing expeditiously. I'll never stay at this hotel again and I would advise all who'd like to avoid bringing home these blood-sucking pests to stay away as well.We were overcharged for our room; the amount taken from my account and what was on the receipt at checkout did not match at all. I called the hotel immediately and the lady that answered the phone told me there was not much she could do and so they transferred me to a manager but turns out they just kept transferring me and no one ever answered. Later I was able to reach a manager and she said she would refund the money but acted as if it were my fault their people messed up. Pretty rude. I told her all of the following as well but she didn't seem concerned. The rooms were not great on the cleanliness scale. I'd give them a low 4 out of 10 (10 being the cleanest). Sheets smelled like straight bleach (good bad I can't decide) pillows had holes in them and the blankets had stains. Bathroom was extremely tiny, toilet was about a foot off the wall requiring you to move the trash can placed in front of it to shimmy into the shower. Shower was also miniature and the drain cover kept slipping off so you could see the black hole of people's hair and shower slime. Watch your step as well. So disgusting. The water glasses in the bathroom had lip marks all over them as if the maid simply replaced the paper cover after the last guest. Where is quality control with housekeeping? Speaking of, house keeping woke us up at about 6am for no reason. Then maintenance began shampooing the carpet with an industrial cleaner in the room next to us at 7:30am.  I appreciate the carpet cleaning as there was dried vomit in the hallway the previous day from what appeared to be the night before  but they need to be considerate of their guests or maybe put guests in rooms where maintenance is not scheduled to complete a job. Upon arrival the hotel looks fabulous and the lady (Barbara) who checked us in was wonderful however the rest of the stay did not match my initial impression. Can be best described as a bummer.I travel the Detroit area quite often for work and everytime I do I book my room with this hotel. The prices are always acceptable and the service has always been wonderful.A few aspects of the hotel could you updating (ex. carpet in some rooms is getting worn) but I've always had a clean room. Irregardless, every time I stay I am treated wonderfully and leave without any complaints. Also, they treat IHG Reward Club Platinum Members wonderfully. The location downtown is nice as well. You're within easy walking distance to a handful of good restaurants and pubs, a feature I always look for when traveling.Stayed here for work and unfortunately they did not deliver the expectation of customer service I expected. Room was clean but not fully stocked with simple things like towels and soap. Was missing my small refrigerator though I specifically requested one. And when I called for room service it took an hour and half to receive it only after I called to inquire. Food quality obviously was poor. Wouldn't recommend except for the extreme convenience of being next Cobo.I had a one night stay to go to a tigers game on 4/18/15. We showed up after the game around 5pm to check-in. Check-in was around 45 minutes. Bryant the front desk agent was not friendly.  The room was showing a lot of wear and tear and was dusty. The pillows also did not have cases. If housekeeping failed to put cases on the pillows what other corners do they cut? It led me to be believe that the rooms are never cleaned properly. Bottom line stay at another location when visiting downtown detroit.The hotel has a great location. Right near the water front which is awesome for a view. We were on the 23rd floor facing the water. Bathroom was horribly small. Small sink, right next to the toilet with a very small single person shower. I am a 5'5 female and skinny and felt crowded in the shower. Hated it. Our room was close to the elevators as well and its all you could hear. My husband didnt mind it but it drove me crazy. The pool area is small and hot tub could be hotter. The staff is amazing tho. Valet crew is top notch. Overall nice hotel for the location and the money. Just need to fix the bathroom situation.By far one of the best customer experience I had at a hotel! Charles the General Manager happen to over hear that I had a misunderstanding with my room assignment. Instead of walking away knowing I didn't know who he was he corrected the situation in such a manner in which I truly didn't expect.(not only did I get a great room with a beautiful view of the city but I also received a dinner voucher!) To top things off I ordered room service and encounter employee Serge who was very knowledgeable about the menu and totally suggest what he felt suit my needs. Boy was he right!!!! I'm a flight attendant and I stay in a lot of hotels and the customer service that I received here was by far the best! Thank you Charles and Serge!!We stayed in this hotel last weekend, when we went for a seminar in Detroit.We thought it was a great value for the price.The room was very clean and spacious, the view from the window was great, overlooking City and the river.The stuff was very helpful and friendly.The only negative was the absence of hot water at night. But in the morning it was okay, SO not sure if it was a glitch or usual.They give great discount if you are a AAA/CAA member. Don't forger to mention.The parking is extra - $25 /nightIt has an indoor pull, but we didn't have chance to use it.The most pleasant surprise was a restaurant. The food is great, the presentation is awesome, and the prices are very reasonable for a hotel restaurant, my meal was around $20 (salad with chicken). Recommend this place if you need to stay in downtown and want a reasonable price.Bottom line: Lipstick on a pig.The hotel was recently upgraded and at first glance appears nice; however, the more you looked & spent time there the worse it got - the building is old and it needs to be stripped to the bones for a proper upgrade vice a new coat a paint & some new furniture.  The bathroom was ridiculous - shower stall was too small for even me (5'5" and 150lb) and the toilet was placed a foot away from the wall so was nearly in the center of the bathroom. View was great but the wood window surround looked rotted with a new coat of paint. Service was slow, and apart from the Starbucks, a but on tge rude side.  I could go on but my finger is tired.  On the plus side, there are some awesome views from the upper floors, rooms are fairly quiet, convenient to the Cobo Center, and the price isn't too bad (though the Westin is infinitely better & not much more $$).The Crowne Plaza is a pretty killer deal for downtown Detroit.  Centrally located, the rooms boast great views- if you're lucky (and/or ask) you might have a panorama of Windsor, the Detroit River, and Downtown Detroit.  The People Mover is about a block away, as is the river.The Rooms: vary in size from large to smallish.  The rooms themselves are well-appointed, comfortable, and clean.  In some minor instances, the age of the building shows.The Staff: are awesome, knowledgable, and friendly.  The valets were responsive, and the one time no one was available, a different staff member dropped what they were doing to grab the car.  At $25 valet parking is pricey, but it does include unlimited ins and outs.The Restaurant: in the lobby is pretty good, at least for breakfast.
