The breakfast has been the same every day, yet it's pretty good: make-your-own-waffles; fresh blueberries, strawberries, blackberries, raspberries, pineapple, cantaloupe, AND watermelon (all delicious and nicely ripe); scrambled eggs with toppings; yogurt selection; apple, cranberry, and orange juice; breakfast bars, and...they serve fresh coffee with pastries all day long. PLUS, they sell other snacks, wine and beer too. I may not have even covered all of the options!I love this place. I stayed her the night before and the night of my wedding. The location is great  - right off Woodward in Midtown. They have a shuttle that will run you anywhere within 5 miles, and a free parking lot behind the main building. There are several buildings - I stayed in the main one which is where reception is and where the daily breakfast is served. The staff was so helpful and nice throughout my stay. They gave me a great room - a huge and super comfortable king bed, jacuzzi tub, and sitting room, for about $150 a night. They also let us use the other buildings for our pictures. The ground are impeccable, the houses are furnished with beautiful antiques and great woodworking, and I love the history there. The breakfast was wonderful - coffee, juice, eggs, pastries, and a make your own waffle station. They also have a hospitality cart in the evenings stocked with water, soda, beer and wine. Just tell the receptionist what you had and they will charge it to your room. They also have a space for private events.My husband and I live in Ann Arbor and stayed at the Inn on Ferry Street on our wedding night almost five years ago---you don't get much more pro-detroit than that!  This place....talk about gorgeous!  Beautifully restored houses with perfectly complimenting and comfortable furniture.  They also had a nice spread for breakfast.  This isn't just someplace to lay your head, it's a place to hide out all day in!I always recommend this B&B to my friends. BEAUTIFUL Victorian homes turned into very personable and charming guest rooms. Just a block north of the DIA, the neighborhood is quiet and safe. Staff is very hospitable, and the shuttle service within 5 miles is complimentary. If you are looking for alternatives to downtown hotels, this is the place to stay!Best place to stay in mid-town Detroit.Even though the facility and staff (not including the front desk staff) were incredibly friendly and helpful, there was a major issue with the beds. Me and my boyfriend slept on a hide a bed in one of the suites, it was incredibly uncomfortable. It felt like were sleeping on springs literally covered in a sheet. For the price we had to pay for the room this situation was unacceptable. He ended up sleeping on the floor the first night and I slept on the couch. We asked the front desk if they could get us another bed or room, the only thing they could do was give us a role away, which they ended up charging us for. The front desk people were very rude and did not seem to care about our needs.Absolutely beautiful! That's the way I feel about the Inn on Ferry Street. This is what true Detroit architecture represents. I have stayed here over night just to change up the scene and have attended events here such as wedding and bridal showers. The staff is extremely helpful and the rooms, hands down, are the best in Detroit. The have managed to turn Victorian style homes into personable rooms without tampering with the character and true details of these homes. Breakfast is delicious too! I recommend this cute little bed and breakfast for those who want to simply relax and get away or those who may have out of town guest who want to stay in the Downtown area.

review_content: Attended the Marriott for an all-day meeting which included breakfast and lunch served by Marriott. Upon arrival the front desk staff politely guided me to my location with big smiles on their faces. When a front desk is as energetic and polite as this front desk staff you know you're in the right place, a clear reflection of the leadership that is kept at the management level of the business. The lobby was extremely clean and newly remodeled with a very nice modern layout. The room was well ventilated allowing all the guests to feel very comfortable focused on the lecture.The breakfast was great, and had just about every baked good any guest could possibly ask for, along with coffee and tea to compliment the meal. When lunch came around the same quality and professionalism was offered, chicken breast and salmon paired with a healthy spinach salad your choice of dressing. Great experience, would imagine staying the night would be nothing less than exceptional.Very bad experience. I stayed 2 nights there, the second because of bad weather so I had ended up staying in 2 different roomsBoth rooms smelled bad. It smelled like nothing was clean in there. The furniture was old and looked like they took the scraps from other Marriott's and dumped it here. There was also a large tree that kept clanging against my window my second night and prevented me from sleeping.The last morning I was there I called to get a later checkout but the girl at the front desk wasnt going to let me ask easily. She first said she thought I left already. Then when I asked if I could defer it until 2 she got mad and said the latest she could do was 12:30 or they would start charging me extra. This was all done with an attitude from her.I then decided to try the room service for breakfast the same morning and that was another bad experience. The phone range about 15 times until a lady finally picked up. She had an attitude right from the start. I told her which breakfast I wanted but each breakfast meal choice had various options. For instance you could choose white toast, wheat toast or a muffin as one part. Then you had a choice of different juices, also different fruits and different cereal choices. When I told her I wanted the "good start breakfast" she just said "ok anything else". I said well I'd like corn flakes for my cereal. She responded " ok anything else". Theres 3 more things she needs to ask me before I can place this order but she was too short on the phone to get to it. I felt like I was apologizing while I was placing my order to her. Never experienced a food order like that let alone room service at a Marriott.The lone bright spot was the dinner options were very good and the bartender was nice and had good customer service skills. The lady that checked me in was also friendlyI will be traveling for work to this area one day every other week for at least the next 3 years. I will never stay here again, but I may sneak over from the courtyard for dinner and then go back to the courtyard and sleep in a clean room where the service is nicerI am a little torn about this Marriott. This is the closest one to my office, and is much better than the neighboring Courtyard. The Marriott has gone through a nice renovation of the lobby, restaurant and bar areas. However, the guest rooms have and haven't (in progress). I think I was in a renovated room. However, it was rather dark even with all of the lights on. The bathroom is a tad on the small side.Getting in late, I didn't want to eat in the dining room (just wanted a quick bite). I ordered room service and got the standard Marriott burger. It was good! The service was quick.The concierge lounge is on the 6th floor. Breakfast is the standard Marriott fare but I feel that the scrambled eggs were the kind that are served at Fairfield Inns (made from a powder bs egg liquid). The lounge is small as well.I would stay here again but I hope the rooms get brightened up.Brand new renovation. But you can still only polish a turd so much. I travel 10 nights a month and this place is just bad. The furniture is so stained I wouldn't let my cat sleep on it. Bring slippers or you'll have to lay towels on floor to walk around it the room. It's just disgusting. I'll post some picturesFirst time staying here and will not be back. This Marriott is nasty. Very dirty not clean at all. I understand they are going through a renovation but not in the rooms and they were just not clean. Stains on the floor and all over the comforter I have attached a picture of the stained bed. The staff was friendly but only goes so far if the room is a mess. The bar and restaurant is not bad the usual Marriott food. Marriott this place needs to be cleaned up bad!Best customer service and hospitality. The people working there were genuinely hospitable and willing to make the accommodations more enjoyable. From room service to repair men, they had the nicest staff.The staff is second to none, concierge lounge is amazing, beds are very comfortable. My complaints are that the internet did not work (would come on for a few minutes then go away). I had to speak with tech support twice--the first one was able to make it function for a bit then it went away. The second one told me that I must be wrong and that it was definitely working. It very much was not  The second complaint was the ac did not function well. It was set to 66 but we sweated all night long :( I called front desk at 9am and they said engineering would be right up. When I left at 11:30, they had not arrived. The front desk offered a partial refund of our points, but for a Plat Elite member, I'm not crazy about that compensation.I couldn't believe how comfortable the bed was! SO COMFORTABLE! 5 stars for the bed!Friendly staff. My only request would be a complimentary breakfast in the morning. I would stay here again!It seems the longer you stay the worse the service is.  I may have written that last review to hasty.  During my second week there there were several days my room was not cleaned.  It wasn't a huge deal, I wasn't soiling the sheets or anything.  It just wasn't very professional.  The service at the restaurant went down hill as well.  It became very slow with mix ups on orders and even burnt food.I stay here a few times a year because my work's corporate office is in Southfield. I have to say this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at in large part because of the staff. The restaurant staff remembers my name every time I come back to town and what I drink and that I like a to go coffee! That's pretty outstanding! Love this hotel!I was here 21 days, and therefore feel I really got to know the staff and hotel. The "new lobby" concept means that whenever the Bistro cafe is busier than reception the reception staff help out in the cafe. This is a great example of the teamwork concept. And it works very well most of the time. Only once did a receptionist turn-up her nose at helping the guests have wonderful stay, (she would Not get a highchair for a family group, because that was a resturant staff task) But the housekeeping staffer who had been standing next to her did go get the chair. When asked the housekeeper explained the non-team-player was having a Bad Day. Otherwise the whole staff are trying their best to make your stay effortless and wonderful. Three wants: 1. more frequent restocking of the food supplies, they ran out of my favorites at least twice. 2. More dessert/ice cream options that Do Not contain Chocolate.  And 3. Need to stock an Non-alcoholic beer. Other than that the food in the Bistro was good, in particular the Slab of ribs are huge, tender and tasty. They also have a nice selection of Healthy options. And the roll-in shower in our room was very nice and easy to use.I'm only a Marriott Rewards Gold level member, but Shannon gave me a giant suite upgrade for my 5 day work week stay. This place is awesome.Staff was friendly and tried to provide great service but they were busy with what appeared to be a large family reunion. We checked in around 3:30 and they had very few rooms clean. I settled for a first floor room that had a musty odor and a couple black flies. We ate the bar. Ok beer selection (1 local option) and the Ruben was good. More black flies at the bar.This hotel should be ashamed to be called a Marriott. It is old, outdated and most of the staff you have contact with could care less. Elevators are so slow you may as well use the stairs. Programs at the hotel are poorly run and wifi constantly disconnects. Do yourself a favor and stay at a better hotel. I am an elite member and stay exclusively at Marriott.I have very little complaints about this hotel. Checking in took awhile, because of a crazy woman demanding things holding up everyone else, so I won't blame that on the hotel. As far as the room, it was clean & small, but I wasn't planning on spending much time there anyways. I'm not sure about the other reviewers, but I did have free coffee and free wifi access, I just had to call to the front desk to get the log on info. I was given a handicap room so my bathroom was a little more spacious than others seem to be describing, and it was a little hard to find the towels (they were at the top of a closet but I'm short & couldn't see them -_-). The bed itself was comfy, but the pillows were a little too soft for my liking. The AC worked great, didn't try that TV so I'm not sure about the selection there. Checking out was a breeze, the manager took our key cards and wished us on our way. I would stay at this hotel again, just bring your own pillows!Only reviewing their restaurant. Overpriced drinks and mediocre food. Also the service is not the best...MustyThe bed was comfy.. The room service is decent whenever they do finally pick up to take your order. The ice machine doesn't work. I will stay again but they def need an upgrade and a few repairsI use Marriott for work all of the time throughout the U.S., with that said, I had a few issues at this one. Let me also note, I am a low maintenance guy. When I arrived the staff was sterile and felt like they were going through the motion (pre-canned welcome). When I attempted to get the company rate I got some mumbo-jumbo about how many rooms are set aside for company rates. I decided to let it pass and fight it on another day. Upon staying there it turns out breakfast was a seperate charge which was different than what I was originally told. On night "2" of my stay the fire alarm went off at 3 am. While we waited for the unresponsive fire department to show up, the staff appeared to have no interest in communicating any information to the guests. The upside is the room was clean and modern. On checkout I asked about the room rate on my bill, same "mumbo-jumbo" again, asked to review it with the GM who in turn adjusted the bill accordingly. For that I give the hotel a "3" star review.The hotel was great, and I stayed here for about a week.Room service and customer service was really hit or miss.Front desk said the first night that I couldn't claim credit for my stay,  but I got credit after following up.Room service was weird.  They kept on changing my towels despite me electing to be green.  Also, they would never refill my toiletries and water everyday.  One of those days, I got a water bottle that was not sealed...=/
review_content_20: Been sitting at the lobby bar for 15 minutes and nobody has come around..... Also, water pressure sucks in the shower coupled with the shower head not being adjustable to accommodate me (I'm 6-1).Great business hotel. The room is pretty big. They have a table you can use, they have decent internet connection and its pretty good for business travel. They provide a nice TV with almost all the channels you would usually want.They have a fitness center, swimming pool and a Jacuzzi.The property is at a very nice location right by the highway, making it easy for you to get to places. The service is amazing and everybody at the reception are very professional the way the handle things.Like going on a blind date: you never know what you might get. In my case it was a priceline.com. deal to the Marriott for a "stay-cation" aka I need to get away without the heavy bills. Happy surprises: Customer service was AMAZING! I was kind of shocked that everyone was so pleasant. They are rated as a 3 1/2 star hotel and I would give them 5 starts for customer service. Check in took less than 3 minutes and I was addressed professionally. The room was spotless and the bed was so comfortable that I didn't want to get out of bed the next morning. The not so good:( TOO MANY UNSUPERVISED KIDS!!!! I could have sworn I was on a school field trip with the number of kids roaming the halls & taking over the swimming pool and hot tub. It was well after 9pm when we went to the pool and we walked in and I wanted to turn around. I didn't think that on a Saturday night I was find kids doing laps and backstroking across the pool. It's not even that big to start with. Besides that the water was a bit ummm murky. I really wanted to get in the hot tub (jacuzzi if you call it that) but there was an couple engaging in heavy PDA (should have taken that to the room. Lol) & a group of teenagers ready to hop in to get warm since the entire place was frigid as heck. We couldn't leave yet because: THERE WERE NO TOWELS!!! After going out in the lobby in a 2 piece soaking wet & cold we finally got some towels. The 24 hour fitness room actually closes at 11pm on the weekends (yes, that struck me as strange, since most people go to hotels on the weekend). Overall this was okay for the price we paid, but rack rates are roughly $75. I didn't go to the bar as it closed at 11pm and we didn't visit the restaurant that is there. *If you go and really need a drink or a late meal there is a TGIFridays on 11 Mile/Evergreen that closes at 2am (kitchen closes at 12 or 1am)*The hotel is beginning a much needed renovation. My room smelled so bad, I had to be moved. The pool is under construction, half the lights are hanging out of the ceiling in the workout room, and they lost one of my shirts being laundered. I would avoid this property......don't plan on actually getting in the pool, it was disgusting. it looked like someones filthy bath water. The room? PERFECT...decor, the bed was a dream, quiet, clean and great location. Again, the pool was the ONLY letdown. I booked hotel mainly because it boasted its pool and my children love to swim...they were so disgusted, as well as everyone else that entered the pool area with the hopes of swimming. I'm laying here in this very comfy bed quite stunned at the conditions of such a great amenity!! Clean your pool, keep the rest as it is!When it comes to travel, I prefer paying as little as possible for a many-starred hotel. Call me a cheapskate or just frugal. I don't see the point in throwing down two hundred dollars on where I rest my head when that could go into attractions, restaurants, or buying some splendiferous knick-knack my loved ones will be appalled by later. On the other hand, staying in a cockroach nest has never been my style and I left the days of EconoInn and Motel Cheap behind me aeons ago. Fortunately that's where Priceline and Hotwire come in.Southfield Marriott shows up in the Priceline list and I managed to snag three days in this hotel last year before I moved to the D for a phenomenal price. I rolled up into the parking garage, eyes gritty from the road trip from Chicago and feet aching from the constant brake-accelerate pattern of people dodging all the M-39 closures wanting nothing more than a place to sleep. O sweet Marriott, how fondly do I recall you. This place is ranked 3.5 stars, but it definitely has a finer finish than that. The slick surfaces and tidy clientele made me feel quite awkward, and I must have mumbled my way into a higher floor room down a quiet corridor. Maybe the staff took pity on me, or perhaps that is where I was assigned. Nonetheless, I was not in the least disappointed. The room was beautiful and the king-sized bed sang Lorelei's song to my weary ears, absorbing my body weight as I collapsed face-first into the softest mattress ever. Almost ever.Now I'm a princess when it comes to beds, and the slightest twinge, pea, rock, or nodule keeps me tossing and turning all night long. This super soft mattress and wonderfully snuggly blanket were enough to make me crow the praises of the Marriott all day and night. Staff ran up extra pillows for me in the flash of an eye (yay!) and I had little trouble organizing my things in preparation for a conference. Everything was clean and tidy, and amenities can be supplied for free if you forgot a razor, shoe polishing cloth, and the rest. I didn't make use of the fitness room despite my best efforts or the pool, given it was a little better than the dead of winter. While other residents may have been enjoying themselves, I heard nary a sound or peep. The restaurant was far too expensive to bother with and I grabbed breakfasts at Tim Horton's down the street, navigating my way into my conference. Free parking, easy access, and a great big TV are all great features that you could definitely appreciate. All in all, though, the hotel was well worth the money and I enjoyed my stay. I just wouldn't pay market rate to stay there.The front desk staff is awesome. I can't say the same for the management. I had a rowdy room next door and called to have it taken care of. I peered through the peep hole and did see management walk by, but they didn't even stop to tell the neighbors to be respectful and quiet down.The AC units are too loud. The bed was comfortable, but you need all three pillows to get a decent night's sleep.I'm pretty sure house keeping merely rinsed a glass I used and turned it back over once dry. I could see the wine residue still left over and where my lips had touched the night before.Didn't get to try the food but I heard it was good.Paper thin walls.The elevators were ungodly slow, not that this really factors in to the rating. Budget hotels are better than this.Luckily I was here on business and won't have to return anytime soon. I wish it was a better experience since I stay almost exclusively at Marriott.Disappointing for a Marriott. The lobby is great, but the room really felt unclean. First, when we got there, they said that our room wasn't clean yet (we got there at 6:30 pm). When I said we needed the room immediately, they said there was a carpet stain that they needed to clean. The front desk person asked one of the staff if he had cleaned it yet and the staff member said he hadn't gotten around to it. If he hadn't gotten around to cleaning such an obvious (and large stain), I don't want to know what hard to see things they never get around to cleaning. The room was large and had the typical Marriott amenities, although the bathroom was very small. Most of the staff was nice, but I'd rather go somewhere else next time.I stayed here two nights & wish I could stay twenty more. The beds are so comfortable 5 star level. The pool is the best! Indoor heated and big enough to get a workout. There is also a jacuzzi, that and the pool are both kept at very high standards by a seriously professional pool guy who checks the condition 2x a day! seriously! I learned that the pool holds Fourteen thousand gallons of water, yes we chatted.I also chatted with Jonathon the concierge who was at my beck and call, Barbara who works at the front desk who was such a peach, Dorthy the pool lady who noticed I had not drank any water for quite awhile and brought me a bottle! :) And Jay the bartender who makes killer shots!I love this hotel and I felt so comfortable and welcomed! I will be going out of my way to return here.Oh and nice homemade veggie burgers.I was very impressed with the friendliness of the staff at this Marriott. Every time I passed the front desk I was greeted with a huge smile and a "hello"... great way to win me over. As a frequent hotel visitor, I really appreciate the hospitality.The hotel was also very well kept. The grounds were groomed and the room was thoroughly cleaned each day. I would definitely return.I cannot say enough about how friendly the staff is. The rooms are clean but you can tell it's a older hotel taken over by Marriott.Stayed here for a business trip. The price is quite affordable for Marriott. The rooms are similar to Courtyard Marriott's, I've seen better but not a biggie. Staff here is super friendly. Even when I checked in at midnight, they staff was so nice and helpful. Even the restaurant staff was great in the morning.I did have breakfast here but it was meh. If you have car, go somewhere else to eat. Overall a nice place to stay.Stayed at the hotel for 11 nights wile I was doing some business in Detroit area. I got the room with good discounts. It is a nice fitness and pool area. The breakfast is good and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Wifi is working perfect. If I came back I would definitely book this hotel again.One of my go-to hotels when I go to visit Detroit (which is often, since my S.O. lives here...the other is the Westin in Southfield). It's a nice hotel, no frills or anything. Parking is free, and the beds are WONDERFUL. One visit, we spend 2 nights in Chicago in a 4-star hotel and didn't sleep comfortably one night. The next night we came here, and it was like sleeping on a cloud! And not just because the previous nights at the other hotel were horrible, the beds are just really nice. lolOne thing though, it seems like this place is a hot spot on the weekends at night....there always seems to be a lot of people hanging around here. Never any problems or anything--we're just always so amused that it seems to liven up (particularly in the parking lot) on the weekends.Hotel's in a pretty accessible location--lots of food around and stuff. Breakfast is nice, but not always free. Nice stay here.MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT & I WILL NEVER GO BACK!I decided to surprise my fiancee with a 2 night stay since I hadn't seen him for 2 months and he was in town for a few days. The reviews on this hotel were pretty good and at such a reasonable price, I booked it. We got to our room which seemed pretty clean. Got settled in and the TV WAS MESSED UP - not the best reception, fuzzy picture, channels not coming in so we could only watch a certain number of channels. The room was pretty warm and we went to put the AC on only to find out IT DIDN'T WORK! We called the front desk and Elshon (sp) was really nice and was able to move us to another room. He even gave us some complimentary cards for either a free movie, free drink, or free breakfast. We got up and left the next morning around 10am and as were leaving, I noticed 2 glasses on the floor in front of the room across from us. 9+ hours later we come back and I noticed those same 2 glasses still on the floor in front of the door - immediately I thought, I bet our room never got cleaned. We walk in, and NOTHING was cleaned! Housekeeping never came, bed was still a mess, no new towels or anything. We were completely dumbfounded! My fiancee called the front desk and explained to them that we were upset that our room was never cleaned. We said we'd come downstairs so that housekeeping could come upstairs. We got to the lobby and told Crystal at the front desk we wanted housekeeping to quickly clean our room while we sat at the bar for a half hour but didn't want to waste any more time since they had 9 hours to do it. She called on the walkie and we went to go sit down. 35 minutes later, we go back upstairs and NOTHING WAS CLEANED!!! Now we were just completely livid! We call the front desk again demanding housekeeping and a manager come up. 10 minutes later housekeeping finally shows up - no manager. My fiancee demands a manager come up so she calls on the walkie for management. Apparently the housekeeper said the AM housekeeper checked off that our room was cleaned and that's why no one went to check on it. BUT at this point, that's completely irrelevant and doesn't matter because for the half hour we were gone, how come our room still wasn't cleaned!?!?!? The manager comes up and my fiancee goes off on how horrible our experience has been from day 1 - she has little to say. My fiancee just tells her we're leaving and will never come back to the hotel and expect compensation. Down to the front desk we go and talk to Crystal and she calls in for another supervisor to handle our situation. We tell Sharon what has happened during the duration of our stay and she's pretty disgusted with the lack of customer service and the quality of work ethic, or again lack thereof. Sharon is completely helpful and offers our money back, however, it completely ruined our experience of Marriott hotels. My fiancee was only in for a few days and we lost 2 hours of time we could have spent together. It was a horrible experience and says a A LOT about this Southfield location and its staff.Corporate traveler meet your swanky accommodations! Nice hotel with modern amenities and some of the most polite staff I have ever encountered. The room was spic and span. If you're looking to rub elbows with other corporate transients, the bar was humming with laughs and beer flowing from the tap. Nothing too rowdy - mind you - this is the corporate crowd. The breakfast was a pretty good spread of the usual and the staff in the breakfast bar were friendlier than a Waffle House waitress. My only complaint would be the restaurant for dinner. The California burger was greasy and flavorless. Definitely would recommend staying again.Nice enough.Checked in on Sunday, 09/18/2011, and I will be here till Saturday on a business trip.I was greeted by the front desk as soon as I walked into the hotel. The staff was very friendly and nice. I was checked in within 3 minutes. The room could be bigger but it was nice.The bed was comfortable.I am very happy with this hotel so far, I will be here for another 5 nights. If I have anything new I will update this review.The facility is a bit dated but the staff is so helpful and has such a great attitude it made the staff terrific. I'd definitely stay there again.Honestly i think the hotel deserve more stars than 3. But the heating system is worth less than 1 so that evens it out. The hotel is nice, the concierge food very standard, the bar is welcoming and the employees are all very friendly. THE HEAT SYSTEM IS FREAKING LOUD. There i said it. Freeze and sleep or be warm and get awaken every 15 min.
review_content_40: Staying at hotel for business for 2 nights.  Greeted by friendly front desk staff and was off to my room.  Room is your typical Courtyard Marriott and no frills, but clean and a big flat screen TV.  Front desk called me about 30 min after I got to my room to make sure all was well and I asked them if there was a refrigerator (there is not) and they were kind enough to offer to bring one.  So far, so good.

review_content: I love this hotel. I try to talk my husband into a night here each time we're in Detroit. Its a great location in Greektown, we can walk to everything, but I don't have to deal with the casino or smokers. Although, if you want to save money on parking, you can park at the casino for free and just cut through the casino to the hotel.The rooms here are huge and I love the layout, especially with the sunken bedroom. Its not the fanciest place we've stayed for the money, but for some reason I just love it there.The only downside to our stay there this weekend was our room was literally between the elevator shafts. It wasn't too bad until about 8am when people started being very active. Most of the noise could only be heard from our bedroom, but the constant elevator dings rang nice & loud all the way to our bed. As did a lot of conversations of people waiting for the elevators. I didn't realize when we checked in that it would be so loud in the morning, so I didn't ask to be moved, but definitely will if it happens again in the future. Given we stayed in the most expensive king suite option, it was disappointing to deal with the noise when I wanted to sleep in after a late night on the town!Stayed here for the weekend, in town for the Raiders game. The hotel is walking distance from everything you'd ever need. The rooms are so big and spacious, loved them. Not much lighting in the rooms, kind of annoying at night. Also, some of the floors, especially by the stairs, are so thin that you feel like you're going to fall right through them. You also hear everyone else going up and down the stairs in their own rooms. If you can get past the constant "boom boom boom boom", you'll be ok. Parking is hard to find but they comped our parking which turned out to be great. If I ever go back to Detroit (doubt it), would definitely be staying here again.I stood at this hotel for a a few short days. I was in Detroit on business. It's a good location because you're right in Greek town. There's a casino, a few restaurants and bars. The folks that work at the Atheneum were very nice. The room was okay but the bed was very uncomfortable for me. It was a bit too firm and I had a hard time sleeping my first night there. Not sure what else is available in Detroit as far as hotels but someone told me that is the go-to hotel for celebs and business folks from out of town.We stayed here for Valentine's day, and overall it was disappointing.  For the price I expected better.We got here about 4:00 PM and were told our room wasn't ready yet, despite check-in being at 3:00.  To their credit, the front desk staff was apologetic about it and gave us a couple of coupons for a free drink at Fishbones.  We sat down and had a drink and our room was finally ready about 5:00.The room was pretty large, and it was nicely furnished.  It wasn't all that well maintained though.  There was a huge crack in the ceiling above our bed, and the floor tiles in the bathroom were cracked and dirty.  The tub/shower was cheap plastic that creaked when you stepped into it.The view was pretty bad.  We were on the second floor, looking across the dirty street at a titty bar.  The worst part of the stay was that the walls are paper thin.  We could hear literally everything happening within about a 100 yard radius.  We could hear the music from inside the titty bar.  We could hear people slamming their doors and shouting down in the lobby.  And we could hear loud R&B music and very enthusiastic outcries from a woman in the room next to ours.  My sleep is less interrupted than this at home with a baby.  I've stayed in a number of other hotels in downtown Detroit, and none of them had the same problem.I stayed here on Valentine's Day, pardon the overpricing that occurs on this day, but it was an overall great experience. We pulled in and valet took care of the car for us instead of us heading to the parking lot ourselves, plus it was cold as balls outside, which made the $25 valet fee even more enticing. The suite was spacious and pretty great. The bed was super comfortable with big fluffy pillows and awesome bedding. 2 flat screen TV's, a sunken-in tub, mini fridge, and a separate living area completed this scenario. The only issue we had with the room was the couple of steps that led down to the bedroom. My boyfriend tripped down them in the middle of the night forgetting that there were steps there and pretty much took down a lamp with him during the fall. I will add that there is a tiny speck of light shining on them to alert you, but alas. Fishbone's is connected to the hotel so we didn't have to venture outside to find somewhere to eat and the Greektown Casino was directly across the street so 2 skips and a hop and we were hanging out in there the rest of the night. I would definitely come back here again for a special occasion.It was my first time in Detroit and I didn't know much about the city. I had to stay for two days after attending a meeting and I wanted to take advantage of the trip so I could see what the city had to offer.  Their guest service person was on point and she gave me great recommendations. We took a long walk on the River Walk which is a great place to to run by the water. We went for lunch to the Fountain Bistro which is located two blocks from the hotel in a very nice park with beach chairs and a water fountain.  We also visited Pegasus and Santorini which are around the block from the hotel and they offered amazing seafood options for very reasonable prices. Overall. The rooms are very spacious and up to date with al amenities. Nice TVs, clean bathrooms, big windows with lovely views and a good room service menu with plenty of options. They also offer a shuttle to the airport and transportation for big groups. Overall ot was a here at experience and I can't wait to go back to Detroit so I can visit the museums next timeThe only positive about this hotel is the location. Other than that, my stay was subpar at best. There was a constant smell of drugs throughout the hotel, which when notified to hotel staff, they seemed put out. Also, there was a huge fight on one of the floors at around 1am on one of the nights. Cops were called and people were arrested. After calling down twice to the front desk thinking people were going to come crashing through my door, the response I received was "it's being taken care of." Word of advice, if you stay here, pack your flak jacket.I just stayed here over the weekend because a friend and I were going to a show just around the block. We came in from Chicago, six hours on a Greyhound bus, and when I arrived, I was told by a man working the front desk that my room wasn't ready with it only being 1:30 (check in was at 3:00). I asked if I could be switched to another similar room, because that's what happens at other hotels, and I've never had an issue or been denied. However, here, I was told no, and to come back at 3:00, which I found absolutely awful after traveling for so long and having to wait outside in line for our show. When I came back at 3:30 to check in, I was helped out by a different employee working the front desk. I told her that I was checking in, and she asked me for my ID and a card to "secure the deposit with." I asked what the deposit was, because when I booked my room, nothing was said about a deposit. She explained that there was a required $50 deposit when booking a room in case something ends up damaged or missing. At this point, that was strike two, because, as you may know, most hotels only keep track of your card number in case something happens, and if it does, they THEN proceed to charge you. This left me with a weird feeling, especially being low on money and being states away.Strike three came when only AFTER my card info was taken, I was asked if there was anyone staying with me who was 21. Once again, this has never been a concern before, and I travel for shows frequently. I said there was, and I was told then that they needed to check in with me. So I had to call my friend who was saving our spots in the queue and ask her to walk over with ALL of her luggage just to check in with me. As for the hotel's features, it's pretty at the very least. The rooms are spacious and big. However, some of the room's furniture was disheveled. There were stains on one of the bed's comforters. A lampshade was bent and crooked, and I was left with the suspicion that they'd charge me for damaging it. Seriously. The free "continental breakfast" is this: a 'buffet' set up on the bar counter which is made up of a small fridge containing cartons of orange juice/milk and small bottles of water, a rack of pastries wrapped in plastic, and that's it. No hot food, no plain toast, even. Additionally, we came down to check out the breakfast in our socks, and got scolded for that. Seriously. Bottom line, wouldn't come back here again. Their competition looks much more promising.The rooms were clean and well appointed, bathrooms to die for!The decor was kitschy and very urban Greek chic.  What makes this place great was the staffs.  Everyone was so appreciative and well mannered.  THIS is how you run a hotel!Amazing location that was in the heart of greektown with a very short walk to the Tigers game.  Check in was prompt, and they even gave me a free room upgrade.  I was able to pay for my overnight valet upon checkin.  The room wasn't pristine clean and the whirlpool didn't have much power but those were my only cons.Currently at the Athenium and having such a miserable time I decided to write about it right now.The staff is friendly and the rooms are spacious. The tub is also a winning element. Besides that, I'm over it. When I first checked in they gave me a room on the 9th floor. I opened the door and to my surprise there were workers in there fixing a damaged ceiling. Awkward. And the staff offered no compensation for my troubles. The AC is miserable and can't decide if it wants to be hot or cold. If I want any sort of relief I need to sleep in the bed closest to the AC and dance with the sheets all night as it turns on and off and I go from freezing to sweating. Even though I'm on the 9th floor, the sound from the casino across the street is agonizing. Like I said, the only relief came from sleeping in the bed by the AC but that also happens to be the bed next to the window!.. I have an early flight and would really like to get some sleep... There's awful DJ music playing, continuous streams of sirens, people screaming, engines revving and I know it won't end for another few hours. Worst part is I can't even drown them out with the television because no channel will come in correctly and clean. Everything skips including audio, and the picture won't come in properly. I'm stuck awake checking emails because it's pointless to get dressed and move everything to a new room just to leave in a few hours (probably exhausted). You have no option but to valet your car and the woman at the front desk told me she'd give me a discount from $25 to $20 a night but from reading other reviews, they typically charge $20 a night anyway so... When I called the valet for my car it rang and rang until an operator picked up and told me they were too busy helping other customers and hung up on me. So I went down there to discover the valet team standing around talking to each other.The only reason for the two stars is the awesome tub and the room service- quick and yummy. Really not worth staying here and I'm disappointed my booking agent chose this place for my business trip. Now back to checking emails.ABSOLUTE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!  We made our reservations, called in to ask questions and were yelled at by the women when asking if there were other rooms available for our friends or if the couch had a fold out for them. It was the strangest phone conversation ever because there was absolutely no reason for her to be so upset with us. We decided to cancel our reservation and have STILL not been able to cancel... I've called 6 times and they won't put me through to a real person to cancel!  I just keep getting sent to a voicemail with no return calls. I've even emailed. I'm calling my bank next to notify them so if/when they try to charge my card it won't go through. This is ridiculous. Don't book here!*** Atheneum Suite Hotel  ...  An Affair to Remember. ***When Atheneum originally opened about 20 years ago, I had to stay overnight bsince I heard so many great things about it: palatial, exposed brick walls, cement pillars, soaking tubs etc.  It was quite lovely.  I would have given Atheneum 5-stars then.Now last month I returned to stay here for a couple of nights.  It was like rekindling an old love - it may not be as glamorous as it was in the beginning but it remains just as lovely as ever.  A solid 4-stars since it is conveniently located near freeways, Greektown casino, bars, restaurants and it's affordably priced.  My king suite felt like an apt.  It was spacious and comfortable.  I will return and hopefully this love will withstand the test of time.*** Atheneum Suite Hotel  ...  An Affair to Remember. ***I have a soft spot for Detroit and hotels like the Atheneum is one of the reasons why.  For less than $150 you get a large, super clean sweet, with a comfy beds, luxury linens, a kick-ass bathroom and right out their back door you are in Detroit's little Greek Town!  What's not love?  Not to mention, they have free shuttle service with one of the nicest men I've ever met as the driver.  The people mover is also right outside your door and on-site is the restaurant Fishbones, a cajun inspired seafood restie that also serves breakfast and a Sunday brunch.  I'd skip this place and hit up Greek Town but it's nice to have a full-service restaurant on-site.  There is also a convenience store on site.  While in Detroit, I went for a walk outside of Greek Town and met a hooker with two missing teeth, wearing a purple bra outside of her tank top with her pimp and they asked me if I wanted to party!  How cool is that?!!!Great Room. The air conditioner broke, but they fixed it right away. The room was beautiful and the parking attendants were very helpful. All around great experience!Husband and I ABSOLUTELY LOVE this hotel and have stayed here multiple times.  It is close to everything we like about downtown Detroit. Everything is in walking distance from the hotel, including 3 of our favorite restaurants (red smoke, fish ones, and Pappy's). We also love the local bars in the area (the Detroiter, Jacoby's, and old shililaigh). Everyone we have encountered within the hotel has been simply amazing. The only downside is that the walls are thin and you can hear a little bit of noise. However, add in a cocktail or two and you sleep like a baby!On the plus side, the rooms are large and unique: nice big soaking tub, decent beds, interesting floorplan. On the minus side the whole place feels dated and in my room the heating unit buzzed all night. That's the reason for the one star. I need to sleep! Staff was mixed: check-in front desk was nice, check-out less so.Breakfast starts at seven - most places that's 6:30.  Too late for me.  When it did open, it wasn't worth waiting for. Coffee ,prepackage rolls. milk, juice - that's it.This hotel is a diamond in the rough and the location is prime but there are a few things I would expect to be standard for a $200+ room. The staff at the hotel is very friendly however booking a room or talking to anyone on the phone is terrible. I called a few times to get some additional details (parking and such) and every time I spoke to someone they were completely ghetto and rude. I have never called a hotel and talked to someone that didn't possess the basic conversational etiquette that should be required to work the phones. Anyways, the hotel seems very nice from a distance but under the microscope the shortcuts begin to unfold. The room was dirty with some sort of sludge on the wall, holes in the ceiling, stains on the furniture, and the AC panel was falling off. Like I said, the place is nice for the most part but it is clear that the hotel needs some extra TLC with the details and the booking department.If I could give 0 stars I would. I never write bad reviews but I had to warn others. This establishment charged my card twice for a one night stay. When I called and asked them about fixing it, they said they wouldn't do anything for 10 business days. Meanwhile, I am out an extra $310 while I wait.  The bed had hairs all over the blanket and the bathroom floor was filthy. Skip this hotel and go to Greektown.We stayed at the Atheneum for a girls' night out. There is no way that I was about to spend over $300 for a very basic hotel room at one of the casino hotels, especially Greek Town Casino. I've seen their rooms. It was clean, but very standard and not worth the money. The Atheneum was a little more than 1/2 the price for more than twice the size. We had a Deluxe Suite with 2 queen beds. Checking in was super easy. Reservation staff was very helpful regarding all of our questions. The only thing I didn't like is that the old bellman lied to us & pretty much everyone else. He told everyone that Lil' Wayne was staying at the hotel for extra tips. Of course, we believed him. (so dumb) Our room was very nice. It had a living room area with a pull-out couch, big flat screen TV, mini bar and small desk. There were about 3 steps down that led to the sleeping area. That was also fairly roomy. The view wasn't great, but we weren't expecting it. The bathroom was pretty standard with a jacuzzi tub. I think the beds were fine. It was quite a night, so I'm not really sure it mattered. I had no problem sleeping though. I love that they offer a free shuttle to any place within a 5 mile radius and they will pick you up. It takes about 15-20 minutes, and it was a very busy night with 2 concerts and a Lion's game. We took a little visit to the 10th floor and hung out in one of the bigger suites they offer. They are really nice! It had 2 bedrooms, a nice dining room area, big couch and a flat screen TV. It was pretty awesome! I would definitely stay here again!
review_content_20: Room was large and comfortable. Staff wasn't particularly friendly (except for one fantastic woman at the valet). They told me offered a free shuttle to the airport, but when we arrived at the terminal I was told I owed them $55. Awkward, embarrassing, and completely unacceptable. Breakfast buffet is a sad attempt. Satisfactory for a night or two, but wouldn't be my first choice.Excellent staff across the board, HUGE suites, large soaking tub, great room service (non greasy hashbrowns- always a plus!). Only "complaint" was the loudness of room 205. Could hear the people in the lobby below, the elevator ding, people on the street AND the people mover! But the dark curtains and king size bed with fresh smelling linens, cleanliness of the room, etc.- still impressed me. Greektown in general has come a long way since we left MI 8 years ago!Best rooms in the city hands down. Service is always great. Rooms are always clean. Room service from Fishbones is the best!I stay here quite often and will definitely be back!I really enjoyed my stay at the Atheneum. The best part of this hotel is one of the bellman Andre - what a hospitable, friendly, caring employee and a great asset to the hotel. My room was huge and very clean. I do think the hotel could use a few upgrades but overall I have really enjoyed my stay and would definitely come back to this property if I was in the Detroit area. There is a complimentary shuttle and free wi-fi which is also very convenient!Just want to say we had a great stay. Beautiful hotel and the room was large spacious and looked brand new. Mostly the staff was super friendly. Corey and Captain Tony were kind enough to take us to Corktown and Indian Village. What nice, fun and great ambassadors they are for the Atheneum and Detroit!Ive never wrote a bad review even though ive had bad experiences before...atheneum suites just took the cake.. called twice to get a room reserved and when we showed up we still didn't have a room held...thank god we still were able to get a room.. the BIGGEST problem is the thieves they employ that park your car..after I unpacked at home I noticed two pairs of new shoes id bought on the way to detroit missing out of the trunk..boxes still there but shoes gone. .you pay a bs parking fee just to get your stuff stolen. ..dont let these bloodsuckers steal your stuff too..We stayed here the night before an event and really enjoyed our stay. The room was really spacious, the staff helpful and friendly, and the location couldn't be beat. We valet parked our cars and they were returned to us upon check out right away.The hotel is in the Greektown neighborhood of Detroit, so there is really good food and entertainment right outside your door - but Fishbone's restaurant is in the same building as your hotel, so you don't even have to step outside to get a good meal. There is a hotel bar also, but we didn't visit there.We travel a lot, and there are a couple things that could be improved upon to bump this to a five star for me. The television was nice, but we couldn't get hi-def channels. The pillows weren't great, although the bed was really comfortable. There was no conditioner, just shampoo, lotion and body wash available. And the in room blow dryer was really weak, even for a hotel one. Except for the pillows, these are really just minor details.That said, the price was amazing - 139 a night for a great room in an outstanding location with really good service. We'd definitely stay here again and would recommend it to out of town visitors.We arrived very late last night and received a warm welcome and great service from the hotel personnel. The doorman/security guy helped us find a place for our truck and trailer on the street. We ended up booking a junior suite (about $130+tax and $50 deposit) which included a mini bar area, HUGE bathroom (which was immaculate btw) King size bed in a sunken area a few steps down from the bathroom and a large desk/vanity area with a flat screen tv. We were impressed with the attention to detail like the lighted vanity mirror in the bathroom, and super soft throw blanket and nice quality sheets and down comforter on the bed. You can even get 24 hr room service here, though we didn't partake. Overall we had a great stay and would stay again!The staff was incredibly nice! The beds and pillows are terrible, you should bring your own pillow! The valet service was fantastic. We stayed on a Saturday night and the hotel had a package for the Lions game that included a voucher for 40 dollars off of your dinner and shuttle to the game for free! They will also hold your bags and car until return from the game! If the beds and pillows were nicer I would give five stars.The valet parking was on point and although the cost is $20/night, the convenience was worth the price for almost the same as you would pay anywhere in Downtown Detroit. I was greeted by a very friendly and helpful staff member who quickly checked me in and sent me up to my beautiful double suite. We had a great view of the Greektown casino and the room was clean and fresh. Very spacious and accommodating for our pre-concert needs. Greektown was right there and very convenient to hit up Pizza Papali's and The Old Shilelegh before heading to The Joe for the concert. The People Mover brought us right back to Greektown by our hotel and a great night was had by all.I stayed here for one night while in Detroit for a job interview. Overall the hotel is clean but rather dated. The rooms were definitely originally designed in the 1980's but have been updated since then. On arrival we valeted the car, which was very convenient. They will add the valet charge (approx $20/night) to the room fee when you check in. The check in was smooth and friendly. The room was quite large, but was an awkward design. Think of a very long rectangle with a front room, then bathroom, then the bedroom all lined in along a hallway. There were 2 flat screens but they did not provide a very good quality picture. The bed was large and comfortable. The room was clean and void of any weird smells (a big plus). There is free wifi with the room. Overall the room was pretty quiet, but when it was late there were definitely some revelers from the Greektown casino outside that woke us up. There is a "complimentary breakfast" which is one of the saddest I have ever witnessed. Literally only cereal and a few sad wrapped up muffins and pastries were laid out. We went to the hotel restaurant "Fishbones" for a decent meal. We couldn't find a waitress to seat us, so we almost walked out. The food was fine there and decently priced. Another big plus is the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service around detroit. We used it to go out to dinner. You call when you are ready to be picked up (took about 30mins to pick us back up from calling time). Very nice service for people who are not familiar with the area. Overall, if you're in Detroit (my apologies if that is the case) then this is a solid placed to spend the night.It's clear that this hotel really cares about it's customers. They are always extremely helpful and polite, from the front desk to the porter to the shuttle driver. Oh, and the free shuttle to anywhere within 5 miles is worth it in itself! It saves you from fighting with Detroit cabs who are drunk/trying to rip you off. Also, the rooms are large and clean and the housekeeping is unobtrusive. We forgot to lock our safe one day and even left valuables out on the desk without anything moving a centimeter. Good people!!I had the BEST customer service today! Faith took care of my reservation. The servers were down when I called and she made sure to return my call promptly to complete the booking process. She was extremely personable, professional, accomodating and truly put some sunshine in my day with her sweet spirit! I already know the hotel and suites are beautiful, but having wonderful people taking care of you, is what truly puts The Atheneum over the top. Highly recommend this place for a lovely experience. :)Friendly staff and the room was nice, but dated. The little things are why I only gave it a three star. After a two hour drive all I wanted was a beer. I opened the mini fridge to get one and it only had Bud light. It was almost a year out of date. When I called to get a replacement they informed me that I only could get a warm beer. They couldn't get one from the bar. It took over a half hr to get it. They are nice big rooms with two TVs. But you cannot hook up a computer to them. So your only chose is to watch whatever is on. The picture quality was horrible. We placed our room service order the night before and it still was 49 minutes late. We asked for 9 and it arrived at 9:40. I wouldn't call that rush hr for breakfast. The order was missing a side of bacon. I asked the girl to please bring it up and it never arrived. At check/out we wanted to make sure it was not in the bill, so the manager got the girl and she said she brought it up. My wife and I let them know we didn't get it. She said she gave it to a women. We explained we were the only two in the room and we didn't get it. It was a headache and something that ended our stay on a bad note. We will not be staying here again. We like consistence to much.Beautiful and NOISY roomI stayed here the night before the 2013 Free Press Marathon, hoping to get a nice relaxing night of sleep and avoid the hassles of early morning parking.Valet parking and check in were a piece of cake. Nice people at the front of the hotel and behind the desk.Beautiful deluxe suite. I believe it was room 411.We checked in and got all cozy in the awesome hot tub.knock knock knock( thought it was somebody rapping at the door) got up to check. Nobody there.knock knock knockgot up again. Nobody there.We finally figured out that about every few minutes the pipes would rattle. I don't know if it was every time a toilet was flushed on a floor above us or what caused it but every few minutes a rapping/knocking sound which sounds exactly like a loud knock at the door , would happen.Once we realized what it was, no problem. A minor annoyance but certainly not reason enough to request a new room,as I figured with the marathon going the place was probably fullPut on the tigers -red sox game and settled down for a quiet night.Then around 10-1030 I start to hear music. boom boom boom doons doons doons, etcI think its a car stereo down on lafayette. But it keeps on goingI then see this MASSIVE night club occupying a large section of the building across on Lafayette ( I don't know the name of the club, but the taco Loco mexican restaurant and the bouzouki topless joint are on the ground floor of this building)This shitty super loud house music was blasting into my room. ( along with screaming DJ's ) by now the tigers game is about over and it's midnight and I am just sort of accepting that I am going to get a crappy night of sleep before my race.IT WAS LOUD!I frankly didn't want to go through the hassle of packing up all my stuff and trying to change rooms that late at night.I was sleepy the next morning but PR'd my race so I was happy. Thanks to perfect weather, but no thanks to this noisy room till at least 2 AM.This is a 4 star hotel and the noise is really out of their control ( though the windows were drafty. I am not sure if windows can be noise proofed to cut down on street and club noise but it would help ) but a 2 star experience if you get a room bordering lafayette ( double check the street, it's the one with the bouzouki lounge) If I wanted to party all night I might consider returning since the room was great BUT if I want to sleep I will probably just go to the Marriott Ren Cen and get a room on the 47th floor and enjoy the silence and the viewMake sure to try and get a room that does not border Lafayette Avenue!!I stayed here for 3 weeks in January, 2014 and the room was a great size--split between a decent sized living room space and bedroom space that was down a short flight of stairs. The staff was friendly and I would especially like to give a quick shout out to Curtis at the Bell Desk who shuttled me to work on multiple days. He was extremely friendly, had a lot of stories about the area and was generally extremely helpful. My stay was generally pretty good but he was great.The hotel isn't in bad shape and the rooms were nice, however, I was robbed while we were out at hockey game. The security man says that he did an investigation and couldn't do anything about it. Pretty pathetic that this could happen at a fairly nice place. Wouldn't advise going there.The annual USMC Birthday Ball was held here this year, so we got to see the level of service for a big event, as well as regular service.Check-in (and valet parking) was quick and efficient, and when I asked if there were refrigerators in the rooms and was told no, but they could have one sent up...she was already dialing the phone to order one before I could stop her to say we didn't really need one. That's service.The rooms were really quite nice. Though I'm not sure exactly what level room we had (since it was an event deal, we got what we got for a certain price with no choice), there was a decent-sized living room with a couch (though very uncomfortable), a side chair, a coffee table, a flat panel TV, and the mini-bar in an entertainment console. Through the door, there was a tiny hallway with a mirrored closet on one side and the bathroom on the other. The bathroom was very decent sized, with a deep tub (though no jets) and a well-lit counter. Unfortunately, our toilet wouldn't flush, so we had to call the front desk. The maintenance guy was there within five minutes and had it fixed within another five (at most). Impressive. I wanted a snack before the events started, and the sushi sounded good (a bit expensive but not super crazy) but we only had an hour before we had to leave, so I called to first ask how long it would take, and asked if an hour was enough time. The guy laughed and said it would be less than half an hour. Cool. It was there in TEN MINUTES. Impressive. The sushi itself wasn't anything to write home about. *Note that gratuity is automatically added. I forgot to tell hubby, so when he signed for it, he tipped. EEK. So we had extra-expensive sushi on accident.I went to get ice and the one on our floor was out of order. I tried another floor and that one had no sign but wasn't working, so I stopped a housekeeper who was walking by to let her know, and by the time I walked away, I heard her calling it in. Impressive. So, what wasn't as impressive? 1) The steps down to get to the sleeping area. Cool idea, but overall I'd rather not have them. Both of us tripped on them at one time or another (and we hadn't even had a drink!). 2) The glass blocks as the bathroom wall. Again, cool idea, but another fail in my opinion--if you turn on either bathroom light in the middle of the night it lights up the entire sleeping area. 3) The A/C was crappy and loud. It was set to 65 when we walked in but it didn't feel like any 65 I know. We turned it down to 62 to try and get some cool air going....and came back to room after 3 hours...still not cool. I called the front desk and long story short they said their rooms don't get cool like that. Huh? Their solution was to shut the door between the two rooms to try and keep the cool air in the bedroom area. Not a great solution as far as I was concerned. Anyway, we like it cool to sleep so left it on...set at 65 and the damn thing was SO noisy that it woke me up every 10-15 minutes all night as it cycled on. In other words, a nightmare. 4) The walls are thin! I heard a bunch of marines coming down the hall at 3am and heard someone's cell phone alarm (in the neighboring room) at 5am. 5) The bed was mostly comfortable and the pillows were okay but neither was anything to write home about.Needless to say I didn't sleep much that night.As far as the convention/event aspect, everything was spot on. The bartenders were great and remembered your drink of choice (a feat, with 150 people in attendance), the servers were efficient and very nice, the food was actually tasty, and additional requests were handled well. Checkout and valet went smoothly, and when we were asked about our stay, I commented on the noisy A/C and saw her write a note about it. So, I'm divided on this review, and must use actual math. 1) Employees (very nice) *****2) Service (quick and efficient) *****3) Event "stuff" ****4) Hotel room **5) Room service sushi **18 stars / 5 categories is 3.5, rounded down to 3 because I only got maybe an hour of sleep the whole night.I booked this hotel on skyauction.com for $270 for two nights (Friday/Saturday) and was happy with my purchase. I know, some of you will complain about the $20 a day charge for valet parking....come out to Seattle and that will double...quit whining...The hotel is located in Greektown...where the action is in Detroit as far as I could see. A short walk to Ford Field or CommericA Park or to the Transit Station to Windsor...all the places I needed to go.The rooms were HUGE, the staff was friendly and helpful. I got a late checkout on a Sunday....a big plus. I liked this hotel. A little more room than I needed, but when I return to Detroit, I will return here!Me and my friends have booked rooms in this all-suite hotel on several occasions. I have enjoyed a few downtown birthdays here as well. This is an awesome hotel. Very much in the heart of the lively Greektown neighborhood, so the casino and tons of restaurants are in walking range of here. There's even a mediocre and low-profile, low-mileage gentleman's club called Bouzouki's across the street. For the family friendly, don't let that deter you from this great hotel, because it's hard to see and only attracts legitimate patrons.This hotel's lobby is spacious, grand, and adorned with plenty of Greek paintings, statues, and architecture. It's not over the top, but it's enough to let a brother know he in Greektown. The suites are awesome! The most square footage for the buck in the D! It's an all-suite hotel, but let me warn you, when you get your room - inspect the size - because due to the floor layout, some rooms in the SAME tier still have less floor space than others!Rooms have 2 TVs, one in the bedroom area and one in the living room area. Bathrooms are huge. Rooms are up to date and clean. Plenty of space to move about! The fact that suites here can be had for discounted rates of well under $200 is great value. Suites at the boutique/antique Omni in the outskirts of downtown are more than twice this cost, and that for a worse location in my opinion.Staff is kind, there's a bar/grill on the main floor, and the hotel is connected to Detroit's popular Fishbone's restaurant! I hear that Fishbone's does the room service as well (which is nice because pricing off of the restaurant menu will be more economy friendly than via inflated in-house hotel dining). All in all, I have had great experiences here. They are also very kind to late checkouts at 1PM, which guys like me who party hard on Saturday nights can appreciate on a detox Sunday afternoon. My girlfriend once forgot her laptop and iPod in her room, and with some repeated calls and probing, was able to recover it from their vast lost and found (which looked like a garage sale of valuables). It was just nice to see that having left those valuables behind in a Detroit hotel did not equate to them being stolen. If you want a comfortable up to date suite, in a fresh up to date hotel, with awesome location in the best and safest part of downtown Detroit - all for sub-$200/night, this is definitely the hotel for you! In recent times, I have been booking $50 3-star rooms via Hotwire & Priceline, but for a special occasion, and when I need more space for more guests, I will surely come back here!
review_content_40: I stayed at the Atheneum Suite Hotel for a family wedding, and paid $139.00 a night during my 3 day stay.The hotel is in an older building, but the interior is quite modern.The room was nice and clean, but was noisy due to being right next to the elevators as well as nearby slamming of neighboring room's doors.  The daytime temperature were in the high 90's, but my room was pleasingly cool, although I heard other's complain their rooms were warm.  I was also finding myself trying to find a working ice machine as the one on my floor, as well as others, were inoperative.  Once notified, the staff was quick to make the necessary repairs.I think the hotel's greatest asset is their employees as they were all cheerful and helpful.The free wifi was nice as was the available computer/printer in a room just off the lobby.The hotel is within walking distance to Ford Field as well Comerica Park, or you can just use the free shuttles of nearby bars.Despite the noted problems, I would stay here again if the price was right when compared to nearby competitors.My first visit was exceptional - stayed here on business in Detroit.  So I decided to return for another business trip.  Both stays were excellent.- Valet parking- Downtown-  Mr. Tony Tone the shuttle driver is off the hook - he will take you to anywhere form hotel door -- within five mile radius - I always go to ROAST restaurant and back - but that is me- The lobby bar is a beauty - and the bartender is top notch - I always have a Bombay Sapphire martini here- Room is spacious and cozy at the same time- Last two rooms on eight floor were church mouse quiet - at least in NovemberI inspected all bed sheets and linens - as I am a particular guy - all good.Booking another stay as we speak.My fiance and I stayed there last night for our fourth anniversary, and for the price we were not disappointed. They only have valet parking, so we parked at Greektown (free) and walked the two blocks over to the hotel. The staff was nice enough.Our suite was on the 9th floor on the east side of the building. Right above a club, it was sort of noisy until around 2 a.m., but what else do you expect being Downtown?There are many places to eat within walking distance, which is great because room service seemed a little pricey and they add 18% gratuity. The King size bed was spacious and so comfortable I almost didn't want to leave for dinner! Back to the hotel, I enjoyed a soak in their deep tub, then relaxed on the soft bed.Since our anniversary was on a Friday, this was less expensive than staying at the casinos, and well worth the money we did pay. This being our first time staying anywhere together, we may consider this again next year!What a terrrific little gem this place is in the middle of Greek Town in downtown Detroit.  The staff was friendly and very informative.  It took next to no time for them to get to know me by name and offer up suggestions for stuff to do in the area.  I was there for NAIAS week so they were able to steer me to things that wouldn't be so crowded.The free shuttle service within 5 miles of the hotel is an awesome perk., especially when one is without a car while staying there like I was.  That 5 miles will get you right to the Motown Museum and back in no time.  Very friendly driver.I was impressed with the rooms.  Nicely appointed and certainly a value for the money.  I liked the big screen TV, even though one of the remotes didn't work.  They are well insulated from noise from the outside.  The beds were among the best I've ever had in a hotel, no back ache in the morning is a good thing!I do have a few niggles about the place.  They were enough to keep me from giving it a 5 star rating.  The clock radio wouldn't set, but the friendly staff did do a prompt wake up call as I had requested.  The remote for the TV in the bedroom was barely functioning and one had to manually turn on/off the TV.  My biggest peeve is when in a boutique hotel as nice as this one, why do they insist on using single ply toilet paper?  The stuff is rough and falls apart during useage which is pure grossness.I wasn't on the side of the hotel facing the strip club so noise was not an issue for me.  I do have friends who were staying same time as I who did note that there was some noise they would hear from the club as well as drunks coming out of the casino at night.The Atheneum is our favorite hotel when we visit downtown Detroit to play at the Greektown Casino. We always book the Deluxe Suite - two-room suite with a parlor area and sleeping room with a king or two queen-size beds. Well-appointed rooms with contemporary furniture and design in earth tones. Beds are comfortable and bathrooms are spacious with a soaking tub. If there is one criticism I have for this hotel, it is the service at the Front Desk. Every time we check in, we do not get that welcome feeling from the staff (they seem in a rush to check you in they don't really engage in conversation)... always made me wonder. But, it is still a nice hotel and you can't beat the location!WARNING...One of my colleagues at work rented the Presidential suite the day before Thanksgiving 2012. Someone broke into their room WHILE THEY slept and robbed them.  You are putting your life and property at risk staying at this hotel.My husband and I stayed here last night and were underwhelmed. I'm a very detail orientated person and noticed a lot of little flaws. The walls in the hallways had water damage and/or cheap plaster and repair work. The caulking in the bathroom was done very poorly. The grout between the tiles was no existent in some places. The railings in the hallway on the 9th floor no less were wobbly. Our check-in seems to take forever. There was a crack in the glass door to our closet. There was a stain in the carpet... I could go on.A much more obvious blunder was the paper thin walls. We could hear garbage trucks outside at 6am and could hear hotel doors slamming shut and people talking in the halls all night.A few good notes: the shuttle service is free and fast (used it to go to dinner), the location is good and the valet service was efficient.Next time we decide to stay overnight downtown we'll be staying at the Greektown hotel or splurge at the Westin Book Cadillac. Also, I'm really shocked that this hotel is a four-diamond AAA rated hotel. I've stayed at true four-diamond hotels before and this hotel doesn't even compare to them.During my stay the wireless internet was down for over a day. Shady neighborhood. Rooms are spacious and clean, but could use some updating.I have had the pleasure of staying at a few hotels in Detroit... MotorCity Casino being a really good hotel, surrounded by a wasteland of pretty much everything. You are kind of stuck in the hotel/casino... the Atheneum was suggested to me by a coworker and I went. The one ting that stood out for me was the proximity of the BOUZOUKI strip club to the really contemporary hotel. Walking in you are greeted by two large scale Greek Gods on the walls.The rooms were really nice, they actually had stairs down to the bedroom. The one thing that bothered me though was the bathtub, it was huge, but stepping into the tub took a bit of effort. The half shower curtain from the 70's was cool.I gave it a 5 for the fact that I was not stuck in the hotel. I got to experience the only civilized area in Detroit, being Greektown. if the city of Detroit were more like this two and half block section of city. I may enjoy it more. Food was excellent in almost every place I went. The people did not look like they were going to rob me at every moment. There were sounds of laughter, talking, no gun fire, nobody screaming that they just got stabbed. It was nice.I will stay here again when I go back, hopefully not for another couple of years....3.5 stars rounded up.Stayed 4 nights.  I love the huge suites.  Not that I use a living room on business trips but I was thoroughly impressed.  The king sized bed was just how I like it, king sized :) with lots of layers of blankets and a thick comforter (down-like) not that weird polyester crap that you get at most joints.  The tub was also huge, didn't get the jets but always good to be able to take a bath here and there and stretch out.Friendly lady when we checked in at near 3am and speedy and kind valets.  But man, Detroit parking is still $20 a night?  That's comparable to other bigger cities, doesn't make sense to me since property value is so low, is this accounting for "security"? Perhaps.... Bellhops are also friendly but I guess everyone is working for a tip, I handed out plenty of that.Really the sleep was the best part which is hard to come by on business trips.  The hotel is located in a great part of town, and on the weekend, it was even bustling.  They included breakfast, which was pretty subpar, so there is a half a point docked for that.  I would just rather not have it included at all than be disappointed.  All in all, a hotel I would have no reservations returning to, and one I could even recommend to others.Stayed here to attend the Green Bay/Detroit Thanksgiving Day game, and I couldn't find much that wasn't to my liking.  All of the staff members were exceedingly friendly and efficient, and the room was quite nice.  It's located in a prime location to some great attractions downtown. I did notice the music from the strip club late in the night, but it didn't bother me that much (I can sleep through most anything).Love the rooms and the location. 24hr room service, flat screen tv's, modern and clean. All must haves for me. Having a casino right there is cool but having to pay for drinks is re-dic. Prob my favorite hotel for Detroit.I've stayed in an Antheneum suite twice and enjoyed it. I like that the suites have a large bath tub. It's also in a great location in downtown Detroit thats just about walking distance from anything you'd wanna see or do downtown. Room service is provided by 3 different restaurants in the area. The price was great. I'd give the beds a B+ rating. However there is one issue with ALL the rooms there that makes staying at the Antheneum a pain. THE WALLS ARE PAPER THIN! I've heard an entire conversation of the ppl staying next to me and they weren't yelling. Makes sleeping kinda hard.Here for business meeting, so not sure of the prices but I am sure we can find those online. The suite was expansive with a front room that included couch and tv. Large bathroom. Great location to many downtown activities and locations.I have stayed at their Jacuzzi Suite few times and I really like it here.  I do recommend this place for out of towners to stay because the location is awesome and it's probably one of the better Hotels in the heart of the city.My Suite had like an upper tier are for the Jacuzzi which is wide open in the room.  The Jacuzzi tub isn't the biggest but it's good enough.  The upper tier has a TV and couch also.
