It's a in a great location, just a short walk from the Cobo, as well as Greektown, Mexicantown, and Corktown.  The amenities are great too.  My room was spacious and had a huge bathroom.  It's a classy joint, and if I'm in town again, I'd definitely consider staying there again.This hotel is very, very nice. To put it in perspective when my taxi driver drove up to drop me off he let out a low whistle and told me, "Dang girl! These are some nice digs!" If only I had such a way with words.The beds are so soft I could have slept for days without leaving. Or maybe that was because of the blackout curtains? I don't know for sure. What I do know for sure is that the bathroom was so big you could have fit at least a dozen of Santa's Little Helpers (yes, I'm talking elves) in there comfortable for a disco dance party. And with the dual shower head two of them could have even taken a shower at the same time. Luckily I didn't have to share and the double water flow was all mine.Room service was friendly and prompt. There is both a restaurant and a coffee shop attached to the hotel. And a cab stand is right out front. If you find yourself in need of a hotel in Downtown Detroit I doubt you could do better for yourself. Scouts honor.Probably the nicest hotel in Detroit and conveniently located to the numerous seedy downtown hot spots.  The rooms at the Book Cadillac are nice and seem to average a little over $200 per night.  Each night that you choose to sleep in your own filth and not have your room cleaned will earn you a $5 coupon.  This is enough to cover a large coffee and pastry or egg sandwich at the WBC coffee place located within the hotel.  Perhaps the biggest draw, though, is the hotel's history.  JFK and Harry Truman stayed at the Book (not together, I don't think) as did Babe Ruth.  It's the place where an ill Lou Gerhig told his manager that he could not play anymore.  The hotel, which opened in 1924, was as vacant as the Book Tower across the street for many years until it received an extensive rehab and reopened in 2008.  Unfortunately, the grand staircase and lobby did not survive the renovation, but at least two ballrooms were recreated to appear as they originally did.The Book does have a few downsides, though.  The post-renovation lobby is sterile and small: don't expect the Palmer House.  Also, they charge nearly $8 a day for Internet: what's next, $3 a day for air? If you don't want to pay for Internet, it is free in 30 minute blocks in the lobby, but don't drink there, as a martini will run about $13.50.The Hotel itself is clean and accommodating.  Appears to be very popular and with it comes a potential long wait at Check-in, which by the way is on the 2nd floor. Only 1 small sign indicating.  Valet personnel could have said something as we arrived.  Which by the way is the main reason the only get 2 stars.  Called 10 minutes prior to check out, got outside and had to wait another 20 minutes while others walked out handed their slip to the attendee and got their vehicle within 5 minutes.  Kept asking, they just said its on the way.  No apologies and seemed upset when I didn't tip.  Change your Valet company!I ordered room service and the steak tasted like leather. I have a food allergy, so I requested a small side salad instead of the fries- I received a small, sad looking bowl of lettuce and dressing and they charged me an additional $13.50. The bathtub had a curly black hair in it- I have blonde hair, so it most certainly did not belong to me. The fire alarm went off at 7:00 AM EST (I am from the West Coast, so this was a rude awakening that set me up for a rough day), I then got locked in the stairwell and ended up outside in my PJ's in negative temperatures. To top it off, I went to print a document for my meeting in the business center and the printer "wasn't working." The beds were comfortable, but not comfortable enough to make me endure this hotel again- I won't be back.On my very first business trip, my firm sent me to Detroit.  I was hoping for NYC or Chicago if I had to jet to the East Coast (in the winter!) but was nevertheless excited to travel for work.  I would've become a flight attendant if I didn't care about making the minimum wage or mind modern-day slavery.  Trial lawyer, it is.Anyway, I stayed at the Westin for two nights in December.  Let me just say that I completely forgot 1) I was in Detroit; 2) there's nothing to do (except work, of course); and 3) the downtown is scary even though I grew up in a ghetto.  This is the best hotel in Motor City.  It offers everything you could possibly want, including a bed for a king, a gym and spa, antibiotic cream in the middle of the night, and the best restaurant in the city (Roast).I haven't experienced many luxury hotels--unless you count wandering through the seven-star hotel in Milano--but the Westin was perfect for business.  Let it be known that I'm happy to visit Detroit anytime, as long as I can eat at Roast while I'm there.My only complaints are that the water pressure was terrible and the service in the breakfast area made me wonder why I didn't run to an egg mcmuffin at McDonald's instead.  Other than that, it's worth every penny my firm paid.
review_content_80: One of my favorite hotels in the world. They did a wonderful job bringing the building back to life. Convenient to Comerica Park - the main reason I go to Detroit - and other bars and restaurants nearby.  Hang out in the Motor Bar during baseball season. You're likely to bump into players from the opposing team, and all the bartenders are friendly and awesome. Well appointed rooms and they'll give you an upgrade if they can, just ask. The corner rooms on the upper floors are gigantic and have wonderful views along with double shower heads. Beautiful indoor pool area downstairs. The staff is always helpful and happy to cater to your every whim.Stayed here May 17-18 2014 and would totally go back again.Pros:Super cleanComfy bedHuge suite (1 king bed with small seating area, desk area and large bathroom)Ordered room service; had steak frites, and it was very quickly delivered and tastyConvenient Starbucks in lobby, when in-room coffee isn't enoughValet service was easy and fast to retrieve my car when checking outStaff signed me up for SPG so I could get the free wi-fiSuper close walking to the waterfront and Greektown and I walked up to the DIA and Cass corridor too. A bit of a hike but easy to get around.Staff; doorperson, valet attendant and check in desk staff were all very polite and professionalCons:Check in time was a little long, but no major complaints. Arrived the same time as a large family attending a function so about 10 parties ahead of me, no big dealWithout being an SPG members you have to pay for wi-fi, which I think is ridiculous this day in ageAte at Roast, one of the restaurants in the hotel, and despite rave reviews it's only okay. I suspect, after eating other places around town, it might actually be one of the fancier places.I didn't like the shampoo/soap, too dryingMotor bar was pretty quiet and boring but would be okay to get a quick drinkAs a result of my stay here I'm booking into another Westin for my next out of town weekend.Enjoyed my stay here, they put me in a room next to the elevator but when I requested a different room they upgraded me to a suite which was very nice. Also, they have a concierge lounge (with eggs for breakfast!) which isn't a given at Westin properties. Location is decent but dodgy at night. Much nicer and newer than the Marriott Ren Cen though.I stayed here for a night this past weekend after a less than stellar experience the night before at another establishment in the city.  While I doubt that I'll be adding anything new to the discussion of this place, I really can't say enough about the Hotel. This was my second time staying here and it's just an all around amazing property.  The rooms themselves are the best I've seen at any Westin and are also extremely spacious as well as sleek.  The cost is pretty reasonable for what I'd say is the nicest hotel in the City as well.  You really can't beat the location either, as this is about as centrally located as you can get in the City of Detroit.  Staying at the Book Cadillac also offers the most painless experience regarding catching a cab in the City (which in my experience is not always easy in Detroit) as they're generally waiting right out in front of the Hotel. My only minor gripe would be the additional charges for internet access (even in the lobby!).  However, this seems to be par for the course for any Westin property that I've stayed at in the past as, so it wasn't entirely surprising.  Regardless, I will definitely be staying here again next time I'm in Detroit.Very Comfortable, and pet friendly...I stayed there for one night with my family and we brought a medium sized dog with us. And was delighted when the Hotel was willing to accommodate all of us, (for a fee, understandably). They provided a nice little dog bed for our pet, which was very nice of them.We only stayed there for one night, so we didn't get to experience all of the amenities of the hotel, however, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean, which was all we needed. The Hotel is located at a very nice area, right in front there was a small park were we could walk our dog, and the People Mover station is also across the street, so there is no need to bother the Valet Parking attendants whenever you want to move through Downtown Detroit.Overall, it was a great experience.If this hotel were anywhere else but on a seriously dead street in the middle of Detroit, it would definitely get 5 stars.While it's super nice and clean, and our junior suite was ENORMOUS had 2 tvs and an OUT of this world bathroom, there were a couple of things that just knocked the stars off.First) the parking....we had to valet and the valets took a little while to get the car...just an inconvenience more than anything else.2nd) When we asked about where to find a breakfast place in walking distance, the valet sent us on a wild goose chase to a dive in the middle of a particularly dodgy part of Detroit(across from the Bus depot.)  My PIC and I could only be described as WASPy so being led that far astray was really bothersome.Good restaurants and bars inside (we had  a Matthew Stafford sighting) but I think there is some room for improvement with the staff.Great room, comfy bed, clean interior, but the worst valet service experienced in a long time... 45 min for a van, in the morning... Lucky we didn't have a flight to catch or else we (10+ people) would all have been looking to rebook... Don't get me wrong, I'm not blaming the people who work in valet at this hotel... I'm just blaming the system or the process of which they pull up vehicles... I would definitely try to call valet from your room and see if they can start to pull up your car... I mean, 45 mins in cold weather isn't fun (yes, we all could have waited inside, but again with all our luggage already outside; we didn't expect to wait 45 minutes)Quite comfy and well appointed.  There is a strange tension between being fancy and attempting "go green" here.  For example, they have double shower heads, with a note showing how to turn one off to save water.The restaurant, Roast, is not your normal hotel fare; worth a visit!Ok, so...if you need to stay Downtown Detroit, THIS is your place. No need to look further, promise. Snag a rate on one of the booking engines, rack up those SPG points and have yourself a little roll in the (extra comfy plush) hay. Beats Ren Cen by a MILE. *The digs be straight-up plush...and NOT just because this is Detroit. This is one of the nicest Westins in all the land. Clean, contemporary, well-appointed. Large bathrooms, room to breathe. And sleep. And...well, whatever you'd like to do!*Staff (from doormen to checkout) were kind, courteous and helpful. The concierge even "tweeted" at me when I checked in via Yelp to make sure I was taken care of if I need anything. Well, hello social media wizards, indeed. *Rate was reasonable: King Standard Room, $179 + taxes. *Complimentary bottle of water and Starbucks coffee in room. *Attached to hotel: WBC coffee bar (yayyyy!), Roast Restaurant, gift shop and parking structure. *Cab stand DIRECTLY out the front door, with plentiful cabs ready to whisk you where ever you might need to go. Obviously, Westins are known for their comfyass beds, and this did not disappoint. Despite only utilizing 10 percent of the King bed, it was comforting JUST to know that I could sleep in any direction I saw fit. Or add 16 friends. But ok, it was just me...but I slept like a rock. Flawless hotel stay. I'll be back.Old world class rarely survives in a downtown's hurried, slick climate. The Westin Book Cadillac is a glamorous gem Detroit deservedly is proud of, standing testament to a genteel time when men held doors open for ladies, going out for dinner called for gloves, and everyone swanned around in black tie formal after 4PM.Hard to believe four foot snowdrifts had the interior to themselves just a few years ago. Harder still to believe Detroiters aren't reclaiming more of their iconic downtown buildings and renovating them into splendid palaces of the old and new. But I dream...Truly the Book Cadillac is something special. I attended a wedding for friends here held in the Boulevard Room but neglected to stay at the hotel due to financial constraints. How I wish I had. Nonetheless, I had the pleasure of enjoying the interior, the services, and heavenly Roast. At first surprised they arranged for the ceremony in the hotel, arriving in the atrium answered my tacit questions in one go. Some hotels are flashy and California luxurious. The Westin simmers with quiet sophistication that awes, but never isolates or overwhelms. Polished floors and wooden accents surround the common rooms, and intense, unobtrusive service from the staff never intrudes upon the event or your stay. The kitchen and events group produced all the aperitifs and beverages beautifully, managing the dishes and exchanging bottles without interfering in mingling conversations. The Toronto Maple Leafs and the Pittsburgh Penguins both stayed at the hotel during the wedding, but you would barely know it other than riding up with members of the organizations in the elevators or escalators. I caught a glimpse of some notable names, not saying who. Discretion still ruled the day and we all felt like kings for the attention received. Drawbacks for the events occurred with miscommunication or problems at the reception at Roast and the hotel reducing number of reserved rooms in the hotel block for the wedding guests and party. Arranging to expand the block in a sold out hotel was a logistics headache capable of leveling an aurochs (MOO) but we had a hard-headed, determined planner who bulled her way through until the issue was grudgingly reconciled.   Parking in the adjacent garage was fine, but a pain in the winter, I'm sure. Not a great deal is down here but other Yelpers, note that Lafayette and American Coney Islands -- two of the most infamous coneys in the city with a near Hatfield-McCoy relationship due to a family feud -- deserve to be visited!Great hotel with great amenities and very friendly staff. Walking to Comerica Park. Walked to and from the Tigers baseball game with several others. Staff was accommodating and helpful. Walking distance to The Ham Shoppe where we had omlettes. Toast and grits for $5. Would definitely stay there again if ever in Detroit.If you are visiting Detroit, stay here !!  The hotel is a beautiful historic building that offers modern amenities throughout.  The rooms are perfect for a business trip or a family vacation.The location is perfect for nearby Tigers Stadium.   Michael Symon Roast is one of the food choices within the hotel, and ironically enough Roast was the best meal I had while visiting Detroit.I will be staying at this hotel every time I visit Detroit, complete no brainer.Awesome hotel in a pretty awesome town. Stayed here for a week and I have to say, this is a great hotel. Very cool, great location and a pretty decent bar. The fitness center is really nice as well!spacious, well appointed rooms.  the downtown location is perfect if you're heading to detroit for a baseball or football game.  "lafayette coney island" (a local sit-down, fast food institution)  is practically across the street.  got a great rate off priceline and will definitely be back.  skip the retooled & overpriced starbuck's clone ("wbc coffee") in the lobby and walk a few blocks to "the roasting company" for a MUCH BETTER cup of coffee.rooms feature large lcd tvs, complimentary bottled water & in-room starbuck's coffee.  top notch accommodations, VERY nice showers and super comfy beds.  staff was extremely friendly & helpful.  i ate elsewhere, but i'm told that the restaurant ("roast") has great local food, along with impressive wine, beer and spirits selections.  really a good stay!!!The only hotel I stay in when in Detroit.Gotta say this was one of the worst "Westin" experiences I've ever had.  NO, let's say it was THE worst.  Never stayed at a Westin that wouldn't be a 5-star review from me.  Should have known at 4:30 p.m. the check-in line had over 20 people waiting.  Slow check-in services.  People were waiting up to 2 hours for their rooms. Heard another couple yelling at front desk because they were waiting over 45 minutes for their luggage to be deliverd.  With all that said,  loved my room.  Loved the bed, etc. - but this place HAS to start living up to the whole "Westin" experience.  Then after assuring me the night before, how easy it was to get a taxicab when i'd be leaving, there was not ONE in site that morning.  Such a perfect ending.  Don't think i'll be back to this place.  Ever.Got my reservation wrong and wouldn't do anything for me to make up. Room was small, unlike the pictures.This was a very beautiful hotel when i stayed several years ago, the room i stayed in was $250 a night and it was very spacious and it had a large queen size bed with a huge 42" flat screen inch television and plenty of outlets available to enjoy your electronics..this is a 5-star hotel and i ordered room service when i got their and it was great the staff is very attentive to all your needs!The Westin Book Cadillac was not my hotel of choice, as I'm used to staying at the MGM Grand. The WBC is 3 blocks away from Cobo though, so it saves you the time of waiting for a cab, as you can walk it if the weather permits.The building is beautiful, and when you walk in, you're on the ground floor (Level 1) which holds the Roast Restaurant (separate review). Take the escalators or elevators up to Level 2 for front desk/registration. Service was really friendly. I was in a King Suite with a full living room, desk, couch, coffee table. The bedroom and bathroom were a good size. Things I loved: - You can forgo housekeeping and get a $5 credit each night or 500 Starwood points to your account. Go green!- Comfy bed.- They have a separate trash can for recycling!- Two shower heads, one is turned off to save water, but you can turn it on yourself (if you're over 5'1" - I couldn't reach!)- Room service was always early or right on time, and good!- Large LG plasma in bedroom and living room. You can set it as an alarm so you can wake up to your TV, instead of an annoying alarm.- Nice, roomy gym with treadmills, ellipticals, weights and weight machines, all the latest and greatest with individual TVs. 24 hour key card access!- Everyone was really nice.Things that could use improvement:- My desk lamp didn't work.- WiFi is expensive, starts at like $10/24 hours.- No liquid soap. Shampoo and conditioner, but only bar soap.- A/C unit was loud when it turned on and off. I just left the heater in the bedroom on and cranked up the one in the living room and left my bedroom door open.- Hotel was a bit confusing. Registration on 2nd floor, gym on 1st.- Not cheap, but super close, 3-block walking distance from Cobo Center.I spend more than a third of my life in hotels, and this is one of my favorites. Perfect location, very nice rooms, friendly service, Roast on-site, a weekday club lounge with good breakfast, and consistently great treatment of SPG Platinum members make the Book stand out from other Westin properties. The only downside is the Boulevard Room restaurant, which is the only breakfast option on weekends (or if you aren't on the club floor). But the Boulevard Room's consistently and appallingly slow service can't detract from this otherwise great property.

review_content: I've said for awhile that casinos match the personality of the people that go to it. MGM can be seen as 'the classy one' or 'the snooty one' depending on your view. Inside it's nice and spacious. Plenty of room for the games and slots. Bars and restaurants litter the outside (bring back The blue room!) and the main bar/entertainment area is in the middle of it all.  This part is the newest addition/renovation and in all truth needs more space. Even on the slower days there's never really a good spot to be, even the one spot always roped off for VIPs isn't something to brag about.The restaurants are all nice in their own way. Tap room is okay for sports watchers but there are better options in the downtown area. Buffet is pretty good from what I remember and Wolfgang Steak is a great place to be.Upstairs, there's a poker room and a nightclub/ sushi bar which both are fine for its purpose. The fire pits in the nightclub can get insanely hot and most of the seats are right along it. Maybe not the best decision (or maybe the increase of drink sales is GENIUS!) could go either way.I'm not much of a gambler (read: tightwad) but they seem to have a good selection of games here. I can't speak on payouts, but my friends have mostly come away in the black so I guess that's good.Having tried the other two on earlier visits to Michigan (and when I used to live in the area), I found them a bit dingy and smokey.  Sometimes I'm into that sort of thing.  But others, I want a casino that makes me feel classy.  Walking into the MGM in Detroit, it felt like a casino that is trying for something better (because MGM does their casinos right in my experience).  This is the swanky casino in Detroit.  I'm glad I finally found it! First of all, they have a dedicated non-smoking room.  While I did not choose to use it (and ended up smelling like, well, a casino from using the blackjack tables), this was definitely a great perk.But the main reason I love this place is that they have a party pit with $1 blackjack on weekends.  It has the usual .25 cent surcharge a hand for that sort of thing (though I found this a handy hand counter) but it was an amazing way to spend a lot of time at a blackjack table with a friendly and knowledgeable dealer.  The weird thing about this is that most people were betting the regular minimum ($15 when I was there) to avoid the charge.  I was betting $5 a hand and finished about $20 (instead of $25 without the surcharge) ahead.Since I am waiting for the freebies for signing up at the new MGM near Washington D.C. when it opens this year as a "new" player, I did not get a player card.  But they are tied into the mLife network across the world.  So if you ever find yourself with an occasion to visit this casino, do it!  Ignore the Detroit in the name if you have to since this place is a clean and shiny MGM casino all the way!This review will be on the hotel, casino, and spa only. Restaurants are reviewed separately. I stayed here for several nights in November 2015 for a conference. Pros: the place is CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN!  The rooms are large and spacious and the beds soft and comfy. Housekeeping is wonderful and the attention to detail is noted! A nice perk is that they offer free newspapers, water, and coffee bar for all guests. The spa is wonderful! Nice clean gym and spa with sauna, vapor bath with steam, and pool (shallow) not good for laps. I loved the gym and spa so much I went every day instead of the casino.The casino: FYI I am not a casino gambler. However- It would be more appealing if the cigarette smoke was less. The have 1 small nonsmoking room with slots only. I am sensitive to smoke and I could not even watch others play poker because the smoke was so bad. Location: I understand this place was built in an area to revitalize an area of down town Detroit. However I walked around every day and  there was not much close outside the hotel to see or do within walking distance, There is the "people mover" rail a short walk which one can assess. The staff are all very nice and friendly and accommodating in every way. Nice hotel.I came here for a 3 day conference that hosted about 100 attendees. This hotel and casino is very spacious. In speaking with some of the staff it was newly built in 2009 and great attention to detail. I stayed in a Luxury King room on the 15th floor, clean and spacious. Beds were luxuriously soft as were the pillows. They offer a turn down service as well. Everything you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The marble bathrooms were pristine, along with a TV in the bathroom, and Bose speakers. I did appreciate that they did not sacrifice on lower end acoustics! I did notice is that the clock radio and room radio was not upgraded to accommodate an iPhone 5 port, really not an issue, I just happened to notice it. The only other thing that was a little off to me is that there was not coffee maker in the room, you had to go down to the lobby where there was a full coffee/bar self service area. Again, a non issue to me, I got my coffee after I left the gym/spa. I do have to say it was a good regular cup of coffee! Every morning I did indulge in the pool/spa/fitness area. The fitness area is the best hotel gym I have been to. Roomy and all equipment is present, including mats to do floor work. I was able to get in a pilates workout in by watching it on my phone. The infinity pool is a huge saltwater pool (a little cool for my liking) The women's area is heavenly as well, there is a large Jacuzzi as well as a sauna that has eucalyptus aromatherapy pumped in. I actually showered in the showers there because I like the scent of the shampoo and conditioner better that what was provided in the rooms. The hotel service was impeccable, very professional and friendly. We were fed by the hotel for most of our meals including a Gala dinner, the food was well prepared and fresh! My coworkers and I walked the Casino a few times, it was also neat and clean, but like all casinos too smokey. We ate at a couple of places in the casino, I'll review those as well! Overall I had a pleasant stay at the MGM Grand, and if my travels bring me to Detroit again, I would make this my choice hotel.One of the only places in Detroit that I enjoy.  I love the hotel rooms and the bars. I do not like that the casino has indoor smoking.  I would have given them 5 stars if they were a non-smoking casino.  I do like that it is not too far from Windsor, Ontario, Canada.I'm a casino lover. Not a big gambler, but there's something about the lights, sounds, and energy in the air. The parking is very easy with an attached parking structure or there is the option to valet. I feel like a lot of casinos have similar aspects.What sets this place apart is that they have an amazing buffet (called Palette), which you can pay for with comps. It's around 40 per person, but it has something for everyone. I didn't even notice the smoke smell in the eating areas - they keep it well ventilated.Another bonus is that they have a Starbucks inside so you can get your caffeine fix then start bidding high! Right across from Starbucks they have The Clear, which is the smoke free gambling section. It's walled off with glass, but guests have a tendency to cut through it rather than walk around. I find that distracting and bothersome.Overall the casino is relatively clean and there is something for everyone. From food options and clubs to live music. It's a great night out.Very spacious and holds the brand name well with different selections to play, but from the lackluster security guards to the somewhat unimpressive games this casino didn't exactly jump out at me.Played for about 30 minutes and left to go explore downtown and Windsor; perhaps I am used to a bit more finess and class when it comes to casinos.This is about the casino, not hotel.Went at 3 p.m. on a Sunday and it was just lovely! Not crowded or smoky, plenty of available slot machines, and after 3 hours I left down about $10 - can't beat that for a day of slots! The bathrooms were not the cleanest although they were modern looking. I have been in the evening when it's much more crowded and not at all the same lovely experience as during the day, guess I will become a day gambler ;)Every local we asked suggested the MGM Casino, so we followed the local's advice.  We walked out with just a little more cash than we walked in with and had fun.I am on my way out of state and forgot to cash the paper ticket before I left a week ago. I went to the security desk and told him I just needed the ticket machine to cash out. One of the guards walked me to it and walked me back to the exit because he knew I was in a hurry. Way better service than any other casino in this area!I'm not down to clown at the MGM Grand.THE GOOD: I like to start things out positive out there, I'm no hater. This facility is my favorite casino in Detroit. It's the no bullshit, no theme, no crazy scents being pumped in (motor city), modern building (unlike Greektown), with great ventilations (I'm non smoker). The Casino floor is great, and is very exciting on the weekend. I've been to this casino several times, and dropped some great coin here. They are poopy on the comps compared to greektown. After losing a few hundred bones, I don't even have enough to comp my ass a cheese burger at the Breeze. THE BAD:Lemme tell you about tonight. I've been a little weary of the MGM Detroit, as a blackjack player. I've had way better luck at Greektown and even Motor City. But at MGM Detroit, I just can't make a dollar. Tonight, I decided to try the "party pit." The party pit is a nice feature, where you can play black jack at any level up to $1.00 under the table minimum for a .25 cent commission. It's great in that it lets you play a while, have a beer, talk to other gambling addicts, etc. Unfortunately, the other people at these tables will NEVER know how to play blackjack even remotely. I'm not being a stickler, but if you don't know not to give 17 against a  dealer 5, theres a problem. The dealers at the "party pit" suck nuts too. They are either the new dealers learning the game, or they are the dealers that are so poor, they are about to get fired, and have to prove themselves by dealer to people playing for a dollar. Tonight, our dealer "Yao" took 35 minutes to shuffle/count the cards prior to playing-- whatever, it's their process. But after that, their stupid auto-shufflers didn't work so I had to watch this poor bastard shuffle his cards thirty ways to sunday by hand taking more time. I probably watched this guy play with the cards for 45 minutes before I even got to bet. By the time the game finally started, I didn't even want to be at the casino anymore. Furthermore, this dealer didn't even know the game. It is sad when the entire table has to tell the dealer when he hits/doesn't, pays/doesn't because he is not understanding of the rules. I ended up leaving with a loss of $40.00. That's nothing, chunk change. I'm not mad about the money I lost, but I'm disappointed I didn't have a good time. I'd rather lose four times that at Greektown but have a good time in the process. This is not the first negative experience I've had at this place. I'll probably be back because TAPS is pretty cool, and I have a gambling problem and like to switch up where I play every now and then. Hopefully while on the way back to MGM i get hit by lightning or something that will otherwise remind me of this bad experience. Just not a good time. Would rather have put that $40.00 towards my buddy Scotty's home made adult toy collection and have something to show for it.This was the first time I've been to this Casino in Detroit.  I've been to Las Vegas, and also other casinos in Michigan, so I am aware of the huge differences.We got a corner suite on the 16th floor in the hotel.  It was a very beautiful room!  I loved the layout... Two bathrooms, a beautiful sofa, amazing and modern furniture, and the view of Detroit was nothing short of breathtaking.  The bathroom had the deepest tub I've ever seen in a hotel.  I love tubs! :). The shampoos and soaps were lovely, and we had plenty of towels.The bed....as amazing as it looked, was horrible!  When I laid down, it felt like I was in a bowl.  My feet were actually higher up than the rest of my body, and I sunk down in the center.  Not cool.  Maybe I'm totally spoiled by my own bed?  I don't know, but for the price of the suite, it should have had a comfy bed.  The room was very clean, and in room breakfast was delicious!  The casino was surprisingly smokey.  I understand you can smoke, but for all the money they put into the hotel, they should have had a better ventilation system. The servers were scarce, so having a drink while gambling was impossible, but there were a lot of tables and slots.  I won a bit, so that was fun :)This hotel was a lot closer to a hotel in Vegas than what the norm is in Michigan.  I really enjoyed it there and will be back.I was in town for a hockey game. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the arena. You hear a lot of things about Detroit, but I have to say that I really enjoyed my visit. The hotel room was very nice, and clean. The staff is friendly and very courteous - felt like a VIP for the weekend. The central bar has a good cigar collection at reasonable prices.How to celebrate a birthday/anniversary/accomplishment/anythingcool in the cold winter of Detroit: Step 1: Pull up to MGM hotel's free valet area and pretend like you are staying at the hotel.  Everyone does this.  Just act cool.  Leave your coats in the car b/c you'll be inside the whole night!  Step 2: Depending on how nice of an experience you are looking for, start the night off fancy with a steak dinner at Wolfgang Puck or sushi at Ignite, or a casual dinner at Tap. Step 3: Hang out in the casno.  Let the food digest in your stomach as you people-watch.  Step 4: Party at V Nightclub.  If it's just a couple or a few of you, then get in line and pay a $10-$20 cover.  If there are 10-20 of you, call a week beforehand and make a reservation for bottle service.  It's worth it because your party won't have to pay cover.  Just make sure if you want everyone to chip in, COMMUNICATE that to people in your party.  Ends up being around $40-$50 per person, including gratuity.  Step 5: PAR-TAY. Step 6: Do you have a designated driver?  If yes, have the hotel valet pull your car around, tip 'em, and be on your merry way home after a fun night.  If no, then consider getting a room at MGM hotel for the night.I have been here mostly for work related events, and have always had a good time.I'm not a big gambler, but there's plenty of stuff going, and the rooms were nice.I would go back.I'm not some famous rich person like Mick Jagger, but this was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in.  The rooms are huge, with probably the most comfortable mattress I've ever slept on.  The elevator was always there within a few seconds.  The room was absolutely spotless as well.  The coffee machine down on the first floor was also the coolest coffee / espresso machine I've ever seen in my life.  Great coffee and espresso at the touch of a button.  The staff was also incredibly service oriented, every one of them.  So why not five stars? So why will I never return even though I visit Detroit regularly?  First, I was told by the front desk staff that using the valet service was mandatory because the casino would not allow me to bring my luggage through the gaming area, which is the only way to the hotel from the regular parking deck.  Valet service is a hassle because you need to remove the things from your car you prefer not to have stolen before handing your keys over.  Next, I want my coffee in the room so I don't have to go get dressed first.  If I was dressed the way I normally am dressed when I fetch my coffee, I'd certainly be arrested by the vice squad right in front of their wonderful Java machine for disturbing the peace for excessive frumpiness and stupid looking boxers on parade for all to see.  It's a damn shame because I love this hotel, but no coffee in the room is a deal breaker for me.  Calling room service for coffee is absurd as well.  I don't want to see another human being before I have my coffee and I don't want to pay $20 including room service charges and tip for room service coffee.  Next time I visit Detroit, I'll go to a Quality Inn or Super 8 because they have coffee in the room and I don't need to worry about someone calling the police on me for how I'm dressed when I pour and drink my coffee.Not as nice as the MGM in Vegas. Lacks the class.Good:1: Quite big.2: High ceilings.3: Friendly staff.4: Self park close to casino.Bad:1: Signage could be better: hard to find you way around.2: Bathrooms not cleaned well / often enough.by far the worse casino ever! money stealers ! i've been going to this casino for so long, me and my friends, and since last year we swore not to ever go again and we haven't. motor city pays out so much more and makes it worth your while!It's not as great as I remember, and I don't think I've been since my last review.  Two good things:  It is pretty well ventilated, so the smoke from smokers isn't too annoying.  There is a tiny smoke-free playing area, but only for slots.  Parking is free, and there is a huge garage, although Tiger fans have discovered this free parking.  Fortunately we arrived on a Wednesday night after an afternoon Tiger game let out.  Plus, it helps when you come with your mom in her SUV with the handicap plate.  We actually found a non-handicap spot across from the door, even though if we would of drove around the bend would have nabbed the handicap spot right next to the door.As always, new players get a $10 credit, but the promo they had last week was "Bring a new friend and you both get a $10 credit".  My sister and I got that deal alright.  Needless to say I blew their money pretty quickly, and some of my own.I couldn't find any machines that I play at other casinos (One is a cool Jaws penny slots).  I came with my entire family (minus one sister) to celebrate my mom's 80th.  Go Mom!  We dined at Tap first, which I don't think was here the last time I came.  Not quite the cuisine you'll find at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant, but there is nothing wrong with bar food and beer.
review_content_20: We stayed at the MGM Detroit while visiting for a wedding.  Being from Vegas, I was prepared to be underwhelmed. Happy to report that I couldn't have been more wrong. We were greeted with a smile and check in went smoothly.  Our room was on the 17th floor which is the Concierge Level. Rooms on this level include access to the lounge. The lounge serves continental breakfast, light snacks during the day and some heavier snacks in the evening.  The lemon cake was super tasty!Our room was very clean, cutely decorated, and had a nice city view. The bathroom was great but it was missing a bathtub if that is important to you. The shower was huge with standard and rain shower head.  It was extremely quiet (almost too quiet for me - but then I like to sleep with a little white noise). Maids were a little loud during early AM hours but nothing too terrible.  The great thing about this room is that, if you didn't know it, you would not be able to tell that you were sharing a building with a casino. There is very little noise and, best of all, no cigarette smell!!!! We didn't have much time but we couldn't help but to tour the Casino.  It is huge!  Tons of slots. It is clean but very smokey. There were many food options including a Food Court with several different quick dining restaurants.  In addition there is a Buffet and Tavern, as well as, a couple nicer restaurants including two Wolfgang Puck places (Steak and a Pizzeria). The middle was blocked off and I was told it was being remodeled into a restaurant lounge with live entertainment. The High limit room was gorgeous.  It offered our tour a much needed respite from the smoke. This area was very large (almost double the size of most that I've seen).  There were a couple other things that surprised me about the casino. There is a complimentary, self-serve soda fountain and coffee bar on the casino floor which seems like a great idea for thirsty players. Finally, there was a very large non-smoking lounge which featured some reel slots and video poker machines.  All in all, this was a great place to stay and I would definitely book here again when traveling to Detroit.I decided to take my daughter out for an afternoon and she forgot to print off her ID,because she's not 21 yet.We went the into the hotel and then we ask the security guard if we can print off the paper that she needed or See on the phone that she had proper ID to get in that she was 21. I couldn't do that and then I proceeded to ask if he knew were there was a print shop so we can print up her ID so she can get in. We walked away we  didn't yell we didn't do anything that was inappropriate we accept that we couldn't go in and as we were exiting the elevators over the over thm system you can hear this man's saying two women describing me and my daughter was trying to get in to MGM with fake ID to make sure that we left the premesis I find that rude and a inpulse of he wasn't so beastly and fat. Be sure to have proper identification,  or face profiling. So maybe some sensitity training, hospitality training and an attitude readjustment for your security staff is really in order. I will glady take my time and money to greektown or Motorcity from now on. This left such a disgust in my mouth. Yours truly, Someone working in a hospitality field and one POed momma.This is the worst casino I have ever been to. I do not frequent casinos but I do go to casinos once every year or two. Not only is this the worst casino that I have ever been to but it has horrible smoke pilfering through all of the building. Including the non-smoking parts of it as I did work their ballrooms for three days coughing and hacking. I asked eight employees how they felt about the smoking they said it's the worst part of their job.The service from the car attendant, front desk, bell hop, waitress to the casino staff was excellent and made us feel very special.  The grill was excellent.  Our room was very special and oh so comfortable.  Only the slots were naughty!  Without hesitation I highly recommend this establishment.I don't gamble, and service at the bars are super slow and mostly crowded. And don't want to forget to mention that their drinks are overpriced.  I do have fun watching my friends play and get into it with them and always trying to convince them to cash out when they are winning. People that work there spare very nice, and the drink girls that bring the drinks to the gamblers are super slow. And drinks are not good, well maybe because they are free.Worst casino ever first I came all the way from my vacation house in Florida and got in my helicopter and then took my black and red McLaren P1 GTR to the casino hotel. the valet was very bossy and my penthouse suite was so dirty the maid service sucked! and everyone is so bossy and then when I got the casino everyone start staring at me and bar service is horrible they didn't even have my crystal champagne that I pre ordered. Then I demanded a refund and I didn't get one! Then the valet brought the wrong car up and I had to go find my 3.3 million dollar car myself very disappointed and never coming backWe had a terrible experience here. From the moment you pull in, it is a mess. The valet people have no idea what they are doing- there are 4 lanes and all are blocked off totally inefficiently with no notable system (this was a huge issue every time we had to leave or come back). The valet is so overstaffed but no one does anything. How can you have 4 lanes all jammed up and no dedicated lane to drop-offs or departures? We had to reverse maneuver between 3 lanes and 10 cars just to pull out. Once we came to check in, it is overwhelming how smoky it is. This place must have zero ventilation. The stench of cigarettes wafts throughout the entire hotel (including on all the floors, elevators, and ROOMS. This is a NONSMOKING HOTEL. All of my clothes smelled and I felt nauseous the whole time. It seeps into everything and disturbs sleep). During checkin, the reception lady was very pushy about the MGM card, which I found to be inappropriate. This was a horrible start and the tone remained the same- smoky hotel, staff lacks manners entirely, and it was very trashy.Got a quote on a block of rooms for a wedding one day.  Called back three days later to have a letter of agreement sent offer.  Salesperson was excited and said she would send it right over.  Never heard back from her.... Sales manager calls me a few days later and says oh we misquoted.  It's always nice when a bride gets upset because hotel staff doesn't know how to do their jobs.Won't be back.  Thanks for nothing MGMMake sure you have your ID in hand and purse open! men, Take off your hat they don't want you smuggling any contraband up in there! You are not at Motor City Casino so no free night stays and less comps but it is a cleaner more maintained casino in my opinion. Stay away, FAR AWAY from the free pop and coffee! If your at the casino chances are you have a few bucks in your pocket to order a Starbucks (They have one there). Don't be cheap. Just get the Starbucks! I give 4 stars for the rude people in there but if I could kick them out myself they deserve 5.After posting my review I had the opportunity to contact management and speak directly with them regarding my experience at the hotel. They were kind and apologetic which is great to hear after such a bad first impression. We will stay again and see what our next experience is like. I'm hopeful that it will be much better,My favorite of the three Detroit casinos. It has an elegant, Vegas feel to it. There are plenty of slot machines to choose from in all denominations.  There are several areas just dedicated to table gaming.  The buffet is good, not the best I've ever had, but very good. Wolfgang Puck's is inside MGM and the food there is excellent. Try the warm spinach salad and thank me later!  They also have a sports bar called Tap and it's very good as well. They have a decent selection of craft beer and all your standard bar drinks. I had a pasta dish that was very tasty and my friend said her burger was delicious. Any of the restaurants can get busy with the wait up to an hour in the evening for dining.  MGM Grand Detroit is a nice afternoon or evening get away without having to fly to Vegas.Hit the MGM Casino last night and left a winner!!!! Up $13.00....This place is beautiful....everything you could wish for and more.This review is for the hotel only. We had a good deal on a room for a batchelorette party. So this review is based more on the room than the price.First, there is free valet, well free not including tip. If you are anti-tipping there is also a free garage. There is a staff member checking keys in order to enter the hotel lounge. The lounge itself is very nice and includes a self serve coffee station which several of our group appreciated the next morning. The room is a standard size, simple decor. The bathroom was a good size and had a separate door for the toilet. When you have a group of women, these things are important. Which brings me to the most imporant aspect of the room: the bed. MGMs are fluffy and comfortable. While not special or unique experience, it covered everything we needed.This is the best casino in Detroit. My husband took me here last night for my birthday and I won $1200 playing the $1 wheel of fortune!  It was great:). Happy bday to me!My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary in September. We were surprised at how nice the rooms are and the view.  We're staying in the luxury room again.  I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. The staff is always very nice and courteous . Will be making this a weekend getaway more often.   Love this place.The hotel reservation was a mess... When we checked in it took them about 30 minutes to get everything straightened out. The girl had to ask for a manager stating that there was an issue mind you I had confirmed the reservation a couple of days ahead of time. I was then told that the hotel had over booked and that they were trying to find me a room. They did find a comparable room that was handicapped which was fine. However the presentation of the room the rep made it sound like I was lucky to be getting it. I had booked a couple if months in advance so I didn't feel I was lucky to be getting it. How was it my fault the hotel overbooked doe the night? What else was I supposed to do?? The customer service was lacking for sure. This encounter  didn't create an overall good feeling of the overall experience. Showing up for a bachelorette party to be presented with we are overbooked was stressful! I used the valet parking the night before so on check out when they brought my car up I noticed there was what appeared to be ashes on my seat. Being a non smoker and the car only being a few months old I was quite perplexed with the findings in my car. There was more of these ash like findings on the rubber located on driver side window inside the car. Gave the appearance that my car was smoked in! Not an overall good experience in either of these areas!I must preface by saying I am not a gambler, or smoker.  I am writing this review for those who have not been to a Detroit casino and are deciding which one to choose.  I say MGM.  I think he restaurant and bar choices are better than Motorcity (the only other one I have been to).  The workers were all professional and helpful and I felt like the Casino itself was clean and well run.  However, it is still smoky.  I had dinner at Tap (see separate review).  Definitely sign up for the players club card, you get a minimum $5.00 free play by spin in a wheel, max $25.00, certainly worth signing up, and card can be used at all MGM properties.I chose this hotel for myself, my husband, and a friend for a trip to a concert at Ford Field because I travel to Vegas a lot and am a Platinum Mlife member. Boy was I surprised at how much different this is from ANY Vegas hotel or 4+ star hotel I've stayed anywhere else- and in a very bad way!First, we arrived at 4:40 and were told that no queen bed rooms were ready despite the check in time of 3 PM (the front desk agent attributed it to "being sold out last night," but that seems like something a 4.5 star hotel should be able to prepare for without penalizing guests!) I was told I could have a $50 food and beverage credit or access to the concierge level while we waited, but we had dinner reservations and needed to start getting ready. Since they were having trouble getting the queen rooms cleaned, I asked if we could be upgraded (which is a standard practice for platinum members when available,) and she said no... they would only consider that if the room was STILL not available when we came BACK down to check again at 5 PM and an upgrade WAS available. Fortunately, while I was trying to negotiate a better option, the room we booked opened up. The front desk agent let us keep the f&b credit for all of the trouble, and I was happy... Then we got to our room. As soon as we opened the door, we were BLASTED in the face with the smell of marijuana smoke. The door closed behind us and we realized we couldn't even breathe because it was so bad. We were so confused as to how a freshly cleaned room that just became available could smell this way- then we found the ashes on TOP of the freshly made white bedding... on BOTH beds. Let me add that we are not strangers to this smell and are very pro-legalization... however, the smell was so strong that it was sickening, and that's just not something I expect to have to deal with at a 4.5 star hotel. So I called the front desk and let them know, and their only offer was to send housekeeping back to the room to "freshen" it. Uh, no thanks... trust me when I say the room was PERMEATED with the smell of pot. I'm not sure what "freshening" could even entail! Since there were no more queen bed rooms, I agreed to be moved to a suite with one bed and a sofa, because my husband offered to sleep on the sofa. They sent a bellman up to deliver the keys to the new room, and when he arrived, he said "whoa, I knew why you were moving as soon as you opened the door!" As we were walking away, a woman on the housekeeping staff came out of the housekeeping supply room and asked why we were being moved. The bellman said "the smell," and she said "ohhh... ok," and didn't even ask what kind- like she already knew! We got to the corner suite, which was beautiful, and realized that even though the a/c was turned down to 65, the room was still pretty warm. We didn't have time to address that, and we ended up missing our dinner reservations and just using our $50 credit to eat at the casino dining court, which was super gross. The desserts were pretty good, but the pizza was like a huge piece of greasy bread with toppings.We got a cab to Ford Field in front of the hotel, and it was a quick drive and cost $15 (the driver had his meter off.) The trip back was the same deal, and we hailed the cab right outside of the venue after the concert, which worked out perfectly. Once we arrived back at around 10:45 PM, I asked for a rollaway bed because the sofa ended up being really uncomfortable and there were no spare blankets or anything. I was told that, even though we ended up in that room as a result of their inability to provide the one we booked, we would have to pay $20 for the rollaway. The front desk agent told me I'd need to talk to a manager to have that waived, and I was fine with waiting until morning to do so because we were all tired. He said it'd be 20 minutes. At almost midnight, I finally called the front desk to see what was taking so long and was told they'd "send one right up" (no explanation- like it was never even requested!) It arrived 20 minutes later and we were FINALLY able to try to sleep...Unfortunately, sleeping was interrupted every 30 seconds or so by the a/c kicking on and off VERY loudly. We ended up having to use the earplugs we bought for the concert just to get some sleep. This was really the last straw. Oh yeah, and I'm pretty sure the elevators had ashes on the floor and they also reeked of marijuana smoke, and the doorman and other employees smelled strongly of it, too. Maybe they could get the rooms cleaned and deliver rollaway beds on time if they weren't BAKED OUT OF THEIR MINDS! The free coffee in the lobby was actually pretty good, and it was very pretty with the fireplace along the back wall going. However, I will never, ever, stay at MGM Grand Detroit again. I have no idea why a hotel this beautiful would have such terrible service, but it's definitely NOT 4.5 stars. It could be if they'd hire the right people and give half of a damn!I've only been to the casino, and haven't stayed in the hotel rooms at all.The parking at this casino is probably the best of the Detroit casinos. Greektown is a crazy helix of spinning, and Motor City is just... weird.The ceilings seem higher at this casino and I feel like it gives off a nicer ambiance because of it. Even if you go to the small nonsmoking area to gamble, you'll still reek of smoke and smell it. I've had better luck with the machines at this casino than other casinos, and I like the food options much better (Breeze/Buffet). The raspberry gelato and the turkey burgers are delicious!If I could put no stars I would. I never make reviews. This is one you should read before booking. I went here for my 21st birthday weekend and what was suppose to be an easy fun time ended up being the most complicated experience I've ever had at a hotel. For starters, a week before check in I asked to view the rooms Bc I wanted to upgrade and compare prices with the rooms. I was treated like they were doing me a favor for showing me the rooms and that I was asking for them to give me their blood. The woman at the front desk was so rude. You'd think for 500 dollars a night you'd get treated decent and not scolded for asking to see what you're paying for. I had been greeted by one woman behind the front desk and was conversing with her about having the concierge show me different room options. There was another woman next to her who was listening in on our conversation and offered to get the concierge for me. I thanked her while she walked away but never got a chance to make eye contact. Minutes later a woman walked out from the back and Asked me if I had been helped. Because I hadn't really had a look at the previous woman's face I laughed and told the woman "oh you just confused me I thought u were the same person who just went back to help get the concierge" .. big mistake. This woman and her partner behind the desk started mocking me and saying "you thought they were the same person? , no resemblance not even close" then the woman who I unintentionally insulted told me "the only similarities between us two is that we African American" as she walked into the back. I was in shock and didn't even have the opportunity to respond the right way because i was so taken back. They basically accused me of being racist. As insulted as she felt, I can't even begin to explain how livid this made and has made me. I think they have poor customer service and if you aren't willing to check out the girls behind the desk you are accused of being a racist. It's insulting and degrading. This was just the beginning of my horrible experience. My list gets worse and worse. Upon arrival for checkin I was informed of an extra 200 deposit fee I was never warned about over the phone. Their answer was "this isn't something new it's always been like this" But it would be nice of them to mention it to their NEW first time guest, which I told them. Upon checkin I got into it with the same woman who accused me of being racist bc I handed the phone to the manager and asked him to speak to my mom in regards to payment for the deposit. She laughed at me. I asked why that was funny to her and she bit my head off and said "I don't know you why are you talking to me? I'm not laughing at you I'm laughing at him" -and pointed to an imaginary person in the lobby-. I told her I knew her and remembered her from the last time she was rude to me so that should tell her something. This all happened in front of the manager who didn't apologize and didn't say anything to his extra rude employee who was getting ready to jump over the counter. Honestly biggest waste of money and horrible spot for my 21st. They made everything inconvenient, every guest I had come to my room I had to physically go down and get them. Instead of just accept it through a phone call. Overall waste of money, inconvenient rude staff who complicate things. I spent a total of 800 dollars and was reimbursed 200 . for my money spent I should've had an easy and great experience and that just was not the case. I hope I save someone from doing an event here I don't know if it's bc my age but I was just treated horribly. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
review_content_40: So, I was down here for a yelp event and had some time to kill between work and the party.  I decided to come straight here since the driving outside was poor with the snow, and it was easier to hang out then drive home and have to get back into the car again.I liked the attached parking garage, and the facility itself is really big. Tons of slot machines, blackjack tables, a small but nice variety of food options and much more.  Staff here was friendly and helpful, but after spending a little time here, I noticed a few things.There aren't a whole lot of bathrooms. One on each side of the casino, with one being a singles bathroom.  What does that mean? Its a toilet with a sink and nothing more. No mens or womens, just a bathroom.  If you want stalls, (or more then one toilet because its in use) you have to trek across the casino to use it.  Secondly, the staff here is professional, but they seem to be really tight on security.  I don't mind it, but I took a wrong turn somewhere and was asked where I was going.  Um, I don't know? I'm lost? seriously.They do have a nice lounge/living room area that I sat in for a while that I found to be extremely relaxing.  Couches, fireplace and free of noise. I loved it!  Also the poker rooms upstairs in a separate quiet area. I went up there to check it out and watch a few games. Unless your playing, GET OUT!  They don't want people who aren't interested in throwing some money down. Players also seemed extremely serious and not interested in any lollygagging. I understand people take their poker seriously, but loosen up folks!Anyways, I would consider coming back in the future, but I'm not overly impressed. They have valet parking here, and an attached hotel which seems pretty cool to stay in if need be.  Lots of places to bet, drink and just hang out.Very disappointed in the way the hotel is handling check in. We having been waiting for 45 to get into our room. Mind you check in is at 3pm and it is now 7:05pm. The staff are not only void of all help they won't even let us in the lobby area of the hotel so we can sit with our luggage while we wait. We have dinner reservations at 7:30 which we are going to miss. The hotel has been here long enough to know how to properly manage these types of situations but seems completely ill prepared for what should be an easy fix.... Shame on you mgm!!!First of all, I should say that I am NOT a casino person, so my opinion might not be worth as much as that of an established gambler.During a trip to see downtown Detroit, my friend spied the casino and wanted to go and so, despite being "green as all get out", I turned toward it. Look out--we needed instructions on everything from parking, to getting in to the casino, to how to get a "card", to how to play. LOL, they saw us coming.Thanks to the security guard who helped us and the guy who eventually got us our cards (apparently, you can't simply drop cash into the machine), we were given $16 each for dinner. I think they could tell we were clueless. It worked out okay, though. My friend put exactly $1 into a penny slot machine, won $19.99, and deemed herself done for the night, after less than a five-minute investment at that machine. I spent maybe ten minutes (five of which was getting a verbose explanation from the guy on the machine next to me) and $5...er, I actually LOST five bucks and then gave up, since I work too hard for my living to pump it all into the equivalent of a money-sucking video game.Anyway, we had a good time and a nice, free dinner. It wasn't as smoky as I had expected, either.It's a typical Casino. I've been to plenty of these and my primary down side here is that I guess I'm used to being non-smoking everywhere I go (bars, clubs, and restaurants).  This Casino is NOT smoke free, you will walk in, and walk out smelling of other people's cigarettes. It just feels out of place for me to walk through clouds of smoke in a Casino, I must be used to the way Casino's work in Canada, smoke free and fresh.This is by far the best gambler's casino in Detroit. As a regular player I have found MGM Grand Detroit has the best comp program in the area. I earn Freeplay & comp dollars quicker here than at the competing casinos. They also have the best High Limit slot room in Detroit. It can get smoky, it's not always spotless & there isn't always a waitress at my beckon call with a free coke but that's not why I'm there. I came to gamble. At MGM Grand Detroit you will find a good selection of loose slots, a fair rewards program and overall the best gambler's experience in the Motor City.I used the valet and the attendant basically was asking for a tip when I dropped off my car. I think it's commonplace to tip when you're picking up the car, not also when dropping off.. He let me know that he may not be there when I come back..sheesh!! They also have a parking garage. Both are free..This casino wasn't nearly as smoky and another one in town, thank heaven. It could be because there was a crazy snowstorm earlier that day and wasn't that busy, I don't know.. I found there to be a variety of slots - my two favorites being Sex and the City and Clue.. I saw a plethora of black jack tables, craps, etc.. Perhaps one day I'll get up the nerve to play one of the many table games they have.. The casino is easy to navigate and everything is well labeled. The players club desk was well staffed so there wasn't much of a wait. The ladies room was modern and clean. There are a few restaurants to choose from and bars.. I recommend Wolfgang Pucks - excellent service and a delicious menu to please the palate.. Go for the Perfect Martini!! I'm actually interested in going back soon and staying in the hotel, why not make an entire night of it and not worry about driving home??.. MGM, I'm open to receive comps!! lol!!I had a great time. It's a casino. It's small so some of the games I wanted to play always had someone on the machine and this was a Monday night so I couldn't imagine the weekend it seems like it would be impossibly to play many of the games. The bar and set up is cool they had a live band in the middle restaurant that starting playing which improved the atmosphere. Expanding would help this play a lot by adding more machines and restaurants. I would def come back it's fun when your able to get on the machines you want.FREE VALETLove MGM get a players card called M Life use it while playing earn comps.  Non alcoholic beverages are free except Red Bull ;-( the servers will bring you a drink while your playing or you can go to the serve yourself conssesion for beverages.  There is a small smoke free slots playing area located next to Starbucks (yummy) cash in your comps for a coffee n snack or go to one of the four restaurants. We win most of the time we go here.  N if ur a lil short on food comps go to customer service they will more than likely give u a lil extra do you can get a meal at the casino and continue playing.I am writing this update because I gave it another chance since a representative wrote back to my previous yelp review. I was hesitant, and decided to go with my wife. We went to the Wolfgang Steak House inside... Great, just great. Service, management, everything was perfect, couldnt ask for better food. We went to lose some money afterwards, nothing big, about 300. Great timer overall. Only thing I would have to say that keeps me from the 5th star is the table interaction, some employees are very touchy if you dont know your next move, dont give you time to think, which is understandable because of the other people at the table, but if youre going to take my money, just give me a min to part with it :D. Great place to eat however, 5 stars for food and service.The hotel was snazzy!  I don't know how much it was for the night because I was there  for a conference.  The room was spacious, the mattress was delightful.  There are two shower heads in the bathroom which is nice...  I don't know it was just really nice.My minibar had a 1/2 drank coke in it and the casino is super smokey so I took off one star because it seemed kinda grody.Came in to the MGM today after going to Mark Snyder's after 5 event. It was my first time and the casino had a definite high quality feel. The outside is an imposing steel frame that makes it look heavy and a bit industrial but certainly refined. The inside floor is a sprawling array of slot, dice and card games. I have not had the chance to dine or go to the clubs here yet but the restaurants looks promising, especially Tap which caters to beer aficionados and sports watchers. I'll update after I have a chance to check this place out more but my initial $25 win has got me excited!Love mgm detroit.  Spacious well venilated  si the nasty smoke isnt t9 bad.  Friendly  staff great  machines.  This is always our casino of choice.This is the better of the 3 casinos downtown. It's a really nice place to kick back and play some slots or get a bite to eat. I haven't stayed in the hotel yet but I've heard nothing but good things. I love the family guy slot machine they have there. The food at the buffet is really good and not a bad price at all. If you want a place to go, check this casino out.Has to be my favorite casino in Detroit.   No bums , best buffet, nice crowd and the cleanest of the 3 " I judge by the consistent conditions of the restroom".  I'm not sure why but this time, the buffet was just ok, they fell short this time, they  were out for a lot of items. Even the Chinese area was short on noodles actually had none at all. But the shrimp, they had all you needed.This review is about the casino.It is MASSIVE. Easily the largest casino in Detroit. There are so many gaming options, ranging to an endless array of slots to Double Exposure Blackjack (don't play that -- all ties go to the house).My new favorite game here is Spanish 21. It's like blackjack, but they remove all 10 cards but keep the king, queen, and jack. As a result, the dealer busts less frequently and blackjacks are less common. They have a bet called Match the Dealer which is the best bet in the casino, in my opinion. If one of your cards matches the dealer's up card, you win.I dig the free parking. My home casino charges a lot for parking. Even if you have a player's card and play the 30 minutes, the house edge means you're paying a lot for parking unless you're lucky.Best of all, it feels like you're in Vegas. But once it sets in that you're in Detroit, the armpit of America, that nostalgia goes away quickly.It felt like the dealers were unpersonable and did not give a fuck what happened to you. I love talkative dealers who at least act like they want you to win. Here it felt like they were just going with the flow.Overall, a very nice casino.I suspect foul play in the casino.  The hotel itself had superb service, high end suite. Very accommodating staff.However, I had 45 minutes to kill before my car arrived so I sat at the black jack table.I was there for less than thirty minutes and the dealer made three errors of quickly removing chips on winning hands, two times with the player to my left and once with me.  I assumed she was having a bad day, or just not very bright.  Then when I went to cash in my chips the cashier made another error in trying to short me $10 - and i had lost at the table, so we're not talking a lot of money she was dealing with!  All were "accidents" but the employees didn't catch any of the mistakes themselves. Both seemed very slick. I had to point out mine to both the dealer and the cashier, and the player to my left had to point out the two other errors to the dealer.  Also, the floor boss came over and asked if I was "Terry." I said, excuse me?  She said are you Terry?  And then she realized I wasn't the apparent QC person she thought I was.  Seemed awfully fishy to me.Rooms are nice but too expensive. Hot tubs are filthy, as are the women's restrooms. Save your money and go to Greektown, or spend around the same and get a business suite at MotorCity. 14 dollars for chicken strips? Kiss my ass. This casino needs new management, stat.My first stop in Detroit was to the MGM Grand to check into a hotel room and hit the casino for a very short bit.Hotel room:- Good Lord, that bed was comfy.  So soft, including the sheets.  I slept that hangover away with no problem in that bed.- Decent sized bathroom with hair dryer, makeup mirror, and even a travel sewing kit.- Concierge level had snacks and drinks in the "lobby" area near the elevators.  Happy hour time even got some meats/cheeses/olives as well as usual snack mix.  Sadly, the only drinks were non-alcoholic.  At breakfast expect the usual spread you would find at most places.Casino:Never been to a casino where you have to buy drinks despite the fact that you are gambling soooo that was weird.  Looks to have all the usual stuff a casino has including tables and slot machines.  Once you are inside there it will take you back in your memory to any visit to Las Vegas as the sounds, the dim lighting, the lack of windows, and the lack of time-keeping are just like it.  I'm not much of a gambler so the casino seemed fine to me.  Plus I won $25 on the penny slots sooooo I was definitely a FAN of that.Restaurants:We did a late night stop at the food court.  The Chinese was just edible, nothing special at all.  Looks like they had a pub and a fancier restaurant too, but they tend to be closed at 2AM.Quite surprised to find casinos in Detroit, but definitely recommend for an evening of fun if you are looking for that type of fun.pretty smokeyMy rating for the hotel - 2 stars: We stayed a night here a few months ago and normally I would rate the MGM hotel 4 stars, I was not as pleased this time.  My main complaint was that the lovely pool area was closed!  There was no warning or anything.  I walked to the spa area in my swimsuit and robe, and the employee at the spa said "I hope you're not coming for the pool, it's closed."  Thanks.  When I politely asked the front desk when the pool would reopen, thinking it was a maintenance issue, they said it wouldn't be for a few weeks.  If I would have known that when I booked the room, I would have rescheduled!  Even if they would have given a day pass to the pool for a later date, I would have been satisfied, but nothing.  The rooms are also starting to show their age.  The room we stayed in had visible wear patterns on the carpet, worn upholstery on the couch and cracks in the grout on the tile floor of the shower.  The bed and linens, however, were top notch.  They make the bed in such a way here that any way you hop into bed, you are immediately hugged by mounds of soft, downy blankets and pillows.  Based on my last experience, I would be hesitant to book another room here and I would certainly do my due diligence to make sure that all facilities are functioning and open at the time of my stay.My rating for the casino floor - 4 stars:  I enjoy the variety of slot machines and the non smoking area called "The Clear."  There are lots of table games for the players that are fonder of them.  I like the plentiful and easy parking, free pop and coffee and the well staffed floor.  In some other casinos, I have had people come up to me panhandling inside the casino.  That has never happened here and I believe that is due to the large amount of security staff and employees on the floor, which I appreciate.The overall MGM experience is 3 stars for me, but by casino standards here in Detroit, that's pretty decent.  MGM is definitely my preferred local casino.
review_content_60: Decent hotel with very nice rooms. Not a Vegas casino by any means. No free alcohol while gambling, smoking is allowed, and not many people having fun. Seeems more like people are spending their paycheck, trying to grind it out. Okay if you are in town and want to gamble like i do, but not a great experience. Wolfgang steakhouse was good.Casino - Pros - Super friendly dealers, pit bosses and other workers. Large variety of slots that pay pretty well. Nice music piped through.Cons - A few of the waitresses on the floor acted annoyed when asked for a drink. Cannot pay for drinks with chips (though I think this is a MI thing), Not enough Texas Hold'em tables for weekend crowd and they do not pay well at all. High minimum bets at tables even early in the mornings. More than a few trashy patrons.Hotel - Pros - Awesome, helpful, polite, friendly staff. Really, really awesome. Rooms are clean and nice and the shower is Really nice. Overall, the hotel is great, but the staff is superior. I drove from the hotel to Dearborn (not taking the interstate) and was soooooo depressed to see the decay in Detroit. I would be so sad if that happened to my hometown, but the staff here rise above the blight they see everyday and are so kind and helpful. I don't think I have ever been as impressed by a staff as a whole anywhere!Cons - Windows do not open in rooms. No personal fridges, only "bar" fridge, and being so close to Dearborn (with it's plethora of delicious food), I really needed a fridge. When you drop so much money in the casino, though, you don't feel it's right to pay for a fridge in the room.This review is for the hotel only as I didn't really venture over to the casino side. So this hotel really blew me away. I'm from the Detroit area and based on the experiences I've had staying at other hotels downtown and Detroit in general (apologies for being a hater - the city's had a rough go), I came in with pretty low expectations. That said, the MGM changed all of that within minutes of my arrival.I want to start by complimenting the service. Starting with the valet (which is free by the way) - they were prompt, courteous, and said they'd send all of our bags up to the room upon check-in. Did they? Yes. Easy. The woman at the front desk asked if we wanted a late check out - no charge. Why not? We ordered room service the next day and even though it was past eleven and I wanted breakfast, they bent the rules and made me an omelet. I've stayed at other nice hotels and waited a ridiculous amount of time for room service only to get cold food. Not here. It was delivered within 20 minutes and it was delicious!The rooms: good job on the bed guys. Wow. Perfect. I was super impressed too by the tv/mirror in the bathroom. I stayed on election night and loved being able to watch the returns while getting ready. The shower was a dream. It's bigger than my bathroom at home. It's one of those rain shower situations which I loved. Felt like I was in a fancy spa. At the end of the day, you can't really ask for much more. This hotel is a 5 star gem in a city that really needs it. I hope it sets the service standard for other developments that pop up.stayed here for the Detroit Tigers opening day. The rooms were nice the hotel is great. lots of good places to eat. Nice TV in the room. If your coming to Detroit. You really need to stay at this hotel. Its worth the money. If you like poker they have a nice poker room. you will think your in Vegas. Stayed April 2011my husband and I had gotten married on 01/03/14 and we went to MGM afterwards to celebrate with some friends. My husband serves in the USAF and we were doing a rushed wedding so it was very small. I was wearing my dress the whole night and I felt like a celebrity. Everyone kept telling me how beautiful I was, including the staff, and we had a beautiful room. When leaving the following day I had packed up EVERYTHING. I am usually very good with this kind of stuff because I hate hotels and I'm one of those people who goes through a checklist 3 times to make sure we have everything. We rechecked our bags in at the front and decided to grab some coffee and play the slots one more time.
