When I got home it was then I realized my dress and my lacey boxer shorts (I dont do lingerie) was missing. To this day I am still heartbroken that someone wouldnt turn it in (if left), had stolen it or whatever may have happened. I called up there a few days later because I thought maybe I left it in my husbands bag which was dropped off at my husbands parents house. Nope. So I called up and they said they had not seen anything but will return the call if they find anything. Never heard anything. You have ruined my experience and a memory I will never get to share with my children one day. Words cannot explain how my heart feels even to this day and lord knows when or if we'll be able to redo our vows due to the nature of my husbands job and money. Great ambiance just don't trust the staff with your items.-Broken BrideOk, here is my update:First and foremost I would visit again if only to have dinner at Wolfgang Puck steak. The food is sublime. The service was impeccable, but you pay for what you get. Dinner for 3 without drinks was 300.00 dollars. If you go make sure to get the tater tots, they are to die for.Had reservations at Immerse spa, the experience was very good. It would be nice to see the attendants more often. The massage service was very good and the amenities were in line with what you pay. They have a sauna, and a whirlpool that is very large. They ambience is soothing and the facility is first class. A 50 minute massage is 130.00. They tell you the gratuity is 20%, but you can tip what you want. I tipped 20% because I was extremely pleased with my service. Oh, I almost forgot, after getting to my room I found that the tv wouldn't come on. Called the front desk and they sent an engineer right away who was able to fix the problem immediately.  I'm not changing my rating because I feel the hotels response was insufficient, but I believe that I've given a fair review.Went on a Saturday afternoon. Went straight into poker lounge. Only available option was 1-2 NL table. Only 4 tables were open. people seemed to know each other really well by name including the dealer. looks like a small poker community in the city where everyone knows about each other. played for closed to 2 hours. made some money. Signed out. now to the regular area 70% are slots,never really bother about that. lost a quick 20 on wheel of fortune. made back in half an hour in a 10$ minimum for Spanish blackjack. didn't try the buffet and never in the 4 hour period was asked for drinks. So although I made money and its a huge place with various games I will limit my rating for the drink less night.MGM Grand Detroit was fantastic!  Everyone was very helpful and super friendly.  Our room was fantastic- executive corner suite.  Super clean- we ate at Tap- it was game day and service didn't slide at all- food was good- we had sliders and the artichoke dip.  Saturday night music was great- we met so many great people. Definitely would go back!I like this place.  Wide and open, and spacy.  That means even though lots of people are smoking, it filters enough that you aren't choked out.  I don't mind casinos smelling like smoke... but I want to be able to breathe a bit... and here you certainly can do that.  Plus it's a beautiful place!You forget you're in Detroit when you step into this casino.  Pretty clean and spacious, looks fairly modern.  Free parking in the garage.  The waitress never came to take my drink order while I was at the slots, but there was a free pop machine that I appreciated having around.  Bathrooms were clean and well stocked.  The cigarette smoke smell is pretty heavy but that's to be expected.  Great restaurants on the floor for when you need to refuel plus multiple bars and a nightclub that looked pretty slick.  Had a fun time!The parking lot here was like a roller coaster.  LITERALLY! Each level was like going up a hill. I found it entertaining, and drove up to the roof just for the laughs and kicks.It was kinda fun, but god forbid I'm here on a day where a bunch of cars are coming in and out.-2 stars for how poorly MGM post signs.  Took me a while circling around before I found this place.  Getting lost around the area seemed a little scary on a rainy Friday night...=/I went to the casino on a weeknight and was surprised at how busy it was.I am a fan of casinos and love to go and check them out when I travel.  This one did not disappoint and I have to say, for me, it was as close to going to Vegas as I can get this year.  I am a fan of the MGM in Vegas, so I was happy to see an MGM in the area when I was looking for casinos.I used the self-parking lot for free and found it to be very well lit and I felt safe in there by myself. There were so many people going in and out. I also found I could leave my coat in the car and run inside. They do have a coat check available by the front door if you don't want to do that.They have plenty of ATMs around as well as machines to cash out your vouchers. Sometimes there would be a line when I walked by, but it moved fast.Plenty of bathrooms, all of them were clean and no lines.I did not see any machine attendants around (but I also didn't see more than one machine out of service the whole night). I saw one hostess bringing drinks during the 3 hours I was there. I only saw 2 security guards by the door to the garage.  I saw a lot of staff cleaning and pushing in chairs constantly.  The casino is very clean.  They have a free soda station that you can get drinks from yourself.The non-smoking room is very small and disappointing in the options you have in there. I did bite the bullet and used the machines in the smoking area.I liked the mix of machines and there were ample 1 cent and 2 cent machines.As for the food inside, I ate at Wolfgang Puck's Cucina and had pizza (my favorite thing to get at MGM in Vegas). All in all, it was a very nice evening and I would definitely go back again.Still my fav out of all the Detroit casinos. But the only machine that pays out at this place is the damn ATM machine!I do not gamble at all!  I do not know how, I do not wish to know how, I'd rather spend my money on ME!!  I have to say that I am not a fan of Casinos ANYWHERE other than Las Vegas.  In Vegas, that's what it's all about...anywhere else I find them DEPRESSING!  All you see are people with cigarettes drooping out of their mouths, dragging their oxygen tanks behind them - wrinkles on faces so deep you could lose yourself in them,  slowly lumping their over grown muffin flop tops to the buffet, then shackling their handicapped family member up in front of a machine...the whole scene is funereal, I could not wait to leave!Ack. I completely abhor casinos. They are the worst.That said, my stay at the MGM in Detroit (rock city) was exceptionally pleasant.The bed: pretty much the best.The shower: two heads and the size of my entire bathroom at home. You can fit many friends in there if that is your plan.Nice comfy couch and chair.Only issue was I had a heck of a time connecting to wifi - to the point that I gave up.Unlike other reviewers, I didn't have a car so I had no valet concerns. I also didn't eat or buy anything so I'm not riled up about the price of anything. Also, the lobby had a hint of cigarette smoke, but that wasn't an issue once you are in the hotel area.I had an issue which I brought up to the front desk.  They charged me the wrong rate for the second time.  The fact that they would not correct the rate was beside the point.  They were flat out rude.  They told me to talk to Jenni Titterington the next day to resolve the issue.  I asked for her the next day.  They said we will get her and then 2 seconds later "oh she left for the day".  I found her office the next day but she refused to talk to me.  This place is nice, but the customer service sucks.  This place looks world class, with bad attitudes.  The management obviously is over their heads.  I'm pulling for Detroit but this will keep Detroit in a hole.  The housekeeping staff gets it though.  They were very pleasant.Very classy casino.  Lot's of slot machine and a good amount of table games. The only negative is the smoking laws don't cover the casino floor.  I guess the toxic fumes don't apply here!  Other than that, it's my favorite casino in the D...Place is great and awesome people!Obviously its the cleanest casino in Detroit!  The slots are better; also better tables.  I feel safer here when out late in their parking structure; I park by the casino entrance regardless.  I don't understand why a draft beer is so dang expensive or alcohol for that matter?  If I have to choose a casino out of the three in Detroit I always choose MGM; you should too.I was pleasantly surprised but this casino.  I had no expectations, but when you are in there you totally feel like you are in Vegas... which is cool, but strange.  Get a room and have a mini vacation in the 'D'.
review_content_80: I have faith in Detroit. I have faith that it can rebuild and be a great American city with the likes of Chicago, San Francisco, etc, but the way to greatness is NOT a casino. I wish I had more time to spend in Detroit as this was just quick stop before I got to the airport, but best believe next time I'll be spending my money at a museum or something that will help revitalize the city.When I go to a hotel the bed is the most important thing to me besides customer service. I want to sleep in a bed that is comfortable with lots of fat fluffy pillows and a soft mattress. MGM didn't disappoint. The bed was like sleeping on my own bed with 8 pillows and a thick white comforter instead of those scratchy fake comforters and a couple of flat pillows. The room was great and the service was excellent. Good job MGM Grand.Don't get me wrong I sometimes enjoy the casino but I hate losing money. Too many told me... "In order to win big, you must SPEND BIG!" I think I'm spending big when I blow off $20 bucks -- Lol! that's usually my max. ATMs are located inside the casino but the fee is $3.The casino has it clubbers, gamblers, and drinker all packed in one. Unfortunately, I just can't tolerate the smoking most of the time -- if I'm going with a friend then I'll stay until that person is ready to go but I'll never go solo and stay long.I'm more of a people watcher!!! (That's right -- I'm not a gambler!)Also forget to tell you... JUICE is free!!! (yummy!) Most everyone knows you can get free coffee and pop.We went to MGM Grand (Casino only) in Oct 2012.... Very impressed with the friendly and helpful staff! As for the games... They had a fairly average selection if machines. Could use more $1.00 slots... And perhaps some of the newer/latest machines... All in all had a perfectly good time and enjoyed the buffet as well. One suggestion to visitors is I would recommend venturing outside the casino to some of the other local attraction while your in the area while youre there... Greektown, Hart Plaza etc... Makes a fun day!This hotel is the absolute very best in the Detroit area.Exceptional valet when you arrive. Bellhops who deliver your luggage. Great great great.You open the door to your room and the lights come up gently to welcome you. You first notice the incredible bathroom, which is a gem. I hopped in the shower and wanted to stand there forever whilst draining the Detroit River.You could actually stand there for quite long because there's a TV in the bathroom mirror, allowing you to shower and watch TV simultaneously.The room is marvelous. The staff are incredible. Helpful, friendly, a joy to talk with. I was having a few people over for a spot of wine, so I called and asked for more wine glasses. They were there in a second.Room service was speedy and delicious. I ordered the reuben and it was delivered hot and delicious. Really, really, good.The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. I really did not want to get out of it in the morning.The hotel is a little pricey. They deserve every penny, but it puts this hotel out of reach for regular visits into Detroit. But for special occasions...this place is the absolute best.I have only been to motor city and MGM as of last night. I wasn't that impressed when I stepped in as much as I was impressed with the exterior of the casino. It is very clean inside and the casino every once in a while is a good time. I wasn't impressed with the food either. If I go back to a casino I'll have to check out Greektown and compare the three, as of now I do think that MGM is better than motor city. I'd say it is between a 3-4 but closer to a 3.I agree with Liz that being childless definitely has it's advantages, especially in the later hours.So after a nice dinner my group decided to head over to MGM because none of us had been there before and we weren't ready to call it a night. Total spur of the moment decision.We pulled into the parking garage and although it was pretty tough to find a spot, we eventually found one and couldn't complain about the fact that it's free. It's pretty easy to navigate your way in and find your way around to the casino.When we walked in we were all impressed. This seemed more like a Vegas casino than the other ones in town. It was much more upscale and you could tell a lot of money went into it. I was extremely impressed by the caliber of restaurants. The atmosphere is very clean, very modern, and very crisp.After dropping a hefty amount of money in a record 2 1/2 minutes on the slots, we decided to grab a drink, sit at the bar and play some video poker. There were 2 female bartenders and man they hated each other!! One was making the other one cry, and they were both yelling at each other. Wow, what a turnoff. It made the whole scene very awkward and tense and we finished up our games and got outta there.I was also amazed at the amount of slots they have here. Rows, and rows, and rows. And just when you think you hit the blackjack table, more rows of slots. It doesn't bother me, just a mere observation.I think I would have given it more stars if I wasn't caught in the middle of the sharks and jets war. MGM, use better judgement when hiring please.Whoa pricey! I mean.... What? I have to pay $7 for a small bottle of coke? Haters don't hate. I know i'm in a Casino. I also know that I am in a high class hotel - however there are just some things that are too expensive for what it's worth. You're in Detroit..... unfortunately a dying city - and if you want to attract more people, you have to lower the cost of the trip! Now let me start off by stating that when i parked my car I left $XXXX amount of money out in the open. After 4 days of in and out valet parking my car, not a single bill was missing.... and we're not talking a few hundred dollars. So with that - I immediately have trust and respect for the hotel staff. The rooms were great. No complaints there. The bathroom is modern with duel frosted glass walls separating the shower from the lavatory - and the "mirror" TV is always a nice touch to any modern bathroom. I was unable to experience the Saturday night crowd due to my business meeting lasting into late in the night - however, after seeing the crowd before they had their fun - then seeing the many smiling and tipsy faces after the night was over (while being in the lobby for a snack) it looked like they had a great time. The smell of smoke is intense. Having gone years now with this smoking ban, the taste of fresh air is one I cherish - so having to breath in an ashtray of air with each breath is disturbing.... to each is own. So cliff notes: Excellent = Trustworthy and welcoming staff. Good = Selection of food, night life entertainment Poor = Price. (of everything)My husband and I have stayed here 5 times, all because my father in law won a little over a million dollars on the wheel of fortune progressive machine, so he gets comps and we get to bargain from them, each time we stayed in a corner suite and they also got us a massage, By far this hotel is the best, the massages were excellent, if your lucky enough to go, ask for Lisa, not me, or Alicia, they are amazing, the rooms are amazing, clean, well stocked and we had nothing but great service each and every time we were there, definately worth it.Downtown Detroit is an unusual sight to behold, here we are the richest country in the world, yet in our heartland we have a major city full of abandoned and burned out homes and buildings. It looks like a war was fought not long ago and I guess in some sense that is true, as the big three automakers have fallen they've taken Detroit down with them.So you're the mayor of a struggling D-Town what do you do to ignite the urban development flames? Bring in the casinos of course! Enter MGM. Did it work? Time will tell, but to MGM's credit they spared no expense in building out the property (I hear it was an 800M investment) and unlike most gambling venues outside of Vegas this hotel is actually Vegas quality. The lobby and room furnishings were stylish (as good or better than any W)), there are a number of destination restaurants within the complex and a hot little nightclub to boot.The staff throughout the hotel was extremely friendly, but the check-in process needs improvement (it took me 30 minutes to check in once I got to the front desk and the line was long behind me). While I'd agree friendly banter with guests at check-in is a great plus, I'd rather the hotel optimize its peeps for speed.Each night was about $249 for a room with two queen beds. The bathroom is generously sized and the shower has two heads, awesome. Bottom line: the hotel is a nice and potentially important add to a desperate downtown. I do worry for the surrounding community. Will they lose what little they have left to the cold cha-ching of a slot machine? My pocket ended up a lot lighter so I can only imagine what would happen if I lived nearby... let's hope for the best, good luck Motown.This review is largely based on my hotel room. I stayed in the Deluxe Corner Suite. for one night. Check in was at 3pm and check out was at 11am which kinda sucks but they allowed me late check out at 1pm. The room was by far the nicest room I've ever stayed in. The bed was a queen and I was expecting a king but it was still very comfortable. The room had a huge tub and the shower was great. It had about 6 different settings for where I wanted to water to come from. The room had 1 full bath and also a half bath.The service at the hotel was second to none. I made a few requests to the front dest and also to random bellmen and every request that I made was tended to immediately. The room came with complimentary wi-fi access but I was not able to connect to it all weekend. not a big deal to me. The hotel offers a complimentary fitness center which includes access to the hot tub, wet and dry sauna. The bathroom attendent in the fitness center went out of his way to answer all my questions and make me feel at home. There are some great restaurants inside the MGM but the really good ones are only open for dinner.This was one of the very best hotel experiences I've ever had. I would surely recommend the MGM to anyone and I definitely look forward to staying with them on my next trip to Detroit.This review is regarding the hotel banquet facilities. I attended an Autotrader.com traning seminar (I work for a dealership) in one of the banquet rooms at the hotel portion yesterday. I was really impressed with the overall building, ambiance, professionalism of the staff and the food/drinks provided. The place is beautiful; clean, modern, fresh yet comfortable. The room we had was smaller (there was only about 20 people in our meeting) but it was nicely decorated and had nice, high-tech sound for the projectors and microphones. Breakfast and lunch were provided, as was beverage service which included coffee, tea, bottled Coke products, iced teas and water. The coffee was top-notch and the hot tea selection was to die for (if you're into that). The meals were essentially a buffet. Breakfast was an egg, asparagus and potato fritatta, turkey sausage and an assortment of muffings, cereals, yogurts and fruit. The lunch was outstanding! Two kinds of salads; spinach with walnuts and orange wedges, butter lettuce with fontina cheese and cherry tomatoes (which looked heirloomish) - two choices of dressings. There was a potato salad with salame as well as a hot onion soup. The entrees included gruyere crusted chicken, grilled salmon and something else (I don't remember), roasted fingerling potatoes, glazed carrots & brocolli and fresh bread with an herb butter. It was really impressive. The staff was attentive, quiet and professional. Quick to refresh the beverages in the stations, and quick to clear plates, glasses, etc out of our way. I would really recommend this for any banquet or large-group event in the future!I stayed here for a friend's bachelorette party. We were in one of the corner suites (can't remember if it was the executive or luxury). I personally would never pay over $500 a night for a room especially in the city, but that's up to the traveler to decide. I think it is overpriced, but many people who stay at MGM are using comps (I'm not made, I would use them too if I gambled) so the rooms are cheaper. Regular rooms are closer to $250-300/night including valet, Internet, and a fitness center. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is immaculate. The shower jets are amazing and I love the decor. Very clean and comfortable. However room service was very slow (Saturday after midnight). The food is priced pretty high, but the burgers were phenomenal. If you are on a business trip, this is a nice place to stay. If you are just looking to stay at a hotel while gambling try booking with a discounted search engine (if you can find a deal).Actually 2.5 stars, rounded up. As mentioned, the rooms themselves are nice enough. I'm from Vegas, and I've seen a lot of great hotels, including the Skyloft rooms at the MGM in Vegas. There were some service issues, including the staff being unaware that one of their major customers, indeed, has a corporate account with them. The bed sheet had a hole in it (about the circumference of a cigarette head). A security guard at the entrance to the casino was grilling me about why I was there if I had a Nevada ID (do they never have out-of-towners? I was there for business). Food court was gross, as was the ($28) buffet. The worst point was the cheap cologne fragrance that was pumped throughout the entire hotel. I mean it is the smell of that cheap cologne that I've smelled a couple times before--once when riding the city bus in a low-income area; once in a drugstore where teens were spraying the cheap fragrance offerings; etc. Someone was having a party at night and the noise was coming through the vent in my room. I ended up needing to change rooms as I was working, which was a hassle to do in the middle of work, and since security should have taken care of the noisy party and not made me move. The pool at the spa had loudly screaming kids. A fellow patron told me that she was not able to enjoy her (expensive) massage because she heard the kids screaming in the pool the whole time. Casino is so smoky that my freshly cleaned hair smelled like an ashtray upon spending 10 minutes down in the casino to get a snack to bring back to my room. And, of course, much of the clientele...This hotel and casino definitely has potential, as the infrastructure is sound. There are just some bad decisions being made on a site-management level.I'm not a fan. My experience was probably tarnished as a result of it being a Friday and the first of the month. My S.O. and I went with the intention of picking up our MLife cards prior to a trip to Vegas and have an evening out without the kids. I found the casino dirty and the reeking of smoke so badly I was choking, and I'm a smoker. It's hard to find machines because there are not overhead signs you can look at to seek out your favorites. I know it's not Vegas and free drinks, but I couldn't believe a Heineken costs $6. The table mins were ridiculous and the slots tights. The clientele all looked desperate like winning a jackpot stood between them and that month's rent. My first impression was not a good one, and I wrote management explaining why. My reply was a generic, "Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. I hope you'll give us another chance."One advantage of being childless is holidays are more casual and you can kind of do what you want.Last night after a huge feast I went gambling over at MGM with some grownups. I have to say I definitely like this vibe best of the casino offerings in Detroit. It is a bit more upscale and for a casino, classy-ish.The bonus was the lounge. They have a deal on bottled cheapie domestics for 2 bucks until 11 on weeknights and they were showing the late game Giants vs Broncos which my husband wanted to see anyway. As he is not a gambler much this kept him amused with a friend. They have comfy chairs and a series of big screens, so good views from all areas.He played a bit of blackjack and liked the setup then settled into the lounge. I went hopping to the penny machines. Woohoo, flashing lights and loud noises, I am a shining example of Pavlov's theories in action. Cheap thrills and happiness. I stuck to freebie diet cokes and was happy as a clam.I don't think any of us had much luck but none of us lost much either. The machines are fun and the setup is nice. You don't feel hugely crowded. I wish there were non smoking areas, well actually I wish the whole place was non smoking but I can deal.Security was on, I got help when needed at my machine when my wrinkly money was not taken (meanie machine) and they have self serve drink stations. The ladies came around periodically but I never seemed to have tip money handy, next time I will take some dollars with me or remember to go to one of the handy change makers before I sit down to play.I liked the handy kiosks for money redemption and change making, the fact that even though I never go there I got a free ten dollar credit emailed to me to come play and just the general feeling there.All in all tops for gaming downtown.I've been to the casino at MGM but never had the chance to stay the night at the hotel. When I had the opportunity to stay the night here I could not pass it up. I have heard so many great things about the hotel so I wanted to check it out. When you check in it's nothing but a five star treatment. The staff are friendly and helpful. When you go towards the doors that will take you to the elevators to your room someone will hold them open for you. They have complementary coffee in the lobby anytime you want it. The views from my room are awesome. Looking at the Ambassador Bridge and where the old Tiger Stadium used to be. The views at night are amazing. It is pricy but you do get what you pay for and it's nothing but a FIVE STAR experience.Smells like an ashtray after spending about 2 hours in the Casino. The number and varieties of slots machines is huge but they have limited number of table games. This place is better than Motorcity Casino as I like the single floorplan as Motorcity is divided into 2 floors of casino facility. The downside is that it is full of smokers.I decided to book a room here to celebrate my graduation from Wayne State. I wanted to be somewhere where all of the entertainment and dining was right there, and if I needed to pass out (which I did!), I could just head up to my room.First off, I got a deal on a double queen room, about $295 including fees, and this was on December 9. The room was BEAUTIFUL. I mean, a TV was in the bathroom mirror. How's that for classy? Word to the wise: DON'T EVEN OPEN THE MINI-BAR! Not even to browse! They start charging you just for opening the door and removing items. There's some sort of sensor. Fortunately, if you catch yourself and call concierge, they won't charge you. The stuff is ridiculously expensive, which is to be expected. Also, valet is free, which I didn't know about, so take advantage.Check-in went smoothly, concierge was excellent, and free newspapers in the morning!On to the entertainment: My guests and I hit the food court (I think it's called Breeze?), and I tried the Mexican food, it was "eh", not bad, not great. My guests had the burgers and Asian food, which they said was decent.We didn't play any slots or tables, but I have here before, and it's just your typical casino. *shrugs*We went to Club V later that night, so check out my review on their Yelp page.Overall, the hotel was beautiful and although I feel it was a bit expensive, I think you get a great value for your money.I've edited this review because they removed the charges (see OP below). after all the bs one goes through in Detroit you don't expect to hustled another time by a place like MGM(that was kinda the only bad thing and being woken up twice during my late checkout by housekeping.): i'm currently disputing $1100 in bogus charges as I booked thru expedia and all should have been paid for. with the exception of in room charges, incidentals etc. i've had to leave a message to credit card issue department (convenient you can't speak directly to them.).... and now a second time! cause they have charged my card for mini bar usage which we did not use!

review_content: I've been here several times to gamble over the years and have always thought it is ok.  Nothing special.  My girlfriend and I each had a free room voucher - Sunday-Thursday.  Anyone can get one for gambling for an hour - even penny slots.We booked both rooms with the intent of giving one to our friend who lives in Lansing.  Unfortunately he didn't show and there is a 50 dollar late cancel fee, so we decided to book both rooms.  When we go to the counter, we told the receptionist our situation and she said "great! We are sold out and can use the room.  We will cancel your fee, and why don't we upgrade your room and give you access to the concierge lounge on the 15 floor".  What????? Amazing.  We hurried up to the lounge before it closed and they had chicken, large chilled shrimp, and a ton of other things.  No alcohol but who cares it is awesome.  We then went to our room which was clean, had a large bathroom with separate shower, tub and toilet, and our view overlooks the city.  The gambling experience is different when staying, we had fun playing penny slots and just relaxing for a bit.  I did have to leave early on Monday for work but I would love to have stayed and extra day so we could go to the seafood buffet, where the crab legs are massive and very tasty.Based on this one time, I really like this place a great deal.You can still smoke cigarettes and cigars in here, so that's a plus for late-night (or all-night) gamblers.  I'm sure that's a deal-breaker for a lot of people, but smoking and gambling seem to go hand-in-hand so it's nice to still find a place that allows it indoors.  Otherwise, this was a pretty decent casino.  The layout was a bit bizarre since they have multiple levels but the employees were friendly and knowledgeable when we asked about specific table games.  They had a Pai Gow table (YES!) which is basically the only game I play in casinos (aside from the occasional slot machine).  Not a lot of casinos (outside Vegas) offer Pai Gow and even fewer offer them offer the game all night.  I spent a good amount of time at the table and ended even at the end of the night.Lamest part of this place: they stop serving drinks at 1:30 a.m.  I'm assuming this has to do with general liquor laws in Detroit and/or Michigan but C'MON.  This is an establishment that is open for gambling ALL NIGHT but they stop serving liquor earlier than some bars.  The end of the liquor service is what prompted us to leave.  I honestly would have stayed longer had they kept serving.  Lame.Parking seems miles away so try to get a spot close to the garage entrance.My stay at the MotorCity Casino Hotel wasn't anything out of the ordinary, but book through Kayak!  They'll give you the best price on hotel rooms... OR if you're interviewing at Detroit Mercy for the dental program, you can call in and tell them that and they'll give you a special rate.  I paid about $160/night for my room.Went down to the casino with a few other interviewees that I met that night and had a blast gambling away.  They had a buffet downstairs with a wide array of American, Italian, Chinese, and Japanese foods, but it was nothing special and quite pricey.. but again, when you're not a local, just stay where you are and be safe!  Especially since you're in Detroit.  The casino reeked of smokers, so by the time I got back to my room, my clothes were soaked with the stench of tobacco smoke.  There were bars all around, slot machines, tables, etc.  It was pretty fun running around with a bunch of other pre-dental students just gambling, but don't fall prey to gambler's fallacy!  I lost $20 before I called it quits.The cleaning lady nearly gave me a heart attack when she opened my door randomly, but I had the door bolt in place and I was changing.. definitely did not appreciate that.The room itself is actually really nice with complimentary Wi-Fi, but there was nothing mindblowing about my stay.  However, IF YOU ARE A PRE-DENTAL STUDENT NOT FROM THE AREA, I RECOMMEND STAYING HERE.  This is a 4-star hotel, and if you're alone, just stay here since the surrounding area is kind of shady.  A majority of the pre-dental students usually stay at the hotel since it's very close to the school (only 10 minutes away if you Lyft).  Definitely meet up with others if you're interviewing at Detroit Mercy to build a sense of camaraderie with your future colleagues, but also to relieve your sense of fear you have while you're in Detroit.I actually had a really nice stay at the MotorCity Casino Hotel...but there were a few things that just made the visit to Detroit, not the best. This will be a good review to read for a Canuck taking a quick visit across the river.The rooms were really nice. We were all impressed with this. Big bathroom, huge bathtub, separate shower, separate toilet, lots of toiletries. We were upgraded to a higher floor (13....they had a 13th floor.....) which had a great view. We got access to the concierge lounge and helped ourselves to some h'orderves. They are really good! No place to sit though so that was annoying. There were a few tables and a bar to sit at but one person took up an entire table and the people at the bar spread themselves out so our group couldn't squeeze in. We ate at the counter. We took a stroll through the casino. Ah, the smoking. Forgot about that one. In Vegas it is manageable with all of the AC. Get the heat pumping? Stifling and insufferable. We had to leave. They have 2 small rooms for non-smokers if you are interested. Didn't see table games in there. I did like how they measured their slots based on longer playtime vs bigger jackpots.This hotel is fairly out of the way. When we looked out the window we saw a few warehouses, and houses. It's a quiet spot here in Midtown. Maybe we are used to the hustle and bustle of Toronto but my goodness, there is nothing around! We decided to take a cab and be prepared to be swindled. Firmly request that they start the meter.  I wish the casino worked with a specific company that would make their guests feel safe. Each ride was sketchier than the last. As a female in my late 20's, other than children, we were probably some of the youngest people in the place. If you are looking for a party, head downtown. I probably wont stay here again simply because of the location. If there was more going on around there it would be different because the rooms and hospitality were fantastic. Free valet was cool but it took about 10 minutes to get our car when the wait time said 0.Stayed here for valentines day..was very nice..had a great time!   Everyone was nice..great staff..friendly people...good entertainment...I've been here many times...but first time staying in the hotel...I'll definitely come back!!!I was here in 2013 and enjoyed it. If I am ever in Detroit again, this would be exactly where I would want to stay again. I was surprisingly impressed with this casino/hotel. It was tad on the expensive side, at $400 a night, but thankfully I was able to split this with a group.Overall, I'm rating this on the hotel room itself. This was the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. The beds were very comfortable. All of the staff was also amazing and super friendly. It's only losing a star because of price, which I though was a little much for the area. The casino itself was hopping. I felt like there was a bar around every corner in the casino, so I never went dry. Great entertainment until 2am and I truly felt like I was in Motown.Wonderful hotel. Staff is very friendly and the rooms are very spacious and clean.  The dining choices are pretty good and there is a good variety of different choices,  The beds are very comfortable and they use wonderful linens.  I highly recommend staying here if you ever can, its will be a very nice treat to yourself.For the most part, my stay at Motor City has been pleasant. There are some very wonderful employees here, most notably Bev, Bill, Brandi, Melvin, Reginald.Amazing rooms, amazing staff! The room are very clean and very nice! The bed is the best part! Once you get in the bed you'll never want to get out! I absolutely love their rooms! I also love the fact that you have to have a key to show to get to the elevators to go your room! Top notch security! Also FREE valet parking!While I don't frequent hotels, I have been around long enough to have been too many different hotels around the country, and Motor City Hotel is one of Detroit's finest. Location is paramount, and the Motor City Hotel is close to many of the best spots this city has to offer. Plus, being connected to a casino can't hurt. If nothing else, there is no shortage of interesting people. There's also many food and bar options in the hotel as well. What else can a chubby dude want?The rooms are very nice as well. I have OCD and it is not easy for me to go to hotels, or stay anywhere overnight for that matter. This, cleanliness is paramount. The two times I've come here, the rooms were cleaned very well, and the decor was legit. The view was pretty chill as well. Again, there may be nicer or fancier hotels in Detroit, but for overall appeal - night life, food, amenities, etc. - I'd put my money down on a room at Motor City.Very nice hotel with spacious rooms that come fully equipped with a minibar (moet included), bathtub and shower. They even had one of those clock radios that plays iPods and iPhones.Security here is on point as they are pretty strict about not letting people upstairs who do not have a key card. Elevators were funny acting as they sometimes didn't want to work in certain instances. Their is a 5th floor lounge here that gives you free appetizers, beverages (non-alcoholic) and pastries in the afternoon which is cool. I wish the lobby restaurant was as on point as everything else as the selection was quite meh...Little Caesars is there for late nite consumption...FYI. There is a bar that is cool with cool peeps working there. Wi-fi & parking is free here. Good place to stay to be in the mix of the actionVery nice place with friendly staff. I'd love to go back. Clean comfortable safe place with modern rooms.Great time, good casino, super nice hotelGreat hotel, very clean and looks beautiful. A few issues I have are the room we stayed in. The mattress was pretty stiff and uncomfortable. We woke up with back pain. Also when I first called about the room, the lady on the phone told me the bath tub had jets in the room we wanted to book. That was one of the highlights and I was looking forward to it. Unfortunately when we got to the room the tub had no jets. Not that big of a deal, but still was a bit of an annoyance.It is a Detroit themed casino in Detroit and it does it pretty well.  The second best casino in the Detroit area overall, and it is probably the nicest looking Casino in Detroit from the outside.  I am a big fan of view and food available at Iridescence.  Gambling wise, I have personally never done well there, but I have a friend who is a professional poker player who says it is by the best for Texas Hold'em in the area.  If you are sensitive to smoke be aware that the ventilation system at MCC is pretty weak.  I am a former smoker and I even found the intensity of the smoke hard to take.  Finally, Soundboard is a very unique venue to watch show or go to an event.  It has an ample dance floor with three bars on the first floor and bleacher style seats on the second floor.  Overall, if you are visiting town or just looking for a fun evening, MCC is worth a visit.I spent little time in the room and even less time in the Casino but I really liked this hotel. The room was clean and modern with plenty of room to spread out. The bathroom had a separate room for the toilet, a shower, a separate tub, and some other nice amenities like a robe, a digital scale and a magnified mirror for the ladies. The view from the room was cool, and booking on Hotwire, this room came in cheaper than the cost of a junior suite I recently booked at the Courtyard. I'm already looking forward to coming back.First of all, great location. Stayed here for two nights a few weeks ago, and it's close to most things in downtown Detroit, as well as right near the freeway for easy access. Yes, there are some abandoned things nearby, but you won't go exploring those, right? Rooms were much nicer than I expected, especially for a casino. You can actually charge your phone and have it within arms reach at night, which isn't a given in many hotels. Obviously, you're connected to the casino and the events facilities inside. Room didn't smell of smoke either, which is a plus for a casino hotel. Only downside is that you can hear the rooms near yours, even when they're in the shower. My neighbors weren't bad at all, but I'd imagine this would become a major problem if they were. I didn't pay, but I think the price was also above $200, which seems steep considering.Nothing fancy, but a decent hotel. I wouldn't mind staying here again, but wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to do so unless I wanted super convenient casino access.I travel for work and I am constantly calling hotels home. I occasionally order room service and never have i ever experienced pancakes delivered to me completely burnt. There is also a constant stream of noise and smoke in the hallways. I hope to never see this place again.We booked a night at the Motor City Casino Hotel via Hotwire, at a "secret rate" deal.  The free parking, free WiFi, and being close to everything made this hotel a fantastic bargain.  Once I saw the photos on the website of the hotel exterior lit in rainbow lights, I knew I was going to love this hotel.The rooms are spacious, and the bed was comfortable.  I slept soundly.  There is a free shuttle service to Detroit Tigers games, but the catch is that you have to sign up for Club Metro (a players/rewards) card in their casino.  The card is free, sign-up is free, there are no disclaimers or gimmicks with it.  You don't even have to use the card.  As soon as I printed my ticket for the shuttle, I threw the card in the trash.My only dislikes about this place were the extremely long check-in, which could have been fixed with one more person at the desk, and the lack of a mini-fridge in the room.  Since we were driving, we had snacks and drinks we would have like to have kept cold.We did not spend any time in the casino, but this hotel is worthy of 5 stars considering the deal we got.We love visiting the MotorCity Casino and we recently received free rooms for gambling for an hour.  The room was excellent.  VERY clean, though some of the dressers has scratches and scuffs - this is to be expected when using dark woods though.Each room had a coffee brewer and Starbucks coffee in them.  Sweet!Be careful taking stuff out of the fridge to put leftovers in there.  They use the pressure system on the fridge so anything that is taken out gets charged to the room.  The guy at checkout was nice enough to take the items off, but be forewarned about that.The food selection at MotorCity is great.  We enjoyed the Lodge Diner in the MotorCity Casino.  The portions were large for the price we paid.  Plus we had some comps to use, which made it even better.
review_content_20: From the moment of check in, Rodderick made sure I was taken care of, his staff was very professional. The room is fantastic. Verners on tap, the Lil Caesar even had riblet side dish.It is not a very nice Casino I feel that the other Casinos in the area are better and cleaner. Way to many people, tables and slots are always crowded, drinks and food are not that great, and the people are not very nice either. stick to the other casinos in the area they are a lot nicer in my opinion.I've only stayed at the Motor City Casino Hotel for free comp nights after joining their Club Metro. I've stayed there four or five times and each experience has been okay.The rooms are kinda swanky. There's a nice tub, the toiletries smell wonderful. Half of the time, my bathroom has been missing the hair dryer though.The view is... not so great. Most of the rooms face the parking lot for the hotel and Detroit/Windsor doesn't really have pretty skylines.Check in and check out is very easy. The robe provided is not as luxurious as you would hope, and it's pretty amusing that they offer it for $100. I've seen nicer robes at TJ Maxx for $15.If you ever want to spend a night in Detroit to unwind, I definitely recommend taking a bath at this hotel. Hotel has free wifi which is a perk! Parking is kind of weird, you can do the 'free' valet (or tippig), or you can park on the roof of the hotel parking garage by turning left before the valet. You can also park in the casino parking, but it'll be a further walk to check-in.Fantastic bathroom; a shower and a great tub. Plus enclosed toilet with its own door. Bed was very comfortable. Downside, lot of tacky locals trolling around having loud conversations. Would recommend if your in the D.the butthole of detroit casinos. this place is so tacky and so gross. it smells like your grandma who smokes three packs of cigs a day's morning breath. the best part is being herded into metal detectors. yay! oh and you cannot breathe in here. seriously. it is impossible.they have crappy slot machines too. love, justonThis place is a must visit 5 star every thing rooms r really nice bathrooms r to die for they hav a marble walk n shower like plus a bath tub deep enough for 2 n u can't enter the hotel without security check in u out. The food is also good frm the deli sandwiches to the buffet style restaurant. And the casino who don't like to gamble lol fun fun fun is all ima sayThe most egregious problem we encountered was with the bellman, who put his hands on a member of our party and spoke to us very disrespectfully. We filed a complaint with security. Other than that, rude rude rude and ridiculous rules. We weren't able to have outside food brought up to our room (cake). I had to speak with the manager to get a refrigerator for a medical necessity; the front desk woman insisted it would be a $20 charge. It turned out that I had to use the minibar fridge because the manager admitted they didn't have any fridges they could provide me. I spoke with 2 managers over the course of our one night stay and they were pleasant but did not go over and above to address the issues we were having. It was clear that they have no regard for customer service. There are lots of security measures in place, which is understandable for a casino hotel, but it is a little unsettling. They could stand to make their atmosphere more welcoming instead of like a lockdown environment. You pay them pretty well to be treated (in our case, physically reprimanded) like children. The room itself showed signs of wear. We were comfortable in the room and slept well but we will not be staying here again.I don't know why there are so many negative reviews of this place, because I thought the hotel was wonderful! Very luxurious, and at an affordable price! I can't get over how incredible the bathroom area was...that deep tub is to die for! We stayed using the Stay&Play package after the Chippendales show...so glad we made that decision! The Sound Board is an awesome venue as well! I will absolutely be staying at this hotel again AND seeing more shows at the Sound Board. Well done, Motor City!Nice Hotel!!! Front Desk Staff are very much so helpful... However, I'm here during the week a stay cation I would say ( my Bday)...I have to work in the morning (work downtown) so I'm here for the rest definitely... I literally cannot sleep I hear everything every conversation, every door knock, every shower door close... even the toilet flush!!! This was cheaply made not a sound proof room!!!!If you need to lay up during a weekend this is the place....We won a room with their "play for an hour" deal. Since the room was free, I was expecting something pretty basic. Thankfully that wasn't the case.While we didn't get our preferred view of downtown, the room was lovely. I specially enjoyed the soaker tub (too bad it wasn't jetted). Another disappointment was the lack of a small fridge. Since it was just overnite, it wasn't a HUGE deal. Next visit I will definitely bring a small cooler. Check in took 20+ minutes but went smooth once it was our turn.We were on the 12 th floor but it didn't feel like 12 stories up (lol).It's our anniversary and we decided to come to the "dirty city casino" we requested a high floor room and was placed on the third floor. Went back to the desk and asked to have a higher floor and was place on the fourth floor room 423. When we walked in room 423 it smelled like a dirty gym! The curtains was dirty, floor dirty! I immediately called the front desk and was told that someone would come up. After waiting for awhile we decided to walk back dow. We was half ass greeted by the "manager keith"! We told him the room med nasty and the curtains and floor was nasty! HE said he would go check it out. He went up and came back to say he didn't smell a thing and he wasn't changing our room again! I said again????? He said yes your original room was 318 and we changed it to 423. I said we never went to room 318! HE proceeded to be argumentative with us and stated you guys are not getting a different room and your key cards Wil be at the front desk! My husband said well just give us our money back and we will leave!!!!!!! Keith said no because you paid through Expedia! !! First of all it was through hotels.com and it was a total of $140.00 THAT WE PAID AT THE HOTEL KEITH FYI!!!! WE ASK TO SPEAK TO A HIGHER MANAGER AND HE SAID HE'S THE HIGHER MANAGER!! HE said he will send the housekeeping manager up to spray the room but he will not be changing our room! Well guess what the housekeeping manager did meet us back up to room 423 and said the room smells like a coney island and body order! But prior to that I knocked on room 415 and ask them to Please come with me and smell our room!!!:well he did and he said it smells like a nasty gym. He also went on to say that this happen to him to and they came up and sprayed the room. The house keeping manager Hunter was very nice and he switched our room to room 430 which was better but not worth $140 maybe motel 6 price or cheaper. Hunter said we should at least be comp for a meal or something and to call keith to see if he would comp us. My husband called back down to the front desk and spoke with keith and Keith say NO comp because he didn't smell a thing and he's sorry for us that he didn't smell nothing and that's the best apology he can give and goodbye! !! Keith need a class in customer service asap!! Keith FYI you shouldn't make your paying guest feel like crap on their important day!! Take time out and listen and try to make it right! ! I almost allowed you to totally ruin my day but thanks to one of the security staff being helpful and also smelling the room and said it smelled like sex and body order I knew I wasn't crazy! IF I could give this nasty hotel a negative 3 stars I would and Keith would be the main reason why! Oh and also when we arrived in our room 430 the Pringle was eaten by the past guest! I immediately found one of the staff members and told them and they came in the room and called the front desk to notify them. We also had long hair on the toilet seat. People this is not the place to stay for any reason!!!!! Today is Thursday April 23rd and I can't wait to check the fu@k out of here! One of the front desk staff members did give me the name of the top manager and it wasn't keith! Buyer beware of keith is working the day to want to come run to mgm!!!! WE did read a prior post that keith was involved in that didn't turn out well! So please read the reviews and call the hotel and ask them how did they deal with prior past bad reviews...I will be contacting higher up to discuss my issues and suggest better ways with dealing with unhappy guest!! I have seen keith name a numerous times and I wish I had truly did my research before wasting our time at this dirty hotel with awful customer service. I was told to speak with Fred Isaiah. I believe that's how you spell his last name. The people at the front desk including keith would not give me corporate number. Happy anniversary to the Weathers next time we will definitely go out of state or back to the gran hotel in Traverse city great front desk, manager and customer service!!!!I always come to the motor city casino when I come home on leave and on this particular occasion, I learned that at the Motor City Casino Hotel,the employee is always right rather than the customer. My husband and I visited last night and from beginning to end ,I felt that we were being disrespected and as far as profiled. The original clerk was rude and gave us room keys that did not work. We came back down to get them replaced and there was no one at the counter. I took a seat and my husband waited patiently. He even asked the security guard to call someone and his attempt failed. My husband continued to wait and other people approaches the desk and began to wait as well. When someone finally came to the desk, she walked past my husband. He continued to wait until she finally asked if he had been helped and he told her that he hadn't and that he had actually been waiting longer than the other people. She shrugged and said, "well i didnt know". After a few more minutes, she asked what he needed and when he said he'd prefer if someone else helped him,she became more rude and obnoxious and told him there was no one else that could help him. When he mentioned a gentleman we saw earlier she told him that he was new and wouldn't know how to help him, and then she walked away. When she returned minutes later she asked if he wanted her help and when he said no she shrugged and he cursed at her. As soon as he did, there was all of a sudden an entire crew of people out there to help. The guy who allegedly was new and incapable of helping us turned out to be the manager. I hate people who use race as an excuse for everything, but when this white male spoke to me,he spoke condescendingly, told me he didn't care what happened and that all that mattered was that his employee was disrespected. He told the security that we were irate and needed to leave. His name was Keith and when i asked the females name,she flipped her name tag and Keith told me her name didnt matter. when i threatened to call corporate he told me he didnt care as long as I left. When I called the next morning, they told me that Keith made a note saying that we were irate and that security got involved, even though the security got involved because we asked the security for help. We returned the next day for an entirely different reservation and Matt nicely escorted us to security to have THEM tell us they we are not to return ever again. They told us that their cameras have no audio and that they can't prove what was said, which is BS from an establishment that makes so much money. We feel disrespected and feel as if we were profiled and I won't stop until someone has even attempted to hear our side.Motor City revoked my reservation and ruined my first year wedding anniversary. Terrible experience.Love the rooms, unique and classy. Great customer service. I asked where the closest dry cleaners was and they offered to clean and fold/hang my laundry for me. Definitely my favorite casino/hotel to stay at in Detroit.Maybe the ceilings were too low but I felt claustrophobic there. There was no flow when walking around the casino floor. Just did not have a good casino feeling with high ceilings so the smoke is not too much, where you can actually walk completely around the casino without having to backtrack because you walked into a dead end.If that does not bother you, you may enjoy it.For the price of the room and drinks (in casino) I expected good service...sadly no.Some reasons why we won't be going back:Dirty room. Someone's wig/weave tangles were stuck to the shower wall, the soap dish was not only dirty but moldy, the room was dusty in general and two of the lamps in the room were broken. Sheets smelled like chemicals and were really uncomfortable. The towels were all falling apart at the edges. Ghetto, ghetto, ghetto.Poor service. Only two staff at the check in, line was very long. Someone dropped a large bottle of red wine near the elevators and the staff member activating key cards was dealing with that mess while trying to assist customers. He was flustered and acted as if we were an inconvenience for key activation.I explained the room conditions upon check out and staff was indifferent stating " OK I'll let the housekeepers know." This was more of a management issue if you ask me...dissatisfied customers should be attended to by management and reassured it won't happen next time. We won't be staying downtown at Motor City again.UPDATE: Called hotel to speak with manager who stated he would let housekeeping management know about the unsanitary conditions of the room. Was told x3 during phone call that I should have said something right away about the room conditions. They Don't Care. It is now very clear that expectation IS NOT that the room be clean upon your arrival, but rather that if you have an issue it is your responsibility to correct it.I had gotten a free room for playing for an hour at the casino.. Awesome Awesome Room!! On the 10th floor.. The room was beautiful, my favorite part was the bathtub! It was so deep and refreshing!! I will definitely return.. Restaurant wise.. Went to Little Caesars expecting the same food from outside of here.. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!! The Italian Cheese Bread.. Nothing Italian About That!! Room Service.. SuperDuperPricey!!Its the A.M. And the housekeeping staff is soooooo noisy..Overrall this visit gets a 10!!!Disclaimer - this review for MCH is just for the hotel portion.The lobby and entrance are both very elegant and welcoming to visitors. The check in process was very quick. The hotel room exceeded my expectations. The King sized bed and pillows were super comfortable, and I love that the large bathroom was clean, well lit, and has a separate tub and walk-in shower. I decided to get a room for me and me only, in order to "fall off the grid" from the rest of the world, so I bought a package that includes money to spend at the restaurants. The beautiful thing is that you can spend the money on room service as well, and you can order room service using your TV/remote. That was so cool! Guess who has 2 thumbs and was watching the World Series while dining on a NY Strip with veggies and mashed potatoes, drinking wine, and sitting on the King Size bed 3 feet away from the TV? (Me!!) Of course, you do get what you pay for. Since I paid so little and got so much, my view from the hotel room was the top floor of the parking structure. For my purposes, it was a non-issue. Valet parking is complimentary and super convenient. There's a kiosk inside the hotel on the way out towards the parking structure where you can scan your ticket and your car will be brought to you. The valet staff is very friendly and very efficient. I look forward to "falling off the grid" at the MCH again, perhaps even making it into an annual tradition.The hotel itself is very nice. I really liked the bathroom, and the provided toiletries were really high quality and smelled fantastic. Also a plus? The free shuttle to the Tigers game. You only have to sign up for Club Metro and swipe your card at a kiosk.The surrounding neighborhood is less than desirable. The casino's motto is something like "keeping what's outside out". Literally. The "outside" is burnt out buildings and liquor stores. Desolate.There is security everywhere.God help you if you forget your room key, you won't make it anywhere near the elevator bank. Make sure you get everyone's name on the room so they can go to to front desk to get a replacement. (No, having the same last name is not good enough)Ate at the buffet for breakfast, I recommend the motor city fried chicken, and there was a ton of fresh fruit. $14 was pretty reasonable, and our server Jason was really friendly.If you bid for a 4.5 star property on hotwire.com, this is more than likely the property you will get. It was worth the $113.About a month ago, I played an hour in the casino for the "Play an Hour, Stay a Night" promo. I was very skeptical about it, because it seemed almost too good to be true. I stayed on one slot pretty much the whole time, and actually managed to win most of my money back. So the room cost a grand total of $1.02.Almost every weekend we tried to reserve was booked, so we decided to go in the middle of the week. We had the deluxe king room on the 6th floor. It was a pretty nice view, and the room was surprisingly very nice and luxurious.I was surprised that there was no kitchen, not even a refrigerator in the room. That was our biggest complaint, but since we were only there for a night, it didn't affect us too much.The bathroom was really nice, with a spacious shower and deep bathtub. I'm all about going green and saving the environment, but the sign noting that they don't wash all of their towels unless you leave them on the counter or floor kind of made me a little uncomfortable. How easy would it be for someone to just refold a dirty towel and put it back? Ew.Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. The TV was great, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and the pillows were very soft. I would definitely go back!
review_content_40: Home run.  This place was inexpensive, the room was very nice and the staff were either exceptionally kind, helpful, hilarious or all three.  Free parking and everything else you might need.  Close to everything downtown.  Highly recommend.My husband and I had an amazing experience! The room was clean, big and very modern. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We had dinner at the Assembly Line and everything tasted great and was hot. But most importantly all of the staff we encountered was very friendly, from the check in desk, to the restaurant, to the casino floor and bell hops! When we booked online we said the reason we were staying was for my husband's birthday and there was a cupcake and a happy birthday note waiting for him when we got to the room. We went to a Tigers game and the stadium was in walking distance. This will be our new go to hotel when staying in Detroit! Worth every penny!I have stayed at the hotel multiple times this year and it has progressively been getting worse and worse. Stayed there last night. Carpet was filthy. Walls were dirty. Both bathrooms and the shower had clumps of long hair left in them.  The towel rack was broken. Towels were filthy and ripped. I would expect this at a motel 6, but not at a 4 star hotel. There was an earing left in the closet. Just overall disappointing.  And it was not a comp room or anything like that. This room was paid for.I was very impressed with the MotorCity Casino Hotel accommodations. The attention to detail for the room/lobby details is incredible--they are very high end.  Very sophisticated touches of marble, modern wood finishes, and  contemporary light fixtures-the interior design is very well done across the board.I absolutely loved the very large bathroom area and toiletry offerings in the room as well.  I would absolutely love to come back for a relaxing weekend get away.This is a great stay. The personel are friendly, hotel isclean, and a fun place to stay at with a number of choices of food and bars. The only bad thing is their lg tv that we have in the room it's a little difficult to work.No no no no no nooooooo terrible service! Dont come here to stay. Just don't! The customer service was a joke! And looked very trashy! Not helpful and bad attitudes!Our room wasn't ready at the 4pm check in.. so we ended up in a double suite instead of the king suite we booked. The room was dirty. The sound board was a nice venue.. with terrible beer selection. I'll never stay there again.The upgraded review is because the management apologized profusely the next morning and comped me for one night's stay.  It didn't return the lost night's sleep but it helped to diminish my ire somewhat.I haven't even been down to the casino, but room is comfortable and beautiful.  The bathtub is long enough to stretch out and deep enough to soak.  I'm in love with this tub.  The bed was comfortable and the floor we were on was very quiet.  I've enjoyed my stay and will be coming back.One of these days I may be try the restaurants and casino.Just an additional note, I received a note from their staff about sharing my comments with their engineering and room service departments. It was good customer service of them to respond and pass along my comments.This is a real Detroit operation.  It took 15 minutes to talk to a check-in clerk, even though I was next in line.  Upon being met by a clerk, an angry lunatic in the back of the line yelled that I'd cut in front of her.  Oy.  Anyhow, they had no record of my name, and it took 15 more minutes to get my room keys.  The room itself was quite nice.  I had such a wonderful, albeit short, sleep on the king sized bed.  The shower was great (perfect shower-singing acoustics).  The bathtub, which I didn't use, didn't look clean.  The view of the Ambassador bridge was lovely.  Additionally, since the room was a comp, it was a hell of a value.Valet was quick and professional, and the staff, despite their slowness were nice.  As for the casino portion, it is smokey and depressing, except for the music stage, where they were playing funk music with lots of booty shaking.  That's my new hangout.Living so close to Atlantic city casinos, we decided to stay here because of their casino. The rooms were nice and a decent price, and the bathrooms were great. We loved the Iridescence restaurant, it was one of the better meals we have had. Unfortunately, we didn't enjoy the casino much because there isn't a smoking section, and for someone who doesn't, it's hard to breathe. The whole casino was a cloud of smoke.. We would have enjoyed everything if they made a specific location for smokers.Stayed here for a conference in April and was pretty happy with the experience. It was a regional chef conference, so it was upon the casino to serve some discerning palates and for the most part, they really succeeded. Honestly, the worst meal was our final night "gala." The sides and salads were good, but the steak served as the main dish was pretty awful. Their head pastry chef coaches the US Olympic food competition team and is rather great, so make sure you take advantage and order dessert whenever you're here. The rooms were big and cozy, but the hotel overall was loud. The doors to every room slam rather loudly, so if you're in a room next to a late night couple, as we were, you'll be hearing that over and over. The entry and bathroom are fully tiled floor to ceiling, so if the people next to you spend time there being loud and drunk, like we did, you'll hear every word with no problem. We also heard a lot of noise from the hallway. I guess I was just surprised that the rooms weren't a bit more sound proof. I literally could have joined my neighbor's conversation, that's how well the sound traveled. And they really, really need to find a way to dampen the doors. There's no reason for them to be able to slam that loud in a hotel. Poor, poor service to your customer, there. The only fridge in the room is stocked with mini bar items which are on a sensor and if you even move one, you'll be charged. You can rent an additional fridge, but I think it was $25 a day. A hotel of this magnitude should be offering an in-room fridge without charging for it. If the Comfort Suites can do it, so can you. I'm certainly paying enough for it. There also were no electrical outlets in the bathroom. They provided a hair dryer, but I had to go out into the room and use it. It was really inconvenient. I don't need a mirror to dry my hair, but if you were using a straightener or curling iron, you'd be doing it blind. Very, very strange. That being said, I wanted to steal the bathroom and take it home with me. Gorgeous, giant bath tub. Separate walk-in shower. Beautiful. Iridescence, the bar on the top floor, was pretty cool and gives you amazing views of the city. Drinks were really interesting and prices in line with what you'd pay for a top martini. The casino itself was just ok for me. I'm not a huge gambler and therefore don't spend a lot of money. There were no table games less than $15 a hand the whole time we were there. I asked if they ever went down and they told me I could come down and check around 5 am on Sunday and there might be lower minimums - no thanks! There was a wide selection of slots, from the standard old-school to the more computer-generated, interactive ones. The location was also nice. We had an event at Tiger Stadium and went to dinner off-site two times and none of those drives was more than a few minutes. Parking was free for guests. One odd parking quirk - if you don't valet you park up a flight and there's no elevator. If you're trying to move suitcases, that can be an issue. Once we figured it out we just brought the car down and loaded it in the valet area, but it did seem like they really wanted to force you into valet.Love Motor City Best comps of the three casinos in Detroit.  Not mention locally owned.  Love Mike IllitchI've been to a lot of casinos this one is by far the worst. The staff is very unprofessional especially if you play craps. they hold conversations while dealing and constantly miss payouts, they also don't mind cursing you out when you let them know they missed your bet and the pit boss just sit there like a idiot. most weekend nights is gonna be rowdy and fights. I've been here a few times and it's always the same. greektown is much better or mgm. if you don't believe me just go by the time you make it the security line you will think of this review.Disappointed, we were never able to use our comped room. We called several weekends in a row ( until expiration) and there were never any "available" rooms. We have stayed at this casino previously and thought that the rooms were clean and roomy.this local casino has a fabulous buffet.  check the specials to see when it's priced on special.  the casino is a casino.  the entertainment is good if you know who you're going to see. check the schedule and get there early to get a good seat if you like to be upfront.Overall we had a great experience at Motor City Casino.  The rooms are modern and the views of Detroit city highline are spectacular!  Each room has a huge soaking tub, separate shower and toilet. (which is nice when you are sharing a room)   Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the food.  It was all just okay, 3 stars at best.  It seems like they just use the same ingredients for all the restaurants so there is very little variety, and minimal vegetarian selections.   One thing I thought was awesome was in the bar you can order a signature drink and get a souvenir item for just a few bucks more. For example, I ordered an old fashioned and got a Motor City Casino flask for $5.  Pretty sweet! I'm looking forward to coming back in a couple weeks.Review of the HOTEL only.My first stay here was when I got a "free" room from the players' club.  Room looked nice if you didn't get too close to anything, but it was dirty!!!  White stain on the bed throw, dirty throw pillow stacked right on top of the pillows you actually sleep on, white stains on the fabric-covered chairs, everything was STICKY.  The drawers and cupboards all have these handles shaped like upturned cups, and they are all sticky and filled with crud and hair.  I stuffed a tissue down in each one rather then touch them.  The handle on the minifridge was particularly sticky and gross.  There were greasy smudges on the window, marks all over the walls, dust caked on the bulkhead above the bed where the blower hits it, smudges and stains on the headboard that were kinda gross.  The bathroom was very clean, except for the door to the toilet room was splashed with something brown and gross.  The pillowcases were tattered at the edges.  Tiles in the bathroom floor were broken.  Every corner everywhere except in the bathroom was caked with dust.  Bed was very comfortable, but it was hard to relax amongst all the stains and filth.I was sure they meant to do better, so I made a list of all the issues and asked the front desk staff to give it to the head of housekeeping.  They asked me to give them another chance, and I said if I got another "free" night from the players' club, I would, but I would not pay their crazy price to stay there based on this experience. So a few months later, I got another "free" room coupon.  I thought I'd give it another try.  This room had many of the same problems, suggesting systemic breakdown in housekeeping.  Again, there were stains and stickiness everywhere (walls, floor, window, drawer handles).  My friend stepped on a wet spot on the carpet in his socks and was quite grossed out.  Same tattered pillowcases.  Some previous occupant had left an open package of lunch meat and yogurt in the minifridge (so I guess they don't check it daily like the guest information book says).  There was something gross and brown caked onto the tile floor in the entryway and the bathroom.  Again, the door to the toilet room was splashed with some brown grossness.  There was no garbage can in the bathroom, which was inconvenient.  I called and asked for an ice bucket to chill our bottles because there wasn't one in the room.  Half an hour later, someone finally brought one, but it had obvious sticky grossness on the lid.  He handed it to me and I pointed out that it was dirty, and he just walked away.  And they had already opened the plastic bag liner and put some dirty sticky ice tongs in it, so there was nothing sanitary to use to line the ice bucket.  Just bothered me that the guy didn't notice the whole way upstairs that the bucket was dirty, but I noticed right away. He must not have cared enough to look. I didn't even bother telling the front desk this time.  The first dirty room wasn't a fluke.  They aren't concerned about maintaining standards.  The place looks nice and swanky from a distance, but no one there can be bothered to give a damn about cleanliness and quality guest service.  The place needs a serious cleaning, and the housekeeping supervisors need to have their staff follow a strict checklist for cleaning and check up on them to make sure they are doing it thoroughly.  Apparently, extreme laziness and doing the bare minimum is the default modus operandi.  Maybe they need to pay more to attract better staff.  Time to wash the windows and walls and get some new garbage cans that aren't all bent to heck.  In short, this could be a fancy and luxurious place to stay, but it's painfully obvious that no one cares about cleaning and maintenance.  Before you pay to stay, go to any cheap chain hotel for a cleaner room, fewer bodily fluids smeared about, and better service.This is a ghetto hotel. If you don't mind being treated like you are a ghetto person, then this hotel will suit you fine. Check in was not very friendly.  The lady made no eye contact until she completed asking if we had stayed there before.  Only then did she look up and say 'Welcome to ....."  It was like taking a number at the Secretary of State office.  You get your key which you have to show to the security guy EVERY TIME you want to enter the hotel elevators (ghetto). Linens on the bed were very wrinkly. Aside from that the room was decent-bed was comfy. Somebody actually knocked on the door to stock the mini bar.  The robes looked like they'd been hanging in the bathroom forever.  The view was the view, nothing special just alot of cars, the Ambassador Bridge, and MGM (sigh).  The saddest part is that aside from free wi-fi(didn't really use it) this hotel offers no special hospitality perks especially to guests who aren't staying in "executive" rooms. You can not get bath salt or complimentary continental breakfast if you are a "regular" guest.  The elevator will lock and will not let you onto the "breakfast floor", but I saw some executive guests get locked out of the breakfast floor as well.  The meanest part was the non allowance of a late check out.  Really??  Remember that $50 deposit?  Well they can keep that if you want to check out at 1pm instead of 11am.  Gee thanks Motor City, guess I'll check out on time.  I called close to 11am to let the desk know we were on our way down to check out.  Most other hotel front desk employees have a smile in their voices.  There was just a long pause like "OK whatever bye".   Then onto the check out welfare line which was so long the security hotel guy had to tell us to stand by the wall.  I would probably try another hotel before coming back here or just get the executive room and keep my expectations low. Update 07/2015- I upgraded to 4 stars.  Something about staying here using the comps and the incredible bath and body products.  I have really started to like this place.  The beds are nice and soft, the tub is like a mini pool, and the food here is really good.  Also, the upper levels offer free continental breakfast with a selection of newspapers.  The rooms are super comfortable.
review_content_60: This hotel is 15 years old and shows its age,carpet are stained and very worn out in the hallways. Very surprised that the Ilitch family would let this hotel get to this point. Casino area is very smokey. Most of the staff was very polite and courteous. Buffet was a 28.00 and the food was average. Our company paid for the room so I personally would not spend the high price of staying here until it was updated.DOG OWNERS BEWARE!!! MotorCity charges a $125 per night pet FEE for each dog which is NON-REFUNDABLE! NEVER have I paid that much!I would have to say just "ok" overall. Room was pretty nice, but a few things really bugged me. The shower smelled like urine for one, and the king mattress did not have a mattress pad or a fitted sheet-- only a flat sheet draped over it. The layout of the room and furniture were very nice, and the bathroom ( other than the initial shower smell ) was one of the better I've been in. Awesome tub and separate shower, and toilet room.
