Really nice and unique fixtures. The staff seemed professional, and the casino was what you would expect.Very very nice Hotel. We went to a tigers game the shuttle bus driver was full of fun. The hotel was clean staff so friendly and lots of smiles. The casino had an atmosphere like no other casino you do have to be careful in there only complaint as it is Detroit. Staff in Casino so very helpful as well as hotel. Did not see any big wins. But a very fun place to go..great music worth every dollar..we loved the place.Went for the best of metro times 2010 party. That was awesome. The casino itself meh! Ive expierenced way better just across the road at MGM.The layout of the casino is confusing anf the ceilings are so low you could not see over anything to know where anything was.Granted the valet and greeter at the hotel itself was super.The dining choices were odd.I guess I'm just spoiled by MGM. I was just not impressed.There are good points and bad points about this casino. Four of us stayed here for two nights. Checking in was a breeze. Super easy, hassle free. The gentleman who showed us the amenities of the room, Mike Carter, was amazing!!! He really paid attention to detail, got us ice, made us feel like celebrities, not tired cranky football fans. The rooms are spectacular, the quality exceeds most rooms in Vegas. The beds are very comfortable, like sleeping on a fluffy cloud, but TINY. For spending $210.00 a night I would rather have a bigger bed and a less majestic bathroom. If you are sharing the bed, my advice is make sure you are in love. I would like to take the bathroom home with me, it's really nice, but the water pressure is terrible, one comment that was made, " the water pressure is awful, even after rinsing off for ten minutes I still feel scuzzy." Who says scuzzy??? I like the idea of the parking sensors, but there were a lot of green (park here, it's empty!) lights, that definitely were malfunctioning...unless I am seeing cars that don't exist. My advice look for lots of green lights clustered together in the parking garages. There is also no clear traffic pattern in the parking garages but I am a woman and you know what they say about woman drivers... I didn't go to the casino, not because I think gambling is sinful, but because I heard its not that great. I can't comment on it from my own experience but the couple we went with was unimpressed. They didn't like it and they are one major gambling loss away from joining Gamblers Anonymous. They know their way around a good casino, this apparently wasn't one of them.Let's talk turkey...they had it at the Assembly Line Buffet. Pricey? Yes. Worth it? Yes! My friend ate his weight in shrimp. Not little tiny shrimp, decent sized, meaty shrimp. The buffet costs $26.00. You can get sushi, pasta, pizza, turkey, roast beef, stir fry, salad, soup and its all delicious! I am telling you they make these popover brioche rolls that melt in your mouth. I will dream about these rolls. The mashed potatoes are real. We all loved the food. The dessert station assaults you first so you remember to save room for it. That is pretty much where my positive food review ends. The overpriced mediocre food is why I gave this place three stars. You are kind of stuck with the food options here unless you want to venture out. The Lodge Diner open 24 hours has a small menu, you can get an omelet for $12.00, WHAT A DEAL, not really. The $8.00 pancakes were pretty delicious. The oj was watered down so much it was like drinking orange colored water. I ordered a side of scrambled eggs, they were tasteless and slimy. We tried to order breakfast from the little pastry kiosk that said on the menu they had bagels and breakfast sandwiches...which they didn't have. We were trying to order breakfast on a Sunday at 9am. I doubt the gambling crowd was up that early and they ran out. Coffee and cupcakes for breakfast, anyone? Come on seriously???They have a deli here too! Would you like to pay $12.00 for a turkey and cheese sandwich? You get your choice of bread! Not me. So we went to Little Caesars across the hall. There you will pay $14.00 for a pizza barely one step above frozen pizza. We happened to have taken our sweet time getting around to eating the pizza, when we did open it, it was the wrong kind. I took it back, they gave me a hot pizza but what really disturbed me is, the lady working the counter, took my wrong pizza, which I had in my possession for at least 5 minutes and put it on another tray to give to someone else!!! Are you kidding me? You just gave my lukewarm pizza that I could have done ANYTHING to, spit on it, sprinkled broken glass on if I was a crazy psycho and they just gave it to another customer??? Gross!!!!! You can bet your sweet bippy (once you figure out what a bippy is) I will be writing to the manager about that!This hotel also has this amazing feature, you control everything in your room through the tv!! The housekeeping, the do not disturb, the temperature, wake up calls, I mean everything! And the coolest thing (I would assume) is a pillow library. Yes. There are 13 different kinds of pillows you can order! We tried to take advantage of this feature, but we either suck at life or the hotel only has one of each pillow, because both nights they had no pillows available. Here are my suggestions: Dear Motor City Casino, buy more pillows to satisfactorily meet your guests dreamy time needs OR put us on a waiting list, so if we order a pillow and its not available at the time we order it, we will get one once one gets turned in. Sincerely, Sleepless in a Small Bed with Ordinary Pillows in Detroit.My boyfriend and I stayed here last weekend for a mini getaway, and I'm glad we chose MCC. The valet and hotel staff were friendly, welcoming, professional, and efficient. Initially, parking for the hotel can be confusing. You don't expect valet for the hotel to be on the 2nd floor of a parking structure so it's a tad counter intuitive. I got a good deal from hotels.com, so we booked a deluxe double (the only rooms available at the time) for two nights. The beds were a little small, but totally fine for the purpose they served. The room was nice -- clean, modern, kept up well. The bathroom was beautiful, large soaking tub, nice rain shower, and cool fixtures. The view we had wasn't as great as I imagined, we looked out over the parking lot and beyond onto the expressway and Detroit, but it was still nice. Actually, the view of the parking lot became one of my favorite parts of the room, as it allowed for some spectacular people watching. Neither of us are gamblers but the casino was packed all weekend. If you don't like noise, bright lights, smoke, a few crazies, and large groups of people, gamble elsewhere. Otherwise, if you're not bothered by it (we weren't) it's a decent place to spend some time. The casino/hotel are separated nicely, so there isn't any carry over of gamblers who aren't hotel guests. You need a room key checked before entering the elevator corridor and there are will directed signs to help direct the flow of people to their desired area.The restaurants in the casino are ok. After some drinks we ate at The Lodge Diner which was basic, but again, served its purpose. The room service we ordered for some breakfast in bed was really good. Try the Cap'n Crunch french toast! For the price, MCC is a good deal. You can stay at hotels closer to the heart of downtown but the price difference is drastically higher. I'll definitely stay there again.This is the best of the three casinos in Detroit. No smoke smell in the hotel at all. Beautiful rooms. Great service.I stay here about once a month, the hotel rooms are very nice, I love the Superior king corner. There are some some very minor imperfections in the rooms, the TV's in the room have burn in (which is partially the casinos fault for having them default to a static message when they turn on) Workmanship can be spotty (poor grout, doors off alignment) The guest room doors are also surprisingly heavy but if someone is outside the room talking you can here them. Beyond that the front desk staff is always polite. The casino staff is also nice. They move their machines around very often and consistently add new games. The players club is ok, they portray it as having great flexibility, but in reality it can be a bit rigid, for example every month I receive a free hotel room. While I appreciate the offer a free room is not necessarily what I want. The room has an estimated value of $89 (to clean,service, etc.) However I'd love to get a free pass or two to the buffet (SRP - $29/40) so they are essentially losing money by offering a perk that is somewhat expensive. I live in Clinton Township staying in the hotel is not a huge perk, as from an amenities stand point, there is no theater with shows on a daily basis, no pool, it's just a casino/hotel. If you want a great hotel to come relax, and gamble this is a perfect place to visit. From the moment I park (They have this amazing parking system that has a very accurate space monitor that goes from red (occupied) to green (space open) to when I leave I have a great time. Side note - I have horrible ATT cell phone reception in here. It pushes me onto the Canadian side of the service often.first time around found it amazing would have given 4 stars at least.stayed 2nd time around and was disappointed.the bathroom was clean but when entered the room there was a kleenex on the bed.and it needed a good vacumming in the corners.the carpet in the hallway was very stained.first time 3rd floor where we got our 2 free rooms2nd time 5th floor not so goodguess 2nd time is not a charmI dont understand why people are hating on Motor City. Its not in that bad of an area. Youre only scared because your a scared person. Nothings ever happened to you personally, youre writing a review so youre obviously alive, if only brain dead.I stayed here 2 days 1 night. Its clean, the staff is friendly, free valet. I wish they had less slots and more tables but whatever works for them. Its not too smokey, youre just too sensitive. Its loud, its bright ITS A CASINO! It doesnt smell like guido, the rooms are totally comfortable and clean. The buffet and restaurant on top floor are great. Theres not many people on the floors to help but maybe you should realize youre in a casino and figure stuff out yourself. Cant help the helpless.I had an awesome time. Dont let these fools fool you. Ill be back, I have been back, and Ill keep going back.This is a nice hotel. But it is impossible to get a good night's sleep here if you do not have/cannot wear earplugs. The doors do not close, they slam. And the sound echoes down the entire hallway. Since the hotel caters to a 24 hour crowd, this happens approximately every five minutes all night long. It's ultimately a design flaw (due in part to tiled entries), so there's not much that can be done about it. Frankly, it doesn't matter how pretty the room is, its basic function is to provide sleeping quarters, so the door situation is an utter failure. The echo problem, of course, also applies to hallway conversation, which will generally interrupt your efforts to sleep until sometime between 2-4 am. Other than that... The good: Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. The panoramic view of the city from the room is great. The fitness room is modern and welcoming. The self-parking is secure, free, and super convenient. The bad: Service at the front desk and concierge were lackluster. There should be more attention to housekeeping (dust, fingerprints). I thought this hotel was fairly new, but it is wearing quickly. Specifically, the mattress is sagging and uncomfortable. I was embarrassed for the spa employee who had to tell us that there is a $25 fee per person to use the whirlpool/sauna and that it is separated by gender. What a joke! While we chose this hotel in Detroit for its modern amenities, we would never return. We need to sleep on our precious few weekends away.The rooms here are AMAZING! It was even a relatively good deal. As far as the casino goes, its alright. Nothing special. I didn't find the club scene, so I can't speak for that either. I wish they gave you free drinks here like they do at Indian casinos, but you can't win them all.The rooms were wonderful! We did not have any noise problems, the bed was very comfortable, and the modern amenities were nice. The free Wifi worked well (although you have to constantly approve their user agreement anytime you momentarily disconnect - annoying on an iPhone or iPad). You can even control the temperature of your room from the TV, and set the DND light from your TV as well (handy for the extra lazy). Room service was affordable in comparison to other hotels of this caliber. The wireless phone that works anywhere in the building was handy. Finally, the shower and deep bathtub were worth giving a try.Now, I am not a big fan of the city of Detroit, but I have to go there every so often for work. This was the first time that I had the chance to stay downtown since our company headquarters moved downtown.My first 5 choices were all booked, so the last choice on my list was the Motor City Casino/Hotel.The only reason I do not give it a 5 star rating is that it is not exactly in the most wonderful area of Detroit. If anything it was in a section of town that I would be found dead in if I walked at night. That being said, if I can say there is a jewel in the middle of a waste heap, the motor city casino is it. The minute I finally got off the road and entered the establishment ( and that was no easy feat as I had problems finding the entrance way). It was clean, it was not crowded, everything looked nice and I felt safe, which being in Detroit is not an easy thing.The room was possibly larger than my condo in CA, the bed was possibly the softest bed I ever slept in, the room was just amazing. They had a full fledged bathtub and a separate shower, with a very nice and comfortable robe they threw in for my stay.Being stuck in the casino for dinner and sometimes lunch, I found the prices to be a little bit out of site, the food court area had a little sleazers in there. In SD I can get a large Pepperoni for $5, in the casino, for a large pepperoni it was $14... the buffet was slightly above mediocre at best, but decent.If I had to stay there again, it would not be a total loss, though I did have to pay $7 to get to the office every morning via cab. I would not mind staying there again, but only if I had no other option.The spa was nice too.. yes, the thunder went to the spa and got his feet scrubbed down pretty good. I also had a bubble bath every day, I pampered myself while I was there.SMOKE GALORE. ghost-town service. almost hypnotic sound/light environment.The place needs a serious ventilation revamping. It's deathly in there. The slots are fun, but I'm a small-time roller, so don't know what the other games are like. I played 6 bucks on slots and lost it all in 4 minutes... it was entertaining i suppose.The restaurant/bar on the main floor had a great looking menu, but after our server brought waters, we never saw him again. 20 minutes we sat, and then left for the bar instead. Drinks, while pricey, were tasty and not skimpy on the booze. That was a plus.The sheer cacophony of sound and visual overload is almost mesmerizing and deserves a full 4 or 5 minutes of your focussed attention. When you really start isolating the sounds and visual stimuli, the chaos takes on an entirely rational autonomy, the way the random bumbling of ants appears somewhat structured if you stare at them long enough... this in itself was maybe the best part about being in Motor City.My man and I spent a weekend here to go to a lions game. The rooms were great. There was a large comfortable bed, great tub, large bathroom and a nice television. The casino was typical of most others I've seen. The weekend buffet looked nice but the food and service in the buffetbwere very sub par. Overall the room and casino were great but I would definitely skip the buffet.My boyfriend and I made reservations a few weeks ago in one of the deluxe rooms for Valentine's Day. With both of us living back at home with the family and having zero private time for ourselves we agreed we deserved it. We priced out a room here, MGM Grand, and Greektown. We ended up picking a room here because it was the better deal for the price. Not to mention MGM's room rates were almost double the price for less (boo MGM!). In the end, and I know this is sad, I wanted the MotorCity Casino's Hotel because at night it lights up pink, purple, and teal. All three some of my favorite colors. :-) I'd also like to note this was our first time going to any of the casinos in Detroit.Friday night we went here for the 95.5 Single Mingle. Gordon and I felt we made the right hotel choice because of how nice and clean the interior of the building seemed. Not to mention the free parking. It's hard to come by that here in Detroit so that already made me like the place.The club, Amnesia, is very nice on the inside. Even the security they have are friendly. The only downside are their drink prices are expensive. I had only one Amaretto Sour the entire night because that drink alone was $8.00. Ouch. :-\Valentine's Day we came to check in at 3:00 pm. There was a huge line to check in but I was impressed at how fast the line moved. They also had every spot filled at the check-in desk. I was pleased to see this because nothing angers me more and will make me dock stars faster than to see a business not opening every register, so to speak. It took us about 15 minute to finally get to the front of the line. When we did we were told that we were selected for a free complimentary room upgrade. We must have asked them 5 or 6 times if we were going to be charged the executive suite price because we were worried about it since we could not afford a penny more. We had the nicest check in guy who kept assuring us that because they were getting more people than they anticipated they had to open up more rooms for other people. I almost hugged the check in guy. Honestly, my boyfriend and I have had 6 months straight of bad luck so for us to luck out with the upgrade made our Valentine's Day.The room was absolutely beautiful!!! The downside is the inflated prices for the in-room fridge service. $5.00 for a bag of peanut M&M's? $8.00 for little one shot liquor bottles? But honestly, we got an executive suite for free so we weren't complaining. The room and bathrooms were so clean and well taken care of that we loved it. In fact, before we checked out this afternoon we made sure to try and make cleaning up easy for the maid by keeping everything together.Apparently, when you get an executive suite free hot hors' dourves were served from 5-7 pm and a free breakfast the next morning from 6-10 am was served. Unfortunately, we did not wake up in time to take advantage of breakfast but we checked out the 5-7 pm food. They did an amazing job and had a great spread. It was exciting to try one of everything because we'd never had most of that kind of food before. It was great!We checked out the casino. We didn't really spend time there because we're not huge gamblers. Because it was our first time ever being in a casino we did try the slot machines. I always wanted to pull a slot-machine lever! :-) On my boyfriends first time ever he put a dollar bill in and we got $9.00 back. This was pretty exciting because, as I said, we have had terrible lucky recently. So thank you well-known rigged computerized slot machines for making us feel slightly lucky today!All in all the experience was amazing. I would recommend this be the hotel of choice of anyone coming to Detroit. The staff is very friendly. and their rooms are clean and lavish. Thank you Motor City and I hope the next time I come we luck out and get an executive suite again!!! I'd love to be prepared for it next time and have money to spend in the casino. We all know I love my Hold'em! :-DWe stayed here in a suite to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th birthday. We had a suite on the 15th floor, and on top of being a beautiful view and room, the bed was wicked comfortable! I seriously took note of the bed manufacturer and pillow companies in hopes that I could replicate the same sleep I had at Motorcity.We also made a pit stop at the spa, where we had an amazing massage.I didn't do so well on the slots, and my boyfriend didn't do great at Blackjack or Poker, but the hotel part was comfortable and relaxing, which is what I had been hoping for. The nightclub at Motorcity, Amnesia, had a line waiting to go upstairs via the elevator (16th floor), and they have a decent restaurant selection (expensive/mid priced/fast food).An interesting location as it is really not convenient to much. The rooms were fantastic but the service was poor. Valet parking was a disaster as it took too long to be parked and get your car. Check in was nice and the lobby was very nice; what you would expect from a Vegas style casino. Meals were just OK. The experience at the dining on the 16 th floor was nice but not good enough for the high price.Just seemed like the service was very poor for a location which, because of it's glamorous outside, made you think you were entering a 5 star hotel. I would not run to go back and would only go back if I received a significant discount to the rate.
review_content_80: Had a real good night 100.00 per bet on roulette table. It was a real good night! I also like the atmosphere in the Strut bar. Comfy chairs and real laid back. I could be a regular here.One of my biggest goals since I was a wii-ling young one was to go to Michigan. I did a report on it when I was in 4th grade and this past weekend I was fortunate enough to have that goal achieved at the Motor City Casino & Hotel!This place was super nice. A group of about 12 went and got 3 rooms in the hotel over a weekend. We got an added bonus of $50 in food/drinks per night per room. That pretty much paid for our dinner & breakfast for 4 in each room. The casino itself was pretty big. They had an awesome Pussy Cat Dolls look alike group that played top 40 songs in the Lounge. Let me tell ya we got our groove on for sure. The drinks were decently priced. There was a big assortment of table games, but because it was a Saturday night, they were all quite full. The food court area offers a number of types of meals, from higher scale sit down, buffet, and burger/pizza take out. They even had a espresso stand to keep you betting out on the casino floor!The rooms were beautiful - the bathroom was HUGE (as Paris Hilton would say). Only crappy thing was that they stopped serving alcohol at 2am (boo!). Hard for Chicago-folk to be okay with that considering we have bars that stay open until 5am.Overall - I would definitely return to the swanky place.The nicest building in Detroit?The Motor City Casino was the last stop of the Rental Car Rally from NYC to Detroit.  We got a group rate of $225, which was not bad considering it was split between the 4 of us.Upon entry the entire hotel staff was super friendly and helpful with any questions and directions that you may have / need.  After a 22 hour drive, this is just the kind of service you need.After throwing down the bags we headed straight to the one place a casino is known for - THE BUFFET.  Eat we shall, and eat we did.The selection was huge.  Everything from steak, to pizza, to soups to Chinese food, to more desert than a bakery in NYC.It was definitely a bargain to have so much selection at such a reasonable rate.  In fact, we had such a great time, you can imagine where we went right after we checked out.Straight back to the Buffer for lunch!My boyfriend LOVES to gamble, so for his birthday I booked a night at the Motor City Casino Hotel so he could play video blackjack to all hours of the night without having to worry about driving home afterward (even though we live only about 20 minutes away). I don't spend much time in hotels, and definitely not ones of this caliber, so I may be a bit biased... but everything about our stay was perfect. The staff was friendly, the room was beautiful and clean, and it was definitely worth the money. I am not the biggest casino fan and I even enjoyed the evening there. Motor City offered the best deal out of the other two Detroit casinos, and I can't imagine that Greektown or MGM would have been any better than what we got.Clean room. Comfortable bed. Check out at 11 is too early especially for a casino.... But other than that it's decentWe don't really gamble but I took my husband here for his birthday last weekend. We got a king-size room and it had what I like a hotel room to have: BIG bathroom and room to spread out a little. Each room also had two complimentary bath robes, slippers, q-tips, cotton balls, mini shower gel/lotion/etc....decent view, comfortable bed, lots of linens, LOTS of room to store your clothing if you're there for a longer stay (hanging and in drawers).I liked the modern design of the room and it was clean. We were on the 3rd floor. The mini fridge has no room to store anything you might get for takeout though ~ and there is a warning that if you remove any of the items from the mini bar or other offerings area for more than 45 seconds, it will automatically be charged to your room bill. Are there sensors in there or something? I wasn't going to pay $8 for a little bag of yogurt pretzels...the prices for the stuff were outrageous.We ate at Flames in the hotel, not currently listed on Yelp yet. Good steak and good service. Spent about $100 + tip for 2 steaks, 1 potato side, 1 app, and 1 bottle of wine. We wanted to try the Assembly Line buffet but the line had about 30 people in it before it even opened. Then when it was open and we walked by, the line was wrapped all around. No thanks. I've heard the buffet is good but I wasn't waiting an hour for it.I liked this hotel and what they had to offer...would stay there again. Friendly staff and usually other things /entertainment going on if you don't gamble. Saw a show in the concert room too - nice room for concerts, seating about 1,600 they said.nice clean rooms, I walked around in the complimentary robe like i owned the place lol!i hate it and like it the same way..Hate: Smoking, Slow workers, comps take forever to get for every 100 in slot play you might get $3.00 in comps back :( also the hotel cost to much!!!Love: food, games and hotelIn celebration of the end of my unemployment, my husband and I decided to investigate the packages available and pricing at all three casino/hotels, for an elaborate date night. Motor City definitely had the most bang for your buck, so we booked the Motor City Package (deluxe accommodations, complimentary valet and a $30 credit at any of the eateries) for $199.00 on a Friday.THE HOTEL:  The room was nice, with quite a few amenities, including:  free Wi-Fi, 42" flat screen (not HD, though), HBO and Showtime, a fully-stocked (outrageously expensive) mini bar ($8 for a short stack of Pringles and $5 for a regular size bag of peanut M&M's!), hair dryer, bath stuff from Molton Brown, two free little bottles of water, a cell phone that you could take with you and use on the grounds of the property, and 24-hour room service, just off the top of my head.  The shower pressure was pretty lame, but other than that, the bathroom was lovely.  The tub was crazy deep and the way the water came out was surprising and fancy.  Generally, it was very modern and clean, but for the price, I expected nothing less.  The sheets, which were supposedly 300 thread count, were like paper, so not so great.  The bed was also too soft.  The turn down service was nice.  We came back from our adventures and found a tiny little corner of the comforter turned down, with a bottle of water and 4 Dean & Deluca chocolates on a tray, and our ice bucket full and next to the bed.THE CASINO:  We then headed to the casino and prepared to part with some cash.  The casino was pretty smokey.  I didn't get the sense that oxygen was being constantly pumped into the room, like I do at MGM.  Also, the casino part is on two floors and it's just huge AND packed AND overwhelming.  There are a bazillion slot machines, placed with no rhyme or reason that I could distinguish, and an oddly disproportionate handful of card tables, craps and roulette in just a few areas.  We played some slots and won some money, and then lost it.  We ended up breaking even in the end when I sat down at a random 2-cent machine, put in $3 to kill some time, spun the reels twice and then the machine gave me a bunch of free spins and just went off by itself like it was possessed, ultimately dishing out $70 when it finally stopped.  There was a live cover band playing earlier in the evening that was okay.  When we came back later on in the evening, there was a really good Motown/funk cover band that really had people excited.  This provided the most excellent people watching, with the dancing and general happiness.  I was really surprised how amazingly packed the place was.  You'd never know you were in a town that's been ravaged by the economic downturn.  We watched some Black Jack, respectfully declining the invites to play ($15 minimum at night), and by 11:00p we were hungry.   THE FOOD:   There are a million food options on the property, including the 24-hour room service that looked amazing, but at $20 for two eggs, meat and potatoes, not a very cost-friendly option.  In fact, there's pretty much a premium on everything you come across.  The only reasonably priced thing we found was at a little souvenir shop on our way out of the casino, where we got a bottle of water for $1.50, a steal compared to the $5 bottle of Fuji Water in our mini bar.  We started the evening at Iridescence (luckily, our adventure coincided with Detroit Restaurant Week and our package included that $30 food credit) and had an absolutely amazing 5-star meal, which will be detailed in a different review.  Our late night munchies landed us at one of the many eateries in the food corridor, Grand River Deli.  Our corned beef sandwich and soups were tasty, but we, not surprisingly, immediately regretted this decision and had to walk it off a bit.  You will definitely not go hungry here.  I'd love to go back just for the seafood buffet at Assembly Line (Fridays only), which must be amazing because there were probably 50 people in line for it at 11:00p and it's $32 a person!  It is also worth mentioning that he coffee we got the next morning from High Octane was really good.THE SERVICE:  Every single service person we came in contact with was amazing.  From the check-in, to the restaurants, to the valets, to the people that you just passed in your travels, every single person was helpful, chatty and lovely.  In summary, if you want a quick, somewhat fancy, getaway in our fair city, I'd highly recommend a trip to the Motor City Casino and Hotel.  I totally felt like I'd escaped for the night and there's plenty to occupy your time for one night, so you don't really even have to leave once you park your car and get in there.  They even offer Tigers, Wings, DIA, and concert packages that include transportation, as well as spa packages (pricey!), so if you're not into gambling, there's that too.My boyfriend and I went to Motor City a few weekends ago for some much needed down time. I picked Motor City based on the reviews I'd read here and other sites, and the fact that I wanted a nice getaway that was cheaper than MGM Grand. I live in the suburbs but I'm a big Detroit supporter. I wouldn't say our experience was unpleasant, I just expected a lot more based on the ads of Motor City Casino being a "luxury getaway." I don't really gamble so I would probably never stay here again unless the price was more reasonable. $320 a night can go a long way in many major cities, even NYC, with a better experience. Motor City is in an area where you can't really walk outside and do anything, so you're relying on them for your full entertainment value. The hotel itself is beautiful, the room was great but definitely starting to show a little wear and tear -- eg, magazines on table were beat up and had beverage stains. Toilet paper was cheap and the hotel robes were really stiff. (But you could buy one in the gift shop for $100!) The casino is the basement and seemed sad -- lots of people spending their disability / retirement at slot machines and table games were hard to find. Way too smoky, even in the non-smoking areas. All the staff of Motor City wears these cheap, ill fitting grey suits...a nice tailored blazer would look so much better. I know these are little things but for someone who appreciates and expects to get the value of their money, as I expect a lot of people on this site are, they go a long way. Iridescence was nice- beautiful room and view. The waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. Hostesses (again wearing those cheap grey suits) were, ahem, not exactly professional looking. The food was excellent, definitely American type fare but I totally get that for a Casino crowd. Wine was good and priced decently. Bottom line,  if Motor City wants to bill itself as luxury getaway, it still has a long way to go. Next time we'll probably stay at Greektown or the Westin Book Cadillac for a better Detroit experience.I'm surprised to read the other reviews and see that no one has mentioned the smell in the lobby of the hotel. After a day of dealing with runny noses and itchy throats (almost our entire group had them), we asked the front desk and had our suspicions confirmed. They pipe in perfume through the air vents. And not a light mist to freshen up the place, it's more like having samples sprayed continually at your face as you walk through a department store fragrance section. And if I'm going to stay in a fragrance factory, I'd rather stay in a department store, since the lighting would be so much better than the dark, dark rooms that we had. We searched every time we came back to the room for a light switch or three that we simply must have missed, but never found them. If you want a place that constantly challenges one of your senses, then this is it. Motorcity Casino......It's Dark and Smells Funny Here.The Motor City Hotel is new, but it won't be for long. It's not very old, but is already lacking basic maintenance and housekeeping to keep it nice. All-in-all my room was okay except for the food stuck to the curtains. In fact, it was quite nice, just not as clean as I would have liked it to be. If didn't know better I'd think they didn't change the sheets. ICK! Having traveled a lot, I can't see staying here again.The neighborhood around this place was scary, run down and I wouldn't go anywhere alone.  I was here less than an hour and was already annoyed with this place.  We arrived at 12:30pm to be told that check in wasn't until 3pm - which is alright however we had a conference at 1pm.  Upon proceeding to check us in, we had to call our travel planner out of his conference to come show them the credit card on file!  Then they said they will call us when the hotel room is ready.  After rearranging my briefcase to check my baggage in (I didn't want my jewelry, ipod, computer and other misc. items to be checked in behind the desk), I proceeded to the casino to waste some time, only to be told that I couldn't bring in my soft sided briefcase because it was too big and the man guarding the casino suggested I check it with the front desk.  I told him I didn't feel secure in leaving some of my items there.  He assured me it was "pretty safe" (is that why hotel rooms have safes???).  I showed him it was only slightly bigger than my handbag and he referred me to the security office next door.  The woman there explained that since "nine-one-one" no bags are allowed and again she suggested I check it at the front desk.  I offered her the same reasons and I again stated it was only slightly bigger than my handbag.  She again recited "nine-one-one" saying it's been this way for a while.  I asked her 3 times if it was hotel policy or if it was a law?  She seemed annoyed and either could not or would not answer the question.  She was about to say you can speak to my manager when he appeared and said there is no law.  I said that was all I want to know. All that said, it appears that I can check into the hotel with as many bags as I want but I cannot go into the casino with a briefcase?  Does that mean they only care about the money - not what one might do with the briefcase while in the hotel or while it is parked at the front desk? I proceeded back to the lobby to wait and the "room" where they checked my luggage has employees in and out constantly as it is behind the front desk and perhaps offices or a break room.  Employees pass through the hotel lobby constantly giving their shout outs to one another.  There was a girl waiting next to me and she and her friend got check in.  I decided to wait it out to see just how long it would take.  I watched others come and get checked in but no call. I was checked into my room and settled when I got a call i could check in (at 3:45).As much as the hotel tries to give a great lobby appearance, something is just not right about it.  There is a guard to make sure you are a guest of the hotel before you can proceed to rooms.  However, I did notice 3 obviously seedily dressed girls that walked right by, mumbled something and went on up.  I sat in the lobby for 2 hours waiting to be able to check in.  Employees frequently walked by and gave each other hoots and hollers and high fives sometimes loud and obnoxiously.The room was nice except our toilet plugged up.  The cleaning crew in the halls seem to forget there are guests in the hotel and shout up and down the halls to one another.  The slots in the casino were very tight.  All in all it gives you the feel of something TRYING to shine in a dust storm.Great casino. Very great buffet. Good price for all you can eat crab legs on Friday night. The hotel is also very classy.I recently went to the hotel and it was REALLY nice. Absolutely gorgeous and everyone was extremely hospitable. I KNEW I loved Motor City for a reason!My husband and I actually got married at the Motor City Casino Hotel.  The whole day was put together by the event coordinator, Irene Lignos.  She was amazing.  The wedding was outstandingly beautiful and every need of ours was taken care of at little or no extra cost.  The event designer was a gentleman named Michael and he was also outstanding.  From the food to decor to the rooms, all of our friends and guests stayed at the hotel and were blown away.  It is truly a wonderful hotel.  Molten Brown products in the bathrooms, turn down service, quick room service - literally, nothing to complain about!!!Nice casino with beautiful rooms. A couple minor issues. No tissue in the room and only one wine glass. A large ketchup stain on the carpet. Minor details that really should not be missed. This hotel can expect to be filled with folks from around the world for the auto show. It would be nice to showcase Detroit and this hotel as a first class place to stay. I hope management takes care of these minor issues.Motor City Casino is the perfect place to hang out and have a good time.  Whether your with your significant other or with a group of 20 friends.  I have to say it's a little nicer than the other two casinos. The suite was awesome!  The main room which had a full wet bar and 42" plasma, was completely separated by a hallway from the bedroom and bathroom.  I was thinking... this is a hotel room?  The bathroom was fully equipped with robes, slippers and everything else you might need.  Both rooms were outfitted with this really dark cherry wood, ultra modern furniture.  I haven't tried any of the restaurants here, only because I must eat at the Parthenon every time I'm downtown.  Most restaurants in the downtown area accept comps from the 3 casino's.  I have been told the restaurants are great though.  I love their electronic roulette table, I must have spent about an 1 1/2 on the thing. There's an actual spinning wheel, but you place your bets at your own station.  No more leaning in and elbowing the person next to you.  Its nice!  I'm sure the other casino's have them but the only time I've used it was here.  They have $5 minimum poker tables!!   A definite plus. Parking was surprisingly extremely easy coming in.  Leaving... not so much.  I had a hell of a time finding my car after all the shenanigan's that night.  But once I found it (after 10 min,) I was out in seconds.  What topped the night off for me the last time I was here was, I was able to catch the Mayweather/ Marquez fight on about 20 different plasma screens.  I will definitely be here to watch the Pacquiao/ Cotto fight too.  Great atmosphere to watch the fight.  It sure beats going to a sports bar and trying to look over people's shoulders to watch it on 1 screen!   Although Motor city is the furthest out from the immediate downtown area, it is definitely the one that is most like a true casino.  Motor city has a couple bad ass night clubs that I've been to.  But you won't really notice them unless that's what your there for.  It's a perfect balance!!  MGM seems to put ALL emphasis on the night clubs.  At MGM the clubs are almost right smack dab in the middle of the casino.  Motor city offers great stay and play packages. So if you want a quick, cheap weekend stay-cation give MC a try.Have stayed in many a hotel, and as far as room size this takes the cake.  Rooms are extra spacious, TV's are all LCD's, and the bathroom is mostly marble and nicely done.  There was a hotel employee checking to make sure people had hotel cards to make sure no people were coming up from the casino.  The staff were all super friendly, I had a good stay on Final Four weekend, the only knock i have is that its on the outskirts of the nice Detriot area, so you have to cab it there, but the upside is that there is free parking in the adjoining garage.

review_content: Now this review is based off the total package. I was here for a wedding in Atrium. I stayed here one night. The hotel room was nice. I wasn't a fan of the lighting but the room was nice, spacious, the jacuzzi was awesome, showers were good, and the bed was comfy. Not a bad Hotel at all. The location is  good 30 minutes from Somerset mall and the lodge freeway is right there which takes you straight to downtown Detroit. For a wedding Venue this was much better than what I was expecting. They have this whole jungle/cave/nature set up. The seating worked out great, lighting was awesome, the mics were a little off but overall this was a great venue. Tables set all around two different floor levels making for great views. Tons of space was available for all the catering and whatever company they used to do the Desserts it was beautiful. It just put everyone is a social joyus mood! Also had tons of space to socialize and take pictures on nice backdrops etc etc. Oh forgot to add the Bride and Groom looked stunning, the camera doesn't do justice for the colors of the venue!Lets say if you are going to have a ceremony in Michigan, you should definitely take a look into this place.My first impression of the Westin was an overall positive one-the staff was friendly, there was a pleasant smell, overall a great start to my weekend. But upon checking into my room, the whole weekend turned sour. I reserved a junior suite, which I was located on the same floor as the pool, and immediately adjacent to the staff room who woke me and my significant other up frequently-as early as 6am. There is rust on the top of the shower rod, there is rust stains on the inside of the shower heads, the wallpaper is peeling, the seal between the outer shower wall and the interior of the wall is outset by an inch, and the walls and ceilings are incredibly thin. Do not spend any extra money here, thinking you will get a better experience-go somewhere else instead. ***UPDATE*** I was promised 7,000 SPG points (as an existing SPG rewards member) but, as of 1/18/2016 (4 days after checkout) I still have not been awarded any points, let alone the promised amount. I do not know if that is standard for SPG hotels, but I expected much more. Such a let down and I would have gotten much more for my dollar at a motel, or the hotel across the street...**********This is my second time staying at this property, the first time was in July. Since I'm SPG Gold and this location is within 10 minutes of my in-laws this location is the most ideal.Our flight, the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, landed at 7:45am. We figured it wouldn't hurt to call the hotel to see if we could check in earlier. They told us we could come at 10:00am. Perfect!We checked in with no wait, they acknowledged my SPG status and said we had been upgraded to a corner room on the top floor. I looked around for my usual welcome amenity or at least a handwritten note, nothing. Figured maybe we'd arrived too early.Our room was spacious. It was one large room with a king-sized bed and a living area with a love seat, desk, and chest that housed the TV and a mini-fridge. It seemed the room hadn't been used in a while because the heat took a long time to come on and the coffee table was dusty.When we left the room around 1:00pm to go visit family, we noticed our neighbor across the hall had left their room service tray in front of our door. Tacky, right?When we returned that evening around 10:30pm, the tray and all the food was still there. I immediately called to ask someone to remove it. That night, in front of the building we could hear a loud hissing sound. As we got closer it smelled of natural gas. We immediately alerted the front desk who informed us they already knew about the issue. Strange it took 2 days for someone to finally come out and turn off the valve. Glad no one was outside smoking. Nice to see they were concerned with our safety.The next morning, we spotted the housekeeper and next to her cart was a huge pile of towels and sheets. Again, we came back to the hotel after 10:00pm to see not one, but two huge piles of towels in the same place since the morning. The room itself was nice and the front desk staff were very accommodating. Too bad they don't pride themselves on keeping the communal areas clean. We may end up staying here again but it definitely won't be my first choice.It's okay.  When we checked in, I was offered a free Starbucks drink from the cafe as my gold amenity.  When we went to get it in the morning, the lady had no idea what I was talking about.  Classy.  When we left, the valet didn't leave the key fob in the car.  When we were about 10 mins away, we had to turn back to go get it making us late for our bunch.  The vast said it wasn't him who pulled our car around.  Again, classy.  The food was decent, but I'd never stay here again.  Apparently it's too difficult for employees to communicate with each other.I liked staying here. The rooms were classic Westin, service was nice and the price appropriate. Nicely located for the various Detroit suburbs that I need to float in and out of.Stayed here for the weekend for the recent Penguicon conference/convention, and this place is, by and large, awesome.- Rooms were clean and absolutely no complaints about the amenities available...not that I used any, because I think I was in my room for a grand total of about 6 hours over the course of the entire weekend...but, still, solid.- The staff could not have possibly been more friendly, especially in light of the crushing crowd that descended upon them for the weekend.- The staff was hilariously completely in the mood and in the mix for the con, with most of them wearing costumes, shirts, or something that showed an interest in the event along with their name badges, and were almost to a fault wanting to talk about what brought you there, what your interests were, and just friendly chatting in general.- Meeting rooms were great, and had everything needed for the various presentations and panels that I was a part of.- The only negative I can ding them for, really, is that the bar staff's kinda slow on the uptake, even with nobody but three of us sitting in the bar.  Not for nothing, but I shouldn't *really* have to remind you twice of our order of three beers.  All the same beer too, so really not a complicated order, and again..."dead" at the time, so it's not like there was a mob scene.  In fact, they tended to react better during the mob scene times...although still a bit on the slow side.  Still awfully friendly and chatty though, which is always a plus in my book.That one minor note aside, it was an outstanding experience, and I'd totally stay here again.  I'll definitely be back for next year's Penguicon.We stayed here for a wedding. The day started off by calling to see if we could check in early. The lady on the phone informed us that she had no such reservations. We booked THREE rooms.. THREE (and had the receipt for said rooms.) The wedding was at 2 and the reception was at 5. We arrived at the hotel a little after 4, and we were told that only one out of three of our rooms were ready. We had to go to the reception, so were forced to check in to our remaining rooms when we got back... After midnight. When we finally got into our remaining rooms they were merely wiped down. There were crumbs on the counters, etc. One thing that really grosses me out are when cloth type things are visibly dirty. For example: A lamp shade. When going to turn on the light I could see dark stains all over the lamp shade. How cheap are lamp shades? It would be an easy fix. When returning from the wedding reception. We went back to another family members room, we were there for less than 10 minutes when a security guard knocked on the door. He asked for the person paying for the room to come to the hallway. Where he rudely stated, "we have gotten multiple calls (ya know, in the total 7 minutes we were in the room) if I have to come back again you will be EVICTED from the room." Slow down BUCKO, evicted? Get over yourself. Oh, and you mean the room that we have had for a grand total of 30 minutes because your hotel wasn't prepared? Very pretty hotel lobby though!I am in the "Heacebly" bed as I write, and I am SO happy. Based on these reviews, I was expecting some sort of run-down institution. Nope nope nope!The only trouble we had was getting to the front of the hotel. Google Maps, you have failed me for the first time ever. It will take you around the Town Center - DON'T DO THAT! If you're coming from the highway, after you turn into the center, just turn left almost immediately into the front parking area of the bank, and straight ahead is the hotel. Easy peazy. When we got there, the attendants told us we could leave our car by the curb so we could check-in first and park after. He was so nice! We were also welcomed by another attendant in the lobby. So much love!Our Front Desk person was Homer and he was GREAT! With a welcoming and genuine smile, he got us a great room and made small talk as we waited for everything to process. We also had an issue with internet which he resolved immediately. Can't get better hospitality employees than that! Two thumbs up for Homer!We went into the garage to park (didn't feel like parking in the open even though it was closer). Turns out that there is a SKYWAY from the lot to the hotel which took us right to the elevators! Pretty much the same distance as the front parking spots were!Elevator wait was minimal. The hallway was fine. But our room is STELLAR! I was seriously expecting mold and dirty sheets based on reviews. Our room is clean clean CLEAN! The bed is so comfortable, the bathroom is spotless, and our room looks fairly new (we're in a basic double). Some of the furniture has scuff marks here and there, but who really cares? Maybe I'm in an updated room, but this is pretty sweet (thank you, Homer!!). I'll update more as our stay progresses, but I am super pleased right now.This Westin offers appreciable discounts off-peak, and so we were able to book a four-day Christmas stay in a hotel with many amenities while visiting relatives in Detroit, so many thanks to them for giving us that opportunity at a discount. We'll probably stay here again. On the plus side, Southfield itself is safe and still super convenient to Detroit proper, and the outside parking lot is free and (given the low winter occupancy rates) ubiquitously available. Huge points there.The hotel is vast and probably earns most of its bread off of business conferences, but the staff were nevertheless gracious and accommodating for these two married holiday travelers with two small dogs. Heck, one of the concierges would stop us so he could pet our furry children on the way in and out from walks. Little things like that matter, and we felt welcomed by the Westin.The room we had was nice enough, if a little older, although the mini-fridge was broken. They were kind enough to send us up another one, so, no points off there. The advertized "Heavenly Bed" and "Heavenly Shower" were more pleasant than ecstasy-inducing, so, yay for a good effort, anyway. The hot water on the shower, e.g, came and went: I hope whatever actual heaven people believe in sets the bar a little higher. The restaurant and bar are not so good: while the hot breakfast that we got cashing in our "don't clean our room" tickets was filling and tasty, the dinner menu is generally mediocre. The bar's beer selection is nothing short of terrible (not a single Michigan craft brew?) and the cocktails all cost 50% more than they ought to even for an upscale place. The indoor pool with hot tub was a nice bonus, as was a fitness center that's vastly better than that of most hotels (with free weights and multiple treadmills in addition to the ubiquitous universal gym).So, four stars for a Priceline Express Deals discount, probably more like three at advertised rates. It fit our needs at the time, which is really about all that you can ask out of life.My fiance and I like to go to hotel rooms just to get away for the night. We were looking online and the Westin Southfield kept popping up.. So we decided to book a room for 1 night.. Let me start off my saying that the valet attendant and front desk personal were very pleasant...The Room....The room is clean.. the bed and pillows are amazing..The view is nice..The wallpaper is peeling..The shower head is hanging.. Broken glass on bathroom floor.. The Starbucks Coffee was nice..The room was a tad too warm..3pm check out is Amazing.. Was nice to not get woken up by vacuums or someone knocking on the door..We did not get a chance to eat there.. We actually ended up at Beans and Cornbread.. Which is amazing lol..The PoolThe pool area is sweltering!the pool and hot tub are soooo tiny! And over ran with tax baller baba kids.. Little 3 year old with no control In The hot tub, which clearly stat 16+... They have every single lifeguard object pulled off the wall.. I understand kids want to have a good time and swim... but damn.. I was really looking forward to enjoying the hot tub.. but unfortunately I kept getting splashed by kids jumping in.. Also, the 2 pops that we did get from the vending machine, we're expired!! From December 14...The hotel NEEDS to monitor the pool area...Overall I the hotel is decent!!I probably will not be revisiting this hotel..This is a great hotel in the middle of Southfield. There aren't too many Starwood properties in the Detroit area, but this is a nice one. Over the holidays it was very quiet. We were upgraded to a suite both times we were there. Overall a great place to stay and reasonable rates.I enjoyed my stay here and found the experience to be very relaxing and comfortable. Check in was fast and easy, and the woman working was very kind. She gave me free internet access and allowed me to check out at 2pm instead of noon. The room was aesthetically pleasing and beds were very comfortable. Internet worked very well. Free parking attached to the hotel. My only complaint is that housekeeping knocked at noon and woke me up. Overall, I found this hotel to be a great value.Lobby always seems to be understaffed, been staying here for work on and off for nearly 7 years and this has always been the case. Expect 10-20 minute wait no matter the day of the week. Such a shame because the rooms are extremely clean and the breakfast buffet is second to none. What a shame.The Westin Southfield has been newly renovated.  It is clean, modern, and smells great.  The beds are very comfortable.  I've stayed here several times for business and found everything up to par or better.  The only downside is the elevators are slow and it seems one or more is always out of order while I'm staying here.  Not a big deal really.  The hotel bar is nice and they have some very good house wines. Haven't had a meal here yet but the food looks pretty good from what I've observed.  The covered, connected parking structure is a bonus especially during the winter.I live in the area but spend a lot of nights out with my wife to escape the kids. We get to see a lot of the areas hotels and always ask for the best suite. I am very displeased with our deluxe master suite. The carpets are dirty and stained throughout our floor. Our room has a funky musk and mold smell and is not what I expect for a deluxe suite in the area. My wife was especially surprised at the small size of the bath, which is usually one of the luxuries we enjoy when staying out. Unless your attending a conference or other reason to be in the facility you would be better served at one of the other fine hotels in greater Detroit.  This is not a nice place to stay, just an expensive one.This review is specifically for the restaurant. Don't get the breakfast buffet. It's $17 and the food is horrible. Our waitress didn't come back for a half hour after dropping off our waters, came back with our bills, and then was gone for another 20 minutes even though we were pulling our our cards as she was putting the bills on the table. Never again.Decent hotel for the price!Given I'm orginally from the area- my usual "hotel" is mom's house.  But on this recent trip, I needed a less familiar setting so I stayed where my business meeting was located.Given I travel a lot, sometimes it's the little things that keep me from giving hotels a 4 star rating even though there is nothing wrong with a 3 start or an "a ok" rating, it just means that there were hassles and as a road weary business traveler, little hassles can ruin a stay.In this case, the little things added up. It was the lack of valet to take my car (I had to hunt one down through the front desk staff after standing out front watching people smoke around me).  It was that the hallways leading to the rooms needed new carpeting.  At least my floor (which was a preferred floor)was dirty and stained which had me wondering what my room was going to be like, yet, I will say, when I opened the door to the room- all was well there. Just gave me a bad first impression.And finally- there were a couple of problems with my check in/checkout. I got a gift basket that was obviously intended for someone else when I checked in, and when I checked out, I should have looked at my bill as they billed my room to some other company's master account and all I had were the incidentials (rectified when I called the hotel but I'm all about "hassle free" as travel is enough of a hassle.The good news?  My room was clean and spactious with coffee, paid internet and a stocked bathroom.  The bed was soft and inviting and there were plenty of different kinds of pillows allowing me to choose just the right one for a good night's sleep.I also thought the meeting space in this hotel was quite nice and the public areas leading to the meeting space was modern and had comfy seating arrangements so that small meetings could take place.And while I didn't use it- the bar must be pretty good as it was packed both nights I was here.All in all it was a good night's sleep which is often just what I need.  But when hotels are competing for my business, sometimes it's the little things that make one hotel stand out from another.I stayed here while on business and while the hotel is clean and modern I had a few issues here that would prevent me from returning. First the room I was in had small nat like bugs for two days and I never once ate or had food in my room. Second in the bathroom there was two spots with peeling paint. This was not a huge issue but should have been caught and communicated to maintenance on routine room checks. Third the tv would not sync to the sound after being on for several minutes. It was annoying. Fourth and my biggest issue was the fact that my room keys had to be replaced twice over the course of a one week stay as they would not work on the elevator and my room. Nothing like getting up to the ninth floor and then having to come all the way back down to get new keys late at night. When I checked out they said here you go. No how was your stay to get feedback or have a nice day. That was just the way to end my stay. If I had the opportunity to come back to Detroit I would not stay here again. Too many things just did not go right.So sad, I have watched this hotel decline over the years.  Several times a year I hold meetings at the EMC- which is wonderful. My meetings require the overnight stay of many of my meeting guests. The Westin Southfield is conveniently located to the metro area, and the Westin use to draw the appeal. In the last two months I have had two meetings, both came with very long, understaffed check in lines, no delivery of a receipt, and maintenance issues with the rooms. The heavenly beds? After many years of use, those have started to break down. The beds are not heavenly, the rooms are often unable to cool themselves down, and are too hot. In fact I stayed last night and had someone from maintenance working on the temperature control for two hours, after midnight. The hotel was sold out, so they couldn't move me to another room. For the price they charge, you can't put a price on a restful stay. Maintenance issues which include toilet problems, temperature control, and long check in lines, you can only take so much off.  The first time, shame on you Westin Southfield, the second time shame on me. After two bad experiences within a month, I'm not sure I will be bringing my business back for overnight stay at the hotel. Outside of the EMC, which offers excellent customer service by Fred and his crew, the only other good part to this place is the bar. Service is great, drinks are made right, and it has a great atmosphere.Great hotel in Southfield Detroit! It's location is nearby everything and the Hotel itself is great. Rooms are spacious and modern looking. They have a small gym with swimming pool and jacuzzi. Also simple checking in and out process. For the price, it's a great hotel to choose from in the area.
review_content_20: Super-super disappointed in this one. Westin's are usually bulletproof; the one in Edina MN is one of my altime favs. This one in Southfield gives off the impression that they've given up. I had spent a fair amount of the day travelling and was really looking forward getting some work done in the room and relaxing a bit. The first issue was trying to find a sandwich. I asked the valet/concierge if there was a place to grab a quick sandwich to bring back to the room. He said "Oh yes. Just go into the restaurant and they have prepared sandwiches." Great...only they don't. The waitress said that the deli/coffee shop that makes them was closed that day "and I don't know why." There were no other places to get food...so back to the room. As I started to unpack and get set up for a meeting I decided to at least have a cup of coffee. No dice. When I went in to the bathroom to fill up the pot, it was obvious that it hadn't been cleaned well. There were used tissues on the floor and when I opened the coffee pot, there was a used coffee filter in the machine...yuck. Now, I'm 10min away from getting on a call and I have to switch rooms. The front desk was nice enough about it and got me a new room on the 9th floor. This room looked similar to other one in that it was pretty dated and roughed up. Chips on the desk, stains on the throw pillows and this time (although the coffee maker was clean) they didn't have any creamer. The downward trend continued in the fitness center when I had to try 3 treadmills before I got one that didn't randomly turn off. I love Westin, but this place has got to get their act together.The best thing about this place is the bar, that's it.  Mike the bartender really knows how to poor a drink.  And its a good thing b/c you will sleep horribly here. The beds were comfortable but the temperature control in the rooms was horrible.  The AC kept breaking/not working at all and they really did nothing to fix it.  Gym: Sucked, how hard is it to get good equipment? I find it crappy that you have to pay for the wifi and the wifi is really bad!It's a nice hotel, good layout, good food, friendly atmosphere. It is what you would expect out of any quality hotel. What really made this place stand out was the EXCELLENT customer service we received from Guest Service Jonathan Hayward. He solved our problems and truly made our stay here amazing. This guy was an all star of an employee. Thank you Jonathan!Let me just state the facts. There was A LOT wrong with this hotel so I will list them:Nice looking lobby, but the room they gave us looked nothing like the website. This hotel markets itself to meetings and weddings. They have put most of the money into their lobby area, and have ignored their rooms. Upon our arrival, There was a musty odor and dingy lighting.After traveling several thousand miles that day, we were looking forward to settling down, but we were greeted with mildew and sub-par air conditioning. Old uncomfortable furniture, a lousy bed that was not comfortable. The furniture is worn and amenities such as hangers and luggage valet are often missing.BROKEN HANDHELD BATHROOM MIRROR. BROKEN SHOWER HEADS and PIPES DISASSEMBLING from the wall. NO WATER PRESSURE. Poorly equipped fitness room & pool are TINY. The PHONE FOR RENTAL CAR SERVICE AT THE FRONT DESK DOES NOT WORK. IN-ROOM COFFEE MAKER DOES NOT WORK. COMFORTERS ARE DINGY YELLOW.The FOOD IS LOUSY. SERVER BROUGHT BURNED CHEESE BREAD to the table. Saw the COOK GO OUTSIDE and SMOKE while in uniform.I can't imagine anyone wanting to have an event at this horrid establishment. Needless to say, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again if they GAVE me a room for the night.What positive thing can we say about the experience? It's over! Oh, This was the WORST travel experience ever. EVER.I'm a frequent business traveler and have stayed here frequently. Never had a problem. Nice clean room, great service and very good food in the restaurant. I got a passcode for free wifi (perhaps due to my SPG membership). No complaints from me and I will stay here again.EDIT: They charged my card twice..so another star off for the inconvenience. I was in the area for a business trip. My coordinator helped booked this place because it was the closet to our venue. Good service, attentive staff. The rooms were a bit rustic and old though. You could see the stains on the toilet and showers, so one star off for that.Amenities:  I was a huge fan of their lotion, which I bought more of at their gift shop. Gym: The pool was tiny and looked nothing like their website. The gym was small as well, but enough to do a quick work out in. Service: The service was quiet and nice, they never bothered me. And whenever I needed something they were quick to deliver it. WIFI: There was no free wifi. One star off for that. Overall, nice staff, but I've been to better.This hotel was definitely mediocre. Not worth the nightly rate we paid. I guess it was cleaned ok but the heavenly bed didn't have crisp linens like I expected and was like any other beds I've stayed in. Nothing special. The bathroom needed some repair and just over all wasn't in great condition. The carpet had pink stains through out. The check in process was really easy so that was a perk. Since we only stayed for one night I don't have any input on the amenities. Parking was easy and location was convenient. Very close to everything.Many issues with this so called 4-star hotel1. Parking is ridiculous: parking is part of a 4 building  complex where they share a parking garage. There is no clear direction on any of the four entrances as to where to park for the hotel. I drove around for 15 minutes before happening upon the entrance. This is an awful first impression. Put some way finding signage on the street! Hello?2. The room cards have to be used to get up to your room which is no big deal if they worked without having to try them five times. Very annoying3. Internet is NOT FREE?!? What kind of hotel nowadays has the audacity to charge for Internet?? Are we back in the 90's? When asked to make this right if they wanted to keep my business they refused! Talk about lack of basic understanding of service philosophies with this decision. 4. No USB connections for powering your devices in the rooms. And no iPhone docking stations for your music. There are 3 star hotels that offer this! 5. In a absolutely dead area for decent restaurants or entertainment. Nothing worthwhile any where near the hotel. Unless you find Wendy's and Qdoba tolerable. You will have to drive 10-15 mins to find a decent restaurant Basic flaw here is that they believe they are a four star establishment. This rating carries with it certain expectations which start with a very user friendly guest experience at which they fail at on many levelsDo yourself a favor and drive the extra 10-15 mins and stay elsewhere 4 star rating that is a 2 star experience*** Solid accommodations, 12 floors, perfect for groups. ***Free weights in the gym, woo-hoo!  A pool and whirlpool too.I liked the amenities here.  Westin is a comfortable spot to be.Yet they actually still charge for wifi. (gasp)  No bueno in 2013.*** Westin is ideal for a large gathering, meetings, ballroom. ***They must have renovated the rooms, the staff and the kitchen because this place was top notch in all areas. Had one of the best yogurt parfaits of my life and everyone was super friendly despite the obvious drop in foot traffic in this area.The reason for the one star was, I went there with my boyfriend for a family memorial service in the area. Since it's a 4 star hotel we've decided to stay at this hotel. Our other families had also decided to stay at the same hotel. Once we got to our room everything was nicely placed except we found a big stain on our couch. So they were nice enough to exchange another couch for us hoping it would be a clean couch, which it turns out the second couch has a bigger stain. After all the time spent in the room waiting for them to come get the couch, remove the couch and place another couch. That's a whole day wasted in the hotel. Finally, we had decided to just live with the dirty couch since we have things to do and places to go. The manager, "Catherine" was nice enough to give us complimentary lunch for the inconvenience. Then on a different night, somehow I was sitting outside with my boyfriend enjoying the nature since we are not from Michigan. After we came back to the hotel room. We found out my boyfriend might have dropped his cellphone on the floor while heading back to the room. So I rush downstairs headed back to the area where we were sitting using a flashlight hoping to see if I can find the phone on the floor. A gentleman asked if I lost something, I said yes an iPhone. So he said he found a phone and handed to the valet. So I ran to the valet guy "Miguel" and asked him, he said he handed the phone to two girls that drove up to the hotel and Miguel asked if the phone belongs to them and they calm the phone was theirs. First of all, was he sure the phone belongs to the two girls? Did he even check to see if they even have the password to turn on the phone? Isn't this common sense for any security to check if an items belongs to someone? Or aren't they supposed to place a lost item in lost and found first for someone that actually lost an item to calm themselves instead of handing it to whoever shows up w/o calming a lost item? What's even more upsetting is I gave Miguel a number to call me if he see those girls again said he will call but never did. An hour or two later, I went downstairs to speak to Miguel, he said he saw those two girls but didn't have a chance to call me or stop them. I guess that's a lesson learn to be very careful with your belongings in this hotel because no one cares about your lost. In this situation, I felt that the staff are not trained well enough. In my conclusion, I feel this is a hotel I would not recommend anyone anymore and I will not feel comfortable staying there again.Flew to Detroit and stayed here 12/21/14 for business. The room was dated, worn, dirty with holes and rips in the carpet and furniture. The quality of the interior was more like a Travel Lodge Motel with cheap and broken IKEA semi-modern decor. The closet door was broken, there were stains on every piece of fabric from the shower curtain to the bedding. Needless to say, I slept 2 hours that night and had a 7:30am work meeting the next day. I've stayed at Westin's all over the country for business---- this location is such a disappointment. The service at check-in was rude and stand-offish. The woman behind the counter didn't even greet me, she just looked at me, rolled her eyes and just asked for ID and credit card. I've never experienced service like this at a Westin hotel. It seemed like she hated her job and/or she just didn't want to help me. Like a previous reviewer mentioned, the lobby is this hotel's best quality. The rooms are uncomfortable, disgusting and the service is far below standard for this hotel chain. The parking lot and garage are both filled with litter and broken glass. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. They could use help from Hotel Impossible!!I feel bad giving this Westin 1 star because the people I *talked to* while I was there were pleasant and nice. However, I would not be able to recommend this hotel to anyone, and I will certainly never stay there again. My husband and I arrived there late, checking in at around 2:00 a.m. When we walked into the room, there was a pile of pillows on the bed. A long decorative pillow and two regular pillows... except they didn't have pillowcases on. We thought it was weird, but the room seemed fine otherwise, so my husband called the desk and they brought 2 pillows with cases. We'd been driving for hours, and I fell asleep quickly. My husband was not so lucky. The men in the room next to us were shouting in their room until approximately 3:30, and the walls were so thin my husband could hear every word. He couldn't fall asleep until they shut up.In the morning, I got in the shower -- saw 2 little bottles there on the tub. Got in, got my hair wet, picked up the bottle I thought was shampoo, and it was body wash. Got out, looked around all over the place in the bathroom -- there was no shampoo. I'm standing there with wet hair, freezing, with no shampoo, so I yelled to my husband to call the desk. I got in the shower to stay warm. Stood there 10 minutes. No one came with shampoo. My husband called again. Stood there some more. While standing there I'm looking around, and there is a gross long brown hair sitting across the handicapped seat that is folded down over the tub. It obviously had not been cleaned. And people are expected to sit on that thing with their bare bum! There was another long brown hair stuck to the side of the shower wall. The tub obviously had not been cleaned since the last guest. How gross.When I called to tell the manager about this, I told her that my husband and I were concerned that the bed that we slept in hadn't even been clean. I mean, if housekeeping didn't clean the tub, didn't replenish supplies, and left unfinished pillows on the bed, what else did she just not bother to do? The manager was very apologetic and seemed pretty upset about it, and she offered to send breakfast to our room -- it wasn't her fault and she was trying, but by then we were so upset that all we wanted to do was get out of there and never go back.The bar inside the Westin is my go to spot when I come home. The food is really good and the drinks are so, so, STRONG and tasty, just the way I like it!. The BEST BARTENDER is Mike (Hi Mike, if you ever read this lol).In regards to the rooms they are decent. I decided one weekend while visiting home I needed some alone time away from home, crazy huh? The room was clean (I check everything, sheets, covers, under the bed, over the bed, top of the bed, wherever!) and the bed was very comfy, which is all I cared about. The only issue I had was parking in the garage and finding my way to get inside the actual hotel from the garage. But, that was me being absent minded :)Westin the star. I like this hotel chain so much because its very clean and comforting. The rooms are big and service is great. Westin hotel always smells very good from the time you enter the hotel until you leave. You literally smell so good even when you leave and I think it's their soap, shampoo etc. my favorites are the coral gables Florida location and Hollywood ft lauderdale ocean front location. Oh and don't forget to collect free stays at the Starwood preferred guest program it's free!Customer service rude. Carolyn informed me that I had to contact American Express to handle their problem for a wrongful charge. I called American express and they had no record of a debit submitted. Had to file a dispute with American Express. This was my third phone call to Westin.This place is all about yeah yeah we will do that for you but when it comes time to it they won't! I'm more than unhappy with my stay here, idk where to begin! I called three times prior to arriving to make sure I could have two cribs for my one year old twins, they said yes it would be no big deal. When we got there to check in we were told the cribs would get there in ten mins. We waited thirty mins no one showed up with a crib. We called the front desk they told us two cribs were a fire hazard, that was irritating but I thought whatever they can share. We waited another hour and the one crib still hadn't came, they ran out of cribs and we weren't getting any but they would call their manager to figure something out! I understand that they don't have to supply cribs but if you really don't have a lot to give out we would have brought our pack n plays and made other arrangements! They brought us a roll in bed like that would do the trick, you can't put year old babys on a twin bed!!!!! Other than the cribs situation the hotel is filthy, there was lipstick on the cups and very outdated.PROS:-looks nice from a distance-room service phone staff and delivery was friendly (plus my "Steak Frite" was delicious)CONS:-found a used cotton "q-tip" swab next to the plush "sitting chair".  What else do they not clean? gross.-the dust cover under the mattress was ripped and about 3 feet of it was lying between the double beds.  It's just not something you want to see when you walk into the room.-no free wi-fi.
