I've stayed in some no-frills hotels and still got free wi-fi from them.(they have ethernet cable access, but ipads and tablets don't have ethernet ports)I was disappointed. I've the SPG membership so when we went to Detroit for the auto show, it was easy for me to choose a westin hotel for the quality. Well, I was wrong in this one. First, the front desk who checked me in did not even ask me for my welcome gift choice for being an SPG gold member. Our room was dated. The bathroom was so dated it looked like an accessible bathroom. The pillows were long and tiny. They were uncomfortable for sure. The lamp on the right side of the bed wasn't working. To top it off, there was a strong wind gust at about 45 mph so power went out at 4 AM. My toddler was crying and it was difficult to change his diaper and prepare milk using your cellphone. When we were about to check out, I didn't get portfolio receipt under the door. So when I went to the front desk to get a copy, they gave me someone else's bill to mg horror. They missed the last number and unfortunately saw someone else's bill and contact info. I will never ever stay in this hotel ever again.Pet peeve - shower doesn't drain fast enough, you end up standing in water. Toilet flap was leaking an ran all night.Restraunt menu was limited. Concierge gave us a list of near by places to eat, first four were all shut down.No free wifi....NO FREE WIFI... NO!!!FREE!!!WIFI!!!!  How do you do, no free wifi? Seriously?
review_content_40: We stayed here with our hockey team for a tournament. Any hockey team puts a strain on the hotel and its staff. They were extremely patient and professional with us. With scuffed walls and banged up doors, the hotel is in need of an update.I am with the Dean Graziosi real estate events and we had an event in this hotel.The staff was very helpful the screen was wonderful. They provided pens and pads for our students and the staff helped us with anything we needed. Very impressed with this place.Paper thin walls. You can hear every conversation on either side of you and above you. Horrible location. I have platinum and ambassador status with spg and never once have I been upgraded at this hotelThis Westin is just OK. No concierge lounge, but they do have free parking. The air conditioning in the room was loud, and the toilet broke during the stay. Also, the power outlet by the bed didn't work. The breakfast buffet was so-so. Most important tip- Ask for a room away from the freeway, it's loud.Ummmmmmm 4 star? Not so much. Peeling paint and wallpaper. Gross gooey ceilings. Moldy caulk in shower.had to stay here for a business trip, Nice hotel. Good location. As always Westin has great beds. great nights sleep. If your staying at this hotel you will need a car to get around. Not a lot within walking dist. If your looking for a good place to eat. I headed up to Maple and Telegraph. Its called Andiamo"s the food was fantastic. Its a must. they also have food on site. I have eaten here a lot and they have a great menu. Perfect place in the Detroit areaRestaurant on the main level had really bad service during breakfast. The $16 breakfast buffet is on par with the free breakfasts you get at chain motels - definitely not worth it. Room and hallway smelled like weed, so to resolve the issue, they pumped a citrus smelling chemical air freshener through the ventilation system. Shower drain was backed up and slow to drain, making a luke warm pool to stand in during my shower. Internet wouldn't connect on my iPad, so they sent the maintenance guy up. He acted like he'd never seen an apple product before... Had no idea what he was doing. So he called internet tech support from my hotel room phone, and left me to talk to them. Upon checkout, I found that I was charged an absurd $2 connection fee for making a phone call from my room - the phone call the maintenance guy made.Won't go back. Won't recommend.This hotel has seen better days. I am an SPG member and stay in a bunch of different properties, so I am comparing to those. While nothing is soooo bad that I would leave there are a lot of things that could easily change to make things better. For example, the hallway has stains all over the carpet, my bathtub doesn't drain if you use the "heavenly" shower (they fixed it once, still didn't work), the pillows were that older, yellow-ish color. Also, paid wifi still exists? Again, nothing terrible, but probably not going to be my first choice.I thought westin stood for quality but I guess it stands for "as much mediocrity as the paying customers will bear". The coffee shop isn't open on Saturday. I was informed I could get coffee in their grossly over priced mediocre restaraunt, but figuring it was probably $6 a cup, I declined. Water is lukewarm at best in the shower along with no ventilation fan, so the mirrors all fog. Wifi? Yes we have it, for another 5-10 dollars that is. Heck motel6 has free wifi! Some kind of voodoo is required to get the room key to work as well. Both in the door and the elevator. I have stayed in hotels that cost half as much and had the same or better amenities. Judging from the other reviews and westins copy and paste reply, nothing much will change here. Stay well!I'm very fussy about where I lay my head, and this occasion was a weekend getaway/family visit. I absolutely LOVED it at the Westin. The hotel is beautiful, and the staff was friendly and courteous. The bed was amazing. Best I've slept in a long time! Loved the double shower head in the bathroom, and the white tea scented products. The fitness room, albeit a little warm, was well equipped. I will definitely return the next time I'm visiting my hometown!This is a somewhat newer Westin which usually means an instant 4 star review. However, that's not the case here. Here are the highlights:- mediocre service except for maintenance (which begs the quesiton, why did you have to call maintenance)- gym is tiny by Westin standards...as if there's a shortage of space in the suburbs- Heavenly Bed that was closer to purgatoryOne highlight for the biz travelers out there is solid wireless in the room: 3.71 Mb/s down speedtest.net/result/129...Overall - mehI've stayed in a lot of Westin hotels and this is not up to Westin standards. One of the great things about this chain is how consistent they are from property to property. My room here felt old, most of the outlets didn't work to power my Mac and the restaurant is abysmal. It feels grungy and the breakfast buffet looked unkempt enough that it scared me away (and that's unusual for me). The location is not great primarily because there really are no other restaurant choices around that area. I also couldn't connect to their wifi through Safari but could through Firefox. Weird. This reminded me of a Radisson more than a Westin.SPG Platinum member who thinks this hotel meets normal Westin standards. Good looking hotel on the outside, nice lobby, clean, well-kept, bar and restaurant look good, and the rooms are up to snuff. Free parking via the garage with an attached walkway. Got a room on a high floor away from street, and the room looks good. Not sure how to reconcile that with the other reviews of old, dated rooms.Downsides include no concierge lounge and a minimal amount of restaurants I'd feel comfortable eating at in the area. Another reviewer says there are lots of restaurants nearby, but a) none are in walking distance, and b) even with my poor eating habits I don't view Qdoba, Wingstop or Uncle Joe's Chicken Fingers as good options.Second time staying here, and both times the hotel seemed empty. Maybe it's just me...I've stayed at this Westin a couple of times. I snagged the rooms here for around $75 via Hotwire and Priceline, so the value was great, especiall since parking is free out here. Located in the clean, safe and well-kept business district of Southfield - this hotel is very accessible to all the highways and is a short drive down The Lodge (M-10) to Detroit. It's also near 696 and is very equidistant to almost all areas of metro Detroit.The building looks very modern from the outside. It's truly a gem on the inside as well. Overall the lobby is very classy and business trendy. The rooms have some of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept on. They are kept very clean and equipped with a roomy, glossy bathroom - as well as a darn big LCD widescreen TV. This is truly a 3.5 to 4.0 star hotel. I had a drink at the bar in the lobby with an old friend, and the service and pricing was very reasonable.Overall, this is a great hotel for the price, especially when locked in via Hotwire or Priceline. Parking is free, service is up to par, the whole building is gorgeous inside and out, and there is even hand sanitizer at the front desk, haha. They are also very kind to late checkouts at 1PM, which guys like me who party hard on Saturday nights can appreciate on a detox Sunday afternoon. If you want to be in a central location in metro Detroit while being in the suburbs, and want to have a short drive to downtown, the airport, Dearborn, the east suburbs, Troy, Royal Oak, west suburbs, etc. - this this Southfield location will very much please you. Restaurants in the immediate area are awesome too. I highly recommend "Beans & Cornbread," the soulfood bistro nearby.I'm not a traditional type of girl. I would be more likely to throw a wedding in a field (which we did) than a hotel.That being said, the Westin Southfield is a beautiful spot for a wedding. Our friends got married here a few weeks back and it was very well done. The atrium was gorgeous, the food was nom worthy and the staff was really nice.The hotel itself was nice, as well. It seems like a decent place to stay in the metro-Detroit area. I was NOT a fan of the $12 glass of wine pre-ceremony, though. It was a little much for what I got, but what can you do? You're a captive audience at that point.This won't be long. When I was in my LDR, this was my hotel of choice, for several reasons:1. It's the Westin--who wouldn't want to stay here?2. The price...there's a cheaper way in!3. The location--it's easily accessible, and pretty close to a lot of key areas of the metro Detroit area4. Parking is free AND covered.5. Free wi-fi...which is a luxury all on its own lolIt's a beautiful hotel, and you can get great deals on it periodically on those bidding sites. I've never eaten here, so i can't vouch for that. I usually don't go to hotels to eat...lol I don't think you can go wrong! But that's just me. =)Paid for wifi that barely works. Writing this review from my mobile because the Internet keeps cutting out.While the staff was courteous and nice, this is probably the most disappointing SPG hotel I have stayed in.This is a beautiful hotel in the heart of it all. Perfect place for a wedding, as they have a gorgeous courtyard that makes you feel like you're outside without worrying what the weather will be. The dining halls are gorgeous and the rooms are so comfy! This hotel lives up to the Westin brand name.I've stayed at Westin Hotels around the world. The one in Detroit is a great value for the service and amenities. Quite cheap for a Westin. (I paid around $100 per night. Can't beat that!)The staff are amazingly nice. On one day, I was on my way out when one of the employees wished me "an amazing day." Wow. And that's not an exception. Everyone at the hotel is polite, they acknowledge you every time, and are genuinely friendly. Service is top-notch too. They are fast to greet you at the check-in counter or the restaurant. They are efficient yet friendly in fulfilling your needs. And since it's a Westin, the hotel rooms are comfortable, classy, and filled with nice shampoos and soaps. You even get an iron and board so you don't have to ask. Lighting is dim outside the bathroom, but since I didn't stay much in the room, that's not a drawback. The lamps have outlets on their base so you never have to stoop to plug in your laptop or phone; a convenient touch.The breakfast buffet was the let-down. Not bad, but the floor was sticky. Gross. I tried it once, then stuck with the menu items after that. Since the hotel has some delicious entrees with just the right portion amount, you're best to stick with the menu. I ordered an egg-whites only omelet with broccoli and cheese; very tasty! It came with a side of hash browns that were perfect; not greasy, and crisp on the outside, soft on the inside. Good stuff.The hotel is centrally located to surrounding neighborhoods. That's great except these neighborhoods are all a 15-20 minute car ride away. Unfortunately, this Westin is smack in the middle of a business park. The hotel is quick to get you a car, but you're best served by getting a rental if you stay here. (Unless you're on a business trip and the company's paying for your cab! I have to say, every cab driver I had in Detroit were friendly, great to talk to, and honest). There are some places in walking distance, but all are of the fast food / diner variety.Place has a gym and wi fi, and adjacent buildings in the business park are connected, so you never have to step outside if you're going to one of the nearby offices. This is a plus when you're talking Detroit with it's rain and snow.Overall, you can't beat the place given that most Westin Hotels are $300+ a night, and the great service. They even comp you $5 if you choose not to change your linens each night you stay. Pretty cool, and good for the environment too.Parking: Free and they have a garage which is wonderful in the winterElevators: super slow. They would generally only run 2 at a time, which meant tons of standing around.Food: The food was good the first couple of times I had it, but the selection is fairly limited and by my 4th week of staying there, I was pretty sick of it. Rooms: Comfy beds and clean facilities. Everything you should expect from a Westin. The King and Queen sized rooms both have enough space to allow for a workout in your room. Gym: Tiny. 5 treadmills, a stairmaster, and an elliptical for cardio machines. Some free weights and a bowflex. Definitively useable, but its also right next to the pool meaning that the air is super humid and warmer than normal. Definitively a no-no for me. Staff: professional and courteous. TLDR: If you're in the area and are concerned about travel time this is a great hotel to stay at. If you are willing to drive 15 more minutes the Book Cadillac in downtown is fabulous
review_content_60: This is my hotel of choice when on shopping trips around the Troy region. Simple reasons:- Accommodate dogs at no additional charge.- Solid breakfast selection and hospitality at Tango restaurant (within hotel)- Modern & Immaculate rooms.- Quality service throughout the hotel.- Starbucks coffee in rooms.There are decent options for fast food and convenient stores nearby. Having said that, the hotel itself is located in an odd, yet safe mixture of townhomes and commercial buildings. Granted, the front desk could use refresher training in customer service and hospitality as they're a little icy, but I don't spend more than 3 minutes checking in, anyway.As a Gold Starwood member, and someone who goes out of their way to stay at Starwood...this hotel is a big disappointment.   I was on the Preferred guest floor and my room didn't have hot water, and there was a pile of cigarette ashes in front of the window, left from a previous guest.  There was a huge hole in the drywall where the bathroom door handle had smashed through it.   The cleaning staff was singing while cleaning, so loud it interfered with a conference call. The restaurant is decent, as is the gym, and parking is free.I stayed here this past Saturday as a surprise from the Mr. for our anniversary.  They have a special package that comes with chocolate covered strawberries, champagne, and late check out (4 PM).  We stayed on the tenth floor and needless to say I can't mention too much about what the hotel offers!But as far the actual room, they have a collection called Heavenly, the bed and pillows felt as if they were made just for me.  We noticed that you can actually purchase the mattress, box springs and sheets,etc for a very reasonable price.  Ummmmmm  no, not used!  lol.  They have a booklet that highlights their collection for the public.  They have a nonsmoking policy in the entire hotel, which I was shocked to discover.   Their gimmick is "be well" or some jargon of the sort, but they promote physical and mental well being so smoky halls don't fit in with that I suppose.The only downside was the breakfast buffet at their restaurant Tango.  It was ok, just basic stuff that we cook at home.  It would have been nice to see some more unique options.  It was picked over, but Late and Later didn't get down there until 30 minutes before breakfast ended, and I never like to go anywhere when they are wrapping up. One highlight was curdled cream!  It was like they just went up to a cow, made her happy and brought the clumps straight to us! gross me out!  They replaced it expeditiously and discovered that they had 3 cases gone bad, but that should have been discovered before it came to our table.Overall, I recommend the hotel for locals looking to get away, or out of towners visiting.This is my go to hotel when I visit Southfield due to its proximity to our office.  I have no major complaints about the place.  The staff is always super friendly and the beds and showers are nice.  I knocked off one star on this review for the following:  Gym - given the size of this hotel, the gym needs to be larger and should offer more machines.Room Service - while the food tasted fine, everytime I ordered, they forgot something!!  Nothing like waiting for someone to run and find the correct item you orderedMenu - I have been coming here for almost 5 years, it is time for them to revamp their menu.  I appreciate the healthier options but the choices are limitedStayed here for three nights this week. The pros: Very conveniently located between all my meetings in the greater Detroit area. Easy to access and to park at. The staff is very friendly. The bed is incredibly comfortable. The bar serves a good Malbec. Poached eggs were good on the room service breakfast. The workout room was serviceable if a bit warm.The consMy room was verging on shabby. It was the Starwood Preferred Guest floor! The lampshades were stained. The in room dining book was falling apart and written on by previous guests. There was a handle missing from one of the drawers, a light bulb out in the bathroom and the wood surfaces were scratched. I could not figure out the wireless so did all my work on my cellular plan. The magnifying free standing mirror in the bathroom had a missing screw which meant I couldn't orient it properly .Being on business, i didn't have time to report or deal with the issues and they really didn't impact my stay - apart from the dim light in the bathroom. Having a Starbucks with bagels available in the lobby saved time and money on breakfast and the nearby restaurants - especially the kabob restaurant - were cheaper and nicer than Tango's. In summary - this hotel is serviceable for the business traveller not looking to spend much time in their room. It may not suit the vacation traveller.A very nice hotel with extremely helpful staff. The rooms are clean, new-age and spacious. Then only downside is that the restaurant is not that good. There breakfast and lunch selection is pricey and limited. Dinner and dessert is better. Ask the bellhop to point you in the direction of a restaurant to please your appetite and I bet you will be quite satisfied!I've stayed at this Westin a couple of times and I've always had a good experience. The staff/service is great, always helpful! The rooms are super spacious, always clean, and big flat screen TV is a plus! This location is particularly unique because it's attached to an office building so there's lots of restaurants, a gym, coffee shop all under one roof. Tango's is the restaurant on the first floor associated with Westin. I went there for a business dinner one night. Their fried macaroni is AMAZING as are their hot wings! Don't let the dim lights and mature crowd fool you, the place really isn't that expensive, and they have a good happy hour!Want a botanical wedding in the middle of January? There's a beautiful indoor garden atrium, with a huge glass wall, letting in all that sunlight. I've attended a couple weddings here too, and they have a big ballroom where you can have your reception.I would definitely recommend you stay here for any occasion!The beds here are soooooooo comfy!!  The blanket, the pillow, the mattress... mmmmmm.... I just want to go back and get swallowed up by the soft coziness!  The beds were so comfy, in fact, that I had trouble dragging myself up in the mornings.The rooms were well-kept/clean (and smelled really good!), the showers come with dual shower heads which I've never had before (I had fun playing around with them =P), they have a decently stocked gym, and they did a good job decorating for Christmas =)I just had a great customer service experience with a reservation problem.  Thanks!Here for work.  The Detroit office is in the next building, so it couldn't be more convenient.   Rooms are clean and attractive.  Awesome shower and comfy beds.  I just can't believe they charge for wifi / internet.   I've been in hotels half the price with free internetI stayed here for several nights over the holidays while back home to visit family. Since I love the Westin at DTW, I thought I'd be thrilled with this location as well. When I walk in to a place I feel the vibe, and what I felt here was not entirely positive. Nothing bad happened, but the place is not well lit, and my room was dark; that in addition to not feeling entirely at ease here, did not make for the most relaxing stay. Services were reduced or eliminated due to the holiday week, and they were only 20% full due to that. The bathroom had an odd smell to it, and though the room was fine overall, it was just an OK stay. I had some of the their food and oatmeal was very tasty (believe me, my oatmeal at home can't compare to their oatmeal); the shrimp with pasta and avocado is really tasty. Good service, just an off vibe.I love it here and stay at this location 5-6 times per year. I always get a nice, fluffy bed with lots of pillows and fresh linens, and the front desk staff is always happy to see me. Tangos is gross, but who cares, you're in Southfield. There are lots of restaurants nearby. Potbelly's down the street delivers, as well as Jimmy John's across the street.One of the nicer hotels I've stayed at in the area. The company I work for was hosting a conference for a couple of days and we did the entire package with Westin. Rooms were great! Nice, clean, and BIG. I checked in at night, so the room was pretty dark, and the light switch by the door only turned on a light by the door and then I had to hunt around in the dark for another light switch, which there wasn't one! The rest of the room lights were connected to lamps. What could improve? The conference food was terrible. Just bland, no taste, and gross. Skipping dinner tonight and hitting a chain because I just can't bear to eat anymore of it. Also, the parking garage is a mess! Things are roped off and all, the angles and signage is terrible.Heavenly Bed. Heavenly Food. Heavenly Service. I was in the Detroit area for a funeral so my stay at the Westin was pleasurably despite seeing my family during a sad occasion. Using my Star Friend discount was helpful for this last minute trip. The best part--the food-- green tea salmon, calamari with an olive sauce, and the berries and cream for dessert.  Delightful.We had a horrible experience. When we checked in they did not have us in the computer at all and insisted we were at the wrong place, even though I had my confirmation e-mail stating I was at the right location. They finally found it and after rude service we were checked in. Our room was supposed to be a larger room and when we checked in it was standard, so the manager moved us to a "larger" room (so she said), yet when we got there it was the SAME EXACT ROOM!! So we stayed in the original room.Room was NOT CLEAN at all, definitely not up to Westin Standards. Hair on the floor and stains on the sheets. Since it is winter we did not have control of the temperature in our room so the room was WAY TOO HOT!! We slept horribly because of it and also because the pillows are so old and flat that it feels like no pillow at all. About the pet policy, it is horrible and rediculous. You are allowed to bring pets but you can not leave them in the room alone AT ALL!! They did not tell us this when we booked the room. It does not even make sense..how do you go to breakfast or go do activities? Also, the elevators suck and you have to use a key every time you get in which is super inconvenient. Lastly, the pool and hot tub suck. It is so warm and muggy in the area we could barely breathe. The pool is only 3 feet deep and really small, so there is not much room for much of anything. It is also really hot in the pool.One more thing..whoever said something about fried macaroni is incorrect because they do not even serve those here. You can find a way better hotel for your money! Dont stay here! PS. I payed $15 extra for internet, and while I was writing this review it went out again.If you're used to frequenting SPG properties, this one is average compared to most that I've stayed in.  Definitely not the nicest Westin that I've stayed in, but it's a Westin and I have to stay in a hotel every week, so I'll take what I can get.  They have the heavenly bed and bath, but the hotel just seems a little dated (slow elevators almost make me want to give 3 stars, but the service that we've received makes this a 4 star hotel).    The workout room is decent, small but the equipment has built in tvs, so that's not so bad.The rooms are fine, nothing fantastic.  Definitely good enough for me to stay in every week and, as I said before, the staff is really nice.  This hotel is a solid 3.5 always, a 4 sometimes :)This place is fine.  If I weren't here on a ridiculously unnecessary business trip, I might have given this place 4 stars.  The service is good, the food is so-so but they do everything with a smile on their face.  Expensive for Detroit?  I would say so.  I wanted a beer after dinner so I ordered one - $15 for a Bass!  Ha ha...good thing I wasn't paying but come on.  Anyway, for room service there are massive charges that  if you there on business you could care less about but if it's your own wallet, beware!!I actually stayed at the Westin Southfield for a 3 day conference my company was sponsoring even though I lived 3 miles away. I wasn't complaining. It gave the chance to check out the place for free. I was satisfied with my overall stay. The gym facility served my purpose, the service from everyone was awesome and all 3 of my daily meals were cool.I especially like the restaurant/bar that is in the hotel. Since my visit to the hotel I frequently visit the restaurant/bar when I don't feel like being in crowded places. This hotel isn't as updated as the one I stayed in while in Chicago but hey no complaints from me.I have stayed here a couple of weeks and have had no problems at all. The staff is very friendly and I love the fact they had Michigan apples available at the front desk,  yumm. The only bad thing I can think of is the darn parking garage and the fact I can never seem to find the exit...I hate that.I just spend the weekend here with my boyfriend.  We were in town for the NCAA Midwest Regionals in Detroit (Go KU).  I LOVE Westins and this one didn't disappoint.  The beds are amazing... and I dream of the duel shower heads.  Flat screen tv's.  Mini-bar :)Kinda lame that they don't have wireless in the hotel and they charge $14 for internet access through the cable in the room.  They do have a community computer in the lobby though.  They were under renovation while we were there so the pool was closed as well as the gym.  However, I proudly squeezed in a work out (eats in Detroit are NOT healthy).  They moved all the aerobic machines into 3 guest rooms.  Slightly odd but it worked.  Really enjoyed my stay and if I ever come back to Detroit I'll definitely stay here.
review_content_80: The room is spacious,very  comfortable and clean. The business center has computers, wi-fi connection and state of art color printer/copier. Besides pool & jacuzzi, the gym has all the standard gym equipments plus more. Most of them are the newest model, which I was a bit surprised since most hotel don't update their gym equipments.But the most impressive part was the customer service. The manager there, Pam really stands for what customer service is all about.. She was courtesy, understanding and with compassion.Growing up in Downriver Detroit, Southfield was just the other end of the Southfield freeway from me and the Town Center was where most of the big companies had their offices, before cities like Troy and Auburn Hills took that over.  The Westin dates from that time period architecturally, and while it's been remodeled, you can tell that this is a franchise hotel.  While the amenities are all the ones that you expect from a corporately owned Westin, the bed's not the same Heavenly Bed.  The signage, not the same.  It's like the parallel reality Westin.  However, good things are ability to park and how quiet the hotel really is.  My first choice for when I visit home is the Westin at the Detroit Airport, but, this will do, especially with a weekend rate of $80 a night.I like the bed and dual shower head.  The staff are generally friendly and helpful.  The restaurant and bar leave something to be desired though.  I especially dislike the layout of and lack of modern televisions in the bar.I arrived at the Westin Southfield at 2am during a blizzard.  The combination of a desk clerk that seemed genuinely glad to see me and greeted me with such warmth was so great after a wildly stressful drive across town in a whiteout.The beds (Westin Heaven Bed) was fantastic.  It is also dangerous for the business traveler as I was really reluctant to leave it in the morning to drive across town for a meeting.If you can get this place on Hotwire for a deal and (hotel with a golf course) it is worth it.Stayed there while on business trip in Detroit.  I was told later by a friend who lives in Michigan that Southfield is not the safest neighborhood.  This is an older hotel -- simply judging it based on the age of the elevators.  Staff is nice and helpful.  I was super sick while I was there, and the valet parking guy actually offered to get me medicine from Walgreens.  Of course we gave him a nice tip for that.  I got room service basically 3 out of the 5 nights I was there, and the Filet Mignon was really good (at least for hotel food).  I ate at the bar one night also, the shrimp cocktail was decent.  The only complain I  have with Westin is that I don't know why they don't support wireless...instead, I had to plug my laptop in to get internet connection.this really isn't that good of a hotel... although, i have def seen much worse. that said, i'd like to give it 2.5 stars, but because the floors aren't level and the carpet looks worn down, i can't give it more than 2 stars. =()

hotel_name: Detroit Marriott at the Renaissance Center
review_content: This hotel could be great if more attention was paid to the details.  Architecturally, the hotel is a magnificent building but the structure design certainly shows its age.  The view made for an amazing morning view watching the sun rise over the city of Windsor. Complaints include missing bell hops during check in, broken appliances in the room, "fresh linens" that still had wine stains in them, and waiters who would rather wait until the next presidential election to check on our table.  Would I stay there again? Probably, but it's unlikely it will be my first choice next time I visit Detroit.*** UPDATE to comment below from manager.I called and left a long detailed message with a representative at Marriott Customer Relations about my experience on 11/25.  Having not had a phone call back, I called again on 12/1 to ask what the heck is going on.  They told me that they could still see my comment in the system and that to wait a few more days and they were sure a manager would get back to me from your hotel.  It is now 12/3, and you guys have responded on Yelp asking me to email in describing my experience and my contact info.  Further frustrations...______________________________________________________Really not what you would expect from a Marriott at all.  Huge beautiful building that seems to be deteriorating quickly.When we arrived the entire building had no water.  Couldn't use the sink, shower, or flush the toilets.  Once water came on again, our shower drain was completely clogged.  This was the 1st of 3 times we needed a maintenance man to come to our room.  He opened up the drain and pulled out about 5 years of other peoples hair and nastiness.Our keys stopped working multiple times a day for our room.  Probably had them reprogrammed 20x in 5 days.Our heater stopped working (wouldn't turn off no matter what... blasting hot air even set at 65 degrees,  This was maintenance guy #2).  I called at midnight asking for blankets... two hours later at 2 am I called again asking where they were.  She said she 'sees me in the system and I will have them in an hour'.  I asked her, 'Are you trying to tell me I am not allowed to sleep warmly in your hotel until 3am???"  They got them up pretty quickly after that.Our bathroom door needed to be oiled so bad that everytime someone opened it in the night it woke up everyone else in the room.  This was maintenance guy #3.  The staff was incredibly edgy, and at times down right rude.  Maybe this is a DETROIT thing that I am not used to, BUT IT SURELY ISN'T WHAT i EXPECT AT MARRIOTTS.  I will say the staff got nicer as the week progressed but the first few days they were really bad.  They had the entire Raider's football team in and a Men's Wearhouse Corporate Party... maybe they were over whelmed.The business center.  LOL.  Good luck in there.  Will cost you $30 to get anything done, the printer was broken, and the machinery archaic.  I thought this place was new?Good luck getting coffee in your room.  The cleaning ladies didn't have any.Oh and good luck getting your room cleaned.  We only wanted our room cleaned once in the five days we stayed.  Finally at 3pm we called to ask where someone was?  A woman finally came at 4 to clean our room, only to announce that our room isn't actually in her section and she would send the other girl.  Had to wait one more hour for the other girl.What the F are we paying for here?  You pay a serious premium at Marriott.  Albeit cleaner than a Motel 6, but sheesh.  I expect so much more.Still waiting to hear from hotel manager to see how they are going to 'make it better'.I've stayed at the Detroit Marriott RenCen three times in the past month, and each time was an overall positive and comfortable experience. The entrance to the hotel has security so I've always felt safe here. Check-in is easy, but there usually only seems to be one employee manning the front desk which makes check-in take longer than if there were multiple concierge clerks. The location is near so much stuff including the Greektown Casino, and the area seems safe to walk around during the day.Each room I've been in has been spotlessly clean and comfortable. Staying on the tower levels, I've been in rooms that had amazing views of Canada or downtown Detroit. Buying wi-fi is also easy. One of the best things I can say about this hotel is that whenever I've ordered room service the employee over the phone has told me my food will be there in 45 minutes and the food has always come in about half that time. The turkey burger is very filling and comes with chips.Besides the concierge seeming understaffed at times, another downside is that the hours of other places in the RenCen seem inconsistent. I went to the Starbucks one day around noon and they were already closed. The gift shop at the Marriott is great- with many snacks and tourist gifts, but also frequently closed at odd times. The Marriott does have a restaurant bar across from the front desk (named Volt-only in Detroit!) that is open for most of the day, and has good food (the breakfast buffet is solid).I enjoyed my overnight stay at the Marriott RenCen.  The bed was comfortable and the entire room was clean.  We had a great view of the night lights from our #5509 room.  First time staying there and yes I did feel it was worth the money I spent booking through Priceline.  Only complaint was the linen, wash clothes, and towels looked old or should I say "dingy".  However, as long as they were washed with bleach and hot water, I should be safe.  The bathroom was clean and decent for its purposes.  One could tell there is gradual renovations happening so I'll pardon the out-dated decor in the halls.  Valet was busy but I had to be mindful that it was check-out time and everyone was leaving at once.  Overall, pleasurable stay and would stay again.Don't stay here if you can help it. So I arrived to the hotel Valentines Day weekend. Had my babes taken by the bellhop and my car by the valet. I headed up to check in and that went  smoothly. Madash was friendly and knowledgeable and was probably the only good part of my stay. I told her I was in a hurry and she said my bags would be right up. I went up to my room and waited for my bags. 5 minutes went by and I called down to see where my bags were. I was told they would be right up. 20 minutes later with no bags i got a call from a bellhop telling me he was on his way up with them. After another 10 minutes I finally got my bags. 30 minutes to get bags up to my room? I could have just brought them up myself. Then when I did receive them, the gift bag I had packed looked like it had been gone through. Everything was still there so I didn't make a big deal of it. I then left the hotel to pick up my fiance from the airport. When we got back to the hotel we decided to order the champagne that came with the room package. It was 4:30pm and I was told by guest services that room service didn't start until 5pm but I could probably get it before then. I said ok. We waited an hour with no champagne and then started drinking the drinks I brought with me to the hotel. At about 7:30 with no champagne I called guest services to cancel the champagne and take it off my bill. They complied. 5 minutes later theres a knock on my door and room service has champagne and glasses. I refused the champagne as we had a standing reservation at Andiamo's for 8pm. Just ridiculous. So you bring my champagne 3 hours later? What kind of shotty operation is this? So after we return from dinner, I checked out the bathroom and was disgusted to say the least. Mildew in the shower, dirt near the corners of the tub, signs of mold and mildew on the light fixture. Then I came out and inspected the rest of the room. There were stains on the sheets, the remote control  had to be wiped down with disinfectant wipes. It was not the most romantic night. The next morning I went down and spoke with Charming at the from desk and told her about my experience. She told me she would apply a $40 credit to my account for the champagne issue. What about the rest? I want my entire stay to be comped. To add insult to injury, I checked my checking account, no credit. I was charged for the full amount. I will not be staying here ever again and I will definitely spread the word to my friends. If you are looking for a less that satisfactory experience then this is the place for you.UPDATE 2/19The hotel did in fact give me a credit. And offered 5000 reward points. I scoffed at the offer. 5000 points for a ruined Valentine's Day experience. No deal! Still waiting to hear back from the hotel.To say that this hotel has seen better days is pretty generous. I'm generally a fan of Marriott branded properties, but this is not one of them.When I arrived, the check-in desk was woefully short staffed. With a line snaking through the lobby back to the elevators, more than half of the check-in terminals were unstaffed. I almost burst into laughter when the person eventually checking me in casually asked "did you experience any travel delays on your way in?" (I hadn't until I arrived in that line). The guest rooms were definitely not up to what I would consider Marriott standards. Doors creaked, walls were banged up, sheets were not pressed, and the toilet needed to be flushed more than once to get everything down. Worst was that the room was not especially clean. The area near the windows were dirty and dusty. The area behind the bed hadn't been cleaned in who knows how long. I thought about going back down and asking for another room, but then I remembered that ridiculous line, plus who knows that any other room would have been any better?Below average Marriott with relatively low rates. You get what you pay for in this case.Great place to stay! Everything you need is right here. The people mover takes you all around the city and its only 75 cents. The rooms are a little dated. There's a Starbucks, CVS, large bar, and AMAZING views. The only thing is accessing the second floor to get to the people mover. A sweet worker named Anna took us to almost every elevator until we could find it since we had a friend that is handicapped. If we didn't have Anna that went the extra mile for us, we would've never found it! (It's by the Verizon store and Detroit police station on the 1st floor)I was debating between 3 and 4 stars and I'll get to why I rounded down at the end. Pros:  Nice size room.  Bed was really comfortable and good size TV.  Location was great as well.  You are right off the Detroit River and it's plenty of places along the boardwalk to eat and do.  It's a conference center hotel so it's extremely large.Cons: Check-in absolutely sucks.  I've never stood in line for 45 minutes waiting to check-in a hotel.  And there were only 6 people in the line.  The reps just took their time with checking ppl in and then going back and forth from the back in between check-ins while ppl were standing in line.  Not a good start.While it was great to be next to the Detroit River, my view was a small opening of it and an empty, vacant room that was under construction.  Looked like an abandoned building.  I get it may be under construction but not pleasant to see when you wake up everyday.  Bathroom was a little run down.  Towels were old.  The saving grace was the shower but that's about it. Usually I would say 3.5 stars but then I saw the most absurd thing I've ever seen at a hotel.  A $45 AUTHORIZATION CHARGE TO USE THE PRINTER DOWNSTAIRS.  Yes, every time you swipe your card to print something or look up something on the Internet, a $45 hold is placed on your card EVERY TIME.  Who is printing out that much stuff to secure 45 dollars?  I printed Erykah Badu tickets not the Bible.  Ridiculous.Stayed here on a Saturday night as we were attending the MoPop festival. I've been to this hotel many times and I knew it was going to be busy, it always is. However upon walking in to check in the line was so long it went all the way down the hallway. It took AN HOUR to check into our hotel room and when I walked up to be check in I received no apology for the long wait. Not to mention there were SEVEN people checking in guests! I don't understand how it took so long considering it took me about 2 minutes. The line should have been moving much faster, and they staff should have been so sorry for the long wait. The room was clean, and nice and we were give a really nice view...points for that. We didn't spend much time in the room so when we came back to crash I noticed that they only gave us 2 pillows on each bed...which seems weird as normally they will give you 4 pillows on each bed. A few of us wanted extra pillows so I called hospitality and asked if I could have 3 pillows brought up to our room...she said "I don't know if I have 3, but I"ll bring you 2" Fine....ok...whatever. About 45 minutes go back and still no pillows, so I call again and I was told that there was a lot of request in front of me and the runner would be there as soon as possible. Ok. Well another hour goes by and still no one came to bring us our pillows. At this point I was SO tired I didn't even care to call back. I don't think I'll stay here again, you can't beat the location but I'd be willing to stay somewhere else for a nicer experience.I stayed at this hotel while visiting a good friend in Detroit for her wedding. Overall, I'd say that this hotel was very accommodating and clean. It was very interesting having GM cars line the bottom floor. The room was clean and spacious and the view was outstanding. We were on the 60th floor and looked straight into Canada. I was a little disappointed there was no fridge, but I don't consider that to be a big deal. What knocks this hotel off down several stars is the so-called valet service. They handed me a valet ticket that had three options for car-retrieval. Option 1 - there was a number I could text that alerts the front desk in advance that I want my car. This number was blacked out in permanent marker. Option 2 - there was a number I could call that would alert the front desk in advance that I want my car. That number was also blacked out in permanent marker so I couldn't read it. What is going on? Finally, I could scan a QR code to alert the front desk in advance that I wanted my car. To no surprise, that code didn't work. Ergo, I had to go to the front desk to tell them I want my car. Of course, this is fine. I asked them why the ticket was blacked out and why the code didn't work. They simply shrugged their shoulders and "I don't know, it doesn't work." Okay...so 45 minutes later the car FINALLY pulls up. The valet is quite rude and rushing us....and when he realized that I wasn't going to leave a tip due to extremely sub-average service, he became almost hostile. The hotel is nice but you have to get your Valet service act together. The lack of professionalism and working product is a substantial knock on the overall experience.I cannot say it enough ... FAIL. FAIL.  FAIL. Oh the staff try and they are all super nice. ...kudos to manager of the restaurant deserves a medal.  She had several hundred angry ( I can't get a room) people descend on her restaurant and she managed beautifully.  The food was only ok ...but every waiter and bartender was on point.  Further, I noticed that she tried to remedy issues outside her scope ...Like working with the bell captain to get luggage stowed and housekeeping re: status of rooms ...But overall this property is a poor reflection on Marriott! 1.  The towels are an embarrassment.  They're old. Greying.  Thin.  Replace them. 2.  There's a space for a fridge ...but there isn't one?! 3. Despite the issues with check in, not one word from management.  A nice letter of apology would have gone a long way.  NEVER again.This is the place to stay during Movement. With VIP pre-sale, you can also get dibs on some rooms at a discount price. This year, there were a couple of weddings and a national volleyball tournament happening in the city at the same time, with patrons of all three in the hotel itself. I was impressed that the people we encountered were very nice. Jonathan, in particular, was very fun(ny) when we checked in as he mused about all the different populations in the hotel that weekend. (They offered complimentary ear plugs due ot the festival.)The staff were able to keep the lobby relatively clean, though at Movement's peak, there were straggling bottles and napkins all over the place. The woman cleaning our room was nice. The bottom sheet of our bed was definitely not fitted correctly and kept coming off, but it was only a small nuisance.Great time In The "D" First to hotel. Get ticket band for concert..Styx.. Buffet at Andiamos. A bit pricy  but ok food. Chicken, salad and a pasta dish for $20.00. Concert rite across street. RenCen open all night with nice clean bathrooms, thank you GM !I've stayed here a few times over the years, especially recently, and found that it's one of the nicer spots to stay in Detroit.The place is open to all people and for all events, from wedding parties to family reunions to concert goers to people who just want to party on a Saturday night. The rooms are above average, boasting nice carpeting, beds (very comfortable mattresses, among the best I ever slept on) and great views of the city and sometimes the river/Canada if you're lucky. The ice machines always work, they have bars and easy access to restaurants, there is a Starbuck's inside for a quick pick-me-up, etc.The price isn't the worst, though it's not a stay at the Econo Lodge for $25. On a summer Saturday you might be shelling out $250 for a room based on events taking place in the city, or just for the "grandeur" of the hotel itself. I always was perplexed to find that our most recent room had no blow dryer in it. Even the crappiest hotels I have stayed in have had hair dryers. They also skimp a little on bath towels.Overall, it's a nice place to drink, play and sleep. It's nice to close the shades to pitch black, turn the A/C down to 62 degrees and sleep like a king or queen, if only for a night. And when you check out, you just have to leave your room and call it a day. Definitely worth a visit.The customer service is horrible. I'm a business traveler, the service is definitely not what I'm used to at a Marriott hotel. I've been waiting for clean towels since this morning and it's 12:20 am. I've been calling the operator for 15 minutes on the house phone at the front desk and I've not gotten an answer, it just rings. There are dirty towels and trash in the halls on my floor. Three people have come in and out of the back office and never acknowledged that I was standing at the front desk. I've been waiting for a refrigerator to be delivered to our rooms since Monday and we check out in the morning. I will not be my choice to ever stay here again.One of the best places to stay in Downtown Detroit.   Several renovations have made a big difference in improving the experience.  The Concierge lounge is very nice.  There is also pretty good food options right near by.The view can be very good - especially if you get a river view. Unfortunately ours view was somewhat spoiled by a stupid decal they put on the side of the building for the upcoming Grand Prix.  If you want to stay downtown and near the river, this is a very good option.Poor Customer Service at the Renaissance Marriott Downtown Detroit!!I checked into the hotel and once I got to my room, I noticed two charges for the exact same room rate moments after another. I called downstairs and the lady answered the phone and told me to come down and they will look into it. I went and told her the problem and she immediately said "oh thats your bank". I replied, "Why would my bank charge two room rates moments after another?" She replied, " sometimes my bank does that?" Huh? (First mistake) I requested to speak to the manager and she never showed. She send this complimentary breakfast coupon out, after my pressure for something to smooth it over but he/she never showed their face after 15 mins of waiting.So, it seems as though since I used my debit card to pay for the room, it holds two room rates. i called customer service and she was explaining to me what happens as opposed to using the credit card. I agreed and said again, but why the second hold moments later. If its not incidental, a debit card fee, or any other fee, why the second hold moments later. She replied, " maybe she changed the reservation". So she transferred me to another lady who basically was saying the same thing regarding the first hold but couldn't explain the second. At this point, no one is acknowledging the fact that the lady at the front desk charges me the room rate(which is fine) and probably meant to charge incidental but charged another room rate. Keep in mind, I never even had a hold pending for incidental so we know the room rate wasn't for incidental.I got an email from the manager explaining the same thing but said NOTHING about the second charge. She went on and on about the hotel industry and I can always use another card in the future. Never once did she explain why two charges for the same amount was appeared moments after the other and why there was no incidental fee. She also went on to say that the Marriott was not responsible for over draft if any overdraft fees occurs. First, this was a crass assumption because I don't even have overdraft fees and on my account and second, I mention to the customer service center that " thankfully I had enough to take cover the two charges and I have no choice but to wait." No one said anything about overdraft fees. Maybe next time if the young lady was less busy talking about her coworker being hungry and crazy, she would have more time to ask the important questions at the front desk and getting the charges right. I have stayed in many Marriott's over the past year, this was just a very different experience.First stay after achieving Platinum Status with Marriott ... of course there woudl be a Penecostal convention going on ... and of course the concierge lounge would be overrun with people who weren't supposed to be there who had big appetites and even bigger mouths, complaining about this (but, you're not entitled to be in the lounge), that (... but...you're not entitled to be in the lounge) and several points in between (forgetting the fact that ... ... you're not even supposed to be in the lounge).  Things got so bad that the GM had to visit the situation to see for herself ... only to be chatted up by another platinum (or so she says) guest who WAS allowed in the lounge but who had to repeat several times "... you know, platinum member means I have over 75 stays at Marriott properties this year?"   Yes chatty, platy Kathy ... everyone heard you...each of the seventy-five times you said it.  But anyway, GM, concierge staff ... they handled the chaos like pro's.  The Westin is newer, but for the location, the views (if you get the right room) and friendly and helpful staff, i'll keep coming back to the Ren Cen Marriott.This place used to be much nicer. I was just there earlier this week for a conference and the room was disgusting; mold In the bathroom, old discolored towels, stained bedding...ugh!  To compound the misery, the food was the worst I have ever had.  Cold, overly salted, not cooked or over cooked. Never again!Room was fine. Clean and decently appointed. However the hotel is poorly designed and staffed. 20 minutes for an elevator to get to your room. 10 to get down. 30 minutes plus for the valet to get you your car. I am way too impatient for this place. Will not stay again.
review_content_20: Adding another star because of the fantastic room service. Chef did a custom meal for me which was one of the best room service meals I've had in awhile. And all of the service has been tremendous from over the phone to in person from guest and room services. Everyone has had fabulous attitudes which is what you want from a business in the hospitality industry.I didn't actually stay in the hotel, but let me just say how beautiful it is here and how massive this place is. Came here for the 42nd annual Access dinner, and the banquet hall on the fourth floor is huge. Greeted by friendly valet that were so busy but took care of us with kindness. They had signs where to go and ushers leading us to the elevators and then greeted with more ushers on the fourth floor to guide us where we were supposed to go. As we were walking in to the beautiful hall, our tables were beautifully set and plated to perfection. Candles everywhere, bread rolls, butter, water glasses filled, a million pieces of silverware, salads and desserts were plated. After the speeches were finished, our plates were cleared and our plated entrees were brought out with fast service. Fresh coffee was served, and omg were their chocolate cakes and cheesecakes so delish. Everything was class from start to finish, and perfect for a nice mingling night with some powerful respectable people.Having stayed here again for Youmacon 2014 and Midwest Media Expo 2014 I can at safely say that nothing much has changed from my prior review of the place. I suppose the only big changes were more signage from the convention telling people where to go (which was really nice) and the great fact that at Midwest Media Expo, the elevator lines were small to non-existant which was a godsend. The lines for the elevators at Youmacon however were definitely long as usual but there were no hotel staff that I saw keeping an eye on the lines as in prior years. As far as the hotel itself, nothing much has changed from my last review. Its still incredibly easy to get lost and you better have a big chunk of change on you if you want to eat anything. There seemed to be a couple of new places in the food court (a new mexican place comes to mind the most, it was really good!). As stated in my last review, the McDonalds does NOT have a Dollar Menu so be aware of that when eating there. The only gripe I always have about this venue is the People Mover station. You have to go through a tunnel to get to it and it is always without fail, freezing cold because there is very little enclosed space in the outdoor part of the station. There is some roof coverage but the wind is still constantly whipping around you and you will be frozen by the time the People Mover pulls in. This is why I love the Cobo Hall station because that one is indoors. The only other revision to my prior review is what the heck was up with the hotel staff and the piano in the lobby during Midwest Media Expo (April 10-12)? My friend was allowed to play on it for a little while prior to checking in (which by the way took FOREVER as there seemed to be only one or two people at the check-in desk when we arrived) and the next day apparently something changed and he wasn't allowed to play on it and the lady at the check-in desk rudely told him that he wasn't allowed to play. Another complaint I have was from back in October... my friends and I were trying to get a taxi from the RenCen back to the Greektown Casino Hotel where we were staying for Youmacon 2014. The lady who "assisted" us (and I use that term very loosely) was beyond rude. She essentially 'bitched' at my friend because we weren't sure how much the fare would cost and had the audacity to say "It's a $5 ride! Do you kids not have $5 on you!?" (Keep in mind I am paraphrasing that, as I don't recall how much cab fare was, but it was relatively cheap - we just didn't know, hence why we asked for help in the first place). I really hope her behavior has changed since October because that was probably the rudest thing I have ever seen a hotel staff member do. Other than the abovementioned points, there aren't any other major revisions to my review that I can make. I hope this proves helpful to others staying at the RenCen for Youmacon or any other events.Stayed for the movement festival during memorial weekend. I will never stay at this hotel ever again. I booked on booking.com but called marriot to confirm and reserve two double beds months in advance. I arrived and was given a suite with a king bed. There was 4 of us staying in that suite. I was then promised two roll away beds not only was I given the run around for about 4-5 hours before I recieved my two roll away beds. Also staff was very rude, I encountered some very pleasant and polite staff majority was very rude to me. I was also told at one point that I'm only allowed two towels for my stay due to the hotel being overbooked, that was not okay for me so I fought for more towels. This is my second year staying in that hotel I will never stay there ever again. And anybody who I will warn them to never stay there. Not worth it.I am very torn about how to rate this place. I normally rate based on whether I would return, and I'm not even sure how I feel about that. There were so many ups and downs here.I can't decide to start with the good or the bad, so I guess I'll just start in chronological order.First I will clarify that there was an Eminem & Rhianna concert downtown the night before and the night we were staying. So the hotel was sold out in advance. We only booked 2 weeks in advance (long after a lot of others had booked) so our regular room was $250 before tax.We arrived on Saturday at 4pm (check in starts at 3). It took about 30 minutes to get from the street through valet into the lobby. At 4:30pm check in was the biggest shit show I've ever seen in a hotel. The "line" snaked all through the lobby and there were people everywhere. Someone mentioned the line to check in was 3 hours. So we decided to go put our stuff back in the car and just walk around and explore downtown for a while. On our way down to valet, someone mentioned it was a 1 hour wait for your car through valet. Luckily our car hadn't even moved yet, so we used our other key to open it and drop stuff off.We walked through the hotel, which is gorgeous, and went out the back to the riverwalk. The riverwalk is amazing, and it was lovely to be out there. This hotel really does have a great location. We walked around downtown, walked through Greektown, and had a nice afternoon.We returned to the hotel at 6:30 (we had 7:30 dinner reservations and needed time to get cleaned up). At 6:30pm the hotel was still checking in people that had been there hours earlier. When people finally checked in they were cheering. Oh, and I forgot to mention that people had been tailgating while in line. Some drank beers straight out of their coolers, others had drinks from the bar that was right next to registration and the line. We finally checked in at 7:15pm. Other people were being told at check in that their room still wasn't ready yet (a lot of rooms were still being cleaned). I think we were angry enough that they found a clean room for us.All of the hotel staff seemed completely frazzled.We got up to our room and the view was outstanding, however there was only 1 bed instead of 2. We called downstairs and they sent up a rollaway within a few minutes.The hotel comped us breakfast in the morning for our troubles, but said they didn't have time to do anything else at the moment we were checking in. The next morning we called the corporate office to complain, and they were very understanding and apologetic and reduced our rate for our troubles. While this was enough for me, I don't actually think it is good enough in the end.It really isn't acceptable for a hotel to have guests waiting for hours to check in. What if people who arrived in the afternoon were late to their evening weddings, concerts, meetings, etc because they could not get into a hotel room they reserved and paid for in advance.The breakfast Sunday morning was fantastic. I'm not sure I would pay $22 for it, but I'm cheap. It was certainly a wonderful breakfast. The staff in the restaurant/bar were wonderful, patient, and kind. It was a huge difference from the staff experiences we'd had the night before. There were so many healthy and unhealthy options for breakfast. They had scrambled eggs, pancakes, blueberry pancakes, bacon, sausage, turkey bacon, turkey sausage, and biscuits and gravy out. They would make omelettes and waffles upon request. There were all the standard cold options.So to recap, the location was great, the water front views were great, the corporate office fixed our issues promptly, but the hotel has issues getting guests into rooms (which is kinda a big deal for a hotel since that's all you really need). In the end I decided that not being able to get into your room promptly is too big of a problem for a hotel to have, and therefore it is hard to encourage other people to stay here.This is a very nice Marriott located right by GM in Downtown Detroit. The rooms are pretty clean, service is great and amenities are definitely adequate.Parking is reasonable at $25/day for valet and anywhere between $15-$20/day for self-parking.The hotel is close to Greektown which is a great little area for grabbing a bite, as well as a couple of casinos if you like to gamble.The sports arenas, Comerica Park (Tigers) and Ford Field (Lions) are walking distance, only about 1 mile or so away. There is also a food court and some stores for shopping connected right to the hotel. Love that convenience.So I'm on my third visit now and the rooms I have had the second and third visit were definitely nicer than the first. The nicest of the three is on the 52nd floor. The 29th floor is definitely better than the 15th. I have had occasion to use the laundry service, which was very prompt, though it would have been good if they'd left me a new laundry slip and bag -- I called to request one the next day but unfortunately couldn't wait in the room long enough for it to arrive which kind of defeated the purpose.As in my first visit, everyone on staff has been extremely friendly. I ran into the housekeeper as I was returning to my room and she was super friendly, told me she'd already been in my room (she was finishing up next door) and hoped everything was to my satisfaction. Interestingly enough, like my first visit she did not throw out any of the obvious trash (in this case, a crunkled up straw wrapper or the used styrofoam cup). Iy can see not risking to throw out something a guest might want but an empty straw wrapper? Just seems weird. Not upsetting in any way, just weird. My beds have all been comfortable and the baths have good hot water and water pressure. The soundproofing of the door could be improved in my current room; two men were chit chatting outside my door this morning when I was dressing and if I'd been trying to sleep it would have been a bit vexing. But I have not heard any late night racket or anything like that.So really, my complaints are pretty minor and I'm upping the rating to 4. I still recommend asking for a renovated room though.My recommendations for other businesses inside the RenCen - Joe Muer Seafood is great if you're splurging. The gyro place in the food court has suprisingly non-greasy gyros (they're not amazing, but they're not greasy!). The scallop entree at Andiamo is really good and worth dining there just for that, but stay away from the giant only-cooked-on-the-outside meatball. If you want to have a great dinner or beers nearby but outside the hotel... Jacoby's, all the way.I am rating the Marriott 2 stars and that's basically based on the restaurant/bar VOLT! Breakfast and lunch was delicious and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. I was extremely disappointed with the Marriott hotel itself. Where do I begin.... I'll start with the check-in.... As I'm waiting in line and there are 4 women at the counter to "be of service" I continue to wait as they were extremely flustered and distracted by a rather handsome gentleman that was being assisted with his check in ahead of me; but I waited patiently. Once I was noticed (I was the only other customer in line at this point) one lady finally makes eye contact and says "can I help you"....lets just say I didn't get the warm welcome I am quite accustomed to being a platinum elite Marriott member....but that's neither here nor there. She was very short and didn't seem like she wanted to be there as I handed her my license and asked if I could check into my room ( I reserved a king bed and requested a crib for my 7 month old and a mini fridge for my breast milk). I was told "we don't have a king available right now we can give you a double or you can wait".... Seeing that hubby and I just drove 13 hours with an infant I settled for the double beds as I couldn't even fathom how long I would be waiting for a king and was exhausted. We get to our room and of course there is no crib and no fridge.Our room was not made up when we walked in. We ended up in a handicaps room with a door that didn't lock correctly. We were never given any direction on how to work the lock. I was very disappointed in the quality of service along with the condition of the room. For $200 plus a night I expected a lot more. I wouldn't recommend the property even though it may be one of the most reasonable priced places. U might be better off heading north on I-75 to find better accommodations.We drove down here to attempt to reserve a block of rooms for our Wedding. They then just gave me a phone number to their representative; which was fine.After trying to work with rep Kelly, she was condescending to my Fiance and was slightly rude. I've had to follow up with her twice before getting a response. I've had many great experiences with Marriott but this one didn't meet my expectations.I stayed in a room at the Renaissance Center for a wedding. We were supposed to be able to check in on Saturday at 3pm. Unfortunately, there was a large conference there that weekend and a lot of them hadn't checked out yet so our room was not ready when it was supposed to be. The line to check in was very long and there were only a few people working the check-in desk, so we stood in line for almost 20 minutes just to find out our room wasn't even ready. We were told that they would call us when the room was ready. Thank goodness our friend was lucky enough to get checked into his room, so I went up there to shower and start getting ready as we had to be at the ceremony by 5. We got the call that the room was ready shortly after I had finished showering, so that was good. When we went back down to the lobby, the line was even longer than before. Since all we needed was to get the room keys, we went up ahead of the line and asked for them at the desk. The woman at the desk was rude, and said, "I'm helping these people, and it's going to be awhile, so you need to get back in line." she was talking over me as I was trying to explain that we had already checked in and just needed keys. She kept repeating herself and finally told us that we could go to the Elite line. Once we were in the Elite line (which was still very long), we finally got the keys and got to the room. The whole process was frustrating. I'm not sure why all the conference attendees were allowed to stay later in the rooms that were booked for a wedding party, but that was poor planning. I heard that many of the wedding guests weren't able to even get into their rooms before the wedding. The price of the room wasn't bad, but I don't know that I would stay here again. If I did, I would plan for a very large amount of extra time and not expect to be able to get into the room at the promised time.Bad experience. They overbooked the hotel so some of our party have to sleep in rooms without beds. Also, their boiler went out both mornings that we were there so we didn't have any warm or hot water to shower. I would recommend other hotels in thee area. For their price it wasn't worth the stay.Filthy. The elevators are dusty, the floor buttons are dusty, staff is incredibly rude, hair in shower, random cigarettes in our room, mean people work here. Spent $300 a night for an elite conference and everyone is mad because it is pure FILTH. If you like sleeping on other people's filth and have money, stay here.Unlike in some cities, there is not much choice of luxury hotels in Detroit. Marriott is not luxurious, but keeps its standards and quality. And it offers definitely the most spectacular view of the city, river and Canada. Walking distance to the river walk and downtown. Spacious rooms. Excellent room service menu, but it's not 24 hours, unfortunately, just till 11pm on weekdays and till midnight on weekend. So if you're coming late from the concert or something - order in advance and ask them to bring the table in your room before they close. They used to have shrimp quesadilla that was very delicious, but they discontinued that one. No minibar, no fridge. But if you ask- they kindly bring little fridge to your room. Breakfast downstairs at the restaurant on lobby level. Since the hotel is located in the huge Renaissance center- there are a lot of conventions going on all the time and a lot of people during daytime. CVS pharmacy and Starbucks are right in the building. Couple great restaurants downstairs- one seafood, one Italian. The fitness center is pretty big and occupies three rooms: all that you might need for the good workout is there: cardio, weights etc. The stuff is nice and friendly. Great quality for reasonable price.Reserved a suite which only had a pull down bed. When time came to go to sleep, bed had no sheets or pillows and none were to be found in room. Couldn't get anyone to answer calls for bedding. After 4 attempts and 30 minutes later, tattered bedding and pillows dropped off without so much as an apology. Paid a premium to stay in a suite and had to beg for linens and make my own bed. Horrible.After a prior less than positive stay about a year ago which the management addressed we booked a night. I am very glad we did. The staff was very professional and freindly. Our room was very clean and the hotel felt safe. The ren cen had many shops and resturant options at every price range. Our room had a great river view and the night lights were beautiful. It was a very romantic classy night. The hotel offers a very high end feel and the hotel bar was alive and fun.Not impressed. Price was high for the mediocre room. Elevators from any floor over 7 take forever. got into our room and went to shower and noticed an open half used bottle of conditioner- if housekeeping missed that what else did they miss?! :( toilet was overflowing after 1 use. Called front desk and the maintenance man was excellent. For something that was once the pride and joy of detroit it has definitely gone down hill.I would never come back here, Very disappointed in the customer service. My first time ever staying here was the end of July and I would never return. We booked a room for a Saturday night. We had tickets to the Tigers game at 1pm that day (double header game) we called twice, the day before our reservation to check if we could do early check-in, we were told to call the day of our reservation and we did. We called at noon to see if we could check-in early and just take the people-mover to the game. The staff told us YES, we could check-in early. We were on our way! We get down there, have our bags and get to the counter. No one is in line but us; it takes forever to be greeted by the nasty front desk girl who looks like she's been bothered and has her head down, not acknowledging us until we say hello... She very rudely tells us we cannot check-in but we can leave our bags off to the side and come back after our Tigers game. We both agreed to do that, no point in getting upset. But I should've written down whoever I spoke with on the phone who originally told us that we could check-in early. We come back from the Tigers game and planned on getting ready, relaxing, going to dinner and going out for the night. We come back to check-in, this other girl at the desk was very nice. She Checked us in, gave us our two room keys, asked if we needed anything, etc. and we were on our way up, the check-in process did not take long at all. On the 53rd floor, very nice room, great view, comfy bed. My boyfriend took a shower and got ready, I was fixing my hair and makeup, he gets out of the shower and gets dressed and all of the sudden we hear someone is at our door & uses their key and walks right into our room! Some lady with her hands full of her own bags actually walks into our room and her key worked. We were just shocked... Thankfully we were both dressed, and at least we were there. If we weren't there- what if that person was going through our stuff? Stealing, etc. You never know... So this lady who walks into our room is so embarrassed and states she's meeting her husband down here for the night and he's already checked in and the front desk gave her a key for our room. Her and I go down to the front desk, the girl who just checked in my boyfriend and I tells me that she has no record of us checking in. (She literally checked us in maybe 15/20 mins before this happened) The girl at the front desk needs a lesson in customer service. I asked to speak with the manager and the girl just pointed to where she was at, not polite or anything. The manager said she was sorry, but really didn't seem to care. This was my first time staying here, I want to enjoy it, I want to come back, I want to let other people know my experience. She tells the lady who walked into our room that her husband does not have a room at the hotel for the night.. And that she also cannot find my reservation. She leaves and comes back after a few minutes, figures everything out somehow and tells the lady that they will comp her husband's room for the night. I of course stated she better be doing something for our room as well. We didn't have to pay for our room, but at this point I didn't even want to stay there... everyone was cranky and seemed like they hated their jobs. We also requested a fridge for our room, which was not there and we were told that they were already gone for that night. I ended up writing a letter to corporate and STILL have not heard back. Very disappointed. Would never stay here again. I know that things happen; I wouldn't have been so upset if the staff was friendly and helpful.Sunday afternoon: Got here at 11, was traveling all night. Trying to rest, massive drilling sound like someone drilling into concrete constantly every 2 or 3 minutes. Called the front desk and they said curtains are being hung and there's nothing that can be done about it. Now I have a massive headache. Almost 5pm and still drilling away. Sent email and contacted on Facebook - nothing has been done! Would never stay here again. Who would have imagined construction on a Sunday afternoon. I can't wait to hear their excuse on this one. Maybe I'll get some work done and pay $15 for internet (per day that is) since I can't sleep.Lobby and entrance is really nice but the room isn't anything special. Confusing hotel to navigate but it is very clean.
review_content_40: I'm adding another star because they actually have staff answering people's comments making sure issues and concerns are fixed.  That tells me that they actually care about their visitors.  Thank you for taking the time to comment on my post.  Kudos and hopefully next time I stay there, I will be able to give them 5 stars!My girlfriend and I booked a "scenic" room with a king bed for a one weekend night so we could attend a show at the Fillmore. Parking was easy. Even though there we're some wedding parties at the hotel, the check-in was fast and professional. Also the building is rad. Our scenic room was just that, 38th floor. Our room was totally updated since my last visit a few years ago and our view was awesome. Everyone at the hotel, and in Detroit; was great.After the show we decided to go back top the hotel and get room service. The late night menu was limited, and we went with the pizza. Room service at decent hotels continues to surprise me. Great pizza, drinks with an awesome view, and a perfect ending to a great night. And check-in is at 3 PM with a Noon check-out, so we got to sleep in a bit.Our stay was decent, I've been to better Marriots, but I've also been to worst hotels.
